Thank you to all the farmers, growers, farmworkers, supply line workers, grocery store clerks, delivery workers, and anyone who is on the front lines making sure our communities are fed. We’ll continue fighting for you every step of the way.

Communities of color face higher risk and more severe consequences from COVID-19. If we don't collect data on these racial disparities, then we won't be able to confront these systemic problems head on. I'm proud to be @AyannaPressley's partner in this fight.

52 years ago, the course of American history changed when we lost a great leader—but his dream lives on. Today and every day, we are the heirs of Dr. King’s dream and we are called to continue fighting for social, racial, and economic justice.
The Trump administration needs to stop using a global pandemic as cover for political revenge. It’s corrupt—and it threatens our national security.

Anyone still wondering why I love @TheRock?

I’m grateful to all the parents out there who are working hard to make things like social distancing and hand washing fun for their kids. 

We’ll get through this together.

Our jails and prisons are overcrowded and lack basic hygiene options and health care.

It’s not only inhumane—it makes coronavirus outbreaks inevitable. And as staff cycle through, it will spread.

States must act to reduce jail and prison populations.

This White House has been a stunning failure in leadership.

I talked to @SignalBoostShow about the warning signs we saw back in January, and how my plans to respond were ignored.

But each day there’s more we can do—and I’ll keep fighting for solutions to this crisis.

Donald Trump made a show of sending off the USNS Comfort. But because of a tangle of bureaucracy, it's sitting mostly idle. States need real resources to fight this pandemic, not elaborate displays that feed Trump's ego.

This is ridiculous. States shouldn’t have to be bidding against each other with private companies to get the resources they desperately need. The federal government needs to send supplies directly to the states—now.
Mike Pence and Donald Trump have made it clear—Americans without health insurance are on their own. It’s disgraceful. The federal government must step up and ensure everyone is covered.
That is, in fact, exactly what it’s there for. Get states the resources they need, or get out of the way.
This administration has consistently failed Puerto Rico. Facing yet another crisis, Puerto Rico must get every resource it needs to fight coronavirus. And Mike Pence needs to do his job.
Wisconsin, the deadline to request an absentee ballot has been extended to today at 5pm!

That’s why last week @AyannaPressley and I sent a letter to HHS urging them to collect and release racial data on coronavirus. I’m grateful that our colleagues @CoryBooker, @KamalaHarris and @RobinLynneKelly have signed on—and I urge others to do the same.

Our health care system is rife with racial disparities. Racial data on coronavirus will be critical to ensuring an equitable and just response to this crisis across the board.

But we don’t have that data—yet.
People experiencing homelessness are particularly vulnerable during this crisis. I've introduced a bill with @AyannaPressley and @RashidaTlaib to provide critical support now to keep everyone safe.

Google shouldn't be deciding which side of any issue the public gets to hear about. No tech company should have that kind of power to control the flow of information or put their thumb on the scale. We need to #BreakUpBigTech.
And months before Democrats could select their nominee, they sold their most prominent YouTube ad on Election Day to the Trump campaign.

Unfortunately, this is part of a larger pattern. Google refused to prohibit false ads on their platforms. They imposed drastic restrictions on targeting for political ads that make it difficult and more costly for Democrats to communicate.

Trump's response to this crisis has been slow, insufficient, and driven by his ego instead of the advice of medical experts. But Google refused to allow anyone to use their platforms to call him out for it and only changed their stance after public outcry.

I hope you're all keeping healthy and safe. Bruce, Bailey, and I are staying home. We will get through social distancing together—because it’s one of the best things we can do to help.

Governors have made it clear: They need support from the federal government. Before we spend a single penny to bail out giant corporations, we need to make sure that cities and states have all the resources they need to fight this pandemic.

The Trump administration has failed to provide states with the necessary resources and medical supplies to fight this pandemic. Now they're outbidding the states and seizing our orders. I'm demanding answers.

This #TransDayOfVisibility, I want all trans and non-binary people to know you are valued, you are loved, and that we will keep fighting to make sure you can live freely, safely, and openly exactly as you are.
I’m sending you and your mother all my love, David. I’m so grateful for all she does to keep us healthy, and wish both of you a speedy and safe recovery.

Racial disparities in our health care system may mean that Black and Brown communities don't receive equal testing and treatment for coronavirus. @AyannaPressley and I want to make sure this data is collected—and addressed.
Last week, I asked for your questions about coronavirus. Today, I answered them. Stay safe out there, and look out for each other.
We need to be doing everything we can to avoid a housing crisis, and @JulianCastro has a plan.
I stand with every worker providing essential services during this crisis. Add your name if you're joining the #InstacartStrike today.

I'm supporting Instacart workers on strike today. They are providing an essential service to those who cannot leave their homes now. They deserve better pay, benefits, and protections. #InstacartStrike
Racist, bigoted language about the coronavirus is driving a surge of violence and hate crimes. It must stop—now.

In 2008, the financial crisis drove our economy to the brink of collapse. As we face another economic recession, @RichCordray reminds us in his new book that the fight to build the CFPB left us a roadmap to make government a force for good even in challenging times.
We need to go further to ensure health care providers have the resources they need to expand testing across the country. Here's how we should do it.

In the midst of a pandemic and an economic crisis, the Trump administration just made it easier for predatory payday lenders to exploit struggling families. This is an appalling, dangerous move that will trap more families in a punishing cycle of debt.

DACA recipients are working hard to support their families and communities, and to ensure they and their loved ones are safe and healthy. Thousands of them are health care workers on the front lines of this pandemic. I stand with them in this fight. #HomeIsHere

We're still fighting righteous fights. Join our movement to put people first in fighting for the relief measures we desperately need today—and rally around candidates who support bold solutions to rebuild our economy in the long term:
Profit margins don't come before people’s lives.

This is not the time for Congress to go on recess. Our work isn't done. We need to force Trump to use the Defense Production Act to ramp up the development of tests and necessary equipment for health care professionals. And we need to do more to help struggling families.

We're so grateful for the doctors, nurses, and health care professionals who are doing the dangerous, necessary work of caring for people with coronavirus. I'll keep fighting to make sure they have the equipment and resources they need.
We have more work to do here to fight this pandemic and help workers and families weather this crisis. This isn't the time to take a recess.

This bill provides immediate, necessary aid⁠—but it's insufficient. Tomorrow, we keep fighting for more aid for families, hospitals, and small businesses. And I'll do everything I can to hold the Trump administration accountable for how it spends this $450 billion taxpayer fund.

Staying at home helps slow the spread of coronavirus and protects medically vulnerable people like Xiomara. If we reopen too early, we are all at risk. We can support our economy and help people stay at home to protect everyone from coronavirus.

Our obligation, our moral imperative, is to save lives. If people are forced out of their homes too early and thousands or millions more people die because hospitals and health care providers are overwhelmed, there won't be an economy left to save.

We shouldn't be choosing giant corporations over those who need resources the most. I'm fighting for a stimulus package that supports workers, small businesses, and gets direct, immediate relief to hospitals, community health centers, and health care workers.
Any stimulus must support workers’ payroll and benefits—not enrich wealthy executives of giant corporations. If we want to weather this crisis, we need to build the economy from the grassroots up.
Bruce and I are sending you and John all of our love, @AmyKlobuchar.
Last week, I asked for your questions about coronavirus. Today, I answered them. Stay safe out there, and look out for each other.

Bruce and I are sending you and John all of our love, @AmyKlobuchar.

Gig workers are doing essential work during this crisis. They need and deserve essential benefits like paid sick leave. Good on New York City for considering legislation to mandate paid sick leave for gig workers.

Gaping holes in @Amazon, @Walmart, and @McDonalds's paid sick leave policies will put workers, their colleagues, and their communities at greater risk. I urge them to provide all of their workers with adequate paid sick leave to help protect lives.

.@PineStreetInn is helping ensure vulnerable individuals have the necessities they need, helping move homeless individuals into homes, and assisting formerly homeless individuals in retaining housing.
.@Gr8BosFoodBank is working with food pantries, community meal programs, and other food assistance providers throughout Eastern Massachusetts to support families, seniors, and individuals.
The Boston Resiliency Fund is supporting Boston residents most affected by this crisis.

.@GlobalGiving is helping send doctors, nurses, and other frontline responders to communities in need, and delivering essential items to hospitals, clinics, and to struggling families and older individuals.

.@CDCFound's Coronavirus Defense Fund is helping communities prevent and detect coronavirus, helping deploy emergency staff, and helping deliver food and medical supplies to those in need who are isolated.
.@AmeriCares is training health workers on the frontlines of this crisis and providing personal protective equipment to health care professionals.
.@NoKidHungry is helping feed kids who aren't getting healthy meals due to school closures.
.@_MealsOnWheels is bringing food to seniors, who are especially vulnerable right now.
.@FeedingAmerica is helping feed those in need during this crisis by supporting local food banks.
.@OneFairWage is providing cash assistance to restaurant workers, car service drivers, delivery workers, personal service workers, and more who are impacted.
.@DomesticWorkers's Coronavirus Care Fund is helping support in-home care workers, nannies, and house cleaners during this crisis.
We need all hands on deck to support our neighbors and communities through this crisis. Here are just a few charities and organizations whose work you can support right now if you're able:

To every nurse, doctor, and health care professional, to every grocery worker keeping the shelves stocked, to every first responder, every domestic worker, and everyone who is on the front lines of this crisis, we are so grateful for everything you're doing.
There is something fundamentally wrong when a Wall Street CEO can get a 19% raise while millions of Americans are struggling to figure out their next paycheck.

We need to rapidly ramp up our ability to test for coronavirus. That means we need to keep up the pressure to ensure we have enough testing kits, testing locations, and resources in our communities. Keep calling your representatives. Keep the pressure up.
Any taxpayer assistance that goes to giant corporations must come with real strings attached to ensure the money is truly going to support the workforce through this crisis.

It's not enough to just waive student loan debt payments during this crisis. If we want to stimulate the economy and minimize the burden of a financial crisis, canceling student loan debt must be part of the next coronavirus stimulus package.

Health care providers are on the front lines of this crisis and we’re so grateful for their selfless work. I’m working to get federal resources toward making sure they get the protective gear and supplies they need.

Gig workers are doing essential work during this crisis. They need and deserve essential benefits like paid sick leave. Good on New York City for considering legislation to mandate paid sick leave for gig workers.

The decisions our government will make in the next few days will be crucial. I’m joining @AdyBarkan, @WorkingFamilies, @BeAHeroTeam, @NNUBonnie, and my colleague @PramilaJayapal for a special organizing town hall tonight at 9 pm ET.

Join us:

The number of coronavirus cases is growing, and we need more resources to care for new patients. Today I'm requesting that Donald Trump deploy the Army Corps of Engineers to retrofit existing facilities to care for patients with coronavirus.

Congrats to @Marie4Congress on winning her primary election in #IL03! This isn’t a moment to back down—it’s the time to fight back. And Illinois families are getting the unwavering champion they deserve.

Airline executives spent billions on stock buybacks and are now asking taxpayers for billions. We need to help airline workers, but that money should come with serious long-term change to the companies—no more buybacks, a $15 minimum wage, and more.

We need a stimulus package that supports our economy from the grassroots up and permanently improves the lives of families. We can put money directly in their hands by increasing Social Security payments and by canceling student loan debt.

The most pressing issue is ensuring that everyone who needs a test for coronavirus can get one—for free. But just a half step behind the health crisis is the financial crisis. We need a stimulus package big enough to meet the moment.

I'll be on @AllInWithChris soon to talk about why we need a stimulus package that directly helps working families. If we want to weather this crisis, we need to support our economy from the grassroots up.

The coronavirus outbreak has been declared a national emergency and we all need to do our part to stop its spread. Follow the guidance from your state, local, and federal officials, and stay up-to-date with the latest information from @CDCgov here.

We can help people stay home if they're sick and support our economy by:
-Creating an emergency paid leave program
-Increasing Social Security checks by $200 per month
-Expanding unemployment benefits
-Canceling student loan debt

We need to show that we have a government that understands the scale of coronavirus’s threat to the economy and public health. The way to tackle both is to get money into the hands of the people so they can stay home if sick, but still support this economy from the ground up.
We can all help slow the spread of coronavirus by taking simple steps. It is important to listen to the public health experts. Follow @CDCgov for updates on how to protect yourself and others.

The lack of widespread coronavirus testing in the United States is a disgrace. If we hope to control this outbreak, the administration must immediately allocate funds to state and local health systems and rapidly stand up testing capacity nationwide.

This crisis also reminds us we need public officials who will serve the public interest. We need a clear-eyed, data-driven assessment of the problems we face, and a comprehensive plan that matches the scale of those problems.

This administration cut funding for public health agencies and put politics and spin ahead of good science. They've put former finance executives in charge of his economic policy to push policies that’ve been great for banks but have made our economy less resilient.

Trump's proposed economic response is inadequate. I'm proposing a $750 billion stimulus package, including:
-Fully paid leave
-Unemployment insurance boosts
-Aid to state governments
-Funding for vaccine development
-Social Security benefit increases
-Student debt cancellation

I’m calling on the administration to issue a Stafford Act declaration that will open key funding and regulatory flexibility to help our health system. We need to rapidly expand diagnostic testing, help prepare our hospitals and local leaders, and fund care for the uninsured.

I am deeply concerned about the threat that coronavirus poses. Trump’s stumbling response is putting American lives and the economy at greater risk. I offered a plan ten days ago, and today I updated it based on the latest data and expert recommendations.
Back in July, I warned an economic crash could be coming. One serious shock would be enough—and the Trump administration's incompetent response to the coronavirus is already weakening our economy.
Our economy was already showing cracks before the coronavirus. But an incompetent administration leading the response, engaged in magical thinking, is only making this crisis worse.
Choose to fight only righteous fights, because then when things get tough—and they will—you will know that there is only one option ahead of you: Nevertheless, you must persist.

I know that we will one day elect a woman to the White House.
Our work continues, the fight goes on, and big dreams never die. From the bottom of my heart, thank you.
I believe in the America that we can build together. Thank you, Detroit!
Trickle down economics has been a failure. We need to build an economy from the grassroots up.
Polls are still open in some #SuperTuesday states! If you haven’t voted yet, find your polling location now and get out and vote!
Polls are still open. If you’re still in line when polls close, stay in line! Find your polling location here:
I believe in the America that we can build together.

Every day in the selfie lines, I hear the stories from people who are struggling, who need a government that's on their side, not the side of the billionaires and giant corporations. They're why I'm in this fight.
Yes, these are hard times. Yes, people are afraid. And the danger is real. Our very democracy hangs in the balance. But Latinx and Chicano history teaches us the power of fighting back.
I’m so happy to be in Michigan, tonight! Tune in as we go live from Detroit, a city full of fighters, dreamers, and persisters.

There are only a few more hours before polls begin to close in #SuperTuesday states across the country.

If you’ve been on the sidelines, now’s the time to get in this fight and chip in a few bucks.

Hope over fear.
Courage over cynicism.

Let’s do this together. Vote:
Thank you @NWPCNational, I’m grateful for your endorsement!

We are facing a homelessness crisis—but it is not inevitable. That's why I've got a plan that will lower rents and invest real federal resources to help build or rehab more than 3 million homes across the country. Everyone deserves a safe, decent, affordable place to live.

Thank you, @sandylocks. Your pioneering of the intersectional framework and your powerful voice have driven groundbreaking work. I'm deeply humbled by your vote today, and I will proudly fight with you for racial, gender, and economic justice.

I voted today with hope in my heart. 

I believe in this grassroots movement. I believe in the America we can build together. 

Let's dream big, fight hard, and get out to vote!
I’m so grateful to have Congressman Mike Honda’s endorsement. Together, we’ll build a country and an economy that works for everyone.
Thank you, @RWPUSA. Together, we can root out the corruption in Washington—and I’ve got the biggest anti-corruption plan since Watergate to get it done.

I'm fighting to build an America where Cynthia and her neighbors all have the opportunity to thrive. I'm grateful for her support—and I'm grateful for everyone knocking doors and making phone calls today.

The Federal Reserve alone can't solve the economic and public health problems that coronavirus poses. I'm calling on Congress to act now to ensure everyone gets care for free, pass an emergency paid leave program, and enact at least a $400 billion fiscal stimulus package.

Bruce, Bailey and I walked to the polls this morning to vote!

If your state votes today, get out and make your voice heard. Find your polling location and go vote!

The crises we face are real, and I know people are afraid. But 2020 is our chance to choose a president. I’m ready to get to work for working Americans.

If you want progressive ideas and progressive results, pitch in $2 to my campaign now. #SuperTuesday
Thank you, @MsLaToshaBrown! You have done incredible work with @BlackVotersMtr. I'm deeply grateful for your endorsement, and proud to be your partner in this fight.

This is our moment.

Make your voice heard. Vote today.

After the economy crashed in 2008, I was called to Washington to help lead us out of the crisis. 

I know what's still broken in our economy today—and I know how to fix it. Watch our new ad.

Make your voice heard. If you live in Alabama, American Samoa, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Maine, Massachusetts, Minnesota, North Carolina, Oklahoma, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, or Virginia, get out and vote today! #SuperTuesday
Thank you, @JanelleMonae. Let’s do this.

I want to tell a story not just as a teacher or as a candidate for president. I want to tell the story as the daughter of a janitor. This is how janitors—mostly women, mostly immigrants from Mexico and Central America—fought for justice and won.
I'm heartsick for the victims and their families. Stay strong, Nashville. You're in our hearts today.

Imagine a government where corruption doesn’t block real change. 

Imagine an economy where everyone has a chance to thrive—a nation that lives up to its values every day. 

It’s not just a dream, it can be our America. Let's fight for it together.

Today is #SuperTuesday and millions of Americans are heading to vote right now.

I’m grateful for every person who gets in this fight. Will you donate $2 to our campaign before noon? This is our moment in history.

“Big, structural change” isn’t just a slogan. 

It’s what I’ve fought for my whole career. It’s a value that will be the driving force of my presidency. It’s a mission—with plans to back it up. 

Join us. Vote today. Let’s do it together.

In less than 8 hours, voters in 14 states will shape the future of our fight.

Help build our movement for the long haul. Will you chip in $2 or more before polls open? #SuperTuesday
I'll be on @JimmyKimmelLive soon to talk about our fight for big, structural change—join us!
Join us in East Los Angeles as we honor immigrant- and Latina-led labor movements—and talk about our shared fight for big, structural change. #JuntosConWarren
.@JohnLegend and I sat down for a conversation about why we're in this fight for justice, equality, and big, structural change.

I’m honored to receive the endorsement of so many Muslim leaders, activists, and scholars. This is our moment to dream big and fight hard for a better country and a better world—for our children and our grandchildren. Let’s do this!

A third of delegates are up for grabs tomorrow—and I’m ready to fight for them.

Will you chip in $2 or whatever you can right now? This is your last chance to pitch in before #SuperTuesday.
I’m committed to being a real partner to Latino communities—during this campaign, and as president of the United States.
I’m deeply grateful for feedback from powerful voices like @VilissaThompson, who makes our plans stronger. Together, we can create real, structural change.

It’s what I’ve fought for my whole career. It’s a value that will be the driving force of my presidency. It’s a mission—with plans to back it up. 

Join us. Vote today. Let’s do it together.

In less than 8 hours, voters in 14 states will shape the future of our fight.

Help build our movement for the long haul. Will you chip in $2 or more before polls open? #SuperTuesday
I'll be on @JimmyKimmelLive soon to talk about our fight for big, structural change—join us!
Join us in East Los Angeles as we honor immigrant- and Latina-led labor movements—and talk about our shared fight for big, structural change. #JuntosConWarren
.@JohnLegend and I sat down for a conversation about why we're in this fight for justice, equality, and big, structural change.

I’m honored to receive the endorsement of so many Muslim leaders, activists, and scholars. This is our moment to dream big and fight hard for a better country and a better world—for our children and our grandchildren. Let’s do this!

A third of delegates are up for grabs tomorrow—and I’m ready to fight for them.

Will you chip in $2 or whatever you can right now? This is your last chance to pitch in before #SuperTuesday.
I’m committed to being a real partner to Latino communities—during this campaign, and as president of the United States.
I’m deeply grateful for feedback from powerful voices like @VilissaThompson, who makes our plans stronger. Together, we can create real, structural change.

You shouldn't have to be a billionaire with a concierge service to get tested, treated, and vaccinated for coronavirus. My plan will let every American get the coronavirus protections they need for free.

Farmworkers like Guera do the hard, necessary work that feeds us all. It should be a path to opportunity and dignity for them and for their families.

I am committed to being a partner for farmworkers in the White House.

We win when we call out what is broken, when we show people how we’re going to fix it, and when we build a grassroots movement to get it done. 

That’s what our campaign is about—and we can only do this together.  

If your state votes tomorrow, join us:

We need someone whose core values can be trusted, who has a plan for how to govern, and who can get things done.

I will be that president.

Thank you @LinaHidalgoTX and @RWeingarten for joining me in Houston!

I never thought I would run for office. But when I was thinking about running against an incumbent Republican in the Senate, @Schriock1 and I sat down over a lot of iced tea and she walked me through the process. I'm thrilled to have her and @EMILYsList with us in this fight!
I am deeply grateful for @EMILYsList's endorsement. Together, we will fight to protect our reproductive rights and elect Democratic women up and down the ballot—because that's what girls do.
Congratulations, Kenneth and Tarja! Bruce and I are sending you our love.

I believe in the power of our movement. Pitch in a few bucks and own a piece of our campaign.

I’m fighting my heart out to make our economy work for working families—and I can’t do it alone.

Donald Trump’s extreme, right-wing judges are already rolling back women’s rights. And, without reform—inside and outside of the courts—any Democratic president’s agenda will be at risk, too. I've got plans to protect our rights for the long haul.

I'm deeply grateful for @NationalNOWPAC's endorsement. Together, we'll fight to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment, protect our rights across the country, and build a country where women and girls have every opportunity to thrive.

Thank you @CHIRLA for your powerful work advocating for immigrant rights, and for sharing your stories with me. Together, we can build an America where every person has value—an America that’s about creating opportunity for everyone.
Thank you to my friend, @AmyKlobuchar. You've been a champion for working families and women in politics, and I look forward to keeping up that fight by your side.

Coronavirus may cause U.S. drug shortages due to supply chain disruptions in China, where we get most of our ingredients. My plan for the virus' economic impact builds domestic manufacturing for pharmaceutical ingredients to reduce future shortages.

My new plan for coronavirus response:
1. Ensure every American can get all recommended care for coronavirus for free.
2. Create an emergency paid leave program so people can recover or provide care.
3. Enact at least a $400 billion fiscal stimulus package.
Thank you for voting for me in Texas, @LizzyBeezKneez. You really did your homework!

I've been worried that our economy is heading towards another crash—and coronavirus is already a serious economic threat. I've got a plan to address the economic impact, and I'm calling on Congress to act immediately.

My path has been bumpy. I never thought I'd run for any public office, let alone president of the United States. But I got to live my dream, and I got into this fight to make sure everyone else had that same opportunity.

Agricultural labor has long been intentionally excluded from basic labor laws, like the right to unionize and overtime pay. This was justified with explicitly racist reasons. It's time to strengthen the rights of farmworkers and food chain workers.

Farmworkers, food chain workers, and their families continue to face entrenched poverty, a lack of opportunity, and an unjust immigration system. It‘s time to treat the people who help feed us with dignity and respect—and I have a plan for that.
.@JulianCastro and I are fighting together to build a country where every family has the opportunity to thrive. Thank you for being a part of this fight, San Antonio!

Can I count on you to chip in $2 to our grassroots campaign tonight? We can only do this together:

Today, we honored the courage and determination of the civil rights leaders who marched across Edmund Pettus Bridge on #BloodySunday. It was an honor to witness Rep. John Lewis challenge us to keep fighting for justice.

The coronavirus crisis demands more than a billionaire mayor who believes that since he’s rich enough to buy network airtime to pretend he’s the president, that entitles him to be president.

I've got a real plan to deal with the coronavirus.

I don't have just one plan for the climate crisis—I've got plans for the #GreenNewDeal, a #BlueNewDeal, a clean energy economy, environmental justice, creating 10 million good jobs, and rooting out corruption in our government.

Dr. @AyanaEliza and @RGunns break it down.

We’ve got one shot in November to elect a president who will get things done for working families. I’m ready—and I’m fighting for you as hard as I fight for my own family.

Chip in a few bucks to join our movement, and let’s get to work together.
Thank you, @PeteButtigieg. I know you'll continue giving back and serving our country for many years to come.
Thank you, @SaharAzizLaw! I’m so grateful to have you on #TeamWarren.
We’re in this fight together. You have the chance to make an impact on our grassroots movement—let’s make it happen! Sign up now to make calls to voters in #SuperTuesday states.

Since the beginning of February, our campaign has seen a record-breaking surge of grassroots support. I am grateful—and determined.

Will you pitch in $2 or more now to help keep up the momentum before #SuperTuesday?

The time to choose is upon us. The crises we face are real. 2020 is our chance to choose a president—and I’m ready to get to work.

If you think we need both progressive ideas and progressive results, join us:
We're facing both a public health crisis and a potential economic crisis. We urgently need top experts at the table in public health and medicine—many of whom are women. This isn't it.
I want to invest in young people. That's how we build a real future. Thanks @CecileRichards for taking a moment to talk about the issues that women voters are facing in 2020!

Muslims are one of the most diverse communities in our country, and have always been a vital part of the American story. I will partner with them to tackle generations of racial injustice and discrimination to build a government that works for everyone.
Progressive ideas are popular ideas. @JulianCastro and I aren't afraid to fight for them.

Donald Trump's border wall is a monument to hate—and his  latest attempt to treat the southern border as a war zone rather than as a vibrant community. It's time to stop Donald Trump's militarization of the border.
Wow—that’s pretty impressive!
Mike Pence paid more attention to politics than science and gravely worsened a health crisis in Indiana. I can't think of a worse person to put in charge of dealing with coronavirus.

Today is Nuclear Victims Remembrance Day in the Marshall Islands, honoring the victims of U.S. nuclear testing there. The U.S. must continue to ensure survivors receive the support and health care they need. We must also work to end nuclear testing once and for all.

Climate change is an existential threat—but Wall Street is refusing to listen, let alone take real action. I've got a new plan to rein in Wall Street and make them pay the true cost of climate change instead of passing it on to millions of Americans.
Thank you to our grassroots donors for a record-breaking February: more than $29 million raised! You’re helping build this campaign for the long haul. Take a look at what your support is building.

After the 2016 election, @LinaHidalgoTX ran for office to fight for her community. I'm proud to be her partner in this fight for big structural change.
Thank you, @RWeingarten. I'm proud to be your partner in this fight for teachers, students, high-quality public education, and to protect and empower the voices of unions.

Tonight, I’ll take the stage in Houston to speak about the threats we face today. With a public health and economic crisis looming, we need a president whose core values can be trusted, who has a plan for how to govern, and who can actually get it done. I will be that president.
Progressives have one chance to make transformative change. We need a leader who knows how to get in the fight and make change happen—and I have a proven track record of doing just that.
I will continue listening to and learning from impacted communities because they make the plans we propose stronger. I'm committed to being their partner in the White House.
So sorry I missed you, Grant—but bedtime is important! Thanks for being a part of this movement.

South Carolina, you still have time to vote:

.@JohnLegend and I agree: It's not enough to beat Donald Trump. We have to change the system that brought him into power in the first place. 

Together, we're fighting for the big, structural change we need.
Paid sick leave shouldn't be a luxury. It's better for our workforce, our businesses, and for public health. It's time to build an economy that works for everyone.

It’s not news to millions of people living in rural America—especially in Black communities in the South—that this economy is leaving them behind. I've got a plan to invest in rural communities and level the playing field for entrepreneurs of color.

We spend billions on an immigration system that breaks up families and keeps thousands locked up—with little evidence that it makes us any safer. We need to live our values. I am committed to a fair and welcoming immigration system that reduces immigration detention by 75%.

My #WealthTax would pay for Universal Child Care, high-quality public education, student loan debt cancellation, universal free public college, and help fully finance #MedicareForAll.

Use our calculator to see how much other billionaires would pay!
Under my #WealthTax, Jeff Bezos would pay approximately $7.3 billion, which would be just about three and a half pounds of this 58 pound mountain of rice.

Thank you, @JenSiebelNewsom! You've broken the mold and reshaped the First Partner’s office to advocate for equal pay and women's representation. Your work empowers women and girls in California and across the country. Proud to be in this fight by your side!

As a former teacher, I know how important well-maintained classrooms are for our children. That’s why I support the Proposition 13 School Safety Bond, which will invest directly into California classrooms to ensure students are learning in safe, healthy, and secure facilities.

Stripping citizens of their citizenship sets a dangerous precedent and opens the door to abuse. As president, I will stand up for all Americans, regardless of where they were born, and I will fight to protect our immigrant communities.
I'm proud to partner with @MsPeoples and @BlackWomxnFor in this fight for big, structural change, and I know they will continue to hold me accountable.

The next president will need to rebuild our government. I've got plans to invest in our federal workforce, root out the corruption of the Trump administration, and ensure key positions are filled. And I'll fight to ensure our federal workforce looks like the rest of America.

Join us in East Los Angeles on Monday, March 2 at 5:30 PM PT, as we talk about the power and values of Latinas and Chicanas in American history and how we can learn from them as we continue fighting for big, structural change.

Mike Bloomberg admitted to spying on Muslim communities. Instead of apologizing, he said it was the “natural place to go.”

This moment in history calls on us to confront anti-Muslim policies and ensure they never happen again—not elect someone who defends bigoted practices.
I couldn’t be more grateful to have @JohnLegend by my side in the fight to save our democracy and build a country that works for everyone.
So let's imagine @StephenAtHome is a billionaire, and that plate of ribs represents all of his money. It would just take a teeny tiny corner to pay for universal child care—and more!
Thank you, @RezaAslan! I’m grateful to have you on #TeamWarren, and I’m proud to fight alongside you to defend our democracy.

The Trump administration's careless incompetence has put lives at risk. Punishing whistleblowers shows how unwilling they are to take responsibility. It's time for a competent leader in the White House to manage this crisis.

The February FEC deadline is in 2 days. It’s the last deadline before #SuperTuesday—and our most important deadline yet.

Will you donate $2 right now to our campaign? It’s all hands on deck during this critical time.
We are facing a global pandemic and a potential economic crash, and this is how Donald Trump is spending his time. We need an adult in the White House.

Selfie lines are fun, but they're also where I hear the most devastating stories. The girl who I just did pinkie promises with, who has brain cancer. The families crushed by student loan debt who see no future. 

These are the stories I carry with me—and they fuel my fight.

Bernie and I both wanted to rein in Wall Street after the 2008 financial crash.

I was the one who dug in, fought back, and created the agency that forced the banks to return more than $12 billion to people they cheated. #CNNTownHall
.@StephenAtHome and I played a game of "Guess the Billionaire" on @ColbertLateShow—I think I did pretty well!
I'm so grateful to this group of youth activists for standing with us in the fight for big structural change. Let's go!
Thank you, Molly! Person by person, conversation by conversation—we’re growing our grassroots movement together.
Thank you, @MrAdamScott! Happy to have you on #TeamWarren!
He is a very good boy!
Congrats @JennyChen8601, and thank you so much!

I stand with the planners, designers, and inspectors at Southern California Edison who want to join @IFPTE Local 20. It should be quick and easy to join a union, and Southern California Edison should respect the process.

My message at the #DemDebate: Progressives have one shot in 2020, and we need to elect a leader who will get things done.

I know how to fight, I know how to build a coalition—and I know how to win.

Thank you @UWDAction! I'm deeply grateful for your endorsement. I promise to continue listening to and learning from your members and immigrant communities as we fight to build an America where immigrants are safe, welcome, and have every opportunity to thrive.

We're looking at a serious economic downturn because of coronavirus—and the Trump administration is bungling every aspect of this crisis. 

I have a plan to combat this outbreak and make sure our economy works for everyone. That's the leadership we need.

We only have 1 more day to show the strength of our grassroots movement before the FEC deadline on February 29.

Will you chip in $2 or whatever you can? I wouldn’t ask if it wasn't important.

Read my full plan to ensure our federal government is accountable to border communities:

A few steps to one side of the border shouldn't mean you forfeit basic rights. As president, I’ll work to reverse this decision legislatively to ensure accountability for victims of border patrol violence—regardless of what side of the border you’re on.

We need to get our priorities straight and focus on keeping the American people safe—not funding a monument to hate. I've introduced a bill to divert every dime Donald Trump is spending on his racist wall to fighting the coronavirus.

Border communities reflect the best of America, but too often politicians in Washington degrade and divide them for political gain. I've got a plan to stop Donald Trump's militarization of the border and fight for safe, prosperous border communities.

Farmers like Germaine Jenkins are supporting their communities—and we need to ensure that they have the opportunity to succeed. I'm fighting for a new farm economy that meaningfully includes farmers of color and environmental justice so that small farmers like her can thrive.
How do we get more women into presidential politics? Elect one for president. I'm ready. #CNNTownHall
I know it's possible to work with Republicans to deliver help to the American people—because I've done it. #CNNTownHall

I'm grateful to @CoryBooker for leading on criminal justice reform and consistently highlighting this issue. And thank you to @BlackWomxnFor for challenging me to join him. I ask you to continue holding me accountable.  

Read my full, updated plan here.

At the same time, overcrowded prisons too often fail to meet basic human rights standards. Under existing conditions, these sentences are inhumane. A president can use her clemency powers to right systemic injustice—and I plan to do just that.

Data show that people tend to age out of crime and are less likely to recidivate, but thousands of elderly people remain behind bars. Those serving sentences equivalent to life are disproportionately Black and Brown, many for nonviolent crimes or crimes committed as juveniles.

Today I'm announcing that, in a Warren administration, we will create a clemency board that will prioritize cases of older Americans incarcerated for unduly long sentences and establish a presumption of release, unless the board finds a danger to public safety.

The president has significant powers to grant clemency and pardons, and historically presidents have used that power broadly. But today’s hierarchical process at DOJ results in relatively few and conservative clemency recommendations.

My heart aches for Kaia. This is absolutely unacceptable. No student should have to learn in an environment where there is a threat of incarceration. We need to reduce police presence in schools and invest in the resources and support our students need.
The Trump administration is bungling the response to coronavirus, putting our public health and our economy at risk. We need a real plan to respond to outbreaks—and an adult in charge.
We need a Justice Department and a president that treats white supremacy as the domestic terrorism threat it is. And we need a president who will fight to end the gun violence epidemic. #CNNTownHall
I want to see an FDA that is based on science. #CNNTownHall
I’m grateful to everyone who watched my #CNNTownHall tonight. Together, we can make our government actually work for the people. I’m in this fight all the way. Chip in $2 now if you are, too.
Climate justice is right at the heart of my plan to fight the climate crisis. #CNNTownHall

We need to build an economy from the grassroots up. 

If we cancel student loan debt, we can grow our economy and make sure it works for everyone. #CNNTownHall

See you soon, @StephenAtHome—it’s going to be fun! Tune in tonight at 11:35 PM ET.

I had an idea to make hearing aids more affordable. The first person I called to help get the legislation passed was a Republican. 

We got it done. Next year, Americans will be able to buy hearing aids over the counter. #CNNTownHall

40 years of trickle-down economics.
40 years of not investing in the American people. 

Our economy needs big, structural change. #CNNTownHall
We can build an America from the grassroots up—we just have to decide to do it. #CNNTownHall

Donald Trump is bungling our response to the coronavirus. We need a real plan to fight back—and I've got one. 

Tomorrow, I’m introducing a plan that takes every dime Donald Trump is spending on his racist wall, and diverting it to fighting the coronavirus. #CNNTownHall

In 2012, I ran against an incumbent Republican. He was very popular and had as much money as he wanted from Wall Street. 

I ended up beating that guy by 7 1/2 points. #CNNTownHall

How do we get more women to run for president?

Elect one for president.

I'm ready. 

#CNNTownHall
I will appoint a head of the FDA who believes in science. #CNNTownHall
We need an Attorney General and a Justice Department that believe in actually enforcing civil rights laws. #CNNTownHall

I don't owe anything to the tobacco industry. Or the drug industry. Or the prison industrial complex.

When I see corruption, I stand up and fight back. #CNNTownHall
In the early 2000s I could see what was happening on mortgages, and how communities of color were being targeted. I rang every alarm bell that I could. This is the fight I’ve been in. #CNNTownHall
We must treat housing like a basic human right. That means we need safe, accessible housing for everyone. I have a plan for that. #CNNTownHall
No one in our country should be paid subminimum wages. It’s time to raise the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour. #CNNTownHall

I'll tell you something about us teachers.
We see the worth of every human.
We love our work.
We never give up.

#CNNTownHall

I think the top one tenth of 1% can afford to pay a little more so we can invest in all our kids. 

That’s why I have a plan for a #WealthTax in America: A two cent tax on fortunes above $50 million. #CNNTownHall

For a price I could pay on a part-time waitressing job, I finished my four-year diploma and became a special education teacher.

That opportunity is not out there for young people today. #CNNTownHall

So what do we need to do? Build an economy from the grassroots up. #CNNTownHall

Join us for our #CNNTownHall tonight at 10 PM ET on @CNN as we talk about our vision of big, structural change—and how we’re dreaming big and fighting hard to make it happen.

Woo-hoo! February isn’t over yet, and we already more than doubled our original fundraising goal, raising more than $21 million—our best month yet. 

This is what the power of our grassroots movement looks like. Chip in $1 now—let’s do this together.

As the proud daughter of a janitor, I stand with the members of @SEIU26, who are fighting not just for the wages and benefits they deserve, but also to protect the health of their workers, community, and our planet. My team is proud to be joining you on the picket line tomorrow.
Congrats, @IndivisiUnion! Your members are doing incredible work, and I'll proudly fight beside you to strengthen and empower the voices of unions.

I'm fighting for justice and opportunity for Black men in America—and I want to make sure we center their voices and experiences in this fight. I'm committed to continue listening and learning, and I'm grateful to @FredTJoseph and @Benny_Starr for moderating this conversation.

This is outrageous. We should use every tool at our disposal, including government manufacturing or contracting if necessary, to make this vaccine available to everyone who needs it. Former Pharma lobbyist Azar should stop putting profits ahead of people's lives.

We are not going to defeat Donald Trump with another arrogant billionaire who has argued for cutting crucial benefits for families that have earned them.

The core of the Democratic Party will never trust him. Mike Bloomberg is the riskiest candidate.
I'm about to join @JohnLegend to speak about our shared fight for big, structural change—watch our livestream from Charleston, South Carolina now!

I'm devastated for the victims, and my heart is with their loved ones and all those affected by this tragedy.

We shouldn't have to live with this constant horror and grief. We need to act now to end the gun violence epidemic.

Thank you, @SoltanLife! I’m honored to receive the endorsement of someone who has dedicated his life to human rights advocacy and fighting for democracy. I'm proud to fight alongside you to build a better country and a better world.

Michigan's Line 5 pipeline is a threat to millions who rely on the Great Lakes for clean water and a healthy economy. My plans for a #GreenNewDeal will rebuild our infrastructure and create over 10 million union jobs. Let's #ShutDownLine5 and build a 100% clean energy future.

I'm heartsick for Alexa and her loved ones. 

This epidemic keeps growing. We must use every tool we have to end it and protect trans women of color. #SeLlamabaAlexa

Big money is powerful, but it doesn't always win. I know that firsthand. 

When I ran against an incumbent Republican in the Senate, Mike Bloomberg endorsed the Republican and raised big money for him. But I beat him anyway.

I believe in people over money.

Legalizing marijuana needs to be about more than just allowing its use. We have to undo a century of racist policy, help rebuild the communities that have suffered the most harm, and ensure everyone can enjoy the opportunities this new market can provide.
Our event with @JohnLegend is about to start—tune in to our livestream from Orangeburg, South Carolina!

Families took incredible risks to fight for a better education for their children. 

But our government isn't living up to its responsibilities. Funding is inadequate and inequitable, and public schools are more segregated now than thirty years ago. I've got a plan to fix this.
I'm grateful for the @BostonGlobe's endorsement. Together, I know we can root out the corruption in Washington and build a country and an economy that work for everyone—join us!
I believe the women—and I want to hear their stories.
I just stepped off the debate stage and I want to say thank you for all the support after the last #DemDebate. Let’s do it again!

For me, this is about how we treat other people and how we lift them up. That is why I am in this fight, that is why I am running to be president, and that is why I will be an effective president. #DemDebate
We cannot ask our military to solve problems that cannot be solved militarily. #DemDebate

While Mike Bloomberg was blaming the housing crash of 2008 on African Americans and Latinos, I was fighting for a consumer agency to protect families from being cheated by Wall Street and the Big Banks. #DemDebate

My motto ties in directly to Matthew 25: Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me.

It’s about how we treat other people and lift them up. That is why I am in this fight. #DemDebate

I just stepped off the #DemDebate stage feeling grateful for everyone who tuned in tonight. Together, we’re growing our movement.

February has been our campaign’s best fundraising month yet—will you chip in $2 before midnight tonight to keep it up?

The filibuster is giving a veto to the gun industry, a veto to the oil industry, a veto on immigration. 

If we want to make progress, it's time to end the filibuster. #DemDebate

We need to speak to the future we can build together. It's time for a #WealthTax in America so we can invest in our families and ensure we have universal child care, high-quality public education, universal free public college, and cancel student loan debt. #DemDebate

People want a chance to hear from the women that Mike Bloomberg and his company have gagged with nondisclosure agreements.

If he says there is nothing to hide here, then sign a blanket release and let the women speak out and tell their stories. #DemDebate

Trump has bungled the response to the coronavirus outbreak. I have a plan to prevent and prepare for outbreaks, contain them if they do break out, and push for medical advances to treat emerging infectious diseases. #DemDebate
Billionaires don’t scare me. Big Oil doesn’t scare me. Big Pharma doesn’t scare me. Chip in $2, and I’ll fight my heart out against the big corporate interests as your next president. #DemDebate

A president’s first job is to keep America safe. All three of my brothers served in the military, and I understand how much the military sacrifices. We have a responsibility to them. We cannot use our military to solve problems that cannot be solved militarily. #DemDebate

My Secretary of Education will be someone who has taught in public schools.
My Secretary of Education will believe in public education. 
My Secretary of Education will believe that public dollars should stay in public schools.
#DemDebate
If we want to build a future in this country, then we do that by investing in our children. I’ve got a plan to invest $800 billion in our public schools. #DemDebate

Mike Bloomberg has dumped millions of dollars into trying to elect Republicans—including the incumbent Senate Republican I beat. 

I don't care how much money he has. The core of the Democratic Party will never trust him—and that makes him the riskiest candidate. #DemDebate

While Mayor Bloomberg was blaming the 2008 housing crash on Black and Latino Americans, I was out there fighting to create the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to make sure people aren’t cheated on their mortgages. #DemDebate

It's not enough to talk about housing neutrally. We need to talk about race.

We must call out the decades of government-sponsored discrimination against Black Americans buying homes and fight back. I have a plan for that. #DemDebate

Families took incredible risks to fight for a better education for their children.

Billionaires don’t scare me. Big Oil doesn’t scare me. Big Pharma doesn’t scare me. Chip in $2, and I’ll fight my heart out against the big corporate interests as your next president. #DemDebate

A president’s first job is to keep America safe. All three of my brothers served in the military, and I understand how much the military sacrifices. We have a responsibility to them. We cannot use our military to solve problems that cannot be solved militarily. #DemDebate

My Secretary of Education will be someone who has taught in public schools.
My Secretary of Education will believe in public education. 
My Secretary of Education will believe that public dollars should stay in public schools.
#DemDebate
If we want to build a future in this country, then we do that by investing in our children. I’ve got a plan to invest $800 billion in our public schools. #DemDebate

Mike Bloomberg has dumped millions of dollars into trying to elect Republicans—including the incumbent Senate Republican I beat. 

I don't care how much money he has. The core of the Democratic Party will never trust him—and that makes him the riskiest candidate. #DemDebate

While Mayor Bloomberg was blaming the 2008 housing crash on Black and Latino Americans, I was out there fighting to create the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to make sure people aren’t cheated on their mortgages. #DemDebate

It's not enough to talk about housing neutrally. We need to talk about race.

We must call out the decades of government-sponsored discrimination against Black Americans buying homes and fight back. I have a plan for that. #DemDebate

My Secretary of Education will believe in public education.
My Secretary of Education will believe in public schools.
My Secretary of Education will believe that it’s time to end high-stakes testing. 

My Secretary of Education will be a former public school teacher. #DemDebate

The Democratic Party is a progressive party, and progressive ideas are popular ideas. But getting that agenda enacted is going to be hard.

I know how to fight, I know how to build a coalition—and I know how to win. #DemDebate

Gun violence is a public health crisis. That’s why I have a comprehensive plan to end the NRA’s influence and eliminate corrupt lawmakers’ ability to block our government from defending the lives of our people. #DemDebate

I asked Mayor Bloomberg to release all the women from non-disclosure agreements—which he refuses to do. His response? "Enough is never enough” for her. 

That's right—and I’ll keep fighting for everyone whose voices need to be heard. #DemDebate

I’ve seen gun control legislation introduced in the Senate, get a majority vote—and then fail to pass because of the filibuster. Understand this: Many people on the #DemDebate stage don’t support rolling back the filibuster—I do. We need to roll it back.
Billionaires don’t have to worry about fundraising goals. But we do. Will you chip in $2 or whatever you can during the #DemDebate to make our campaign’s best month for fundraising even better?

How about a #WealthTax in America? 

With a small wealth tax on the top one-tenth of 1%, we have a chance to invest in Universal Child Care, put $50 billion into HBCUs, and start closing the racial wealth gap by canceling student loan debt for 43 million Americans. #DemDebate

Bloomberg and his companies have been accused of harassment and discrimination. But the women are bound by nondisclosures so they cannot speak. If he says there is nothing to hide here, then sign a blanket release and let the women speak out and tell their stories. #DemDebate

I don't care how much money Mayor Bloomberg has. The core of the Democratic Party will never trust him, and that means he is the riskiest candidate standing on this stage.

He hasn’t earned their trust. I will. #DemDebate

In 2012, Mayor Bloomberg scooped in to try to defend another Republican senator against a woman challenger: me. 

It didn't work, but he tried hard. #DemDebate

Who funded Lindsey Graham's campaign for re-election last time? Mayor Bloomberg. 

And that's not the only right-wing Senator that Mayor Bloomberg has funded. In 2016, he dumped $12 million into the Pennsylvania Senate race to help re-elect a right-wing senator. #DemDebate
Want to see how the leading Democratic candidates’ health care plans compare? #DemDebate
Progressives have one shot in 2020, and we need to spend it with a leader who will get something done. #DemDebate

Bernie and I both wanted to rein in Wall Street. We both got our chance—but I’m the one who dug in, fought the banks, and I won.

Bernie and I both want to see #MedicareForAll. But Bernie's plan doesn't explain how to get there or how we’ll pay for it. Mine does. #DemDebate
The Democratic party is a progressive party, and progressive ideas are popular ideas—even if there are a lot of people on the #DemDebate stage who don't want to say so.

We’re moments away from the #DemDebate, and I’m thinking about the power of our grassroots movement.

Together, we raised more than $21 million this month so far—our campaign’s best month ever. 

Will you pitch in $2 before the #DemDebate begins?

I'm heartsick for the people of Idlib. The U.S. cannot solve every problem militarily, but we should increase our humanitarian assistance, allow more refugees to come to our country, and lead international efforts to broker a ceasefire and end this war.

Like so much else, the Trump administration’s bungled response to the coronavirus outbreak is a mess. As president, I will lead a competent administration prepared to combat outbreaks—because our public health, economy, and national security depend on it.

The outbreak also shows how vulnerable our manufacturing sector and our economy are to disruptions in China. I’ve got a plan to bring more production back home, which will create jobs and reduce our vulnerability to supply chain disruptions.

We should be taking action right now to mitigate the supply chain impacts of the outbreak. The government should be helping American manufacturers find alternative sources for parts and production and helping American exporters find new purchasers.

The economic threat is also growing—the 1800-point drop in the Dow this week is the tip of the iceberg. Without swift action, supply chain disruptions and reduced purchases will have severe, long-term effects on our entire economy.

As the virus spreads, the Chinese Communist Party’s ongoing attempts to hide what’s happening in China endangers the health of people around the world. Instead of praising Xi, as Trump has done, we should lead a global effort to uphold principles of open science and transparency.

Even worse, Trump refuses to centralize crisis management in the White House—allowing CDC scientists to be overruled and sowing internal dysfunction. All this mismanagement casts doubt on how effectively he can deploy emergency funding.

Before requesting much needed emergency funding, Trump pushed again and again for dangerous budget cuts to public health and aid programs—but we win the fight against outbreaks by preparing and investing in advance, not scrambling once they’ve spread.

We must treat coronavirus as the serious health, diplomatic, and economic threat it is. Weeks ago, I released a plan for the health risks: more funding for public health and international aid programs, and centralize response management in the White House.

The Trump administration is absolutely bungling the response to coronavirus, putting our public health and our economy at risk. This is why we need a real plan and an adult in charge. Here's what I think we should be doing.

We need to shift from trickle-down economics to grassroots-up economics. That means a #WealthTax so we can invest in families. 

And we need a president who will stand up to Wall Street to protect consumers. That's how we'll build an economy from the ground up.

Back when I was a young mom, toasters could actually set your kitchen on fire—ask me how I know! But the Consumer Product Safety Commission stepped in, and now they have safety switches.

I had an idea for an agency to protect consumers from being cheated—and it became the CFPB.

If we fight side by side, we can beat the Big Banks, Big Oil, and Big Pharma—and actually make our government work for the people.

Chip in $2 before midnight to help make it happen.

Black history is American history. And that history teaches us that racism has shaped crucial aspects of our economic and political system for generations. But if we fight side by side, we can make real, structural change that will honor that history.

We need a president who will fight for working families—not for Big Banks. That’s why I’m in this fight.

Will you chip in $2 or whatever you can to join me?

We've had three years of Donald Trump, and people are afraid. Our democracy hangs in the balance in this election. So here's the decision that we have to make—do we pull back, or do we get in the fight?

Me, I'm fighting back. Fighting back is an act of patriotism.
Your bravery and resolve is an inspiration for all of us. Thank you, Ashley—and thank you to all of the women who stepped forward to speak truth to power. My heart goes out to you all today.
.@JohnLegend and I want to meet you! Chip in $1 or more before midnight, and you’ll be automatically entered for the chance to meet John Legend and me in South Carolina.

Will we let the fear hold us back, or are we going to fight back? Me, I'm fighting back. Thank you, Denver!

We can't afford to nickel and dime essential health and aid programs. We need to act—now. Read my full plan to prevent, contain, and treat infectious disease outbreaks like coronavirus.

We need all hands on deck now to fight the spread of coronavirus. While Donald Trump has no plan and proposes dramatic cuts to the CDC, the World Health Organization, and other global health programs, I proposed a plan nearly a month ago to fight global pandemics.

Bridgette’s experience highlights many of the problems of our criminal justice system—from how it fails to protect survivors of domestic violence, to the injustice of mandatory minimums, to the lack of rehabilitative services. That's why I've got a comprehensive plan for reform.

Tommy Young died in a county jail, where he was being held because he couldn't afford to pay the $100 bond. 

It's long past time to end the punitive financial burden that is cash bail.

Legalizing marijuana is about more than just allowing its use. It’s about undoing a century of racist policy that disproportionately targeted Black and Latino communities and rebuilding the communities that have suffered the most harm.

My friends and colleagues @KamalaHarris and @CoryBooker have led the fight to repair the damage done by failed anti-marijuana policies. I am proud to support the MORE Act and the Marijuana Justice Act, and will continue to fight for those reforms as president.

I've got a plan to legalize marijuana, rebuild communities devastated by failed anti-marijuana policies, and ensure that those communities are equally able to participate in the budding cannabis industry. Here’s how we’ll do it.
Since Wednesday night, our movement has been growing everywhere. This fight is our fight—join us.

We need to address the stigma around mental health and make sure that everyone has the full health care coverage they need—including mental health care. #MedicareForAll ensures that everyone has the health care they need.
Starting your own business is hard—and it's especially hard for women and people of color. I've got a plan to help entrepreneurs start small businesses, and give them the opportunity to thrive.

I want every person who pitches in a few bucks to our campaign to know: I’m deeply grateful for you. Together, we’re building a movement to put power in the hands of the people. Chip in now to keep up the momentum.
Families are struggling to get by. They just want a chance—for themselves and for their kids. @JulianCastro and I are fighting to make sure every family has a chance to thrive.

Twelve years after the financial crash, working families are still struggling to get by. Wages have barely budged, while the costs of housing, child care, and health care are soaring. We need to build an economy that works for working families in Nevada and across the country.

Millions of children could lose their health care coverage because of the Trump administration's cruel public charge rule. Families shouldn't be forced to choose between staying in our country or ensuring their kids get health care. As president, I'll roll back this policy.

Donald Trump's expanded Muslim Ban is now in effect.

But the Muslim Ban didn't come out of nowhere—it builds on existing policies that have targeted Muslim communities for years.

We must confront the deep-seated anti-Muslim racism in our society and in our policies.
I think there’s a 50/50 chance that Donald Trump looks at debating me and doesn’t even show up. He ain’t that brave.
I always recommend a good cardigan!
Thank you, @calculizer—I’m so grateful to have you on #TeamWarren!

I opposed Las Vegas’s harmful law that criminalizes homelessness. We are facing a housing crisis across this country. That's why I've got a plan to invest in real, federal resources to help build or rehab more than 3 million homes across the country.
We're going live from our Las Vegas event with @JulianCastro!
Like I said yesterday, Mike Bloomberg and his company should issue a blanket waiver so anyone who wants to come forward can come forward, with or without Bloomberg's prior permission.
Thank you, Gina! I’m so grateful to have you and Briar on #TeamWarren. Keep persisting!

After the 2008 financial crash, I held hearings in Nevada with families who were losing their homes. I fought to hold banks accountable and protect homeowners—and as president, I'll fight so that families in Nevada and across the country have a safe and affordable place to live.

I've fought for years for real accountability for Wells Fargo and its executives. This is a small step in the right direction, but it's not a substitute for holding senior executives individually accountable—and bringing criminal charges against them if the evidence justifies it.

Congratulations on your first vote as a U.S. citizen, @DreamElder! Humbled that you put your trust behind me. I promise to fight for you—and for all immigrant youth—as hard as I fight for my family. And we’ll do it together.
I’m so grateful to have @KathyKLTran on #TeamWarren! This is how we’ll build the movement for big, structural change—together.
Thank you so much, @TIDevine! I’m so grateful for your endorsement, and I’m proud to partner with you to fight for South Carolina families.
Nevada, here’s everything you need to know to caucus today!

I want every person who pitches in a few bucks to our campaign to know: I’m deeply grateful for you. Together, we’re building a movement to put power in the hands of the people. Chip in now to keep up the momentum.
Families are struggling to get by. They just want a chance—for themselves and for their kids. @JulianCastro and I are fighting to make sure every family has a chance to thrive.
Thank you, @GavinGrimmVA. I’m deeply grateful for your endorsement, and I will fight alongside you so that LGBTQ+ kids feel safe and supported.
We can build a country where everyone has a chance to thrive if we dream big and fight hard—together. Let’s go, Nevada!

Twelve years after the financial crash, working families are still struggling to get by. Wages have barely budged, while the costs of housing, child care, and health care are soaring. We need to build an economy that works for working families in Nevada and across the country.

Millions of children could lose their health care coverage because of the Trump administration's cruel public charge rule. Families shouldn't be forced to choose between staying in our country or ensuring their kids get health care. As president, I'll roll back this policy.

Donald Trump's expanded Muslim Ban is now in effect.

But the Muslim Ban didn't come out of nowhere—it builds on existing policies that have targeted Muslim communities for years.

We must confront the deep-seated anti-Muslim racism in our society and in our policies.
I think there’s a 50/50 chance that Donald Trump looks at debating me and doesn’t even show up. He ain’t that brave.
I always recommend a good cardigan!
Thank you, @calculizer—I’m so grateful to have you on #TeamWarren!

I opposed Las Vegas’s harmful law that criminalizes homelessness. We are facing a housing crisis across this country. That's why I've got a plan to invest in real, federal resources to help build or rehab more than 3 million homes across the country.
We're going live from our Las Vegas event with @JulianCastro!
Like I said yesterday, Mike Bloomberg and his company should issue a blanket waiver so anyone who wants to come forward can come forward, with or without Bloomberg's prior permission.
Thank you, Gina! I’m so grateful to have you and Briar on #TeamWarren. Keep persisting!

As the first woman, and first Latina, to serve as chief executive of a Texas county home to 5 million people, @LinaHidalgoTX knows what it’s like to fight her heart out for the future Americans deserve. I’m deeply grateful for her endorsement!
Puerto Rico needs debt relief—and they need it now. I have been in this fight since before I ran for president, and I will fight for Puerto Rico as president of the United States.

These comments are horrifying, and the attitude they reflect directly leads to the violence that trans people face.

We will not defeat Trump by undermining the dignity and safety of LGBTQ+ Americans—and someone who does cannot be the leader of our party.
As the 2008 financial crisis was unfolding, I got a call from @SenatorReid asking me to lead the Congressional Oversight Panel. We've been partners in the fight to protect consumers ever since.

I stand with the people of McFarland, California. No town should have to live in a state of constant fear. We need to close private detention centers like this GEO facility and invest in rural farm worker communities.
I told Priyanka: Yes, it really is me! She chipped in $10 after the #DemDebate so I gave her a call to say thank you. We’re in this fight together, Priyanka—and we got this.

It was great talking to Christopher and his husband, Ryan! They chipped in a few bucks to our campaign and helped us reach our fundraising goal before the Nevada caucuses.

I couldn’t be more grateful. Donate $2 or more now—and I could call you next!

I'm going to fight like hell to build a country that works for everyone.

Watch our new Colorado ad. And if you're a Colorado voter, remember to mail in your ballot!

Bigotry and hatred towards immigrants is growing around the world, with deadly consequences. We have a responsibility to step up and fight back. My administration will work with our international partners to fight the spread of white supremacist violence.
You never give up on someone else, because that’s what being a teacher is all about. #CNNTownHall
Immigration does not make our country weaker—immigration makes our country stronger. #CNNTownHall

It should worry all of us that we now live in an America where one political party seems to think that foreign interference helps them in an election. That makes the challenge we face enormous. It's up to the voters to make sure Democrats win big in November. #CNNTownHall
It's time for a #WealthTax in America. #CNNTownHall

I’m grateful to everyone who tuned in to my #CNNTownHall tonight. 

Let’s keep the momentum going. Will you chip in $2 before midnight? $12 million before the Nevada caucuses is our most ambitious goal yet—but I know we can do it together.

Our campaign is bigger and stronger now because we have people working on it from @JulianCastro and @KamalaHarris's campaign. We have people who worked with @CoryBooker, @GovernorBullock, and @JayInslee. That's how we build a strong, inclusive campaign. #CNNTownHall

I want to tell you exactly the kind of vice president I want: Someone who will be in this fight alongside me for your families. Someone who feels this fight passionately—and who brings his, her, or their own energy to get it done. #CNNTownHall

Never give up.

That’s what being a teacher is all about. No matter how hard it gets, no matter how steep the road looks, no matter how many times it doesn’t look like it’s moving forward, you just don’t give up. #CNNTownHall

What kind of an America do we want to be?

Do we want to be an America where 2 cents goes to millionaires and billionaires just to get richer? Or do we want to use that money to invest in an entire generation?

That's how we build a future in America. #CNNTownHall

We can take my #WealthTax and provide:

✔️ Universal Child Care 
✔️ Universal pre-k
✔️ Increased wages for child care workers
✔️ $800 billion investment in public schools

#CNNTownHall

I won’t talk about climate without talking about climate justice. For decades, our government has permitted polluting factories and toxic waste dumps to be put in Black and Latino communities, over and over and over. Enough. #CNNTownHall
Climate change is an existential threat. I not only support a #GreenNewDeal—I also have a plan for a #BlueNewDeal, because we've got to be thinking about our oceans as well. #CNNTownHall

My plan to build 3.2 million new housing units across this country is fully paid for by asking the wealthiest families to pay their fair share. It’s housing for working families, for people experiencing homelessness, for veterans, for seniors, and more.

I opposed Las Vegas’s harmful law that criminalizes being poor. Homelessness is a problem across our country. And you know it here, Nevada: We've also got a housing crisis in this country. #CNNTownHall
Mike Bloomberg can easily release the women who have accused him of sexual harassment and discrimination. I used to teach contract law—so I made it simple for him. #CNNTownHall

We need to make sure that everyone has the full health care coverage they need—and that includes mental health care. #MedicareForAll makes certain that everyone has access to the health care they need. #CNNTownHall

The world has changed since 2016.

In 2018, Democrats took back Nevada because women ran, and women won. And that’s exactly what we’re going to do in 2020. #CNNTownHall

If Mitch McConnell tries to do to me what he did to President Obama—block whatever our administration is trying to do—then I'm all for rolling back the filibuster. And that means we could get immigration reform done on 50 votes. #CNNTownHall

Immigration does not make this nation weaker—immigration makes this country stronger. We need to expand legal immigration, and that means a pathway to citizenship for all of our neighbors, friends, and loved ones who are here. #CNNTownHall

I believe in the rule of law. That means we need a Justice Department with an Attorney General whose loyalty is not to the person who sits in the White House. The loyalty oath they take is to the Constitution of the United States of America. #CNNTownHall

I want everyone to hear this who is in the Trump administration right now: If you get out there and break the law now serving this president, he may be willing to look the other way, but President Warren will not look the other way. #CNNTownHall

Let's face it. We cannot afford to win in November by a little tiny bit.

We must win by so much that no one can deny it. Chip in now to help make it happen. #CNNTownHall

It’s deeply worrisome that we now live in an America where one political party seems to think political interference helps them in an election. We’ll keep pushing Mitch McConnell to tighten security around our elections. #CNNTownHall

My #WealthTax is supported by Democrats, Independents, and Republicans. Why? Because Americans, regardless of party affiliations, understand they're getting the short end of the stick. It’s time for a little basic fairness. #CNNTownHall

Before the financial crisis, I kept warning about how mortgage companies were targeting communities of color. I was out there ringing every alarm bell I could ring. But nobody wanted to hear it. So I got in that fight. That's why I was right here in Nevada. #CNNTownHall

All I can do here at tonight’s #CNNTownHall, and for as long as I am in this race, as long as I've got breath in my body—is to fight for working families, and to make this an America that isn't just about all the riches getting sucked up to the top. #CNNTownHall

I didn't spend my life thinking I’d be a president or senator. I spent my life studying what was happening to working families in America. I was a teacher and a researcher. And I kept watching year by year, as life just got tougher and tougher for working people. #CNNTownHall
