Thank you @MiFamiliaVota for welcoming @JulianCastro and me! I'll fight to build a humane immigration system that reflects our best values, and build a government and economy that works for Latino and immigrant families across the country.

Russia is interfering in our election again to help elect Trump.

After members of Congress were briefed about this threat, Trump fired the acting Director of National Intelligence.

Trump is shredding the rule of law—and the integrity of our democracy.

We’re not going to beat Donald Trump with a man who silences women with nondisclosure agreements. 

We are not going to beat Donald Trump with a man who supported racist policies like stop-and-frisk.

We are not going to beat Donald Trump with another arrogant billionaire.

It's time to put power in the hands of the people—and that means strengthening and empowering our unions. I've led the effort to end so-called "right-to-work" laws, and as president, I'll make sure it's quick and easy to join a union.

Since I stepped on the #DemDebate stage, our grassroots campaign has raised more than $5 million. We’ve not only reached our critical goal of raising $7 million before the Nevada caucuses—we're now raising it to $12 million. I'm so grateful. Keep it up!
We choose hope over fear. We choose courage over cynicism. I’m proud to partner with @AyannaPressley in this fight.
I’m so proud to have @AlenciaJohnson on my team!
Trans athletes are not a threat. We need to protect trans kids—and all LGBTQ+ kids—and ensure they feel safe and welcomed at school. I urge the Arizona legislature to reject this cruel bill.

State legislators like @CindyPoloFL103 are fighting hard to protect our reproductive rights from right-wing ideologues. I'll fight alongside them and push for federal laws that protect reproductive care in every state.

I was humbled to be on @LatinoUSA. The fight to defeat Donald Trump must include Latino, Latina, and Latinx voices—and I’m determined to continue listening and learning from the community. Thank you for having me, @Maria_Hinojosa!

Too often, Black moms feel ignored, terrified, and discriminated against while giving birth. All of this contributes to the Black maternal mortality crisis we face. It's time to tackle this crisis head-on, and I've got a plan for that.

This country has worked for the rich and powerful for a long time and left everyone else in the dirt. It's time to have a president who will be on the side of working families and will fight for them. I'm not afraid to fight back. That is how I will beat Donald Trump. #DemDebate

Thank you, @AliciaGarza and @BlackToTheFutu1! I’m deeply grateful for your endorsement. I will continue to listen and learn from you, and I ask that you continue to hold me accountable as we fight together for big, structural change.
I am deeply humbled by this endorsement, and I’m proud to partner with @BlackToTheFutu1 to build a country and a government that works for Black families and communities across the country.

I want to make sure that environmental justice gets more than a passing mention. I have made a commitment to invest a trillion dollars to repair the damage that this nation has permitted to be inflicted on communities of color. We have to own up to our responsibility. #DemDebate

Of all the people on the #DemDebate stage, I’ve been a politician the shortest—but I've been the one out fighting for families the longest. As President, I'll fight for your family as hard as I fight for mine. #DemDebate

I just stepped off the #DemDebate stage and got some good news from my team: We’re getting closer to our fundraising goal of $7 million before the Nevada caucuses on Saturday.

Chip in $2 and I could give you a call tomorrow to say thanks.

I grew up in Oklahoma. I grew up fighting.

I watched when my dad had a heart attack, when our car was lost, when we were on the edge of losing our home. I watched my mother fight to save our family. And I grew up fighting to save our family. #DemDebate
A majority of Americans—Democrats, independents, and Republicans—support my #WealthTax on all fortunes above $50 million. #DemDebate
This is a question of values. Do we want to invest in Mayor Bloomberg, or in an entire generation of young people? #DemDebate

With my #WealthTax, we can afford:

✅ Universal Child Care and universal pre-k
✅ Raise the wages of every childcare worker and preschool teacher
✅ Put $800 billion into our public schools
✅ $50 billion into our HBCUs and more
This presidential race is about leadership and accountability. Mike Bloomberg needs a different apology. #DemDebate

There’s a startup gap between white entrepreneurs and Latino entrepreneurs. The principal reason is that Latino entrepreneurs don’t have the equity to get businesses started. I have a plan to put $7 billion in a fund to help people who are routinely cut out. #DemDebate

The end of redlining didn't cause the 2008 crash. Out-of-control greed by big banks—and the corruption that lets them control our government—caused the crash. We need to confront the shameful legacy of discrimination, not lie about it like Mike Bloomberg has done. #DemDebate

We can't simply talk about climate change in big, global terms. We have to own up to our responsibility. We need to talk about it in terms of rescuing the communities that have been damaged. #DemDebate

The question of environmental justice should get more than a glancing blow in this #DemDebate. I have a commitment of a trillion dollars to repair the damage that this nation has permitted to inflict on Black and Brown communities for generations.
Let’s be clear: We need to get rid of the filibuster. If you're not willing to roll back the filibuster, then you're giving the fossil fuel industry a veto. #DemDebate

Why can't we get anything passed in Washington on climate? Corruption. The first thing I want to do as president is pass my anti-corruption bill so we can start making changes and stand up to the fossil fuel industry. #DemDebate

I believe in science.

And I believe that one way we're going to deal with the climate crisis is by increasing by tenfold our investment in science. I have a plan for that. #DemDebate

On my first day as president, I will sign an executive order to stop all new drilling and mining on public lands and offshore drilling. We cannot continue to let our public lands be used for profits. #DemDebate

While Mike Bloomberg was blaming Blacks and Latinos for the 2008 financial crisis, I was holding hearings with families in Nevada who were losing their homes. I have a record of fighting for working families—and winning. #DemDebate

This is not just a question of Mayor Bloomberg’s character—it’s a question about electability. We’re not going to beat Donald Trump with a man who silences women with who knows how many nondisclosure agreements. That's not what we do as Democrats. #DemDebate

Mayor Bloomberg has made women—dozens, who knows—sign nondisclosure agreements for sexual harassment and gender discrimination.

Mr. Mayor, are you willing to release all of those women from those nondisclosure agreements so we can hear their side of the story? #DemDebate

I want to make sure that environmental justice gets more than a passing mention. I have made a commitment to invest a trillion dollars to repair the damage that this nation has permitted to be inflicted on communities of color. We have to own up to our responsibility. #DemDebate

Of all the people on the #DemDebate stage, I’ve been a politician the shortest—but I've been the one out fighting for families the longest. As President, I'll fight for your family as hard as I fight for mine. #DemDebate

I just stepped off the #DemDebate stage and got some good news from my team: We’re getting closer to our fundraising goal of $7 million before the Nevada caucuses on Saturday.

Chip in $2 and I could give you a call tomorrow to say thanks.

I grew up in Oklahoma. I grew up fighting.

I watched when my dad had a heart attack, when our car was lost, when we were on the edge of losing our home. I watched my mother fight to save our family. And I grew up fighting to save our family. #DemDebate
A majority of Americans—Democrats, independents, and Republicans—support my #WealthTax on all fortunes above $50 million. #DemDebate
This is a question of values. Do we want to invest in Mayor Bloomberg, or in an entire generation of young people? #DemDebate

With my #WealthTax, we can afford:

✅ Universal Child Care and universal pre-k
✅ Raise the wages of every childcare worker and preschool teacher
✅ Put $800 billion into our public schools
✅ $50 billion into our HBCUs and more
This presidential race is about leadership and accountability. Mike Bloomberg needs a different apology. #DemDebate

There’s a startup gap between white entrepreneurs and Latino entrepreneurs. The principal reason is that Latino entrepreneurs don’t have the equity to get businesses started. I have a plan to put $7 billion in a fund to help people who are routinely cut out. #DemDebate

The end of redlining didn't cause the 2008 crash. Out-of-control greed by big banks—and the corruption that lets them control our government—caused the crash. We need to confront the shameful legacy of discrimination, not lie about it like Mike Bloomberg has done. #DemDebate

We can't simply talk about climate change in big, global terms. We have to own up to our responsibility. We need to talk about it in terms of rescuing the communities that have been damaged. #DemDebate

The question of environmental justice should get more than a glancing blow in this #DemDebate. I have a commitment of a trillion dollars to repair the damage that this nation has permitted to inflict on Black and Brown communities for generations.
Let’s be clear: We need to get rid of the filibuster. If you're not willing to roll back the filibuster, then you're giving the fossil fuel industry a veto. #DemDebate

Why can't we get anything passed in Washington on climate? Corruption. The first thing I want to do as president is pass my anti-corruption bill so we can start making changes and stand up to the fossil fuel industry. #DemDebate

I believe in science.

And I believe that one way we're going to deal with the climate crisis is by increasing by tenfold our investment in science. I have a plan for that. #DemDebate

On my first day as president, I will sign an executive order to stop all new drilling and mining on public lands and offshore drilling. We cannot continue to let our public lands be used for profits. #DemDebate

While Mike Bloomberg was blaming Blacks and Latinos for the 2008 financial crisis, I was holding hearings with families in Nevada who were losing their homes. I have a record of fighting for working families—and winning. #DemDebate

This is not just a question of Mayor Bloomberg’s character—it’s a question about electability. We’re not going to beat Donald Trump with a man who silences women with who knows how many nondisclosure agreements. That's not what we do as Democrats. #DemDebate

Mayor Bloomberg has made women—dozens, who knows—sign nondisclosure agreements for sexual harassment and gender discrimination.

Mr. Mayor, are you willing to release all of those women from those nondisclosure agreements so we can hear their side of the story? #DemDebate

I hope you heard what Mayor Bloomberg’s defense of decades of mistreatment to women was: “I’ve been nice to some women.”

That just doesn’t cut it. #DemDebate

If you want to issue a real apology, then it has to start with the racist intent of the plan, and the willful ignorance of admitting what was happening even as people protested in your own streets. You need a different apology here, Mr. Mayor. #DemDebate

This is about leadership and accountability. When Mayor Bloomberg apologizes for stop and frisk, he talks about how it turned out. The problem is what it was designed to do to begin with: Target communities of color and Black and Brown men from the start. #DemDebate

Democrats take a huge risk if we just substitute one arrogant billionaire for another. It's time to have a president who is on the side of working families—and is willing to get out there and fight for them. #DemDebate

I met a man in Reno with diabetes who gets his insulin through the VA. His sister and daughter also have diabetes—and no way to pay for it.

Three human beings right here in Nevada—sharing one insulin prescription.

That should not happen in America. #MedicareForAll #DemDebate

You can't stand on the #DemDebate stage and trash #MedicareForAll without a realistic plan of your own. And if you're not going to own up to the fact that you don't have a plan—or that your plan will leave people without full coverage—then you need to say so. #DemDebate

Health care is a crisis in this country. My approach is we need as much help for as many people as quickly as possible. To bring in as many supporters as we can. If we don't get it all the first time, we take the win and come back into the fight to ask for more. #MedicareForAll

Wall Street tried to stop us. 
I won, they lost. 

We’re not going to beat Donald Trump with a candidate who makes excuses for the powerful. We need a candidate who has shown they can fight them—and win. #DemDebate

I will never forget one of your neighbors, Mr. Estrada, who broke down in tears over how he did everything right—but then Wells Fargo yanked his home away. I spent years fighting to make sure that would never happen again. #DemDebate

While Mike Bloomberg was blaming Black and Latino families for the 2008 crash, I was in Nevada—literally down the street from where we’re standing tonight—holding hearings on how Wall Street was ripping homes away from millions of people. #DemDebate
The way we are going to lead this country and beat Donald Trump is going to be with a candidate who has rock-solid values and who actually gets something done. #DemDebate

This country has worked for the rich and left everyone else in the dirt for too long. It’s time to have a president who is willing to get out there and fight for working families. That’s why I am in this race. And that’s how I will beat Donald Trump. #DemDebate

Democrats won’t win if we have a nominee who has a history of hiding his tax returns, harassing women, and supporting racist policies like stop and frisk and redlining. Understand this: Democrats take a huge risk if we substitute one arrogant billionaire for another. #DemDebate

I'd like to talk about who we're running against: A billionaire who calls women “fat broads” and “horsey-faced lesbians.” And no I'm not talking about Donald Trump. I'm talking about Mayor Bloomberg. #DemDebate
I’m deeply grateful to everyone who pitches in what they can to our campaign. Together, we can put power in the hands of working people and make our government work for all of us. Join us:
Brandon, I’m in this fight for you, Drew, and Juan. We will build a better America, together.

Dream big. 
Fight hard.
Let’s win.

I’m fired up for tonight’s #DemDebate in Las Vegas. Will you chip in $2 to our campaign now? We’re doing this together, person by person.
It was so great to meet you, @YNB!
Stay strong out there, @Culinary226—I’m fighting alongside you all the way!

On this Day of Remembrance, we must acknowledge when President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed an order to unjustly incarcerate 120,000 Japanese Americans during World War II. It comes upon us to call out our government’s legacy of racism and injustice—and keep fighting against it.

On this Day of Remembrance, we must acknowledge when President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed an order to unjustly incarcerate 120,000 Japanese Americans during World War II. It comes upon us to call out our government’s legacy of racism and injustice—and keep fighting against it.

We can defeat the climate crisis, create 10.6 million good union jobs, and end environmental racism so working families can live with clean air and water. This is how we’ll build a country that works for everyone—not just giant polluters and fossil fuel companies.
Unions and workers have been by my side since I first ran for the Senate, and I will be fighting alongside them in the White House.

We need to build an immigration system that is fair, humane, and reflects our best values. We need #JudicialIndependence and to ensure immigrants receive due process. It's time for #ImmigrationCourtReformNow.

I'm the proud daughter of a janitor, and I went on to be a public school teacher, a law professor, a senator—and a candidate for president.

I’ll never forget who I’m fighting for.

Black moms die from childbirth-related causes 3-4 times more often than white moms. We have a Black maternal mortality crisis, and racism is at the root of it. I’ve got a plan to address this head-on.
Dorothy Bolden knew that you don’t get what you don’t fight for—and she showed how one very determined woman, backed up by many people across this country, can deliver big, structural change.

A lot of politicians praise entrepreneurs and mom-and-pop shops, but they support the big businesses that can hire armies of lobbyists. And being pro big-business means, by and large, being pro-big businesses run by white men. It's time to change that.

Small businesses are the heart of our economy, but it's getting harder to start and grow one—and the challenges are even greater for communities of color. I've got a comprehensive plan to boost America's small businesses.

This week, some candidates are hosting closed-door fundraisers that cost $75,000 a ticket.

Not me. I’m in Nevada—meeting voters, talking with community leaders, and taking questions.

How we fund our campaign matters. Will you donate $2 now?

Domestic workers have been at the frontlines of the fight for economic justice. I'm proud to stand with @CareInActionUSA and fight side by side with domestic workers across the country for universal family care and the passage of the Domestic Workers Bill of Rights.

I don’t listen to the naysayers. I’m determined to hit our most ambitious fundraising goal yet: $7 million before the Nevada caucuses on Saturday.

Will you chip in $2 right now? If a few more people on Twitter chip in tonight, we’ll be on track.
It looks like in the Trump White House, you can buy a pardon. This is corruption, plain and simple.
Nevada, you still have time to vote early before the caucuses this Saturday!

Donald Trump has done serious damage to our government, and our next president is going to have to work hard to rebuild it.

I know how to get the government working for the people because I’ve done it before, when I launched the CFPB—which Megan understands very well!

Mike Bloomberg approved and oversaw a program that surveilled and tracked Muslim communities in mosques, restaurants, and even college campuses—leaving permanent damage. He refuses to apologize for it.

My heart goes out to all of those affected by historic flooding in Mississippi. 

This is one more example of the devastating effects of the climate crisis. We must act now so that severe flooding and extreme storms don't become our new normal.

The president's pardon and clemency powers are supposed to be used to correct injustice or grant mercy to the powerless—not to give immunity to the powerful. We need a president on the side of the people, not the corrupt and well-connected.
.@FredTJoseph personally knows the damage that Mike Bloomberg’s policies and agendas have caused. He knows that our party deserves better.

I’m so grateful for your contributions to #TeamWarren. Your illustration work for Juliet Takes A Breath, and the work you continue to do every day to fight for big, structural change, is incredibly powerful. I will fight for your family as hard as I fight for my own.
Thank you, @MichaelGKagan. I'm so grateful to have your endorsement, and I'll proudly fight beside you to build a humane immigration system that reflects our best values.

As the first woman—the first Latina—to be elected mayor of Tucson, Arizona, @TucsonRomero has been breaking barriers her entire life. She knows the American dream is slipping further away, and I’m humbled to partner with her in this fight for big, structural change.

It’s a shame Mike Bloomberg can buy his way into the debate. But at least now primary voters curious about how each candidate will take on Donald Trump can get a live demonstration of how we each take on an egomaniac billionaire.

Domestic workers have led the fight for economic justice—from the Atlanta washerwomen’s strike, to Dorothy Bolden and the National Domestic Workers Union of America, to @DomesticWorkers leading the fight now. I look forward to joining their #DignityUnityPower forum today!
Proud to partner with @Benny_Starr in this fight!

Mike Bloomberg's expansion of “stop and frisk” devastated Black and Brown communities. For years, he used racist justifications to defend the practice—and more comments are already resurfacing. We need a nominee that Democratic voters can trust.

This grassroots movement isn't just about defeating Donald Trump. Big, structural change means winning up and down the ticket. That's why I'm proudly endorsing candidates fighting to put power in the hands of the people.

These are frightening times. People are afraid for their friends, their family, their neighbors. Yet they still have so much optimism that we can defeat Donald Trump and build a better country. They give me hope and fuel this fight. Thank you so much, Reno!

Families just want a chance to succeed—to build a good life for themselves and their kids. I hear that everywhere, from the Broadacres Market in Las Vegas, to communities across the country. We need to ensure our country and economy work for them—not just a thin slice at the top.
This is how we’ll do this—together!

I don’t accept contributions from:

✖️ PACs 
✖️ Federal lobbyists
✖️ Big Oil executives
✖️ Big Pharma executives
✖️ Big Tech executives 
✖️ Big Bank executives

We’re doing this the grassroots way—person by person. Will you chip in $3 before midnight?
Let’s do this!
Yes we will!
Thank you so much, I’m so grateful for your support!
Woo-hoo!
Thank you, @PattyArquette, I’m grateful to have you on #TeamWarren!

When I meet young girls on the campaign trail, I tell them, "I'm Elizabeth Warren, and I'm running for president because that's what girls do." Then we pinkie promise so they remember.

I can't wait for a #PresidentsDay not too long from now, when they're all running, too!
.@CRoadCore did such a phenomenal job with this illustration. I am beyond grateful for her work.

AAPI communities include nearly 50 diverse racial and ethnic groups, yet the aggregated data we collect hides that some AAPI families are hanging on by their fingernails. This is a civil rights issue, and I've got a plan to fix it.

Had a wonderful time joining the @ClarkDems for the Kick-Off to Caucus Gala!

Thank you for my “Happy Presidents’ Day” card—I love it!
Thank you, @TucsonRomero! I’m deeply grateful for your endorsement, and am proud to partner with you in this fight for big, structural change.

Desecrating Native sacred sites to build Trump's hateful border wall is unacceptable. We must respect tribal sovereignty. No project impacting Native sacred sites should proceed without the free, prior, and informed consent of the Tribal Nations concerned.

I’m humbled by @CRoadCore’s thoughtful design. Her work embodies the insight and tenacity that Latinas bring to this fight, and I am so grateful for her decision to collaborate with #TeamWarren. Cristy, I hope I can make you proud as president of the United States.
Dreamers like Alejandra make our communities stronger. I'll fight to make sure Alejandra and every Dreamer in our country has an achievable path to citizenship.

I don’t take these endorsements lightly. I will partner with these powerful Latina women in the fight for big, structural change—and I will continue to listen and learn from the community every step of the way. I ask you all to hold me accountable to this promise.

Donald Trump has been abusing our immigration system to cause tremendous harm to immigrant families. I'm proud to work with @JayesGreenJ to build a humane immigration system that reflects our best values.
Thank you, @JimOfSuperior! I’m grateful to have you on #TeamWarren.

I’m honored to be joined in this campaign by Latina leaders who are fighting for big, structural change. As president, I’m committed to being a real partner to the community. This is our moment to dream big, fight hard—and win.

We set an ambitious goal to raise $7 million before the Nevada caucuses—and this grassroots community is stepping up. I'm grateful down to my toes, and if you chip in $5 or whatever you can today to help hit this goal, I could call you to say thanks!
I loved meeting families in Las Vegas Chinatown, including many first-time voters and caucusgoers. Thanks for showing me around, @MaryLouAkai—and recommending we grab boba!
Families in Las Vegas, Nevada, and all across the country are ready to fight for big, structural change. #NVertheless, we persist.

Courtney from Texas donated $5 to our campaign and said she believes in me. Well, I believe in Courtney—and over 1 million others who've chipped in a few bucks to keep our movement strong. We can only do this together—will you chip in $5 now?
Thanks for joining us and #WomenWithWarren in Nevada, @YNB! I’m grateful to be with you in this fight for big, structural change.

Jordan should still be with us today. My heart is with @LucyMcBath and Jordan's friends and family. I will fight beside you to end the gun violence epidemic and fight systemic racism, so that young Black boys can grow up safe and free.

The United States has the highest incarceration rate in the world. If we want to end mass incarceration, we can't just nibble around the edges of this problem—we need to reform the system from front to back. And I've got a plan for that.
Emily asked me why it's important for women to run for president. Here's my answer.

Self-funding billionaires like Mike Bloomberg who are running for president don’t have to think about fundraising goals—but we do.

We need to raise $7 million before the Nevada caucuses, and we’re doing it person by person. Will you chip in $3 right now?

My heart aches for the children and young adults like Kevin who are being harmed and traumatized by our immigration system. They deserve so much better. This is unethical, cruel, and inhumane—and this will stop in a Warren administration.

Lizzy from Massachusetts chipped in a few bucks to our campaign—so I called to say thanks. I told Lizzy and her daughter, Annie, that I’m fighting for them. The only way we’ll make real change is by doing it together. Chip in now and I could call you next!
February 14 was my mother's birthday, and she loved her special connection to Valentine’s Day. Every year, I make a heart-shaped cake to remember her. Here's why.

I believe that you measure what you care about—and I care about building a government that works for everyone in the diverse AAPI community.

Tuesday was AAPI Women's Equal Pay Day. AAPI women as a whole are paid 90 cents on every dollar earned by white men. But Native Hawaiian women make 63 cents, Samoan women make 62 cents, and Fijian women make just 55 cents on the dollar.

Here's just one example: Income inequality in Asian American communities nearly doubled from 1970 to 2016. Burmese, Nepalese, Hmong, and Bangladeshi Americans make, on average, less than half what people in some other AAPI communities make.

The AAPI community includes nearly 50 diverse racial and ethnic groups, but the data we gather today doesn’t capture significant differences on key economic and social outcomes. Data equity is a civil rights issue—and I've got a plan for that.

We need to confront the racist legacy of redlining head-on. My housing plan creates a first-of-its-kind down-payment assistance program to help families living in formerly redlined neighborhoods buy a home.
The Trump administration is refusing to allow grieving parents to visit their remaining daughter. The Muslim Ban is cruel, and it's time for it to go. Congress must pass the No Ban Act.

I will provide a path to citizenship for the 1.7 million undocumented #AAPIs, expand family reunification, and roll back harmful policies like Trump’s Public Charge rule, which prevents children from having access to critical services. #AAPI2020

I’ll use every tool to fight hate crimes. I'll rebuild trust with targeted communities by working with community leaders and directing the CDC to research white nationalism. And my DOJ will prioritize combatting white nationalist violence. #AAPI2020

From rising seas to lingering effects of nuclear testing, Pacific Islanders face dangers of climate change firsthand. As president, I'll remediate historic injustices for frontline communities by prioritizing at least $1 trillion in climate investments.

AAPI Americans’ voices will be crucial in 2020. My plan would guarantee the fundamental right to vote, ensure racist and corrupt politicians don’t undermine that right, and improve voting accessibility for LEP voters. #AAPI2020

The student loan crisis is crushing a generation. Enough is enough: Starting on day one of my presidency, I’ll cancel student debt for 95% of Americans who have it. Then, we’ll make public colleges, which over 80% of AAPI students attend, free—no tuition or fees. #AAPI2020
My goal as president, and our goal as a society, will be to reduce gun deaths by 80%—and I have a plan to get it done. #AAPI2020

We have a gun violence epidemic in this country. We need to act—now. I will break the NRA’s stranglehold on Congress and sign comprehensive gun violence prevention legislation into law in my first 100 days, and keep improving on it every year. #AAPI2020

We need expanded legal immigration that will grow our economy and reunite families. We need to provide due process to migrants. I’ll eliminate the use of expedited removal proceedings and fight for a national immigration public defender corps. #AAPI2020

Donald Trump's racist immigration policies have done unimaginable harm, contributed to several deaths, and torn apart families. We need to build a fair, humane immigration system that reflects our values—and I’ve got a plan for that.
The 2008 financial crash would not have been averted if we had allowed the banks to be more racist. And anyone who thinks otherwise should not be the leader of our party.

I will strengthen protections for English Language Learners in schools, make elections more accessible to Limited English Proficiency voters, and reverse Trump's shameful proposal to roll back health care non-discrimination protections for LEP people under Section 1557. #AAPI2020

I’ll form a White House Task Force on data equity to make sure that no one in the AAPI community is erased. We’ll work with AAPI communities to collect comprehensive, disaggregated data in key federal surveys and across agencies. #AAPI2020

Data equity is a civil rights issue. AAPI people are not a monolith, and aggregated data hides the fact that many AAPI families are hanging on by their fingernails. Data erasure limits our abilities to tackle the structural barriers faced by distinct AAPI communities. #AAPI2020

I will build a cabinet and senior leadership team that reflects the full diversity of America’s communities. I will diversify recruitment for government jobs, including directing resources toward attracting applicants from minority-serving institutions. #AAPI2020

We need to staff our government with people who deeply understand the intersectional needs and experiences of all Americans—from housing to health care—and who reflect the diversity of the American people, and that includes Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islanders. #AAPI2020

Personnel is policy. I’m proud to have the first Asian American campaign manager of any major presidential campaign. I’ve pledged to appoint a diverse cabinet. I’ll listen to and learn from AAPI leaders who have been at the forefront of advocating for their communities. #AAPI2020
Learn more about my platform at the #AAPI2020 Twitter Town Hall, happening soon at 2 PM ET—and join the conversation using the hashtag #AAPI2020.

Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders are the fastest-growing minority group in the U.S. today—working hard to thrive, but still facing unique barriers to achieving their dreams. I'm a fighter for working families—and committed to fighting for AAPI families.
Here’s a history lesson on the racist legacy of redlining, if any presidential candidate needs a refresher.

If we want to build a government and a country that works for everyone, we need to tackle generations of racial injustice and systemic discrimination head on. I’ll listen to and learn from the AAPI leaders who have been at the forefront of this fight.

We need to take concrete steps to address the impact of redlining and the subprime mortgage crisis. I built an office at the @CFPB to fight lending discrimination and my housing plan helps families in formerly redlined areas to buy homes and build wealth.

The end of redlining didn't cause the 2008 crash. Out-of-control greed by Wall Street and big banks, and the corruption that lets them control our government, caused the crash. Predatory lenders steered families of color into the worst loans and those families lost billions.

I'm surprised that someone running for the Democratic nomination thinks the economy would be better off if we just let banks be more overtly racist. We need to confront the shameful legacy of discrimination, not lie about it like Mike Bloomberg has done.
Thank you, Smitha! I’m thankful to have your support!
I deeply appreciate your support, Erika!
Thank you, Marshall. I’m deeply grateful.
Scarlett, I’m grateful. This is how we’re going to do this: Together.
Thank you, Saira! I’m with you, too.
And I believe in you! Thank you.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart, Colette.

David Adame-Reyes was arrested for sitting on a sidewalk, then sent to immigration detention. This is cruel and unjust. Immigration and law enforcement should be kept separate—combining them only sows distrust and harms public safety.
I look forward to joining the #AAPI2020 Twitter Town Hall tomorrow!

No one should attack @Culinary226 and its members for fighting hard for themselves and their families. Like them, I want to see every American get high-quality and affordable health care—and I’m committed to working with them to achieve that goal.
I'll be on @AllInWithChris shortly to talk about how we're building our grassroots movement to power through Nevada, South Carolina, Super Tuesday, and beyond. Tune in!

A third of delegates aren't decided until Super Tuesday. What we do now matters.

Our campaign needs critical funds to reach voters and caucus-goers, so we’ve set an ambitious goal: $7 million before the Nevada caucuses.

Will you chip in $5 or more now?

From day one, this fight has been the same. Our government and our economy are working better and better for a thinner slice at the top—at the expense of everyone else. We need big, structural change to make them work for everyone.
Gutting funding for clean energy isn't just bad for our climate—it kills jobs. If we want to fight climate change and create good union jobs, we need to invest in clean energy.

Zaya is a remarkable young woman with such an insight on life. Bruce, I, and our entire team are inspired by her. We’re sending all our love and support. Thank you for being such incredible parents—I know that’s the future you want for all our kids.
We will win by uniting our country around ending the corruption that has shortchanged our kids, our schools, and the very survival of our planet.

This fight to save our democracy is an uphill battle. But our campaign is built for the long haul, and we are just getting started. We have the hope that comes with dreaming big—and the courage to fight for the big, structural change we need.

Americans of all political stripes should be gravely concerned about the corruption that pressures federal prosecutors to give sweetheart deals to criminals who do their crimes on behalf of Donald Trump.

Yes Roger Stone, I’m looking at you.
Thank you, @DevalPatrick. I know that we will continue fighting together for Massachusetts families, and for working families all across our country.

Abusing official power to protect political friends and attack opponents is common in authoritarian regimes like Putin’s Russia. Trump and Barr’s conduct has no place in our democracy. To end it, Congress must act—and the American people must hold them accountable in November.

I am the only candidate to propose an independent DOJ task force to investigate crimes by Trump administration officials. Every Democratic candidate must commit to it—so Trump officials know they will be held accountable by career prosecutors once he is out of office.

Congress must act immediately to rein in our lawless Attorney General. Barr should resign or face impeachment. And Congress should use spending power to defund the AG’s authority to interfere with anything that affects Trump, his friends, or his elections.

Donald Trump can continue his corrupt rampages and vendettas because elected Republicans do nothing. They lack the courage and backbone shown by four career prosecutors who stepped down rather than facilitate the Attorney General’s corrupt scheme. But we are not powerless.

Donald Trump is shredding the rule of law in this country. His AG overruled career prosecutors to reduce the sentence for his buddy Roger Stone after Stone committed crimes to protect him. Every Republican who voted to acquit Trump for his corrupt actions enabled and owns this.
We’re staying in this fight for the people who are counting on us. Tomorrow morning, we’ll wake up and fight twice as hard—together. Chip in $5 and let’s do this:

A young girl came up to me tonight and said, “I’m a broke college student with a lot of student loan debt. I checked and I have $6 in the bank—so I just gave $3 to keep you in this fight.” We’re staying in this fight for the people who are counting on us.
I’m fighting for you. Thank you for your support!

Abusing official power to protect political friends and attack opponents is common in authoritarian regimes like Putin’s Russia. Trump and Barr’s conduct has no place in our democracy. To end it, Congress must act—and the American people must hold them accountable in November.

I am the only candidate to propose an independent DOJ task force to investigate crimes by Trump administration officials. Every Democratic candidate must commit to it—so Trump officials know they will be held accountable by career prosecutors once he is out of office.

Congress must act immediately to rein in our lawless Attorney General. Barr should resign or face impeachment. And Congress should use spending power to defund the AG’s authority to interfere with anything that affects Trump, his friends, or his elections.

I believe that the best investment we can make as a nation, the best investment we can make as human beings, is to invest in our children. I have a plan for that. #DemDebate

We cannot only talk about how important the Black community is at election time. We need to have concrete plans that will have a real impact on Black Americans’ lives. I'm in this fight to make real change. #DemDebate

I just stepped off the #DemDebate stage and got some good news from my team: We’re getting close to hitting our $2 million fundraising goal before the New Hampshire primary on Tuesday!

Will you chip in $3 tonight? I wouldn’t ask if it wasn’t important.

With my #WealthTax, we can get #UniversalChildCare, universal pre-k for every 3-year-old and 4-year-old in America, and raise the wages of every child care worker and preschool teacher in America, who are largely Black and Brown women. #DemDebate

The new trade deal makes things somewhat better for American farmers and workers. And when I see change that makes things somewhat better for hardworking people, I'll sign up for that—and I'll get up tomorrow and start working for a better trade deal on climate. #DemDebate

We build a movement by funding it from the grassroots up. That's the way I'm running my campaign. I don’t take money from federal lobbyists or billionaires at fancy fundraisers. If you think it's the right way to run—chip in $3 before the #DemDebate ends.

I hear everyone talking about how we all want to overturn Citizens United because we want to end unlimited spending. Everyone on this stage except Amy and me is a billionaire or receiving help from Super PACs. Time to put your money where your mouth is. #DemDebate
No one should be able to buy their way into being president of the United States. And no one who sucks up to billionaires in order to fund their campaigns should be able to do it either. #DemDebate
We cannot just say that criminal justice is the only time we want to talk about race. We need race-conscious laws. #DemDebate
It's time to end endless wars and bring our troops home. #DemDebate.

For generations, government redlining prevented people of color from buying homes. You can't just repeal that and think everything is fine. We need race-conscious laws in education, in employment, and entrepreneurship to make this a country of opportunity for everyone. #DemDebate

We must rework our justice system from what we criminalize at the front end, to how we help people come back to their communities.

But we can't say criminal justice is the only time we want to talk about race specifically. We must start having race-conscious laws. #DemDebate

States are heading toward trying to ban safe, legal abortion and the Supreme Court seems headed in exactly that direction as well. We need a national law to protect a person’s right to control their own body. #DemDebate

Until we roll back the filibuster, the gun industry is going to continue to have a veto and we'll never make the changes. We have to be willing to build a future that works not for a gun industry—but works for the rest of America and protects our children. #DemDebate
Why can we not even get a vote in the United States Senate on background checks? Because the gun industry continues to call the shots. #DemDebate
We have a gun violence problem in America, and it’s often communities of color that are hit hardest. We need to treat it like the public health emergency that it is. #DemDebate

People across the country see that our government is working great for billionaires and giant corporations, while they and their children are left with less. We have to stand up to those who control our government and make that government work for us. #DemDebate

I sit on the Senate Armed Services Committee. I’ve been to Afghanistan. We cannot wait five more years or ten more years, or until we turn the corner ten more times. We need to bring our combat troops home. #DemDebate

We are Democrats. We are on the side of everyone in America who needs health care. And when we come up against Donald Trump—the man trying to take health care from millions of people—that is what will matter. #DemDebate

Americans are losing faith in our government. They see themselves and their children with less and less. It’s not enough to simply talk about the future. We must stand up to those who now control our government, and make our government work for the people instead. #DemDebate

We need to re-establish the rule of law in our country. I believe in an independent commission in our Justice Department that investigates crimes committed by our own government.

No one is above the law—and that includes the president of the United States. #DemDebate

On day one, I’ll do what a president can do all by herself: Defend the Affordable Care Act and reduce the costs of prescription drugs like insulin, HIV AIDS drugs, and EpiPens. We are Democrats—we are on the side of those who need health care. #DemDebate

Will you chip in $3 tonight? I wouldn’t ask if it wasn’t important.

In 2018, 36 million Americans couldn't afford to have a prescription filled. We need to bring the most help to the most people as quickly as possible. We need #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate

Democrats, Independents, and Republicans across the country understand that our government works great for the rich and powerful and no one else. Fighting corruption head on is what’s going to bring Americans together—and it’s how we’re going to win in November. #DemDebate

Donald Trump hired Gordon Sondland to be his ambassador to the EU after he donated $1 million to Trump's inaugural committee. Now he's fired Sondland after he testified about Trump's crimes. The corruption of this administration knows no bounds.
Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman is a decorated servicemember. He did his patriotic, constitutional duty. And now Donald Trump has retaliated against him.

It was so great to meet Vivian and Riley, two graduate students from Dartmouth, before tonight's #DemDebate! They won the @TeamWarren contest after chipping in to help power this grassroots movement. I’m so grateful to have them in this fight!

Donald Trump spent his career getting rich off the backs of others. Today, he's exploiting our government for his own personal benefit.

I grew up in Oklahoma on the ragged edge of the middle class. I'm fighting to make our government work for all families.

Sandra Bland should still be alive today to celebrate her 33rd birthday. We must #SayHerName—and we must honor her life by reforming our criminal justice system once and for all.

My heart goes out to Sandra Bland's friends, family, and everyone who is missing her today.

If we’re going to be a country where the only way you get to be president is by starting out as a billionaire—or by spending most of your time sucking up to billionaires and giant corporations—then this will be a country that only works for billionaires and giant corporations.

Mitch McConnell couldn't silence Coretta Scott King's voice three years ago, and we won't let her enduring warning be forgotten. We must keep uplifting the voices of Black women fighting voter suppression today, and partner with them in this fight.
Donald Trump is exploiting our government to line his own pockets. This is corruption, plain and simple.
Corruption follows corruption. It's time to end the practice of auctioning off cushy diplomatic posts to the highest bidder—and rebuild our State Department with committed, competent professionals.

We face big challenges right now. But Americans have always met big problems with even bigger solutions. That’s who we are.

I'm optimistic because here in Derry, New Hampshire, and all across America, I see the grassroots movement that is ready to fight back.
All right New Hampshire, Election Day is coming up! We brought together a few friends to share ways you can help in the final few days, no matter where you live.

In New Hampshire and across the country, I've heard devastating stories of families fighting for clean drinking water free from dangerous PFAS chemicals. We need to enforce strict regulations to ensure everyone has clean water—and I've got a plan for that.
I'll be on with @ChrisLHayes soon to talk about the grassroots movement we're building across the country to fight for big, structural change—tune in!

I'll have a Secretary of Education who's been a public school teacher, who believes in public education, and who believes that public dollars should stay in public schools. Our Department of Education should be on the side of students, not for-profit institutions. #WarrenTownHall

There's a lot we can do to end gun violence—and I've got a plan outlining how I'll do that. But we should also ask why nothing is being done right now. If we want to end gun violence, we must root out the corruption that is holding up progress. #WarrenTownHall

All policy issues are disability policy issues. That's why I make sure each of my plans addresses the disability community's concerns. And when I built my disability plan, I reached out to the disability community to help build it. #WarrenTownHall

Matthew 25: I was a stranger and you took me in.

We have a moral responsibility. We cannot be a nation that treats people who come to us—desperate and afraid for their lives—with anything other than humanity. #WarrenTownHall
Thank you Dr. @AyanaEliza for filling in for me while I fulfilled my constitutional duty in Washington. I'm proud to fight alongside you to defeat the climate crisis.
In 2018, 36 million Americans couldn't afford to have a prescription filled. We need to bring the most help to the most people as quickly as possible. We need #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate

Thank you Dr. @AyanaEliza for filling in for me while I fulfilled my constitutional duty in Washington. I'm proud to fight alongside you to defeat the climate crisis.
I'm grateful to stand shoulder to shoulder with @JamilahLemieux. From #TeamWarren dormstorms in Texas to Tennessee and beyond, let’s keep dreaming big and fighting hard together!

Selfie lines have been the best times of the campaign. But it's also the people who whisper in my ear to tell me about their lives and put a note in my hand—the people who need a government on their side. #WarrenTownHall

My heart goes out to @SybrinaFulton and Trayvon's family and friends. He should still be with us today.

We need to end gun violence and racism. And we need to build a world where all of our children—especially young Black boys—can grow up safe and free.

Since Donald Trump was elected, women have been outperforming men in competitive elections. Democrats took back the House and state houses across the country because of women candidates. It's simple: Women win! #WarrenTownHall

I've got three older brothers—two of them are Republicans. But there's a lot we agree on, like corruption. We all agree that it's not right when the wealthy and well-connected use their influence in Washington to rewrite the rules in their favor. #WarrenTownHall

They said the CFPB would never happen. They said I couldn't beat a popular Republican incumbent. They said a woman couldn't win. Every time, I proved them wrong. 

I know how to fight, and I know how to win. Will you chip in $3 to help power our movement?
I'll be joining @Lawrence on @MSNBC shortly to talk about the grassroots movement we're building to defeat Donald Trump. I hope you'll tune in!

The people who whisper in my ear, who tell me about their lives, who put a note in my hand, who tell me what universal health care would mean for them: My selfie lines are about listening to concerns and dreams of Americans who need a government on their side. #WarrenTownHall

I reached out to the disability community to build my disability plan: To talk about the places where we’ve failed as a nation and where there are opportunities to be inclusive of people to be full and equal participants in this country. #WarrenTownHall

I will have a Secretary of Education who has been a public school teacher. I will have a Secretary of Education who believes in public education. I will have a Secretary who understands that public dollars should stay in public schools. #WarrenTownHall

I’m not cozying up to billionaires behind closed doors or calling up wealthy donors for big checks. Instead, I'm running a 100% grassroots-funded campaign. If you think this is how campaigns should be run, chip in now and join this grassroots movement:

We need to treat gun violence like a public health emergency. That means we collect data about where the threats come from, and then reduce those threats. We have to be a nation committed to reducing gun violence. As president, I will reduce gun violence by 80% over eight years.

Why have we done nothing on gun violence when more than 90% of Americans want us to pass background checks? The reason is corruption. It’s the power of the gun industry and the power of the NRA. We need to attack that corruption head on. #WarrenTownHall

We cannot be a nation that takes away children from their families, or that takes people who come to us who are desperate and treat them with anything other than humanity. We have a moral responsibility to them and to each other to live our values every day. #WarrenTownHall

This so-called crisis at our border is one that Donald Trump helped blow up. He did it in part by disrupting aid for Central American countries. We need to restore that aid and help stabilize those governments so people don’t feel they need to flee for their lives.
Immigration does not make this country weaker. Immigration makes this country stronger. #WarrenTownHall

I grew up in Oklahoma on the ragged edge of the middle class. Donald Trump grew up rich in a New York City mansion, and spent his life getting richer off the backs of others. We see our government differently—he wants to exploit it, I want to make sure it works for everyone.

193 people die every day from addiction and overdose. We need to tackle opioids like the AIDS crisis: Combat the stigma and put in the real resources to save our neighbors. We need to put the resources in the local communities who are on the frontlines of the crisis.

We have an America where the GDP keeps going up, so does the stock market and corporate profits—but hardworking families have virtually flat wages and rising costs for health care, housing, and child care. We’ve got to change that—that’s why I’m in this fight. #WarrenTownHall.

Corruption drives my family crazy. And I think it drives people across this country crazy—whether they’re Democrats, Republicans, Independents. Because they understand that it’s not right for people to use their power to get the rules re-written in their favor. #WarrenTownHall

I was born and raised in Oklahoma. I have 3 older brothers—1 is a Democrat, the other 2 are Republicans. I ask my brothers about Eli Lilly and Amazon. You know what they have in common? They made billions of dollars in profits, but paid $0 in federal income taxes. #WarrenTownHall

I made the decision at the beginning of this campaign that I wasn’t going to spend my time in closed-door fundraisers or selling my time to billionaires and federal lobbyists. Instead, we're powered by more than 1,000,000 grassroots donors. Chip in at

My first job was as a special education teacher. That’s where I learned the worth of every human being. That’s where I came to understand that public service and teaching are about being there for others. Donald Trump thinks others are there for him. #WarrenTownHall

What today shows is what kind of human being we’re running against. Donald Trump is someone who thinks that the world is there to save him and to serve him—and he’s been that way ever since he was a kid. #WarrenTownHall
Tune in to @CNN now to watch our #WarrenTownHall!

For decades, Black Americans were cut out of higher education because of government-sponsored discrimination. I’ll use every tool I have to address racial disparities in higher education—including investing at least $50 billion in our HBCUs.
You matter, @OmarParraM. Thank you for being in this fight with me—I won't stop fighting for you.

We can defeat Donald Trump and root out corruption in Washington. We can defeat his hate and bigotry, and build a country of our best values. We can make sure our country works for everyone, not just his wealthy, well-connected cronies. And we can only do it together.

These are hard times. People are frustrated and angry—but we must not be discouraged. Now more than ever, we must choose courage and hope over fear. Now is our moment to fight back. We have defeated corruption before, and we will do it again.

Donald Trump pressured a foreign government to interfere in our election. He undermined our diplomatic relationships and put our national security at risk. He exploits our government for his personal gain—and Republicans just voted to protect him.

The New START treaty will expire exactly one year from today, further increasing the risk of nuclear war. Donald Trump can agree to extend this critical treaty today—but if he does not get the job done, I will move to extend the agreement on my first day in office.

"Corrupting an election to keep oneself in office is perhaps the most abusive and destructive violation of one's oath of office that I can imagine." 

I agree, @MittRomney. Voting to convict this president is an act of patriotism. Thank you for yours.

This is a scary time for our country, and many are worried. But in Peterborough, New Hampshire, and all across the country, people are ready to get out and fight to save our democracy and our country. 

I believe in that optimism—and I'm in this fight alongside them.

Our union is stronger than Donald Trump. And in less than a year, our union will be stronger than ever when that one man is replaced—thanks to the hard work of very persistent women like @AyannaPressley.

From our homes to our streets, schools, and playgrounds—an average of 100 people are killed in the United States by a gun every day. The stories from #MomentsThatSurvive are devastating. We don't need to live like this. I'm fighting to end gun violence.
People told me the CFPB could never happen, but it did. I was proud to fight alongside President @BarackObama for middle-class families. I know how to fight—and I know how to win.

Ultimately, what you do—coming to town halls, knocking on doors, calling voters—is an act of optimism. It's an act that says: If we get out there and fight from the heart, we'll save our democracy and our country.
 
I believe in that optimism. That's why I'm in this fight.

I agree, @MittRomney. Voting to convict this president is an act of patriotism. Thank you for yours.

This is a scary time for our country, and many are worried. But in Peterborough, New Hampshire, and all across the country, people are ready to get out and fight to save our democracy and our country. 

I believe in that optimism—and I'm in this fight alongside them.

Our union is stronger than Donald Trump. And in less than a year, our union will be stronger than ever when that one man is replaced—thanks to the hard work of very persistent women like @AyannaPressley.

From our homes to our streets, schools, and playgrounds—an average of 100 people are killed in the United States by a gun every day. The stories from #MomentsThatSurvive are devastating. We don't need to live like this. I'm fighting to end gun violence.
People told me the CFPB could never happen, but it did. I was proud to fight alongside President @BarackObama for middle-class families. I know how to fight—and I know how to win.

Ultimately, what you do—coming to town halls, knocking on doors, calling voters—is an act of optimism. It's an act that says: If we get out there and fight from the heart, we'll save our democracy and our country.
 
I believe in that optimism. That's why I'm in this fight.

Thank you @vgescobar for delivering a powerful #SOTU response in Spanish—and for continuing to be a leader in the fight against Donald Trump's xenophobia, bigotry, and hate. Tonight you showed the country how defeating Trump will take a diverse and fearless coalition.
Thank you @GretchenWhitmer for your important #SOTU response speech—and for continuing to share a vision of what our country can be when we offer everyone a path to opportunity and a good life.
Congratulations to my dear friend and Campaign Co-Chair @AyannaPressley on a powerful @WorkingFamilies Party response to tonight’s #SOTU!

Last night, I thought about the grassroots movement we've built—over 1 million grassroots donors, 3 million contributions, and over 100,000 selfies. They see a government that's working great for a thinner slice of the top, and they're ready to fight to make it work for everyone.

I know many people are starting to feel discouraged. But we are at our best when we take on big battles and fight for our country and our families. If you’re worried or frustrated—and want to do something—join our campaign. Let’s fight back together. #SOTU
Now is our moment to choose the future we can build together. Now is our moment to get out there and fight from the heart. Because that is how we will save our democracy and save our country. #SOTU

But the character of our country—and the state of our union—aren’t determined by Trump. They’re determined by our people, and we’re stronger than Donald Trump. Now more than ever, we must choose courage and hope over fear. #SOTU
These are hard times for our country. Tomorrow it looks like Republicans will continue to protect an out-of-control president rather than uphold the Constitution. #SOTU

Innocent civilians are the main casualties of landmines. This is an abhorrent decision that won’t make America any safer, and could cause untold damage. As president, I will reverse this decision and work with our allies to eliminate landmines.
Families in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, and all across the country are ready to fight for big, structural change. Tune in as I join @AyannaPressley for our #GOTC rally.
Black history is American history. And American history teaches us that racism has for generations shaped every crucial aspect of our economic and political systems.
In Iowa and across the country, one thing stands true about this movement we're building together: Over the past year, you've made me a better candidate—and you'll make me a better president.

This #BlackHistoryMonth, I want to reiterate a promise: When I am president, the lessons of Black history will not be lost. Those lessons will live in every part of my presidency. And I will ask you to hold me accountable for that promise every single day.
I'm so grateful for each and every one of our grassroots donors! This is how we make big, structural change: together.

Your donation right now would make a direct impact on how many caucusgoers and voters we can reach at this pivotal moment. I wouldn’t ask if it weren’t important—will you pitch in $3 or whatever makes sense for you before midnight?
I am deeply grateful for these endorsements, and I will fight to make sure that every LGBTQ+ person in America has the opportunity to thrive.
Our January FEC fundraising report will set the tone for the rest of 2020—and we have until midnight to make it as strong as possible. Pitch in $3 or whatever you can to help grow our movement.

This is what the wealth gap looks like in America today. 

It's time for a #WealthTax so we can invest in opportunities for working families, produce a bigger pie, and cut families a larger slice:
Thank you @WCruz73! This is how we’re going to do this—together.
I’m so grateful to have @sdvorsky1 and Bob on #TeamWarren. Together, we’re going to keep fighting for big, structural change.
Our Campaign Co-Chairs @Deb4CongressNM, @KatiePorterOC, and @AyannaPressley are back in Des Moines to help #GOTC! Tune in at 8:15 PM ET for a live look at our rally!

Trump just expanded his racist, xenophobic Muslim Ban to ban 6 more countries—including Nigeria, the most populous nation in Africa.

Congress must pass the NO BAN Act. And if they don’t, I’ll reverse the Muslim Ban on the first day of my presidency.

In this moment of crisis, I know we'll protect our democracy by standing up for ourselves and each other. We have defeated corruption before. We have changed our system together before. And we will do it again.

The only force that’s powerful enough to stop Trump and the Republicans is us—the American people. They want us to be discouraged and feel hopeless because they're afraid of what will happen when we all come together and take up each other’s fights.

Senate Republicans have let the American people down, giving Donald Trump permission to conspire with foreign governments to undermine your vote. The GOP has shown where they stand—and it's not with you.

The DNC didn’t change the rules to ensure good, diverse candidates could remain on the debate stage. They shouldn’t change the rules to let a billionaire on. Billionaires shouldn't be allowed to play by different rules—on the debate stage, in our democracy, or in our government.

Farmers like Mark have experienced the effects of climate change firsthand, all while Big Ag and Big Oil walk away with giant profits. We need big, structural changes so family farmers like Mark have the opportunity to thrive.
This is not a time for small ideas. This is a time to fight for big, structural change—but I can’t do it alone. Please chip in $3 or whatever you can before tonight's crucial FEC deadline:

This moment is too important to nibble around the edges of the problems we face. Thank you @DMRegister for your endorsement. We need big, structural change—and I'm ready to fight for it. Check out our new Iowa ad.

Hope over fear.
Courage over cynicism.

I’m fighting for Drew, for Juan, for you, and for everyone in this country. We’re going to do this, @bjoewolf.
Thank you, @PhilTing! I’m proud to fight beside you to put power in the hands of working people.

Senate Republicans and the White House should know that the evidence against Trump won't be hidden forever. On day one as president, I will order the release of every document related to this impeachment inquiry that they've been hiding. The people will learn the truth.

By pushing through a sham trial with no witnesses and no White House documents, they are assisting with his cover-up, and giving him a green light to continue breaking the law. And they've trampled over our Constitution in the process.

Donald Trump is dangerous and corrupt: He undermined our diplomatic relationships for his personal, political gain. He solicited foreign interference in our elections. Even Republicans have begun to admit it—they simply refuse to hold him accountable for it.

Donald Trump has deprioritized global health security and cut critical programs like Predict—which can leave us vulnerable to epidemics. As president, I'll bring back Predict and invest in our public health systems to keep us safe from outbreaks like coronavirus.
In 2016, Stephen caucused for Donald Trump. Now, he's switching parties to caucus for me on Monday. This is how we beat Trump in 2020. Watch our new Iowa ad.

This is our moment in history. We can choose hope over fear and fight to make our country work for working people. But it’s going to take all hands on deck—and that’s why I’m asking: Will you chip in $3 to help grow our movement?

They all voted for different candidates in 2016—and they're all joining @TeamWarren in 2020. This is how we’re building the grassroots movement that will unite the country and create big, structural change—by bringing people together.
The Iowa caucuses are just three days away—so we got some friends together to talk about what you can do these next few days to help!

Republicans know that the facts are damning for Donald Trump. If they push through a sham trial to protect him, with no witnesses and no White House documents, they will be assisting with his cover-up, and setting a terrible precedent for the future of our country.
I couldn't do this without incredible people like @FarrellGabriell by my side!
This is shameful. Taxpayer money should be used for programs meant to help American families—not for the personal benefit of Donald Trump’s corrupt administration.

And Trump’s first HHS Secretary still hasn’t repaid taxpayers for the private jets he took while fighting to rip health care from millions by repealing the ACA.
The head of Medicaid, Seema Verma, spent millions of taxpayer dollars on consultants to boost her personal image while trying to kick people off Medicaid or significantly cut their coverage.

The Trump administration took another step to rip health care away from millions. This Medicaid "healthy opportunity" plan will leave many sicker and deny them care they need—while Trump administration officials use taxpayer dollars for their own benefit.

There are four days until the #IACaucus. The critical work we’re doing now—talking with voters, knocking on doors, hosting events—is only possible through grassroots donations. Will you chip in $3 before you log off Twitter tonight?

Kerris's family pays $1,200 a month for health insurance, plus $700 more a month for diabetic supplies. If they can't afford that, they're forced to re-use supplies and risk infection.

No one should profit off patients and struggling families. We need #MedicareForAll.
We lose about 100 people a day in America to gun violence—which often falls hardest on Black and Brown communities. My plan to end this epidemic addresses all kinds of gun violence.

Why are there no resources for essential programs? The wealthy and the well-connected have used their influence in Washington so they can skip out on the bill.

I'm going to make sure our government works for everyone—and pass a #WealthTax so everyone pays their fair share.

We have a Congress that is being held hostage by the gun industry.

If we want to end the gun violence epidemic, we must fight Washington corruption head-on and eliminate the filibuster.

We need to decriminalize mental health crises and invest in prevention and treatment services. I'm grateful to @OsopePatrisse for taking the time to talk with me about @ReformLAJails. I'm proud to support Yes on Measure R, and I'll fight for comprehensive criminal justice reform.
This continues to be one of the hardest questions I've ever had to answer. No child should have to go to school afraid for their lives. We must end the gun violence epidemic now.

These airline catering employees work hard every day to bring food to travelers—they should be paid enough to feed their own families. I stand with them in their fight for fair wages and good benefits.

.@ElenaHung202: I'm fighting to make sure that Xiomara and kids across the country with complex medical needs and disabilities can grow up in a world that is accessible and inclusive—because everyone deserves the opportunity to thrive. I'm proud to fight alongside you.

We know that a small group of corrupt extremists will do everything they can to stop this bill. That's why I've also got a plan to root out the corruption in Washington. Together, we can end the gun violence epidemic that is devastating our communities.

The #EndGunViolenceBill is supported by @NAACP, @GiffordsCourage, @AMarch4OurLives, @NewtownAction, @StopHandguns, and gun violence prevention, civil rights, public health, and community organizations across the country.

Our gun violence epidemic is a public health emergency—and we need to make big, structural changes if we want to end it. So today, I introduced the #EndGunViolenceBill in the Senate to confront this crisis head on.

.@foe_us is a leader in our fight to defeat the climate crisis, and I'm deeply grateful for their endorsement. This is the existential threat of our time—and when I'm president, I'll fight for a #GreenNewDeal and a 100% clean energy future.

Our government officials can best serve the American people when they reflect the diversity of the country itself. That's why I'll build a Cabinet and senior leadership team that reflects the full diversity of America.
Thank you, @One_Colorado! LGBTQ+ Americans should feel free to be who they are and live without fear or discrimination. I won’t stop fighting for them.

Navient has avoided paying $22 million it owes to the federal government. Now they're asking Betsy DeVos to wipe that debt away. It's absurd. When I'm president, I'll cancel debt for student loan borrowers—not the loan servicers who cheat and abuse them.

Right now, we have a government that works great for the wealthy and well-connected—at the expense of everyone else.

I'm fighting to make sure we have a government and an economy that works for working families. And I’m proud to fight alongside @WorkingFamilies and @MauriceWFP.

People told me the CFPB could never happen—but it did. People told me I could never beat a popular Republican incumbent—now he's a former senator. I know how to fight, and I know how to win. Will you chip in $3 to help fund our grassroots campaign?

Trump's cruel "Remain in Mexico" policy put asylum seekers' lives in danger. When I'm president, I'll reverse this cruel policy and ensure that asylum seekers are treated with the dignity and respect that every human being deserves. #RestoreAsylumNow
I'm fighting to put power in the hands of working people, and as president, I'll fight to strengthen unions and empower their voices. Because when unions win, all workers win.

Big corporations push to enact state "right to work" laws to crush unions and the workers they represent. I’ve led the fight against these laws, and today I’m reintroducing a bill in the Senate to eliminate them nationwide.

Too many families like Laura's are struggling to get by, coping with one financial crisis after another. All she wants is a fair shot—for herself, and for her kids. I'm fighting to make sure our economy works for every family in America, not just the wealthy and well-connected.

This is our moment in history to dream big and fight hard for the big, structural change our country needs. If you’re ready to join us, hop on the dialer and talk with Iowans about our movement. This is how we’ll do it—together.

Gun violence. Climate change. Health care. Criminal justice reform. Immigration.

We know what's broken, and we know how to fix it. But, because of corruption, nothing ever gets done.

If we want to make big, structural changes, we need to root out corruption in Washington.

Donald Trump is the most corrupt president in history—and if we want to beat him in 2020, we need to draw the sharpest possible distinction with his corruption. I'm running to root out corruption in Washington and make government work for everyone.
Thank you so much! Together, we’re going to build a country of our best values.

Kids like Autumn are worried about the threat of climate change. I'm fighting to protect her future and the future of our planet—not to protect the profits of corporate polluters putting that future at risk.

The stakes of this election are too high. We need to fight the spread of false information that disempowers voters and undermines democracy. I’ll do my part—and I’m calling on my fellow candidates and big tech companies to do their part, too.

Campaigns and tech companies can take a number of steps to slow the spread of misinformation right now. And as president, I'll take a series of actions to further address the spread of disinformation.

I'm also calling on tech companies like Facebook, Twitter, and Google to take real steps right now to fight disinformation spread on their platforms. The safety of our democracy is more important than shareholder dividends and CEO salaries.

I’m sending a clear message to anyone associated with the Warren campaign: I will not tolerate the use of false information or false accounts to attack my opponents, promote my campaign, or undermine our elections. And I urge my fellow candidates to do the same.

So today, I’m making a pledge: I will not knowingly use or spread disinformation to benefit my own candidacy or damage others. And I will fight disinformation aimed at my campaign, my opponents, and voters.

Anyone who seeks to challenge and defeat Donald Trump must be prepared to take on the full array of disinformation that foreign actors and people in and around his campaign will use to divide Democrats, suppress Democratic votes, and erode the standing of the Democratic nominee.

In the 2016 election we saw how digital disinformation was used to influence and suppress voters. But 4 years later, we're hardly better prepared for it. Donald Trump has welcomed foreign interference in our elections, and if he isn't removed from office, he'll continue to do so.

Disinformation and online foreign interference erode our democracy, and Donald Trump has invited both. Anyone who seeks to challenge and defeat Donald Trump in the 2020 election must be fully prepared to take this on—and I've got a plan to do it.

A small group of the wealthiest families has gobbled up a massive amount of wealth—at the expense of everyone else. 

This is what the wealth gap looks like in America today. It's time for a #WealthTax.

The world changed after 2016. Since Donald Trump was elected, women candidates have been outperforming men candidates in competitive elections. We took back the House and state legislatures because of women candidates and women who got out to help elect them.

Women win!

Donald Trump not only ordered his team to “get rid” of a career ambassador, but did so at a private dinner with wealthy donors. For too long, money has bought access. It’s time to get money out of politics, pursue real campaign finance reform, and end corruption in Washington.

Trump's cruel "Remain in Mexico" policy put asylum seekers' lives in danger. When I'm president, I'll reverse this cruel policy and ensure that asylum seekers are treated with the dignity and respect that every human being deserves. #RestoreAsylumNow
