Donald Trump not only ordered his team to “get rid” of a career ambassador, but did so at a private dinner with wealthy donors. For too long, money has bought access. It’s time to get money out of politics, pursue real campaign finance reform, and end corruption in Washington.
I'll be on @TheLastWord with @Lawrence shortly to talk about the Senate impeachment trial and how we'll root out corruption in Washington.

No matter where you live in America, you should have the opportunity to thrive. I want Washington to work for communities all over this country—including our rural communities—and I've got a plan to make sure it does. Thanks to everyone who joined us for our Davenport town hall!

Gordon Sondland got his job as an ambassador after donating $1 million to Donald Trump’s inaugural committee. Lev Parnas bought access to the president using foreign money. On day one of my presidency, I will take aggressive steps to end Washington corruption.

I called Mary Ellen to say thank you for making the three millionth contribution to this campaign! This is how we're going to create big, structural change—together. Chip in $3 or whatever you can now to join this movement.

I was proud to take the @ProtectRDfnders pledge—and I've proposed a plan to end sexual assault in the military. We owe it to our service members to make real change and reform the military justice system.
I'll be on @NewsHour shortly to talk about the Senate impeachment trial against Donald Trump—tune in.

Our health care system is immoral and inefficient, and it is costing lives. No one should be able to make a profit off of denying people health care. I'm fighting for #MedicareForAll for families like Jenny's.
We can beat Donald Trump—and when the dust settles, I'll fight like hell to make this a country that works for everyone. Watch our new Nevada ad in Spanish.
We must end this cruelty. I’ll reverse this bigoted, xenophobic ban on my first day in office.
Thank you, @RaquelWillis_! I don’t take this endorsement lightly, and I’m committed to continue reaching out, listening, and learning from you.
Thank you for your endorsement and for volunteering with this campaign, @HMcGhee. This is how we build big, structural change—together!
Thank you @PfPicardi. I know that together, we’ll be able to root out corruption in Washington and make our government work for the people.

I'm deeply grateful for @UniteHere11's endorsement. They're on the front lines of the fights for better wages, benefits, and dignity on the job—including when they won their historic contract with Sodexo. I'm proudly fighting by their side.

Trump's "peace plan" is a rubber stamp for annexation and offers no chance for a real Palestinian state. Releasing a plan without negotiating with Palestinians isn't diplomacy, it's a sham. I will oppose unilateral annexation in any form—and reverse any policy that supports it.
I couldn't do this without my family by my side. Check out our new Iowa ad!

I’m proud to endorse @JosePGarza, an experienced public servant with a proven track record of standing up for working families. With him as Travis County District Attorney, we'll gain another champion in the fight to transform our criminal justice system.

As an educator and former school board leader, @CandaceFor24 knows firsthand the struggles that working families face. I know she’ll be an unwavering force in Congress that will fight tirelessly for them, both at home and in Washington—and I'm excited to endorse her!

.@MondaireJones knows that we’re in a fight to put power in the hands of working families. With him in Congress, we’ll gain another chance to build the big, structural change our country needs. I’m proud to endorse him!

.@KimFoxxForSA is a seasoned advocate and a champion invested in rethinking the county’s approach to criminal justice reform. I’m confident that when reelected, she'll continue to be an effective public servant who leads with compassion, and I'm proud to endorse her!
When we prepare and collaborate to fight common threats, we can stop these diseases in their tracks.

Trump's "peace plan" is a rubber stamp for annexation and offers no chance for a real Palestinian state. Releasing a plan without negotiating with Palestinians isn't diplomacy, it's a sham. I will oppose unilateral annexation in any form—and reverse any policy that supports it.
I couldn't do this without my family by my side. Check out our new Iowa ad!

I’m proud to endorse @JosePGarza, an experienced public servant with a proven track record of standing up for working families. With him as Travis County District Attorney, we'll gain another champion in the fight to transform our criminal justice system.

As an educator and former school board leader, @CandaceFor24 knows firsthand the struggles that working families face. I know she’ll be an unwavering force in Congress that will fight tirelessly for them, both at home and in Washington—and I'm excited to endorse her!

.@MondaireJones knows that we’re in a fight to put power in the hands of working families. With him in Congress, we’ll gain another chance to build the big, structural change our country needs. I’m proud to endorse him!

.@KimFoxxForSA is a seasoned advocate and a champion invested in rethinking the county’s approach to criminal justice reform. I’m confident that when reelected, she'll continue to be an effective public servant who leads with compassion, and I'm proud to endorse her!
When we prepare and collaborate to fight common threats, we can stop these diseases in their tracks.

Diseases like coronavirus remind us why we need robust institutions and investments in public health, and a government that is ready to respond at any moment. That means using science-based policy and confronting climate change, which will affect how diseases emerge and spread.

It's time to invest in keeping Americans safe and healthy. That’s why I have a plan to prevent and prepare for outbreaks, contain them if they do break out, and push for medical advances to treat emerging infectious diseases.

Donald Trump has deprioritized global health security, repeatedly tried to nickel and dime key federal programs, refused to confront climate change, and done almost nothing in response to natural disasters that could cause serious outbreaks, like the hurricanes in Puerto Rico.

To effectively beat infectious diseases like coronavirus, we need all hands on deck. But like so much else, Trump’s approach to keeping us safe from disease outbreaks is a mess. When he's gone, we must fix the damage he's done—and I've got a plan for that.

Are we going to give in to the fear, or are we going to fight back? I'm ready to fight back.

Fighting back is an act of patriotism.

Try as they might, the White House should know that the evidence against Donald Trump will not be hidden forever. On day one as president, I will order the release of every document related to this impeachment inquiry. The American people deserve to know the truth.

The Muslim Ban has separated families and torn apart communities. Citizens and students are being harassed and humiliated at our borders. We must end this cruelty—I’ll reverse this bigoted, xenophobic ban on my first day in office.

This is not a time for small ideas. This is not a time to nibble around the edges of the real problems that we face. We need big, structural change—and we're building the grassroots movement to fight for it. Thank you Cedar Rapids for joining me and @jvn last night!

Donald Trump grew up rich and spent his career getting richer off the backs of others.

I grew up in Oklahoma, on the ragged edge of the middle class, and I'm fighting to make sure all families have the chance to thrive.

Watch our new Iowa ad, narrated by @rgay.

Even with scholarships, even with a bit of savings, Carolyn still had to take out loans to afford to go to college. She wants her son to have a better future, free from debt. That's why I've got a plan for universal free two- and four-year public college and technical school.

This is simply another way for the Trump administration to attack immigrants, particularly those with disabilities. Families shouldn't be forced to choose between staying in our country and basic health care and housing. I'll overturn this rule as president.
I'm so grateful for these endorsements. This is how we're going to make big, structural, progressive change, and build a movement that will defeat Donald Trump.
We can‘t ask our military to solve problems that can’t be solved militarily. It's time to end these endless wars and bring our troops home.

The president’s obstruction is unprecedented. Nixon staff testified and documents were turned over. Yet Trump has at every turn blocked witnesses and defied subpoenas for documents. If his obstruction stands, Congress will be forever weakened. The Senate must act.

On the 75th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz, #WeRemember the millions of victims of the Holocaust. We must recognize the horrors of the past so we can never repeat them in the future, and fight bigotry and hate at every turn. #HolocaustMemorialDay
Women candidates have been outperforming men candidates in competitive elections since Donald Trump was elected. Women win.

Republicans can't say there is no direct evidence of what the president's done while there is somebody out there saying: "I have the direct evidence." We need a real trial, with witnesses and documents.

It’s hard to save enough for a decent retirement, and it’s only getting harder. That's why I've got a plan to increase Social Security benefits by $200 a month—the biggest increase in nearly half a century—so seniors like Michael can retire with dignity and live independently.

Bruce and I are heartsick for Vanessa Bryant, the entire Bryant family, and the family and friends of those killed in the crash. We grieve with you. America, hold your children close and tell your loved ones how much you care.

My determination to lead a movement has been forged by the thousands of people from Des Moines, Iowa, and across the country who are ready to fight for the country they know we can be. I'll fight to build an America of our best values—one that works for everyone.

It’s hard to save enough for a decent retirement, and it’s only getting harder. That's why I've got a plan to increase Social Security benefits by $200 a month—the biggest increase in nearly half a century—so seniors like Michael can retire with dignity and live independently.

Bruce and I are heartsick for Vanessa Bryant, the entire Bryant family, and the family and friends of those killed in the crash. We grieve with you. America, hold your children close and tell your loved ones how much you care.

My determination to lead a movement has been forged by the thousands of people from Des Moines, Iowa, and across the country who are ready to fight for the country they know we can be. I'll fight to build an America of our best values—one that works for everyone.

If we want to end this crisis for good, we need universal free public two- and four-year college and technical school. Everyone should have the opportunity to get an affordable higher education—and I've got the plan for that.

The student loan debt crisis didn't happen by accident. States invested less in public college students and shifted the burden onto them and their families. So while I paid $50 a semester, today's students are graduating with thousands of dollars of debt.

States should focus on funding public schools, not private ones—especially not ones that maintain anti-LGBTQ+ policies. We must ensure every kid—especially LGBTQ+ kids—can get a high-quality public education.
I want every little girl to grow up knowing that when they fight from the heart, they can win—and we pinky promise so they won’t forget.
Thank you, @DMRegister, for your endorsement! Iowans are ready to make big, structural change—and I’m going to fight my heart out for everyone in Iowa and across the country.

My promise to Jennifer, to Iowans, and to everyone in this country is this: I’ll fight for you as hard as I fight for my family. 

From immigration to health care to climate change and beyond, Americans are ready for big, structural change—and I’m in this fight all the way.

All the president’s lawyers have done today is make the case for documents and witnesses. If Trump didn't do anything wrong when he withheld aid for personal, political reasons—well, release the documents and prove it to us. They won’t, because what Trump did was illegal.
It’s true!

My daddy couldn't work for awhile after his heart attack. We lost the station wagon and nearly lost the house. But my mom got a minimum wage job that saved our home.

Today, a minimum wage job can't keep a mom and a baby out of poverty.

It's time to raise the minimum wage.

Every day, doctors see firsthand what our broken system does to patients who skip prescriptions, treatments, and tests due to cost. This week, thousands of doctors came out in support of fixing that system for good and I’m grateful to have them in this fight for #MedicareForAll.
Happy Lunar New Year to all those around the world celebrating! Bruce and I wish you a joyous holiday spent with family and friends, and warmest wishes for health and success in the new year.

Health care workers do so much to care for their communities. They need and deserve fair wages, benefits, and safe staffing levels. I support the workers of @SEIU1199NW—and my team will be standing with you at all seven strike locations next week.
Thank you, @BioProfessorMom. I’m proud to fight alongside you to make sure our economy works for all of us.
Thanks, @JBrostoff! LFG!

David is a fifth-generation farmer—and he hopes that his two daughters have the opportunity to carry on farming. But if there's going to be a sixth generation of Rosmann farmers, we need to level the playing field for family farms in Iowa and across the country.

Trump provoked a conflict with Iran, then concealed and diminished the injuries our troops suffered as a result. It's appalling. I worked in the Senate to improve treatment of traumatic brain injuries—and as president I'll end the wars that cause them.

Abortion rights are human rights.
Abortion rights are economic rights.
We will never stop fighting to defend those rights.

Being a working mom was hard, and it was child care that nearly brought me down. Today, it's holding back families like Amber's. Every family should have access to high-quality, affordable child care—and we can pay for it with my #WealthTax.

The UN’s ruling in favor of protecting the Rohingya is an important step forward in accountability and protecting the human rights of Muslim populations around the world. We can’t be silent in the face of the atrocities the Rohingya have faced.

Republicans and the White House have made it clear that they don't want the American people to know what happened. When I'm president, I'll order the release of every document related to the impeachment inquiry that they've been hiding so the American people know the full truth.

Even more disturbing, damning evidence that Donald Trump undermined our diplomatic relationships, our committed public servants, and our national security for his own personal, political gain. This is exactly why we need a real trial, with witnesses and documents.

My fight for social, racial, and economic justice is rooted in my faith. Faith doesn't just call on us to think good thoughts—it calls on us to act. Today, I'm proud to introduce my Interfaith Advisory Council—principled faith leaders who know our fight is a righteous struggle.
Yesterday, our grassroots campaign surpassed three million grassroots donations. I’m deeply grateful for your support: This is what your contributions are building.
Three million double-woohoo thank yous, Team Warren! You make our campaign possible.

I believe in the rule of law. The United States must be a country where the rule of law means something. If we don't re-establish the rule of law in this country, every future administration will think they can act illegally without facing any consequences.

The White House and the Republicans have made clear that they don't want the American people to know what happened. So they're not letting any of the documents out and they aren’t allowing any witnesses. But they should know this evidence won’t be hidden forever.

On day one as president, I will order the release of every document related to this impeachment inquiry that the administration has been hiding. The public needs to know what happened. All the other candidates for president should commit to take this step as well.
I'll be on @CBSThisMorning soon to talk about the impeachment trial and how we'll hold Donald Trump accountable.

Thousands of lives were lost in the aftermath of Hurricane Maria, while unused aid remained in a warehouse under the government's watch. That's corruption—plain and simple. I stand with the people of Puerto Rico as they demand accountability from their government.

Impeachment managers laid out a clear case describing how Donald Trump solicited a bribe from President Zelensky when he pressured him to open investigations into a political opponent. If any other official did that, they would be in jail. This is a criminal presidency.
Trump has sought foreign interference at least twice to help him in elections. He’s a repeat offender—and if Senate Republicans protect him now, they are giving him a green light to do it again.

John Stumpf oversaw a scam that hurt hundreds of thousands of customers and cost workers their jobs. It's not accountability for him to give back a fraction of the millions he made. As I've said, he should be criminally investigated—and put in jail if the facts justify it.

Toxic “forever chemicals” like PFAS should not be in our water. My administration will fully enforce safe drinking water standards and aggressively regulate chemicals in our water supply—including by designating PFAS as the hazardous substance that it is.

I knew that I wanted to be a teacher—and it was my second grade teacher who made me believe that I could. #PublicSchoolMadeMe who I am today, and I'll fight for our public schools, our teachers, and our students.

The conditions in Parchman are dangerous and inhumane, and we are seeing the deadly consequences. As we fight to end mass incarceration, our government needs to meet basic human rights standards for the people under its care. #MSPrisonReformNow

Construction workers building our cities deserve justice and fair wages. As a former @UHouston law professor, I stand with @WorkersDefense members fighting for justice and dignity as they call on @UHPres to ensure workers are paid what they’re owed.
Thank you, @SDNYC! I’m proud to fight alongside you so every LGBTQ+ American has the opportunity to thrive.

The Bolsonaro government is pursuing state retaliation against Glenn Greenwald because of his work as a journalist to expose public abuse and corruption. Brazil should drop the charges immediately and stop its attacks on a free and open press.

Mitch McConnell took an oath to uphold the Constitution. No one is above the law. That includes the president of the United States. I’m in the Senate, ready to uphold my sworn duty to the American people. Republicans should do the same.
I'm grateful down to my toes for each of these endorsements. I promise to fight shoulder-to-shoulder with you all for the big, structural change we need so everyone has the opportunity to succeed.

When a public school teacher from Des Moines, Iowa asked me about the greatest threat facing our nation, I said climate change. We've got to fight this climate crisis, because that is how we will keep America safe.

Donald Trump has done serious damage to our government. As president, I’ll move swiftly to appoint new personnel who will undo his disastrous policies—and I'll adopt the strictest anti-corruption hiring rules of any administration in American history.

The president of the United States has abused our government for his own personal, political gain. It's corruption, plain and simple.

We have a moment now to root out corruption and make sure government works for everyone—not just Donald Trump and his rich cronies.
I'll be on @Maddow shortly to discuss the impeachment trial and how I'm fighting to root out corruption in Washington.

Planned Parenthood fights every day to ensure people get the reproductive health care they need. That’s why I was proud to join @PPact in Iowa for a fireside chat, and why I stand with them to protect the important health services they provide.

I lived in an America where abortions were illegal. If you had the means, you still had access to safe abortions. It was the most marginalized and vulnerable people who did not. We can never go back to that time. #7in10ForRoe

Thank you @foe_us for your leadership. I'm proud to take this pledge. We've got to make sure our government and our economy work for our family farmers, farmworkers, and food chain workers—not just Big Ag and giant corporations.

Immigration and law enforcement should be kept separate. Combining them only sows distrust and harms public safety. I stand with @ArribaLasVegas and @MALDEF. Las Vegas must honor its pledge to stop unconstitutionally detaining immigrants.

This bill is a huge step forward. State employees work hard to serve and support Colorado families—they deserve the same in return. I stand with @CoWINSpolitics in the fight for collective bargaining rights. It's time to rewrite the rules to strengthen the voices of workers.

We need to make sure our government and our economy work for all of us, not just the wealthy and well-connected. There are nearly 140 million poor and low-income people living in this country—almost half of our population. This is the central question of our election.

Black and Brown women are leading the charge to protect reproductive rights—yet they face significant barriers accessing abortion care. My administration will empower their leadership and fight against the decades of systematic racism that has led to this point. #RoeVWade

If Michael Bloomberg wants to be the Democratic nominee, he should let reporters do their jobs and report on him, and everyone else, as they see fit. And he should divest from Bloomberg News so there’s no question about his influence over news coverage of presidential candidates.

I’ve taken more than a thousand unfiltered questions from the press and from voters since I got in the race. I welcome tough questions and scrutiny because the free press is a cornerstone of our democracy—and every presidential candidate should be closely vetted.

Bloomberg News banned its reporters from investigating Democratic candidates as Mike Bloomberg runs for president. This ban puts reporters in an impossible situation and undermines a free press. Bloomberg should lift the ban and divest from Bloomberg News.

After Ebola, Congress invested to prevent pandemics like coronavirus. Donald Trump tried to cut that funding. As president, I’ll fully fund global health security, research on medical countermeasures, and public health capacity at home to keep us safe and healthy.

There are 40 million people locked in poverty in our country. Yet, we've barely been asked any questions on poverty in the seven Democratic debates we've had so far. I agree with @RevDrBarber and @UniteThePoor. We need a #PovertyDebateNow.

Reproductive rights are human rights.

Reproductive rights are economic rights.

And I will fight to protect those rights.

Trump's spent his entire presidency attacking every lifeline we have for struggling families. Democrats will win by not just defending these benefits, but by fighting for progressive expansion of Social Security, Medicare, and Medicaid. See my plans:
Thank you @Jamie_Raskin. Together, we'll sweep out the corruption of the Trump administration and make our government work for the people.

Trump's spent his entire presidency attacking every lifeline we have for struggling families. Democrats will win by not just defending these benefits, but by fighting for progressive expansion of Social Security, Medicare, and Medicaid. See my plans:
Thank you @Jamie_Raskin. Together, we'll sweep out the corruption of the Trump administration and make our government work for the people.

47 years ago today, #RoeVWade established the constitutional right to abortion. But right-wing ideologues are trying to turn back the clock. I've got a plan to protect our rights and ensure real access to birth control and abortion for all. #7in10ForRoe

Trump has appointed people who are actively hostile to the mission of their government agencies—like Betsy DeVos, who doesn't believe in public education. I'll appoint a Secretary of Education who has been a public school teacher and believes in our public schools.
We're in a climate crisis, whether Donald Trump wants to admit it or not. But after he lined his administration with fossil fuel lobbyists, it comes as no surprise that he is in denial.

My mom got a minimum wage job that saved our home and family. Today, a minimum wage job isn't enough to keep a mom and a baby out of poverty. I'm standing with @RaiseTheWageVA as they fight for a $15/hr minimum wage, because every family should have the opportunity to thrive.

Donald Trump’s presidency has been a dark time—but it won’t end just because he's left office. Rooting out corruption and incompetence, rebuilding our government, and ensuring it will work for the people will require painstaking work. I've got a serious plan to get it done.

Our government officials can best serve the American public when they reflect the diversity of the country itself. That's why I'll build a Cabinet and senior leadership team that reflects the full diversity of America.

Under the Trump administration, we've seen appointees who are actively hostile to the missions of their agencies, like Secretary Betsy DeVos, who doesn’t believe in public education. As president, I'll appoint people who want to fulfill their agency's mission, not undermine it.

I'll move swiftly to appoint new personnel who will undo the Trump administration's disastrous policies. I'll adopt the strictest anti-corruption hiring rules of any administration in American history.

I will also direct the Justice Department to establish an independent task force to investigate violations of specific anti-corruption and public integrity laws during the Trump administration, with independent authority to pursue any substantiated violations.

On day one of my presidency, I will take aggressive steps to root out the corruption and incompetence of the Trump administration, starting by removing all political appointees, except those necessary to preserve continuity and protect national security.

I know how to get our government working for the people because I’ve done it before. In 2010 President Obama picked me to get the CFPB up and running. We recruited a mission-driven staff, set up the organization, and it acted swiftly to protect Americans from financial predators.

Donald Trump has done serious damage to our government. He's left key positions unfilled. Of those he has filled, he’s appointed lobbyists, campaign donors, and cronies. His current vindictive actions mean he's likely to do everything he can to undermine the next president.

One year from today, the next president will begin her first full day of work. She’ll inherit a government in crisis, infected by corruption, and will need the expertise and drive to rebuild it and ensure it works for the people. I've got a plan for that.

Shahab Dehghani is an Iranian student with a valid F1 visa, returning to finish his education. CBP already held him overnight. His deportation must be halted, and we must fight the Trump administration's xenophobic policies.

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. awakened the conscience of a nation and challenged us to live up to our highest ideals. So though this is a moment of crisis, I marched with a heart full of hope that together we'll one day achieve the racial, social, and economic justice he dreamed of.

Virginians voted for candidates who support gun violence prevention legislation. The majority of Americans—including a majority of gun owners—support reform too. And they will not be silenced or intimidated. #IStandWithVirginia, and I will fight alongside you to end gun violence.

For-profit detention companies donated generously to Donald Trump, and they've made millions implementing Trump’s cruel immigration policies. It's corruption, pure and simple. I'll fight to permanently ban for-profit prisons and detention centers.

I'm heartsick for Mustafa Kassem and his family. Imprisoned for six years with negligent medical care—while Donald Trump praised the dictator who held him prisoner and refused to hold him accountable. We must stand up for human rights.

I plan to engage communities by showing up, listening, and learning. And part of that is making sure to uplift the voices of my team, so that their lived experiences can help shape our plans and our movement for change.
Today we honor the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., and his fight for social, racial, and economic justice. We honor his struggles and triumphs. We honor his courage and his vision.
So, I guess @AmyKlobuchar and I are now both undefeated in elections and undefeated in New York Times endorsements!
I'm grateful for every single one of these endorsements, and I'll keep fighting so that every family has the opportunity to thrive.
We’re far behind the curve—and families are suffering for it. We need paid family and medical leave for all workers now.

Republicans and the Trump administration are hoping that the Supreme Court will back their extreme plans to limit access to abortion and birth control—which is why I've got a plan to protect both no matter what the Supreme Court does. Enough is enough.

Amazon made over $10 billion in profits but paid $0 in federal income taxes in 2018. That won’t happen when I'm president. Use this calculator to find out how much big corporations would pay when they pay their fair share.

The Trump administration wants to weaken the law that bars American companies from bribing foreign officials. That’s corruption, plain and simple. I have a plan to reform our global financial system—and fight corruption at home and abroad.

It’s hard to be a small business owner, especially when you have to pay much more in taxes than companies like Amazon.

My administration will fight the influence of corporate money to make our government work for the people—not giant corporations.

And we do that by investing in Black Americans and creating opportunity. The fights for social, racial, and economic justice belong to all of us—and when I’m president, that truth will inform our policies and our actions.

For generations, the federal government has prevented African Americans from building wealth and financial security. It's time for our government to acknowledge its actions and step in to make opportunity available for African American communities.

Black Wall Street was defined by the human spirit. So the community was rebuilt relatively quickly, peaking in the 1940s. But it declined in the sixties and seventies because of gentrification and failure to have a systematic mentorship process in place.
In a Warren administration, we will use every tool we have to defeat white nationalist violence and associated acts of terror.

The men responsible for killing hundreds of innocent African Americans committed an act of domestic terrorism, but they were never held accountable. The search for the victims’ mass graves continues to this day, as does the domestic terrorism threat of white nationalism.

While we can never undo this hateful act of domestic terrorism or the pain and suffering it inflicted on the Black community, we all must do our part to dismantle the legacy of systemic racism and oppression that was left in its wake—and that starts with justice and opportunity.
I had the chance to visit the site of the Tulsa Race Massacre—a terrible chapter in our nation's history.

Nearly 100 years ago, mobs of white residents descended on Black Wall Street in Tulsa, Oklahoma, ransacking Black businesses and murdering hundreds of African Americans. The Tulsa Race Massacre was one of the worst incidents of racist violence in our nation's history.

What gets you in this fight?

I want to hear from you—because I’m fighting for you as hard as I fight for my own family. Chip in $3 or whatever you can right now, and I could call you soon to say thank you. 

We can only do this together.

2020 is our chance to stand up to Big Money and make our government work for working people. In Newton, Iowa, @Deb4CongressNM and I spoke with voters about how a Warren administration will do just that.
Let’s be clear: Our government should make health policy based on what’s good for the American people, not what’s good for Donald Trump.
The Trump administration's cruelty knows no limits. In a Warren administration, we’ll treat immigrants and refugees with dignity and respect.

Early voting started yesterday in Minnesota, and Jared and Davis camped out in the cold to cast the first votes in the state for me! It’s an honor that makes me feel deeply humbled and grateful. Of course, I had to call them to say thank you!
I stand in solidarity with everyone marching across the country today—from Florida to New York to Chicago. Together, we’ll keep fighting for a more equal world.

Our campaign is run by volunteers like Suzanne. Even if you don’t live in Iowa, we’re counting on you. Join our #WarrenRoadWarriors program to help knock doors with @IAForWarren and in other early states:
My plan for disability rights and equality grew from the community, and I'm grateful for the contributions of advocates like @MaysoonZayid. Together, we can build a truly inclusive country!

I’m fighting for families like Carolyn’s in Grinnell, and everywhere in Iowa. Student loan debt is a crisis—and it’s why I have a plan to start canceling it for millions of Americans on day one.

What you could you do if you weren’t crushed by student loan debt?

White supremacists and people with hateful ideologies of all kinds feel empowered and protected by Donald Trump. This has to stop. In a Warren administration, we’ll use the full force of the Justice Department to fight this head on.

The Iowa caucuses are on February 3—and I can’t wait.

As the people of Iowa get ready to make their voices heard, follow @IAForWarren to stay up to date on the latest news from our team on the ground in Iowa.

Thank you, Scott! I’m grateful for your support.

A Warren administration will never suck up to those who want to take power away from working people. I’ve led the effort to end anti-worker right-to-work laws, and as president, I’ll make it easier to join a union.
I’m about to return this survey to the National Right to Work Committee.

Decades of institutionalized racism have targeted Black and Brown communities and destroyed their families. To face our mass incarceration problem, we need to prioritize rehabilitation and tackle the problem at its roots.
Our broken capital punishment system has decided the fate of too many people, especially people of color. We must end the death penalty in America for good.

Not only are Barclays bankers flat-out wrong about my #WealthTax—they’re scared. The wealthy and the well-connected are terrified of losing their power and profits, but it’s time to put power where it belongs: In the hands of working people.

Student loan debt is a crisis—and it's only growing larger. This is crushing an entire generation and holding back our economy. That's why I will act on day one of my presidency to start cancelling student debt and getting relief to families.
I was born and raised in Oklahoma, on the ragged edge of the middle class. I never imagined I'd be back home as a candidate for president of the United States.

Our best moments as a country are when we see a challenge clearly and mobilize to meet it head on.

When we imagine a better world and fight for it with everything we have.

If you've been waiting for your moment to get in this fight—this is it.

We need all hands on deck to knock doors, make phone calls, and talk to your neighbors about their plan to caucus. Text GOTC to 24477 to get started.
Here's my promise to you: I'll fight for your family just as hard as I fight for my own.

Fear doesn't win. 

Courage, vision, and hope win.

Florida voted to restore voting rights for 1.4 million of their fellow citizens—and Republicans are doing everything they can to undermine the will of the people. We must fight this voter suppression—in Florida, and nationwide.
I've got three older brothers—John, David, and Don Reed. Two of them are Republicans, but we are united in our common values: Fighting for our families and our communities.
This is corruption, plain and simple. And we must root it out.

The warning signs are clear. We must take bold action now—or we will continue to break temperature records year after year.
If we want to protect access to abortion, birth control, and reproductive health care, we must elect candidates up and down the ballot who will protect our rights. I'm proud to stand with @PPact.
I’m proud to be in this fight alongside @JulianCastro. Together, we’re going to build the movement for big, structural change.

The Department of Education is sitting on evidence of massive racial disparities in student debt. My administration would start canceling student loans on day one—and open a civil rights investigation into racial disparities in student debt.

Grateful for every single person’s endorsement. Your leadership during these dark times gives me hope. 

My promise to you is this: I will continue learning and listening to the community, and I’m in this fight with you all the way.

The president not only undermined our diplomatic relationships for his own personal, political gain—he also broke the law. He must be held accountable or he will continue breaking the law and putting the country at risk.

The people of Puerto Rico have shown incredible strength and resilience in the face of multiple disasters, and we cannot forget or ignore their suffering. I'll fight to ensure they get the aid and resources they need to recover.

And as we fight the climate crisis, I will make environmental justice a core part of our fight, ensuring that communities in Puerto Rico on the front lines of this crisis receive the pre-disaster mitigation and post-disaster aid they need and deserve.
I've got a plan to provide comprehensive debt relief to Puerto Rico, which will help rebuild Puerto Rico's infrastructure after these devastating natural disasters.

Donald Trump’s cruel indifference to Puerto Rico's suffering is only a small part of the problem. Puerto Rico is dealing with a debt crisis, fueled in part by Wall Street firms that are using their desperation as just another opportunity to make a profit.
The Trump administration, meanwhile, has been sitting on billions of dollars of disaster aid that Congress appropriated to provide Puerto Rico with relief.
Puerto Rico was on its way to recovering from multiple devastating hurricanes—and these earthquakes are only compounding the damage to local infrastructure.

The last few weeks have been terrifying for the people of Puerto Rico. Hundreds of earthquakes have struck the area, some of which have caused devastating damage. Homes have been destroyed—or are so unstable that families are afraid to sleep inside.

Lev Parnas's interview on @maddow tonight is damning. He's an associate of Trump's personal lawyer, Rudy Giuliani, and implicated Trump in a criminal extortion scheme. How can any Senator argue that we don't need a real trial, with witnesses and documents?
Despite the challenges we face, I left the #DemDebate stage with a heart full of hope. This is our moment to fight for big, structural change, and we will build it together.

Workers have been striking against Asarco's abusive labor practices for over four months. Some are taking temporary jobs to make ends meet, while Asarco rakes in profits. I stand with @Teamsters, @steelworkers, and the other unions in their fight for fair wages.

After women took back the Virginia General Assembly, Virginia finally passed the Equal Rights Amendment, becoming the final state needed for ratification! Congratulations to all of the incredible women who led this charge.
Thank you @Sally_Field! I'm so grateful to have you in this fight. Together, we're going to build the big, structural change our country desperately needs.
I stand with the people of Puerto Rico. Trump should release the full amount of natural disaster aid that Congress appropriated. Lives are at stake.

Imagine a country where the decisions made in Washington aren’t simply bought and paid for by lobbyists and big donors. 

Imagine a country where the fossil fuel industry and the NRA don’t have a death grip on Congress.

We have to root out Washington corruption.
The warning signs are clear. We must take bold action now—or we will continue to break temperature records year after year.
If we want to protect access to abortion, birth control, and reproductive health care, we must elect candidates up and down the ballot who will protect our rights. I'm proud to stand with @PPact.
I’m proud to be in this fight alongside @JulianCastro. Together, we’re going to build the movement for big, structural change.

The Department of Education is sitting on evidence of massive racial disparities in student debt. My administration would start canceling student loans on day one—and open a civil rights investigation into racial disparities in student debt.

Grateful for every single person’s endorsement. Your leadership during these dark times gives me hope. 

My promise to you is this: I will continue learning and listening to the community, and I’m in this fight with you all the way.

The president not only undermined our diplomatic relationships for his own personal, political gain—he also broke the law. He must be held accountable or he will continue breaking the law and putting the country at risk.

The people of Puerto Rico have shown incredible strength and resilience in the face of multiple disasters, and we cannot forget or ignore their suffering. I'll fight to ensure they get the aid and resources they need to recover.

And as we fight the climate crisis, I will make environmental justice a core part of our fight, ensuring that communities in Puerto Rico on the front lines of this crisis receive the pre-disaster mitigation and post-disaster aid they need and deserve.
I've got a plan to provide comprehensive debt relief to Puerto Rico, which will help rebuild Puerto Rico's infrastructure after these devastating natural disasters.

Donald Trump’s cruel indifference to Puerto Rico's suffering is only a small part of the problem. Puerto Rico is dealing with a debt crisis, fueled in part by Wall Street firms that are using their desperation as just another opportunity to make a profit.
The Trump administration, meanwhile, has been sitting on billions of dollars of disaster aid that Congress appropriated to provide Puerto Rico with relief.
Puerto Rico was on its way to recovering from multiple devastating hurricanes—and these earthquakes are only compounding the damage to local infrastructure.

The last few weeks have been terrifying for the people of Puerto Rico. Hundreds of earthquakes have struck the area, some of which have caused devastating damage. Homes have been destroyed—or are so unstable that families are afraid to sleep inside.

Lev Parnas's interview on @maddow tonight is damning. He's an associate of Trump's personal lawyer, Rudy Giuliani, and implicated Trump in a criminal extortion scheme. How can any Senator argue that we don't need a real trial, with witnesses and documents?
Despite the challenges we face, I left the #DemDebate stage with a heart full of hope. This is our moment to fight for big, structural change, and we will build it together.

Workers have been striking against Asarco's abusive labor practices for over four months. Some are taking temporary jobs to make ends meet, while Asarco rakes in profits. I stand with @Teamsters, @steelworkers, and the other unions in their fight for fair wages.

After women took back the Virginia General Assembly, Virginia finally passed the Equal Rights Amendment, becoming the final state needed for ratification! Congratulations to all of the incredible women who led this charge.
Thank you @Sally_Field! I'm so grateful to have you in this fight. Together, we're going to build the big, structural change our country desperately needs.
I stand with the people of Puerto Rico. Trump should release the full amount of natural disaster aid that Congress appropriated. Lives are at stake.

Imagine a country where the decisions made in Washington aren’t simply bought and paid for by lobbyists and big donors. 

Imagine a country where the fossil fuel industry and the NRA don’t have a death grip on Congress.

We have to root out Washington corruption.

This is corruption, plain and simple. 

We will not defeat the climate crisis if our government agencies are packed with people who have ties to the fossil fuel industry. Fighting corruption must be at the center of our fight against climate change.

These restrictions on the press go against the constitutional right of freedom of the press, and have absolutely nothing to do with ensuring security. The American people need and deserve transparency and accountability during the impeachment trial.

The revelations in these text messages are shocking, and we must get to the bottom of them. I stand with Ambassador Yovanovitch and all of our diplomats, who deserve to be supported and protected by our government—not undermined or threatened.

As @USNavy looks to expand NAS Fallon, it hasn’t meaningfully consulted and worked with the Fallon Paiute-Shoshone Tribe. That’s unacceptable. As president, I’ll seek Tribal Nations’ free, prior, informed consent for decisions affecting their lands.
Student loan debt is widening the racial wealth gap. Enough is enough. #CancelMyDebt

I saw the warning signs of the student loan debt crisis more than a decade ago. Families can't wait any longer for relief. That's why I'll use every tool a president has to start providing relief on day one of my presidency.

Climate change threatens every living thing. On day one, I’ll do everything a president can do all by herself to fight this crisis: Roll back the changes that Trump is putting in place, stop all new drilling and mining on federal lands, and end offshore drilling. #DemDebate

The impeachment trial will show that this is the most corrupt administration of our lives. That’s what lies at the heart of it—Trump putting Trump first. We need to draw that distinction, and show that Democrats are fighting on the side of the people. #DemDebate

Some things are more important than politics. I took an oath to uphold the Constitution. It says that no one is above the law. That includes the president of the United States. We have an impeachment trial, and I will be there because it is my responsibility. #DemDebate
In 2008, people asked if an African American could be elected president of the United States. We said yes, stood behind our candidate—and changed America. #DemDebate

We need a #WealthTax in America. We need to ask giant corporations to pay their fair share. That’s how we build an economy that works for everyone, bring down the national debt, and invest in our kids and our future. #DemDebate

As a young mom, child care would have sunk me if it weren’t for my Aunt Bee. My plan is #UniversalChildCare, paid for with my #WealthTax so we can cover child care for all of our children and provide universal pre-k for every 3 year-old and 4 year-old. #DemDebate

We have to get as much help to as many people as quickly as possible. My #MedicareForAll plan does that without raising taxes on middle-class families by one penny. On day one, I will cut the cost of drugs like insulin and EpiPens that Americans rely on. #DemDebate

We need to start with what's happening in America: People are suffering. 36 million people last year went to the doctor, got a prescription—and couldn't afford to have the prescription filled. Let’s be clear: We need #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate
Keep in mind that the men on this stage have lost ten elections. The only people on this stage who have won every race are the women—Amy and me. #DemDebate

The real danger that we face as Democrats is picking a candidate who can’t pull our party together—or someone who takes big parts of the democratic constituency for granted. We need a candidate who will excite all parts of our party and bring everyone in. #DemDebate

Can a woman beat Donald Trump? Look at the men on the #DemDebate stage tonight. Collectively, they have lost ten elections. The only people on this stage who have won every single election that they’ve been in are the women: @AmyKlobuchar and me. #DemDebate

I led the fight against the trade deals that weren’t in the interest of the American people, American workers, or the environment. We have farmers here in Iowa who are hurting. And they are hurting because of Donald Trump's initiated trade wars. #DemDebate

We need a policy that actually helps our workers and our farmers. The USMCA is a modest improvement. I believe we should accept that relief, try to help the people who need help, and then we get up the next day and fight for a better trade deal. #DemDebate
We need authorization for the use of military force before we take this nation into combat. That is what the Constitution provides, and that is what I will do as Commander-In-Chief. #DemDebate

We have to stop asking our military to solve problems that cannot be solved militarily. We need to work with our allies, and use our economic and diplomatic tools.

We need to get our combat troops out of the Middle East—now. #DemDebate

We have a revolving door in Washington between the defense industry and the Pentagon. That’s corruption⁠—and as president, I’ll block that revolving door and cut our defense budget so the defense industry isn’t calling the shots. #DemDebate

The job of the Commander-in-Chief is to keep America safe. That's about judgment. I've sat on the Senate Armed Services committee, I've worked with our generals, I’ve visited our troops. My 3 brothers were in the military—I know how much military families sacrifice. #DemDebate

I'm fighting so everyone can have the same opportunities I did.

The future of our economy and a generation of student loan borrowers are at risk, and we must use every tool and opportunity we have to help them. We can't let corruption in Washington hold back big, structural change. I’m committed to seeing this fight through—no matter what.
I will also use all the tools available to me to address the racial disparities in higher education, crack down on for-profit institutions, and eliminate predatory lending.
Understand this: The Department of Education has broad authority to end the student loan debt crisis. When I'm president, I plan to use that authority.

I made sure Congress provided $700 million in a relief fund for borrowers who dedicated their lives to public service but missed technical requirements for loan forgiveness, and I fought to cancel loans for 80,000 students who were cheated by Corinthian Colleges.

When I was elected to the Senate, I used every opportunity and tool available to ease the burden of student debt. I fought to lower interest rates, refinance loans, and hold loan servicers and debt collectors accountable for breaking the law and hurting borrowers.

We have a student loan crisis—and we can't afford to wait for Congress to act. I’ve already proposed a student loan debt cancellation plan, and on day one of my presidency, I’ll use existing laws to start providing that debt cancellation immediately.

If the only way to run for president of the United States is either to be a billionaire or to suck up to billionaires, then we're going to have a country that works better for billionaires—and worse for everyone else.

I support the right of the people of Iran to peacefully protest against their corrupt government. But this isn’t about us. We should support them, including by lifting the Muslim Ban—not try to engineer regime change or recklessly risk a war.
We all do better when everyone has the opportunity to fully participate in all aspects of life. Together, we must fight to build a truly inclusive world.

I’m deeply grateful to have the support of the @AFTMass and @BTU66. They’re on the frontlines of making sure our educators have dignity on the job and that every kid can build a better future. I look forward to standing shoulder to shoulder with them in this fight.

Thank you, @CoryBooker. You've always been a powerful voice for justice and equality, and you've made this primary stronger. I know you will continue to be a leader in the fight to defeat Donald Trump and build a stronger future for America.
I'm not afraid to stand up to billionaires and giant corporations because I'm in this fight to build a government and an economy that works for everyone. Check out our new ad in New Hampshire!

Everywhere I go, I hear stories of families like mine—hanging on to their place in the middle class. They're worried about a health crisis, a lost job, losing their house or their car. But they still have hope—and they're ready to fight for the America they know we can be.

We need a government and an economy that works for all of us, not just the wealthy and well-connected. In Marshalltown, Iowa, @JulianCastro and I talked about how we can build a country where every single family has the opportunity to thrive.

We know what's broken in this country, and we know how to fix it. But widely popular policies are stuck. If we want to make big, structural change, we can’t let corruption in Washington hold up the changes we desperately need to make. It’s time to get rid of the filibuster.

Florida teachers are rallying for fair pay and better funding for schools, and they won't be intimidated or undermined. I stand with the teachers—and I'll fight so that teachers get the fair pay and well-funded schools they need and deserve.

All policy issues are disability policy issues.

We are facing a maternal mortality crisis in America. And for Black moms, it's an epidemic. One major reason why? Racism. Let’s be clear: It's time to hold health systems accountable and demand change—because lives depend on it.
Americans in Dover, New Hampshire, and all across the country are ready for big, structural change.

I’m grateful for the opportunity to talk with voters about my plans to defeat the climate crisis in Milford, New Hampshire.

The Iowa caucuses are just 23 days away. If you sign up to make calls to Iowa caucus-goers this weekend, I could give you a call! You can start making calls from anywhere, right now. 

This is how we’re going to do this: Together.
Climate change is the existential crisis we all face. It’s why I’m fighting my heart out for big, structural changes like a #GreenNewDeal and a #BlueNewDeal.

There are still huge problems with our bankruptcy laws today, in large part due to harmful provisions in the 2005 bankruptcy bill. It’s why I have a plan to overhaul consumer bankruptcy rules in this country and restore the middle class.

My response was to study contracts, finance, and—most of all—economic failure, to learn everything I could. And I started a ten-year fight against the banking industry’s efforts to change our bankruptcy laws so they could squeeze everything they could out of working families.

I don’t think my dad ever spoke the word “bankruptcy,” at least not when I was around. He and I were both afraid of falling off the financial cliff. His response was to not talk about money or what might happen if it ran out. He stayed away from sores that hurt. I poked at them.

Everywhere I go, I hear stories of families like mine—hanging on to their place in the middle class. They're worried about a health crisis, a lost job, losing their house or their car. But they still have hope—and they're ready to fight for the America they know we can be.

We need a government and an economy that works for all of us, not just the wealthy and well-connected. In Marshalltown, Iowa, @JulianCastro and I talked about how we can build a country where every single family has the opportunity to thrive.

We know what's broken in this country, and we know how to fix it. But widely popular policies are stuck. If we want to make big, structural change, we can’t let corruption in Washington hold up the changes we desperately need to make. It’s time to get rid of the filibuster.

Florida teachers are rallying for fair pay and better funding for schools, and they won't be intimidated or undermined. I stand with the teachers—and I'll fight so that teachers get the fair pay and well-funded schools they need and deserve.

We are facing a maternal mortality crisis in America. And for Black moms, it's an epidemic. One major reason why? Racism. Let’s be clear: It's time to hold health systems accountable and demand change—because lives depend on it.
Americans in Dover, New Hampshire, and all across the country are ready for big, structural change.

There are still huge problems with our bankruptcy laws today, in large part due to harmful provisions in the 2005 bankruptcy bill. It’s why I have a plan to overhaul consumer bankruptcy rules in this country and restore the middle class.

My response was to study contracts, finance, and—most of all—economic failure, to learn everything I could. And I started a ten-year fight against the banking industry’s efforts to change our bankruptcy laws so they could squeeze everything they could out of working families.

I don’t think my dad ever spoke the word “bankruptcy,” at least not when I was around. He and I were both afraid of falling off the financial cliff. His response was to not talk about money or what might happen if it ran out. He stayed away from sores that hurt. I poked at them.

I spent most of my career studying one simple question: Why do American families go broke? Whenever someone asked my daddy about my bankruptcy research, I noticed that he would look off and say something like “Oh, she’s special, that one,” and then move on to something else.

People with disabilities deserve financial security. My plan increases SSI to the federal poverty line, revises income limits, and ends rules that force people to choose between critical benefits and financial independence, saving, or marrying the person they love. #CripTheVote

I’ll fight to make Election Day a national holiday, require all federal elections to have a minimum of 15 days of early voting, expand voting hours, allow the option to vote with a sworn statement of identity instead of an ID, and offer voting by mail. #CripTheVote

Participating in our democracy should be accessible for all. I’ll ensure polling locations are conveniently located and have accessible ballot machines for people with disabilities. I’ll also research improving voting security and accessibility for everyone. #CripTheVote
Thank you @DisVisibility, @GreggBeratan, and @AndrewPulrang for hosting this chat! I look forward to working with #CripTheVote to build a truly inclusive country.
What are the things that you're fighting for—and how can leaders in government be better listeners? #CripTheVote

Disability will not be an afterthought in my administration—it will be a priority. We all do better when everyone has the opportunity to fully participate in all aspects of life, and together, I know we can realize a truly inclusive world. #CripTheVote

We also have a volunteer working group of leaders in the disability community who help us connect with the larger community. My campaign—and my administration—will always seek the input of the community as we govern. #CripTheVote
We have staff with disabilities across the campaign. Their lived experiences and talents help foster an inclusive and accessible campaign. #CripTheVote

As president, I will fight alongside the disability community for justice across all aspects of life and to fulfill the goals of the ADA—equal opportunity, full participation, independent living, and economic self sufficiency. #CripTheVote

Last week—in collaboration with advocates and thanks to hundreds of emails, letters, and selfie line conversations—I released my plan to protect the rights and equality of people with disabilities:   #CripTheVote

All policy issues are disability policy issues, which is why I’ve approached many of my previous plans with a disability rights lens, from criminal justice reform, to ensuring a high-quality public education for all, to strengthening our democracy. #CripTheVote

From fostering an inclusive economy and ensuring access to affordable, quality health care for everyone to developing new technology and responding to climate change, we must put disability rights front and center. #CripTheVote

People with disabilities are still fighting for economic security, equal opportunity, and inclusion—and if we want to build a country for everyone, we need to work together to combat ableism and build big, structural change. #CripTheVote

The disability community has been fighting for a more just future and a better country for everyone. From the fights to protect the ACA to the stories I’ve heard at town halls and the letters I've been sent, I’ve been so grateful to them for sharing their stories. #CripTheVote

We have campaign staff with disabilities across the campaign and a Director of Disability Outreach to coordinate with the community. From offices to event spaces to selfie lines, we're committed to making our campaign accessible. #CripTheVote

I'm committed to making my campaign inclusive. We spent months listening to and working with a volunteer working group of leaders in the disability community to develop our plan to protect the rights and equality of people with disabilities. #CripTheVote
I look forward to answering your questions at our first-ever #CripTheVote Twitter Town Hall!

I spent most of my career studying why American families go broke. When I saw how the economy was rigged against working families—how the giant banks rigged the bankruptcy system to squeeze struggling families—I decided to get into this fight.
Looking forward to joining the #HotTopics table on @TheView shortly—tune in!

My heart and thoughts are with the people of Puerto Rico today. I know they are resilient and I'll fight to ensure they receive the disaster assistance they need and deserve to recover from these earthquakes.

The fundamental question: Who should our democracy work for—the wealthy and the well-connected, or everyone else? I made the decision to run a grassroots campaign instead of sucking up to billionaires. If you think that's the right way to run, join us:

The banking industry wants you to believe people who file for bankruptcy are reckless or irresponsible. The truth is that they're struggling with rising costs and flat wages. One crisis is enough to send them over the edge. They don’t need shaming. They need relief.
Finally, I'll close the loopholes that allow the wealthy and corporate creditors to abuse the bankruptcy system at the expense of everyone else.

Bankruptcy also doesn’t affect all people equally. Women and people of color are more likely to file for bankruptcy, which is partly a reflection of wealth and income disparities. I'll take additional steps to target specific problems to help eliminate these shameful disparities.
My plan also makes it easier for people to protect their homes and cars in bankruptcy so they can start from a better foundation as they try to rebuild their financial lives.

We have a student loan debt crisis in America in part because our bankruptcy system makes it nearly impossible to get rid of that debt, even when you have nothing left. While I'm fighting to cancel student loan debt, I'll also fight to make that debt dischargeable in bankruptcy.

Bankruptcy law places certain spending limitations on people while they’re in the process of bankruptcy. My plan pares back some of those burdensome limits—like those that prevent families from paying rent—so families have a chance to recover after the bankruptcy process.

My plan starts by making it easier for people being crushed by debt to obtain relief through bankruptcy by streamlining the process, reducing the costs of filing, and giving people more flexibility in bankruptcy to find solutions that match their financial problems.

In 2005, the banking industry pushed through a bill to change our bankruptcy laws so they could squeeze everything they could out of families. The bill hit working families hard and resulted in 250,000 more foreclosures during the financial crisis. It's time for an overhaul.

I spent most of my career studying why American families go broke. What I discovered was that they weren't reckless or irresponsible—they were being squeezed by an economy that forced them to take on more debt, and one bad break sent them tumbling over the edge.

This economy is pushing struggling families to the breaking point, and our bankruptcy laws make it harder for them to get back on their feet. That's not right. I've got a plan to overhaul our consumer bankruptcy rules.

Covered a lot of ground on @LateNightSeth—from our campaign to Kate McKinnon’s impression of me. I also told @SethMeyers I’ll be calling some grassroots donors who donate today to say thank you. Chip in $3 now, and I could call you next!
I'll be on @LateNightSeth on @NBC soon to talk about the big, structural change I'm fighting for. I hope you'll join us!

I just finished speaking with @Maddow about the urgency of our moment. We can make our economy and government actually work for the people—but only if we fight for it. Chip in $3 before tomorrow, and I could give you a call soon to say thanks!
I'll be speaking with @Maddow shortly about how to build a country and an economy that works for everyone—tune in on @MSNBC!

At town halls in Davenport, Iowa, and across the country, people tell me about what's broken—about the things they're afraid of. But in spite of the fear, they have hope that things can change, because they believe in America, and in each other. And I believe, too.
I hate to say “I told you so,” but... I told you so!
Together, we imagined a country where everyone has a fighting chance. Thank you, Dubuque!

If you're ready to knock doors, too, sign up for a canvass training!

Donald Trump is dangerous. He's repeatedly undermined our diplomatic relationships for his own personal, political gain. He’s escalated tensions and driven crises. We cannot allow his reckless actions to drag us back into another war.

The banking industry wants you to believe people who file for bankruptcy are reckless or irresponsible. The truth is that they're struggling with rising costs and flat wages. One crisis is enough to send them over the edge. They don’t need shaming. They need relief.
Finally, I'll close the loopholes that allow the wealthy and corporate creditors to abuse the bankruptcy system at the expense of everyone else.

Bankruptcy also doesn’t affect all people equally. Women and people of color are more likely to file for bankruptcy, which is partly a reflection of wealth and income disparities. I'll take additional steps to target specific problems to help eliminate these shameful disparities.

Right now our government and our economy are working great for the wealthy and well-connected, but not so much for everyone else. Every family should have the opportunity to thrive, and @JulianCastro and I are going to fight for that—together.

Now let’s make sure we value their work! I’ve got a plan to boost wages for women of color and open up new pathways to the leadership positions they deserve.
We have to pick up each other's fights. Because that's how we'll build a better America for our kids and grandkids—by fighting together.

Our achievements weren't born of fear. They were born of boldness and big dreams. Our best moments have been when we see a challenge and mobilize to meet it head-on. In Hanover, New Hampshire, and all across the country, Americans are ready to fight for a brighter future.

Woo-hoo! Glad to see @TeamWarren Okies hard at work in my home state.

As we get closer to voting, having conversations with voters is one of the most important things we can do. The good news is you can start making calls now, from wherever you are!

The problem isn't big government versus small government.

The problem is a government that's been captured by the rich and powerful.

The solution is creating a government that works for everyone—not just the wealthy and well-connected.

New Hampshire's legislature passed a bill to raise the minimum wage—and Gov. Sununu vetoed it.

We need to raise the federal minimum wage so everyone, in every state, has a living wage that can support themselves and their families.

If you can imagine that something better lies on the other side of the chaos and ugliness, you're more than halfway there. First you have to see it. Then we fight for it. 

Between selfies and pinkie promises in Concord, I heard those dreams. Together, we'll build that future.

Just a few hours into the new year, another trans American was killed in a senseless act of gun violence.

Dustin Parker was a father, a husband, and an advocate who looked out for his community. We must fight for justice for him and all trans Americans.

Nobody fighting for climate action should be afraid that they’re going to lose their job. In a Warren administration, I will fight to protect and strengthen workers’ voices, especially those who are holding their employers accountable.

Too many "American" companies have only one real loyalty: The short-term interests of their shareholders. If they can outsource jobs to save a nickel, that’s exactly what they'll do.

We have to defend good American jobs—and I've got a plan for that.

The catastrophic scenes from Australia's wildfires should alarm all of us. Climate change is driving even more dangerous and destructive fires across the world, from California to New South Wales—and we must fight together to defeat this crisis.

The Trump administration is expanding its dangerous and cruel "Remain in Mexico" policy, putting the lives of even more asylum seekers at risk. As president, I'll reverse this policy and ensure that asylum seekers are welcomed.

People with disabilities, like Sarah, are still fighting for economic security, equal opportunity, and inclusion—and I'll be fighting alongside them. Together, we built a plan to fight for justice and inclusion.

Donald Trump is dangerous and reckless. He's escalated crises and betrayed our partners. He's undermined our diplomatic relationships for his own personal, political gain.

We cannot allow him to drag us back into another war. We must speak out.

All three of my brothers served in uniform. I know the sacrifices we ask of them and their families. Trump’s actions put every service member and diplomat in the region at risk. This is a moment for vigilance—for Americans to speak up and speak out. No more Middle East wars.

Donald Trump ripped up an Iran nuclear deal that was working. He’s repeatedly escalated tensions. Now he’s assassinated a senior foreign military official. He’s been marching toward war with Iran since his first days in office—but the American people won’t stand for it.

We’re on the brink of yet another war in the Middle East—one that would be devastating in terms of lives lost and resources wasted. We’re not here by accident. We’re here because a reckless president, his allies, and his administration have spent years pushing us here.

I called Laura, a teacher, to say thank you. We agreed: We need a teacher in the White House! 

I'm so grateful for every single person who chips in to our grassroots campaign. This is how we can win—together.

In 2019, nearly one million donors pitched in to raise more than $71 million for our grassroots movement—with zero closed-door fundraisers. 

I'm so deeply grateful for everyone supporting our campaign. Team Warren is ready to dream big, fight hard, and win!

Soleimani was a murderer, responsible for the deaths of thousands, including hundreds of Americans. But this reckless move escalates the situation with Iran and increases the likelihood of more deaths and new Middle East conflict. Our priority must be to avoid another costly war.

Right now, employers are allowed to pay people with disabilities wages as low as 4¢ per hour. This is shameful. People with disabilities have the same rights to fair wages and economic security as everyone else. I'll fight to end the subminimum wage.
We need to call out the fact that Americans with disabilities are excluded from economic opportunity and denied financial security. I have a plan to fight and change that.

Republicans want to turn back the clock, outlaw abortion, and deny people reproductive health care—and they're hoping the Supreme Court will back their radical play. We need to take back the Senate and pass federal laws protecting our reproductive rights.
Thank you, @JustStimming, for making sure we had those details right. I’m in this fight alongside you all the way!
I’m deeply grateful for all of your work on this plan and for your work on the ground in North Carolina, @SeeMiaRoll. I’m proud to fight alongside you for justice for people with disabilities.

Issues of racism can't just be issues for Black and Brown women—they must be issues for all of us. I talked with @AshantiGholar on @TheBGGuide about the Black-white wealth gap, student debt, and how my plans will build an economy that works for everyone.

Sarah sent me a letter asking me to make sure that people with disabilities like her brother aren't left behind. 

Sarah, here's my promise to you both: I will fight so he can get all the care and services he needs to live a self-determined life in a community that loves him.
I’m proud to fight alongside you—for Xiomara and all our kids. This is how we’re going to win, together!
I’m fighting for @MattBC and @CosetTheTable, and all disabled Americans, because no one should be forced to choose between critical benefits and marrying the person they love.
Thank you for your tireless advocacy and hard work, @ANeeman. I’m grateful to have you on the working group for this plan!

I'll fight to expand and reform Social Security Disability Insurance and Supplemental Security Income to ensure financial security for all. I'm deeply grateful to @JulianCastro for helping shape this conversation—and look forward to working side by side to enact these changes.
Thank you, @RebeccaCokley, for taking my call and helping build this plan. I’m proud to work with you!
Thank you so much for your thoughtful work on this plan and for being a part of @BlackWomxnFor, @VilissaThompson. Intersectionality is how we get this done! I’m proud to fight alongside you.

New technology can foster accessibility for people with disabilities—if it's affordable. My hearing aid law will help bring down costs, and my administration will work to bring down the costs of assistive technologies for everyone who needs them.
Thank you, @MaysoonZayid. Together, we'll fight for economic security, equal opportunity, and inclusion for all.

We all do better when everyone has the opportunity to fully participate in all aspects of life. Together, we can realize a truly inclusive world. Because when we organize together, when we fight together, and when we persist together, we can win.

Finally, we must lead the fight for disability rights worldwide. Under Trump, the U.S. has neglected its responsibility to be a leader in human rights, including disability rights. As president, I'll make disability rights a priority in my foreign policy.

As we transition to #MedicareForAll, I will roll back harmful work requirements, enrollment caps, and Medicaid premiums allowed by the Trump administration—to ensure that Americans with disabilities can get the care they need.

Health care is a human right, but too many people with disabilities face barriers to quality care. We need a system that empowers all people to live full lives and that reflects our values. That system is #MedicareForAll.

As we tackle environmental injustices and climate change, we must put disability rights front and center. That means accessible and green housing and transportation—and inclusive emergency planning, response, and recovery.

For people with disabilities, finding affordable housing can be even more difficult due to limited accessible options and discrimination. My administration will fight to ensure they have a decent, affordable, and safe place to live, and strengthen anti-discrimination protections.

From criminal justice to voting, immigration, and protecting parents with disabilities from discrimination, my administration will safeguard the rights and civil liberties of people with disabilities and work to ensure that our society and democracy are truly inclusive.

Republicans want to turn back the clock, outlaw abortion, and deny people reproductive health care—and they're hoping the Supreme Court will back their radical play. We need to take back the Senate and pass federal laws protecting our reproductive rights.

Finally, we must lead the fight for disability rights worldwide. Under Trump, the U.S. has neglected its responsibility to be a leader in human rights, including disability rights. As president, I'll make disability rights a priority in my foreign policy.
