As we tackle environmental injustices and climate change, we must put disability rights front and center. That means accessible and green housing and transportation—and inclusive emergency planning, response, and recovery.

For people with disabilities, finding affordable housing can be even more difficult due to limited accessible options and discrimination. My administration will fight to ensure they have a decent, affordable, and safe place to live, and strengthen anti-discrimination protections.

From criminal justice to voting, immigration, and protecting parents with disabilities from discrimination, my administration will safeguard the rights and civil liberties of people with disabilities and work to ensure that our society and democracy are truly inclusive.

My administration will work to bring down the costs of assistive technologies that allow people with disabilities to lead fuller lives. We'll also enforce existing anti-discrimination laws and propose new regulations that specifically address discrimination in technology.

New technology has brought many positive changes for people with disabilities—but it can be used in ways that discriminate against them or exclude them from an increasingly digital world. I will fight to ensure that technology is used to advance their interests.

My administration will support children with disabilities, their families, and their educators by providing crucial early interventions and ensuring kids have meaningful access to a high-quality public education. And we'll tackle discriminatory policies and practices head-on.

We must also rewrite the rules of government programs that trap people with disabilities in poverty. No one should be forced to wait months to receive assistance or choose between critical benefits and marrying the person they love. I'll fight to expand and reform these programs.

As president, I'll fight for economic security for people with disabilities by rewriting the rules of the economy to end labor market discrimination and exploitation, and foster inclusivity. That starts with fighting for a $15 minimum wage—and ending the shameful subminimum wage.

Disability activists have organized for years to fight injustice. 2020 marks the 30th anniversary of the ADA, and though we've made significant progress, we still have a lot of ground to cover. In my administration, disability rights and equality will be a top priority.

People with disabilities are still fighting for economic security, equal opportunity, and inclusion—and they’re not fighting alone. As president, I'll partner with the disability community to combat ableism and fight for justice across all aspects of life.

Thank you @JulianCastro for being a powerful voice, for proposing bold and progressive plans, and for using your campaign to help people who need it now. You made this race stronger—and you will continue to be a leader in our party and our country for many years to come.

Americans do big things. That’s who we are. And our best moments as a country have been when we see a challenge clearly and we mobilize to meet it head on. So let's begin this new year with big dreams and bold plans!

What are your aspirations and dreams for 2020? 

If you weren't stretched to make ends meet, who would you be? If you weren't crushed by debt, what would you do? If you lived without worrying if you could afford the health care and prescriptions you need, how could you thrive?

Taking the time to see ourselves and our world better than they are today sparks urgency in our hearts and determination in our minds. As we welcome in 2020, let's take a minute to imagine what our country could look like—what our own lives could look like—in a better future.

As we look ahead to 2020, let's imagine what our country could look like on the other side of the chaos and ugliness of the past three years. That future is possible when we believe in ourselves and in each other—and when we have the courage to fight for it. Happy New Year!

Juliette chipped in to help meet our end-of-quarter goal, so I called her to say thanks! If you chip in $3—or whatever you can—before tonight's deadline, I might call you later, too. Dream big, fight hard, and have a safe and happy New Year!

If I call you on the phone, just call me Elizabeth! I called Keith to say thanks for contributing to this grassroots campaign. And if you chip in $3 (or whatever you can) before tonight's deadline, I could call you next!
Thank you, @AshleyJudd. Together, we can root out the corruption in Washington and make our democracy work for everyone.

Imagine the future America you want to live in. 

That future is possible—and if we dream big and fight hard, we can build it together.

I called @choo_ek to thank her for donating to our grassroots campaign and for being a part of @TeamWarren. We're going to do this—together.

Chip in $3 or whatever you can before tonight's deadline, and I could call you soon!
Woo-hoo! @TeamWarren is still sending out a free sticker to anyone who chips in to our campaign—from now until tonight’s FEC deadline. Chip in $1 or more to claim yours now.

I called Jaylin to say thanks for chipping in to our grassroots campaign and being a part of this fight. Together, we can make big, structural change in 2020. 

Chip in $3—or whatever you can—and I could call you soon!
There’s still time to enter if you haven’t already!

My administration will work to bring down the costs of assistive technologies that allow people with disabilities to lead fuller lives. We'll also enforce existing anti-discrimination laws and propose new regulations that specifically address discrimination in technology.

New technology has brought many positive changes for people with disabilities—but it can be used in ways that discriminate against them or exclude them from an increasingly digital world. I will fight to ensure that technology is used to advance their interests.

My administration will support children with disabilities, their families, and their educators by providing crucial early interventions and ensuring kids have meaningful access to a high-quality public education. And we'll tackle discriminatory policies and practices head-on.

We must also rewrite the rules of government programs that trap people with disabilities in poverty. No one should be forced to wait months to receive assistance or choose between critical benefits and marrying the person they love. I'll fight to expand and reform these programs.

As president, I'll fight for economic security for people with disabilities by rewriting the rules of the economy to end labor market discrimination and exploitation, and foster inclusivity. That starts with fighting for a $15 minimum wage—and ending the shameful subminimum wage.

Disability activists have organized for years to fight injustice. 2020 marks the 30th anniversary of the ADA, and though we've made significant progress, we still have a lot of ground to cover. In my administration, disability rights and equality will be a top priority.

People with disabilities are still fighting for economic security, equal opportunity, and inclusion—and they’re not fighting alone. As president, I'll partner with the disability community to combat ableism and fight for justice across all aspects of life.

Thank you @JulianCastro for being a powerful voice, for proposing bold and progressive plans, and for using your campaign to help people who need it now. You made this race stronger—and you will continue to be a leader in our party and our country for many years to come.

Americans do big things. That’s who we are. And our best moments as a country have been when we see a challenge clearly and we mobilize to meet it head on. So let's begin this new year with big dreams and bold plans!

What are your aspirations and dreams for 2020? 

If you weren't stretched to make ends meet, who would you be? If you weren't crushed by debt, what would you do? If you lived without worrying if you could afford the health care and prescriptions you need, how could you thrive?

Taking the time to see ourselves and our world better than they are today sparks urgency in our hearts and determination in our minds. As we welcome in 2020, let's take a minute to imagine what our country could look like—what our own lives could look like—in a better future.

As we look ahead to 2020, let's imagine what our country could look like on the other side of the chaos and ugliness of the past three years. That future is possible when we believe in ourselves and in each other—and when we have the courage to fight for it. Happy New Year!

Juliette chipped in to help meet our end-of-quarter goal, so I called her to say thanks! If you chip in $3—or whatever you can—before tonight's deadline, I might call you later, too. Dream big, fight hard, and have a safe and happy New Year!

If I call you on the phone, just call me Elizabeth! I called Keith to say thanks for contributing to this grassroots campaign. And if you chip in $3 (or whatever you can) before tonight's deadline, I could call you next!
Thank you, @AshleyJudd. Together, we can root out the corruption in Washington and make our democracy work for everyone.

Imagine the future America you want to live in. 

That future is possible—and if we dream big and fight hard, we can build it together.

In the face of hatred, injustice, and oppression, Black Americans throughout our history have never stopped imagining and fighting for a better tomorrow. Black history—American history—has shown us the way to the America of our highest ideals. #Warren2020

If you can imagine that something better lies on the other side of the chaos and ugliness of the last three years—then you are more than halfway there. 

The first step is to see it. The next step is to fight for it. #Warren2020

There are less than 12 hours until our most important FEC deadline, and our fundraising is still behind last quarter’s.

I’m counting on grassroots supporters like you to help close the gap. Will you contribute $3 now to help meet our $20 million goal?
Our achievements and victories were not born of fear. They were born of boldness and big dreams. #Warren2020
Stay strong out there, Isabella. I know that together, we can elect another wave of progressive women up and down the ballot in 2020 and beyond. Let’s do this!

Our best moments as a country have been when we see a challenge clearly and we mobilize to meet it head on.

Fighting back is an act of patriotism. #Warren2020

Trump’s reckless decisions to walk away from the Iran Deal and now to launch airstrikes in Iraq without Iraqi government consent have brought us closer to war and endangered U.S. troops and diplomats. We should end the forever wars, not start new ones.
Let us begin tomorrow committed to dream big, fight hard, and win. Happy New Year! #Warren2020

I believe that when future generations of Americans look back on this time, they will celebrate us for choosing hope over fear. I believe they will see that we fought to build an America of our best values—an America that works for everyone. #Warren2020
2020 is our fight: Our chance to rewrite the rules of power in our country. Our chance to come together despite our differences and mobilize a movement for change. #Warren2020
We know that the America we imagine together is possible when Americans believe in ourselves and in each other—and when we have the courage to fight for it. #Warren2020
But we know in our hearts that power in America can rest with the people. We can and we must have an economy and a democracy that finally works for everyone. #Warren2020

Those with power dump an endless avalanche of excuses, misdirections, and distractions on the American people. It’s all designed to get us to give up and resign ourselves to the way things are—with them in power and everyone else left behind. #Warren2020
We begin this fight with a hard truth: No one who has power in Washington is going to give it up easily. #Warren2020

If you can imagine all this—if you can imagine that something better lies on the other side of the chaos and ugliness of the last three years—then you are more than halfway there. The first step is to see it. The next step is to fight for it. #Warren2020

Imagine an America where no matter the color of your skin, who you love, how you worship, where you were born, or what zip code you live in, you are safe and your opportunities look pretty much like everyone else’s. #Warren2020
Imagine an America where the lived experience of women is reflected in committee rooms and corner offices, and yes, even at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue. #Warren2020
Imagine an America where more women—women of color, LGBTQ+ women, women with diverse backgrounds—have more power to make the right decisions for our country. #Warren2020
Imagine what’s possible when poor communities and communities of color are no longer dumping grounds for toxic wastes and polluting industries. #Warren2020

Jonathan chipped in $5 to our campaign, so I gave him a call to say thanks! We talked about my plans to root out corruption in Washington and how we can grow our grassroots movement.

Imagine an America where no matter the color of your skin, who you love, how you worship, where you were born, or what zip code you live in, you are safe and your opportunities look pretty much like everyone else’s. #Warren2020
Imagine an America where the lived experience of women is reflected in committee rooms and corner offices, and yes, even at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue. #Warren2020
Imagine an America where more women—women of color, LGBTQ+ women, women with diverse backgrounds—have more power to make the right decisions for our country. #Warren2020
Imagine what’s possible when poor communities and communities of color are no longer dumping grounds for toxic wastes and polluting industries. #Warren2020

While the survival of every living thing on this planet hangs in the balance, while fossil fuel companies still call the shots in Washington, imagine an America that has come together to beat back the climate crisis and embrace a #GreenNewDeal. #Warren2020

Imagine an America where monthly social security checks are big enough to cover the bills and leave a little extra for home repairs or an occasional meal out—or maybe birthday presents for the grandchildren. #Warren2020
Imagine an America where black maternal health is a priority. Imagine an America where, if you get really sick, you can concentrate on getting well—and not worry about bankruptcy. #Warren2020
Imagine an America where #MedicareForAll ensures health care is a basic human right. Imagine an America where you could get your prescriptions filled, without worrying about the cost. #Warren2020
Imagine fleeing violence and oppression and finding an America that matches our best values every day and welcomes asylum seekers and refugees with care and compassion. #Warren2020

Imagine a country where every young adult is treated as so valuable to all of us that technical school, two-year college, or four-year college is tuition-free and ready to welcome every one of them. #Warren2020

Imagine a country where every child is treated as so valuable to all of us that their education is a top priority. Imagine a country where teachers are deeply respected for the work they do—and paid accordingly. #Warren2020

If you were no longer stretched to make ends meet, who would you be? A coach? A volunteer? A parent? And if you could make these changes, what opportunities would it open up, for you? For your children? For your grandchildren? #Warren2020

If you were no longer paying half your income in rent, what could you do? Pay off your credit cards? Put money in a savings account? Get a dog? (That idea came from Bailey—but think about it.) #Warren2020
If you were no longer tied to your job in order to pay off student loan debt, where would you go? Try a different job? Move back to your hometown? Start your own business? #Warren2020

Imagine how you could thrive if America was safe for everyone. If you lived in a community without fear—without fear of oppression, of violence, of anti-semitism, white supremacy, and police brutality—how would you live your life? #Warren2020
Imagine what our country could mean for you. Imagine who you could be if America worked for everyone. #Warren2020
My determination to lead a movement has been forged by the tens of thousands of people who have said they are ready to fight for the country they know we can be. #Warren2020
My will to fight has been strengthened by the people who have whispered their dreams into my ear. #Warren2020
My plans for this country have been influenced by letters pressed into my palm by little girls. #Warren2020
One year into this campaign, you’ve never found me behind closed doors with corporate executives or spending hours on the phone sucking up to rich donors to fund my campaign. #Warren2020

Over the past year I’ve had the chance to shake hands or hug nearly 100,000 people in more than 180 town halls across the country. We have many differences—but we are ready to fight side-by-side for our common aspirations. #Warren2020

Exactly a year ago today, I got in the race for president. And I made the decision to run a campaign straight from the heart. I am deeply grateful that so many of you have put your full hearts into this campaign, as well. #Warren2020
On day one, we will start to make big, structural change to end the rigged economy and to create a new set of rules—rules that give everyone a chance to succeed. #Warren2020
On day one, we will start to make big, structural change to put the people in charge of our democracy—so we hear everyone’s voice and count everyone’s vote. #Warren2020

When I am president, we will attack corruption in Washington head-on. We will attack the concentration of power that makes this government work great for the wealthy and well-connected, and not for much of anyone else. #Warren2020
We come together to imagine this reality because this reality is now within our reach. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where no politician has to kiss the rings of the rich in order to win elected office. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where big drug companies and the insurance industry don’t stand between Americans and the basic health care they need. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where the NRA and gun industry don’t get to put their own profits above the safety of our children. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where private prisons and detention centers don’t exist and no one makes a profit from locking people up. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where the fossil fuel industry doesn’t have a grip on our planet. #Warren2020
Imagine a country where the decisions made in Washington aren’t simply bought and paid for by lobbyists and big donors. #Warren2020
Taking the time to see ourselves and our world better than they are today sparks urgency in our hearts and determination in our minds. #Warren2020
Imagining alone won’t be enough. But imagination is powerful. It forces us to contemplate change in our lives; to begin to expect change. #Warren2020

So, just for a moment, here on the eve of a new year, let us come together to imagine. Imagine what our country will look like—imagine what your own life will look like—when we finally turn this page in our history. #Warren2020

Our greatest achievements were not born of fear. They were born of boldness and big dreams—of our unique ability to imagine a better world so clearly and thoroughly that we fought for it with everything we had, and turned things we could only imagine into reality. #Warren2020

We became the world’s leading industrial producer and simultaneously gave workers the right to join unions and live decent lives. We created breakthroughs in science and technology and connected the world through the internet. We rocketed to the moon. #Warren2020
Americans do big things. That’s who we are. And our best moments as a country have been when we see a challenge clearly and we mobilize to meet it head-on. #Warren2020
We are a nation that fights back. Fighting back is an act of patriotism. #Warren2020

As we turn the page tomorrow—into an election year and a new decade—there is a chill of fear in the air. People are afraid, and the danger they feel is real. Our democracy hangs in the balance. And now it comes to us—now it comes to us to fight back. #Warren2020

House Democrats upheld their sworn duty and impeached the president. Soon, I will return to the Senate to do mine as well. But unless some Senate Republicans choose truth over politics, Donald Trump will be emboldened to try to cheat his way through another election. #Warren2020

In the past 12 months, the president has become bolder with his lies and law-breaking. He tried to squeeze a foreign government to advance his own personal fortunes. Meanwhile, Republicans in Congress have turned into fawning, spineless defenders of his crimes. #Warren2020

In a few hours, the dawn of a new year will break over America, offering us a moment for pause and reflection. It is normally a moment for optimism. But let’s face it—this year in America has been anything but normal. #Warren2020
A year ago today, we launched this campaign for big, structural change. In just a few minutes, I'll be speaking live about the optimism I'll be carrying into 2020. #Warren2020

It's been a year since we launched our campaign and our fight to protect the promise of America—and since then, our fight has only become more important. In 2020, we will dream big, fight hard, and win.

Everyone should be free to worship and celebrate without fear. We have to stand up and fight against hate, bigotry, and anti-Semitic violence—and in a Warren administration, we'll use every tool we have to defeat it.

Call time is a chance for me to talk with grassroots donors and listen to their stories—regardless of how much they were able to give to our campaign.

I’m making more calls tomorrow! Will you chip in $3 now to help reach our end-of-quarter goal?
This Tuesday at 11 AM ET, I'll be speaking in Boston on the one-year anniversary of launching this campaign. Bookmark this page now to watch the speech live tomorrow! #Warren2020
We shouldn't have to live like this. In 2020, we have to fight to put an end to the daily toll of gun violence that is devastating our communities—including mass shootings.

Climate change. Gun violence. Health care. 

We have a lot of good ideas for how to fix these issues, and the majority of Americans are with us. And yet we don't make change. Why? 

Corruption, pure and simple. We've got to root it out—and I've got plans for that.
Here's my advice to young women on running for office: Fight from the heart. That's how you'll be strong, and that’s how you’ll persuade others to join you.

Working families in Des Moines and across the country deserve a fighting chance. That’s why I have a lot of plans—from increasing Social Security benefits to canceling student loan debt—that will help rebuild our middle class and put power in the hands of the people.
I’m sorry I missed you—but thank you for being in this fight!

It's also time to ensure our government works for all of us, not just the wealthy and well-connected. I'll end lobbying as we know it—and I'll shut the revolving door between Wall Street and Washington.

My Real Corporate Profits Tax ensures that very large and profitable companies pay taxes on their reported profits—no loopholes or exemptions. And I'll make it harder for companies to hide their profits in offshore tax havens.

Too many corporations are cashing in on all the benefits of America while skipping out on the bill. Companies that make massive profits shouldn't be paying less in federal income taxes than working families. It's time for them to pay their fair share—and I've got plans for that.
Trump is the most corrupt president in history, and here’s the latest example of how that corruption helps giant corporations at the expense of small businesses and working families.
It’s been a really great year!
Rich people may have a whole lot more of a lot of things. But that doesn’t mean they should own a bigger piece of our democracy.
Fred doesn’t usually answer unknown numbers, but Bruce and I are glad he picked up today! Chip in $3 now and I could call you soon, too!

The FEC deadline is in two days—and my campaign is running short of our $20 million goal.

If enough people on Twitter pitch in tonight, we can close the gap and get back on track. Will you chip in $3 now? We can only make this deadline together.
My heart is with Rep. John Lewis and his family. He’s always been a fighter, and I know he'll continue making good trouble. Stay strong, John.

The richest Americans with the biggest fortunes keep getting richer, and the wealth gap just gets wider and wider. We need a #WealthTax to level the playing field and fund opportunity—to ensure every family has a chance to succeed.
That’s what I like to hear! I can’t wait to meet Tabi today.

I'm heartsick for the victims of this horrific attack. This is unfortunately just the latest of a series of anti-Semitic attacks in New York and New Jersey. We must fight anti-Semitism and make clear that hateful bigotry has no place in our society.
.@JVN and I look forward to meeting you soon!

He’s on vacation, but Logan from Maine still picked up the phone when I called to thank him for being a donor! Logan chipped in $3—and that $3 makes a difference as we work to close our fundraising gap before the FEC deadline.

Will you chip in $3, too?

Moniqua, a small business owner in Georgia, chipped in $20 to our campaign—so I just gave her a call to say thanks! This is how I like to spend call time: On the phone with grassroots donors who make it happen.
 
Chip in $3 now and I could call you soon:
Whenever I meet a little girl, I say: “I’m running for president, because that’s what girls do." And then we make a pinky promise so they’ll remember.
I spend my time thanking grassroots donors, because grassroots donors make growing our campaign possible—and I’ll be calling folks all weekend!
I was grateful to spend time with Rosa yesterday and talk with her about child care workers’ rights. My plans will increase wages for child care workers and make it easier to form a union.

I don’t spend my time at fancy fundraisers asking wealthy donors for donations. With 37 days until the #IAcaucus, I’m spending my time with the people.

Today, I’m thanking grassroots donors for chipping into our campaign. Chip in $3 now—and I could call!
I’m so grateful to have @ZachWahls on @TeamWarren. Zach is a fighter for progressive values and working families, and together we’ll keep dreaming big and fighting hard in Iowa.

Climate change is an existential threat—and we're running out of time.

In 2020, we need to elect a president who will fight this crisis. I'll fight to root out the corruption in Washington, pass a #GreenNewDeal, and create millions of green jobs.

I wouldn’t ask if it weren’t important: Will you chip in $3 now to help hit our campaign’s end-of-quarter fundraising goal?

This is a critical time to invest in Iowa and other states before voting and caucusing start, and we can only do it together!

As a working mom, I went through one child care arrangement after another. I felt like a failure until my Aunt Bee stepped in to help.

Let’s be clear: My plan for #UniversalChildCare will make high-quality child care free for millions of families and affordable for everyone.
We need to call out white supremacy for what it is: Domestic terrorism. In a Warren administration, we will use the Justice Department to end its rise.
Thank you, Bryan, I’m really grateful. We’re in this fight together!
When working people fight, working people win. Let’s do this, @SEIU.

This election isn’t about whether or not we start a fight. 

We’re already in a fight. 

This is about how we win.

A small group of the wealthiest families gobbled up a massive amount of wealth, while the middle class was hollowed out. 

This wasn't an accident.

Here's how my #WealthTax will level the playing field.

Families should be able to get an education without being drowned in debt. They should be able to go to work without child care costs eating up their paychecks. They should be able to get the health care they need without risking bankruptcy.

We need big, structural change.

Keep your phone nearby!

This weekend, I’ll be calling grassroots donors to thank them for chipping in to our campaign. Will you pitch in $3 tonight? I hope we’ll talk soon.

This weekend, I’ll be calling grassroots donors to thank them for chipping in to our campaign. Will you pitch in $3 tonight? I hope we’ll talk soon.

We're closing out the decade with a widening wealth gap and millions of families drowning in debt due to the costs of health care and higher education. 

In 2020, let's fight for big, structural change to build an economy that works for everyone.

If you make it big—and I mean really big, top one‑tenth of one percent big—pitch in a few cents so everyone else gets a chance to make it, too. 

It’s really that simple.
Someone had a bit too much Christmas dinner!
Like I said at the debate, my #WealthTax will boost our economy. And top economists agree with me.

The best way to grow the economy isn't by giving more money to billionaires and corporations already sitting on piles of money, but by helping working families struggling with the costs of health care, child care, housing, and education.
Bruce and I are wishing a very happy Kwanzaa to everyone celebrating this week!

One year ago today, Felipe Gómez Alonzo died in CBP custody. He was just eight years old.

This Christmas, I'm heartsick for all of the families who won't be celebrating together today because of the Trump administration's cruel treatment of immigrants and asylum-seekers.
From our family to yours: Have a very merry Christmas!
Bailey wishes you a very Merry Christmas!
Imagine: Your parents go through all that effort to dress you in your holiday best, take you to see Santa, and all they get is a mildly terrified photo! (I figured it out eventually.)
I stand with Amazon's workers, who are doing back-breaking work this holiday season. Everyone deserves time to spend with their families. And I know that when workers fight together, they can win.
I never thought I’d be back in my high school gym, running for president of the United States. But you know, you don’t get what you don’t fight for.

These are difficult times, and yet my heart is filled with hope. It’s because of the people I meet at town halls in Cedar Rapids and all across the country: They're struggling, they've got challenges, but they still believe in a better America—and they're willing to fight for it.

Our government is working great for the wealthy and well-connected at the expense of everyone else. I’m fighting for big, structural change to make sure it works for families in North Liberty, Iowa, and working families across the country.

Our big FEC deadline is approaching—and tonight, my team will send me a list of new donors so I can check if we’re on track. 

If you haven’t donated to our campaign before, will you chip in $3? We’re in this fight together.
Dennis Muilenburg pressured regulators and put profits ahead of the safety of passengers, pilots, and flight attendants. His firing is welcome news—and long overdue.

We had our Oklahoma City town hall at my former high school—where my high school debate trophy is still on display! Public school made me, and that debate team gave me so many incredible opportunities. I believe in our public schools, and that's why I'm fighting for them.
I never thought I'd be back in my high school—this time as a candidate for president of the United States. But you don't get what you don't fight for!

By the time I graduated high school, my folks couldn't even afford a college application—much less four years of college. High school debate gave me amazing opportunities, and it was great to meet Oklahoma’s state champions!
Oklahoma, it was good to be home!

In Ottumwa, Iowa, I talked about how a free press is a powerfully important part of any democracy. My administration will fight to protect journalists and the First Amendment.
We won’t make any progress on any of the issues we care about until we root out corruption in Washington—and I’ve got a plan for that.

Real freedom isn’t letting big corporations prevent workers from taking a better job.  

Real freedom is a government ban on non-compete clauses so workers can choose the job that’s best for them.

Our country's top turkey companies are getting sued for allegedly conspiring to raise prices. Each of the four major meat industries are now under investigation for price-fixing and collusion. Enough. It’s time to enforce our antitrust laws against Big Ag.
It's great to be back in Oklahoma! Tune in now for a live look at our Oklahoma City town hall.
We need to use every tool we have to combat voter suppression. I'll fight to defend our right to vote and build the grassroots movement to win in 2020.

Targeting families trying to reunite with their children is despicable and cruel. Stephen Miller, Donald Trump, and his administration are willing to go to any lengths to harm vulnerable families—and we’ll fight to hold them accountable.
Bruce and I are wishing a happy Hanukkah to everyone celebrating the Festival of Lights this week. Chag Sameach!
How do we change the perception of a president as a man with a tie? By electing a woman president.

When John F. Kennedy said we would send a man to the moon in under a decade, people said it'd be impossible. But American ingenuity rose to meet the challenge. Today, we face a new challenge—climate change. And American ingenuity can rise again to meet it.

We need a candidate for president who can draw the sharpest distinction with the corruption of the Trump administration. We need to show that we're willing to fight, not just for the wealthy and well-connected, but for everyone else. That’s why I’m in this fight.

The way I see it, this election is about who our government is going to work for—the wealthy and the well-connected, or working families like the ones I met in Burlington, Iowa?

I know which side I'm on. I'm fighting so that our government and our economy work for everyone.
America has a long and proud history of rising to the challenges that have faced this country—and defeating the climate crisis is no exception. #GreenNewDeal

Let’s be clear: Dreamers are #HereToStay despite the Trump administration’s cruelty. From showing up for the #SCOTUS DACA hearings, to my plan to protect immigrants, our campaign stands with Dreamers all the way.

I don't do fancy fundraisers with millionaires and billionaires. Instead, I spend my time grabbing a beer (and an iced tea!) with donors like Mike and Linda, who chipped in a few dollars to my campaign, because I think grassroots donors should be deciding the Democratic nominee.
In some states, creating a shell company to hide your identity is easier than getting a library card. It's time to tackle the global flow of dark money—and I've got a plan for that.

I grew up on the ragged edge of the middle class. My daddy's heart attack nearly sent us hurtling over a financial cliff.

I'm fighting so that our government and our economy works for working families like mine, so they can weather whatever comes their way.

Hateful, bigoted language has violent consequences, and we've seen that in the surge of hate crimes since 2016. I'm heartsick for this teenager and her family, and I’m sending all my thoughts for a speedy recovery.
Another Black trans woman, Yahira Nesby, was killed. This epidemic keeps growing, and we need to use every tool we have to end it.
Atatiana Jefferson should still be alive—but hopefully now she and her family can have some justice. Now it's on us to fight for real reform, including federal standards for the use of force.

Families are struggling. They're working hard—even working multiple jobs—and yet sometimes they're just barely scraping by. It's time to make sure our economy is working for working people—in Keokuk, Iowa, and across the country.

What would it mean to your family if we canceled student loan debt? Raised the minimum wage to $15 an hour? If your Social Security benefits increased $200 a month?

I hear those stories from families in Fort Madison and all across the country—and I'm fighting so they can thrive.

For decades, the horrors of the #TulsaRaceMassacre have been covered up—but they must never be forgotten. I hope these discoveries will bring some healing to Tulsa and the remaining families of the victims.
We’re going to do this—together!
Thank you @Hashmi4Va! I’m so grateful to have you on @TeamWarren.

If we want to make big, structural change, then we need to build a grassroots movement to fight for it. @TheDemocrats are building a team of top notch organizers through @orgcorps2020. If you're ready to join the fight, send in your application:   #OC2020

I make pinky promises with all the girls I meet on the campaign trail so that they'll remember that running for president is what girls do. No matter what issue they care about—their schools, the environment, gun violence—if we fight together, from the heart, we can win.

Efforts to silence @PramilaJayapal are deeply troubling. The U.S. and India have an important partnership—but our partnership can only succeed if it is rooted in honest dialogue and shared respect for religious pluralism, democracy, and human rights.

The #GreenNewDeal isn't just an agenda for reducing carbon emissions and defeating the climate crisis—it's an opportunity to transform our economy and create millions of good, new jobs. American ingenuity can rise to meet this challenge.

The transition to clean energy is an opportunity to transform our economy, creating new industries and greatly expanding others. My administration will create new financing tools to unlock investments to tackle climate change, including a Green Bank and Green Victory Bonds.

As part of my 100% Clean Energy Plan, I'll take action to achieve zero-carbon pollution from all new buildings, and improve the energy efficiency of existing buildings. This will create over 970,000 new jobs.

America’s water infrastructure is crumbling, leaving us vulnerable to climate crises and putting our drinking water at risk. My administration will protect Americans by rebuilding our nation's water infrastructure—and creating about 190,000 good, union jobs.

Transportation is one of the largest sources of U.S. carbon pollution. As we rebuild our crumbling transportation infrastructure, we can create a transportation system powered by electricity rather than fossil fuels, build in climate resiliency, and create about 2.6 million jobs.

The clean energy sector is rapidly expanding—and as part of my 100% Clean Energy Plan, my administration will focus on rebuilding and repowering our energy grid, creating 6.8 million good jobs, while cutting carbon pollution.

To develop the green workforce of the future, we'll invest in expanding job training, and we'll make sure no worker is left behind as we transition to a clean economy. My administration will work hand-in-hand with unions to ensure these jobs have good wages and strong benefits.

I mean it when I say that defeating the climate crisis will be a top priority in my administration. My plans will enact a climate change agenda that not only reduces our carbon emissions, but also jumpstarts our economy and creates millions of new jobs.

When faced with seemingly impossible challenges, American ingenuity has risen to meet them. We can do it again and defeat the climate crisis. The #GreenNewDeal is an opportunity to invest in a green economy and create 10.6 million new jobs.

I’m grateful down to my toes for everyone who tuned into the #DemDebate—and for everyone who pitches in to keep our campaign growing.

Will you join us?

We made the decision many years ago that rich people in smoke-filled rooms wouldn’t pick the next president of the U.S.

People need to believe you're going to stand up to the wealthy and well-connected when you're president—and I intend to keep my promise to the American people.

The Trump administration is trying to throw up every barrier they can to make it harder for people to get the care they need. We have to fight back—and we need to elect a president who will protect the right to an abortion.

I hear those stories from families in Fort Madison and all across the country—and I'm fighting so they can thrive.

Will you join us?

We made the decision many years ago that rich people in smoke-filled rooms wouldn’t pick the next president of the U.S.

People need to believe you're going to stand up to the wealthy and well-connected when you're president—and I intend to keep my promise to the American people.
It’s a very special #DemDebate when I get to have so much of my family here with me.

I’m not working for millionaires and billionaires. I'm here to work for the tens of millions of people across this country who are ready to build an America that doesn’t work just for those at the top—but for everyone.

I am not working for millionaires and billionaires. I'm here to work for the tens of millions of people across this country who are ready to build an America that won't just work for those at the top—but that will work for everyone. #DemDebate

The transgender community has been marginalized in every way possible—and the president can lift up attention, lift up their voices, lift up their lives. I will do everything I can to make sure we are an America that leaves no one behind. #DemDebate

I just stepped off the #DemDebate stage feeling inspired and determined. And I just heard from our team—we’re close to reaching our goal of 1 million grassroots donors.

Will you chip in $3 now to help our campaign get there?

America is ready for a #WealthTax supported by Republicans, Democrats, and independents.

America is ready to expand Social Security payments.

America is ready for a president who won't work for those at the top, but who will work for everyone. #DemDebate

Of my three brothers, one’s a Democrat and two are Republicans. But you know what unites them? They’re furious that Amazon reported record profits and paid $0 in taxes. Americans are ready to root out corruption and fight back. #DemDebate
I want billionaires to pay enough to cover tuition for all of our kids—because that's how we build a future. #DemDebate
I just got off the #DemDebate stage, where I talked about the big, structural change we're going to make in 2020. Now, time to take some selfies!

I met a man last week in Nevada, who said that he has to stretch his one prescription for diabetes between his family. If we get a majority in the House, the Senate, & win the White House, we can make this country work for people like him. That's why I'm in this fight. #DemDebate
I just got off the #DemDebate stage, where I talked about the big, structural change we're going to make in 2020. Now, time to take some selfies!  – at LMU - Gersten Pavilion

Billionaires in wine caves should not pick the next president of the United States. If you can't stand up to the wealthy and well-connected as a candidate, how can the American people believe you’re going to stand up to them when you’re president? #DemDebate

People that can put down $5,000 to have a picture taken don't have the same priorities as people who are struggling with student loan debt or to pay off medical debt.

I won’t let them drown out the voices of everyone else—not in my campaign, not in my White House. #DemDebate
Here’s a promise: I will go to the Rose Garden every year to read the names of transgender people of color who have been killed. #DemDebate

I was a special education teacher. I loved that work, because it was about recognizing the worth of every human being. As president, I will make sure that people with disabilities are treated fairly and paid fairly. That is how we make a better America. #DemDebate
I’d be the youngest woman ever inaugurated. #DemDebate

We need to invest in our future, and the best way to do that is by investing in public education. My #WealthTax gives us enough to pay for #UniversalChildCare, free public college, put a $50 billion investment in our HBCUs, cancel student loan debt, and more. #DemDebate

We have to be an America that understands the difference between our allies and the dictators who would do us harm. And we need to treat our allies better than we treat the dictators. That needs to be our job as America. #DemDebate
Billionaires in wine caves should not pick the next president of the United States. #DemDebate

The transgender community has been marginalized in every way possible—and the president can lift up attention, lift up their voices, lift up their lives. I will do everything I can to make sure we are an America that leaves no one behind. #DemDebate

I just stepped off the #DemDebate stage feeling inspired and determined. And I just heard from our team—we’re close to reaching our goal of 1 million grassroots donors.

America is ready for a #WealthTax supported by Republicans, Democrats, and independents.

America is ready to expand Social Security payments.

America is ready for a president who won't work for those at the top, but who will work for everyone. #DemDebate

Of my three brothers, one’s a Democrat and two are Republicans. But you know what unites them? They’re furious that Amazon reported record profits and paid $0 in taxes. Americans are ready to root out corruption and fight back. #DemDebate
I want billionaires to pay enough to cover tuition for all of our kids—because that's how we build a future. #DemDebate
I just got off the #DemDebate stage, where I talked about the big, structural change we're going to make in 2020. Now, time to take some selfies!

I met a man last week in Nevada, who said that he has to stretch his one prescription for diabetes between his family. If we get a majority in the House, the Senate, & win the White House, we can make this country work for people like him. That's why I'm in this fight. #DemDebate

I won’t let them drown out the voices of everyone else—not in my campaign, not in my White House. #DemDebate
Here’s a promise: I will go to the Rose Garden every year to read the names of transgender people of color who have been killed. #DemDebate

I was a special education teacher. I loved that work, because it was about recognizing the worth of every human being. As president, I will make sure that people with disabilities are treated fairly and paid fairly. That is how we make a better America. #DemDebate
I’d be the youngest woman ever inaugurated. #DemDebate

Donald Trump has spent the last three years retreating further into his own bubble and firing anybody who crosses him. I’m not afraid to call him out.

I've seen firsthand how our middle class was hollowed out while our government and economy were rigged to work for the wealthy and well-connected. I'm fighting for big, structural change so that families in Fairfield, Iowa, and across the country have the opportunity to succeed.

.@Boeing's crisis isn't just about a technical failure—it's about how our government is bending over backwards for giant corporations at the expense of everyone else. It's corruption, plain and simple.

Our government is working great for the wealthy and well-connected—but not so much for everyone else. I'm fighting to get our government working for working people, so families like the ones I met in Ottumwa have a fair shot at the American dream.

Around the world, protestors are rising up against corruption and economic inequality. The United States must stand with them and lead the way to fight financial corruption here at home and around the world.

Financial corruption is a worldwide problem, and my administration will work with our international allies and partners to fight it. We'll expand the technical assistance we offer to our partners. And we'll work together to hold corrupt kleptocrats accountable.

We must overturn Citizens United with a constitutional amendment to end the corruption of our campaigns and elections—but there are also steps we can take now. I'll fight to update campaign finance laws to limit foreign interference and bring dark money into the light.

I’ll work with Congress to enact anti-money laundering reforms and update basic financial integrity requirements. I’ll expand real estate disclosure requirements. I'll strengthen enforcement against financial institutions and clamp down on dark money enablers here in the U.S.

We need a president who will fight back against global financial corruption—and that starts here at home. The United States is at the center of the global financial system and helps to shape international financial rules. We have the leverage to strengthen global transparency.

Rather than fighting for transparency, Donald Trump has spent his career embracing shady deals and exploiting legal loopholes. He’s repeatedly partnered with shady actors on real estate deals that reek of money laundering, corruption, and fraud.

Financial corruption is a threat to our security and our democracy. Illicit networks foster corruption, inequality, and kleptocracy. Dark money bankrolls nuclear proliferation, terrorism, human trafficking, and repressive and hostile regimes.

In some states, creating a shell company to hide your identity is easier than getting a library card. The global flow of dark money is a serious threat—and it's time to root it out. I've got a plan to fight global financial corruption at home and abroad.
This is good news. But we have a lot of work still to do to fight back against measures that criminalize homelessness and ensure every American has a safe, decent, and affordable place to live.

I guess calling up billionaires to ask for giant checks is one way to spend time.

But I’d rather spend my time with people who aren’t scared of big, structural change. Will you chip in $3 to our campaign now? I might call soon to say thanks.
I spend my time with grassroots donors like Mike, because I think grassroots donors should be deciding the Democratic nominee.

You probably paid more federal income taxes in 2018 than companies like Amazon, Chevron, Halliburton, and IBM. That’s corruption—and I’ve got a plan to make giant corporations start paying their fair share.

When billionaires and giant corporations wanted a tax cut, it took Republicans a few weeks to get it done. Our government isn't gridlocked—it's working great for the wealthy and well-connected at the expense of everyone else.

Politicians should be competing over how many voters they can persuade, not how many they can keep from voting. We need to fight back against these attempts to undermine our elections and pass reforms that strengthen our democracy.

We need big, structural change, so every generation has the opportunity to succeed.

Real freedom comes when everyone has the opportunity to prosper.

Young people today are as hardworking as any generation, but opportunity is collapsing around them.

We need big, structural change, so every generation has the opportunity to succeed.

The families I met in Reno are struggling with the costs of housing, health care, and education—but they're ready to fight for the big, structural change we need so they all have the opportunity to thrive.
This is how we’re going to win—together!
Thank you @BJoeWolf. The LGBTQ+ community will always have a home in my White House.

Tom Joyner is leaving @TJMShow with an incredible legacy. But even though he's leaving radio, he's still fighting to support his community and help students go to HBCUs. 

Tom, I'll stand right beside you in this fight!
I'm so grateful to have @mPinoe on @TeamWarren! LFG.
I’m proud to fight shoulder-to-shoulder alongside @Krasner4DA and @WorkingFamilies for criminal justice reform and an economy that works for everyone!

One of Trump's appointees who absolved McDonald's of liability for labor law violations worked at a law firm that McDonald’s hired to counter organizing efforts. This is how our government works great for giant corporations at everyone else's expense.

Politicians are supposed to compete over how many voters they can persuade, not how many they can keep from the polls. My plan to protect and strengthen our democracy will end this racist voter suppression. Enough is enough.

The details of this memo are horrifying. I'll end the unnecessary detainment of immigrants and enforce strict standards for medical care for anyone in our care. The Trump administration must be held accountable for their negligence and cruelty.

The people voted to restore voting rights to 1.4 million of their fellow citizens who had been disenfranchised in Florida. We must keep fighting efforts to silence their voices. Thank you @NikkiFried for standing up to this injustice and fighting for Floridians! #LetUsVoteFL

.@UniteHere11 is fighting for better wages and benefits—and I stand with them. The DNC should find a solution that lives up to our party's commitment to fight for working people. I will not cross the union's picket line even if it means missing the debate.
Thank you, @mPinoe! I'm so grateful to have you on @TeamWarren. I promise to fight shoulder-to-shoulder alongside you for equal pay and the bold, structural change our country needs.

Our problem isn’t big government—our problem is a government that’s been captured by the rich and the powerful. I'm running for president to take on a corrupt system and get our economy working for everyone.

The opioid epidemic is a humanitarian crisis, and we need bold plans to fight it. I've got a plan to ensure that everyone gets the treatment they need—and to fight the greed and corruption that has driven this epidemic.

We’re weeks away from the first caucuses and primaries. If a few more people on Twitter chip in tonight, we’ll be on track to grow our grassroots movement before voting begins.

I’m deeply grateful for any amount you’re able to give.
I'm proud to be fighting shoulder to shoulder alongside @RepSchakowsky for working families in Chicago and all across the United States!
I’m proud to have @Equity_Center’s top rating. I promise to keep fighting for racial and economic justice—and to close the racial wealth gap.
This is an absurd and ridiculous retaliation by ICE. I stand with @MigrantFreedom. Their hotline to provide legal aid to detained immigrants should never have been shut down.

Immigration and law enforcement should be kept separate so that victims and witnesses of crimes feel safe coming forward—combining them only sows distrust and harms public safety. I stand with @voces_milwaukee in their protest today. Immigrants shouldn't fear their local police.
Our government helped create the racial wealth gap—and government should help fix it. This is a moral obligation.

Some people dismiss any investment in middle-class families as “free stuff.” 

You know who's getting free stuff? Amazon, which had $10 billion in profits this year and is paying $0 in federal income taxes.

Working families are paying their fair share—let’s invest in them.

Young people today are as hard-working as any generation, but opportunity is collapsing around them. And if they dare question the corrupt system that has put them in this giant hole, the elites responsible for this mess have the gall to call them lazy and entitled.

Enough.

I don't sell access to my time. I don't do closed-door fundraisers. And I don't ask for a $1,000 contribution for a selfie. If you want to know about a candidate’s commitment to reform, don’t just look at what they say they will do—look at what they’re doing right now.

Wall Street executives and billionaires are spending their time and money attacking me—they believe I'm the biggest threat to a corrupt system that has enriched them at everyone else’s expense. They are right. I do have a plan to make real change.

The thin slice of folks at the top who benefit from our rigged economy push policies that help themselves and push the costs off on everyone else. And they tag any attempt to reform this system as "divisive" and "extreme"—no matter how many Americans agree with it.

Gloria needs a job with good pay, benefits, and protections for herself and for her son. But Washington isn't on her side—it's on the side of giant corporations. I'm fighting for big, structural change so our government and our economy works for working people like Gloria.
When unions win, all workers win. I'm proudly fighting alongside @Culinary226 to protect unions and empower the voices of their members!

I decided from the beginning that I was going to run a grassroots campaign. I wasn't going to sell access to my time or make promises to billionaires. Our democracy shouldn't be for sale—and if you agree, I hope you'll join us:
Cutting Planned Parenthood out of public health programs cuts off patients from the reproductive health care they need. I'll fight to protect @PPact and the health services they provide.

Rising sea levels are already displacing communities.

Offshore drilling is putting the health and economies of coastal communities at risk.

And communities are facing longer, harsher droughts. 

We need a #BlueNewDeal to protect our oceans and fight the climate crisis.
I’m grateful for Dr. @AyanaEliza’s work to make the #BlueNewDeal a reality. Hope you get a chance to send in your questions for her!

What a well-deserved honor for @GretaThunberg. Climate change is an existential threat, and Greta has been one of the leading voices in this fight. Now it's on us to hear her warning and fight to defeat the climate crisis.
I'm heartsick for the victims and their loved ones. We have to fight the rise of anti-Semitic bigotry and violence—and we have to end the gun violence epidemic that makes these attacks so deadly.
Thank you, @IndivisibleTeam! I'm committed to fighting for big, structural change, building the grassroots movement that we'll need to get it done, and protecting our democracy.
Thank you, @cullen_art and @SLTimes. I promise to fight for the big, structural change we need so that everyone has the opportunity to succeed—in rural Iowa, and across the country.

Offshore drilling is putting the health and economies of coastal communities at risk. It's time to transition to 100% clean energy. I'll end all new fossil fuel leases offshore and on public lands—and phase out all existing offshore drilling.

Some candidates jet off to Manhattan or San Francisco for fancy fundraisers that cost more than $2,000 a ticket.

Not me. We’re building our campaign one small-dollar donation at a time—because the presidency shouldn’t be bought. Chip in $3 now to join us.

America's middle class has been deliberately hollowed out by the rich and powerful—people who rigged the system to work in their favor, while hanging the rest of us out to dry. It's time for a #WealthTax to ensure that everyone has a chance to succeed.
Héctor Figueroa was a beloved leader for @32BJSEIU and all working people. It’s only fitting that his legacy live on through the Héctor Figueroa School.

Climate change is an existential threat—and our coastal communities are particularly at risk as sea levels rise and storms get stronger and more destructive. The ocean must be a part of the climate solution. That's why I've got a plan for a #BlueNewDeal.

.@CPDAction and their network do transformative work around housing affordability, fighting climate change, and advocating for economic justice. I'll keep fighting alongside you for the big, structural change our country needs.

I'm heartsick for the family and friends of the victims in Jersey City.

Gun violence is terrifying our communities. We shouldn't have to live like this.

Children are dying in CBP custody due to the flu. Refusing to administer flu vaccines is neglectful and cruel. I'll end the unnecessary detention of children and families—and enforce strict standards for medical care for anyone in our care.

71 years ago, Eleanor Roosevelt led the world in adopting the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. On International Human Rights Day, we recommit to an America that advocates for justice, protects the rights of all people, and lives up to its values—at home and abroad.
The future of our planet depends on healthy oceans—and we don’t have time to waste. We need a #BlueNewDeal to protect and restore our oceans and make them a part of the climate solution.
Thank you, Dr. Ayana Elizabeth Johnson, I’m so grateful for your work on our #BlueNewDeal!

Targeting Black and Latinx commuters only further erodes the trust between law enforcement and their communities. If we’re serious about criminal justice reform, we must move towards a system that protects its communities instead of preying on them.

Starting on day one of my presidency, I’ll take bold action to fight climate change. That includes harnessing the power of our oceans to be a key part of our solution to the climate crisis. The future of our planet depends on healthy oceans—and we don’t have time to waste.

Finally, we must mitigate the damage that has already been done as a result of climate change—and prepare for sea level rise, droughts, and extreme weather events. Disaster assistance must be distributed equitably, and we must ensure that everyone gets the help they need.

On day one of my presidency, I'll end all new fossil fuel leases offshore and on public lands—and phase out all existing offshore drilling. I'm committed to leaving no worker behind as we transition to clean energy, and will focus on transitioning workers to offshore wind energy.

I’ll work to reduce marine plastic pollution and ocean trash. And I'll hold Big Ag accountable for polluting our oceans and waterways, which has exacerbated toxic algal blooms, harmed marine life, and contaminated our drinking water.

Coastal and marine habitats are our best natural defense system in the fight against climate change, storing more carbon than tropical forests and acting as cheaper and more effective sea walls. My administration will restore marine ecosystems and expand marine protected areas.

As we transition our economy to 100% clean energy, my administration will prioritize offshore renewable energy. I'll fight to fully restore America's fish stocks—supporting up to 500k additional jobs—and invest in regenerative ocean farming that will help fight climate change.

Climate change has pushed our oceans to the brink. By restoring our oceans and rebuilding our blue economy, we can create good, high-paying union jobs, protect a crucial source of food, and fight climate change.

We need a #GreenNewDeal to fight the climate crisis—and we need a #BlueNewDeal to protect and restore our oceans so they are a part of our climate solution, and so we can rebuild our blue economy. Read my plan for a #BlueNewDeal:

I called Madeline, a grassroots donor who is studying to be a high school Social Studies teacher! We talked about the role of big money in our elections—and how my #WealthTax can ensure that every kid gets a high-quality public education.
Last night's town hall in Charleston, South Carolina, was something special. This is how we're going to win—together.

Donald Trump's anti-Semitic comments aren't just repugnant—they're dangerous. People with hateful ideologies feel empowered by him, and we see the consequences in the surge of anti-Semitic incidents following his election. We must fight the bigotry he promotes and enables.

Senate Republicans stole a Supreme Court seat to cement an anti-choice majority on the Court—and we’re seeing the consequences. We need new federal laws and oversight to protect abortion rights no matter what the Court does, and I've got a plan for that.

I'm going to fight to ensure that everyone gets the full health coverage they need, including mental health care, under #MedicareForAll. But people like Olivia will make all the difference to ending the stigma around mental illness—and I'll be fighting alongside them.
Marvin Miller revolutionized baseball by leading the players’ union and helping players gain crucial rights. His recognition by the Baseball Hall of Fame is long overdue!
From New Hampshire to Iowa, South Carolina, Nevada, and beyond—we're building a grassroots movement for big, structural change together.

Paul Volcker fought to rein in Wall Street banks making risky financial bets, and we sat together as the Volcker Rule was signed into law as part of Dodd-Frank. My heart goes out to his friends and family.

I'm not afraid to stand up to billionaires and corrupt politicians to fight for the big, structural change we need.
Corruption has put our planet at risk, broken our economy, and is breaking our democracy. It's time to root it out—and I've got a plan for that.
Our economy is working great for the wealthy and well-connected—but not so great for everyone else. I promised Henniker, New Hampshire, that I’ll keep fighting for the big, structural change we need.
I hope Amelia and her two golden retrievers can meet me and Bailey at the White House!

Venezuelans are fleeing persecution only to wind up detained under Trump's cruel immigration policies. 

My administration will not turn its back on those seeking freedom from violent dictatorships. Venezuelan asylum-seekers deserve parole and TPS now.

.@BlackWomxnFor is a powerfully important group of Black women and gender non-conforming people fighting for real change in 2020. I’m deeply grateful to have their endorsement—and to be in this fight with them.

What would a #TwoCentWealthTax mean for the folks I met in Peterborough?

It would mean they could send their kids to high-quality child care, good public schools, and free public college—and be free of student loan debt.

That's the big, structural change I'm fighting for.

$39 million to spend on advertising—and no time for voters in Iowa, New Hampshire, Nevada, or South Carolina. Our democracy shouldn't be for sale. If it’s a fight between money and the power of a grassroots movement, I'm betting on the people.
We must end the unnecessary detainment and inhumane treatment of asylum-seekers and immigrants at our borders. I've got a plan to build a fair, humane immigration system that reflects our values.

Jakelin Amei Rosmery Caal Maquin died one year ago today, just days after her seventh birthday. Jakelin and her family came to the U.S. seeking safety and a better life. Instead, she died because of the Trump administration's cruelty and neglect.

The United States doesn't become stronger by weakening our allies. But that's exactly what Trump has done, repeatedly and deliberately. The next president will need to repair our relationships and rebuild our State Department—and I've got a plan for that.

If you made it to the top, good for you. But you should pitch in your fair share so that everyone else has a chance to make it. We need a #WealthTax.

Hearing assistance devices should be available for anyone who needs one—and my Over-the-Counter Hearing Aid Act will help bring down costs and make some hearing aids  available over the counter.

Uber's safety investigators are reportedly more concerned about protecting their company from liability than protecting passengers and drivers. Misclassifying their employees as contractors is just another way to avoid responsibility. Uber must be held accountable.

The rich and powerful want us to believe the racist lie that more for your neighbors means less for you. Donald Trump has used this lie to divide us and pit us against each other for his own political gain. But the truth is that we can only move forward together.

Uh huh. I'll put any promise Donald Trump makes about student loans right next to his broken promises about protecting people with pre-existing conditions, making no cuts to Medicaid, cutting middle class taxes, protecting the rights of LGBTQ+ Americans...

New Hampshire state workers deserve fair pay—and an independent fact-finder agreed. I stand with @SEIU1984. It's time for Governor Chris Sununu to stop shortchanging workers and give them the fair compensation they deserve.

Freedom of the press is one of the most important values in our country. A reporter’s coverage of candidates for the highest office shouldn’t be determined by one of the candidates controlling their paychecks.

We have to defeat climate change now—or kids like Eleanor will be living with the consequences for the rest of their lives. We'll start by rooting out the corruption in Washington that's giving Big Oil a free pass to poison our communities.

Running for president shouldn't be a passion project for bored billionaires. Our democracy should not be for sale. I'll make sure we keep talking about the issues that matter to all families, and I'll keep building a grassroots movement to fight for big, structural change.

Others have said it before me: "If you don't have a seat at the table, you're probably on the menu." I’m looking forward to continuing to fight alongside @SenGillibrand and @KamalaHarris, who are advancing an agenda that will transform the lives of people of all genders.

.@KamalaHarris is a leading advocate for reproductive rights—and I'll fight alongside her to enact her proposal requiring federal preclearance when state and local governments with a history of violating Roe v. Wade try to restrict reproductive rights.
.@SenGillibrand is a leading advocate for national paid leave—and I’ll fight alongside her to enact her plan to make paid family and medical leave available to all workers.

We've seen a record number of women in this primary. That has meant that together, we've been able to shape the national conversation to highlight issues impacting people in America. But as billionaires buy their way into the race, some of my colleagues have been pushed out.

It's not just about having a job—it's about having a good job with fair pay, benefits, and that treats its workers with dignity. I've got plans to raise the minimum wage, empower unions, and help workers control their schedules so they can build a future.

We need a #GreenNewDeal. We need to build a new green economy with millions of good jobs. And we need to root out the corruption in Washington that’s holding up every effort to fight the climate crisis. I stand with everyone on #ClimateStrike today.
Children are dying because of the Trump administration's cruelty, racism, and neglect. The Trump administration must be held accountable—and we must fight to build a humane immigration system.

Pearl Harbor. Pensacola. Not even our military bases are safe from gun violence. I'm heartsick for the victims and their families. We must end this epidemic and protect the lives of our service members.

Dream Big.
Fight Hard.
And together, we can win!

Trump isn't ending needless forever wars—he's only expanding them while keeping Americans in the dark. It's time to responsibly bring our troops home.

Grateful down to my toes! We’re going to do this—together.
Aw! So sorry to have missed your sister, but glad I could bring a little joy.

Today, I’m making calls to thank grassroots donors. 

Pitch in to our campaign now—and I might give you a call soon to say thanks!

Donald Trump will keep committing crimes and undermining our diplomatic relationships and national security unless we hold him accountable. I was the first candidate to call for impeachment—it's long past time to hold Donald Trump accountable.

Yesterday on @FallonTonight, I talked about how we’re running this campaign by people pitching in $20 here and $5 there. No fancy fundraisers, PACs, or giant corporations.

Chip in any amount, and I could call you today to say thanks!

The devastating impacts of climate change in Puerto Rico have been made worse by decades of neglect and racism. Justice must be at the center of our response to the climate crisis and that's why I will invest $1 trillion in vulnerable communities.
Giant corporations have too much power—and they’re pushing working families to the breaking point. It's time to make big, structural change to build an economy that works for everyone.

I talked with @JimmyFallon about how I'm building my campaign from the grassroots up. I want to spend my time with voters, not sucking up to billionaires. If you believe that's what candidates should do, donate tonight—you may get a call from me tomorrow!
Donald Trump embarrasses America. And he does it repeatedly.
Looking forward to joining @JimmyFallon on @FallonTonight—tune in!
I was glad to meet @Alanis at @FallonTonight! It wasn’t ironic at all.
I have some thoughts on the whole @BillieEilish thing—tune in!
I'll be talking with @Lawrence on @TheLastWord soon about how we can build an economy that works for everyone—I hope you'll join us!
Congratulations to @RachelForAmes—the youngest woman ever elected in Iowa and the first @IowaStateU student to be elected to the Ames City Council! When women fight, women win. Go Rachel!

Universal put money into this race, but if it’s a fight between money and the power of a grassroots movement, I'm betting on the people—and last night, the people won. Congratulations! I'll keep fighting with you for affordable housing for everyone.

This is cruel and disgraceful. Donald Trump will happily give millions of dollars in tax breaks to his billionaire buddies—but he's making it harder for struggling families to be able to eat. I'll reverse this shameful policy.

I just spoke on @BloombergTV about why billionaires like @MikeBloomberg, who owns their news network, shouldn't be able to buy their way into the White House, and how I've got plans to make our government work for everyone—not just the wealthy and well-connected.
I'll be on @BloombergTV soon to talk about the big, structural change I'm fighting for. Tune in!

I guess some billionaires figured it'd be a lot cheaper to spend a few hundred million to buy the American presidency than paying their fair share in a #WealthTax so that everyone can succeed. I put an ad on Bloomberg TV to let them know—I'm not backing down from this fight.

Climate change is an existential threat, and we must get to net-zero carbon emissions as soon as possible if we want to defeat it. That's why I support the #GreenNewDeal—and why I've got a plan to achieve 100% clean energy for America.

Betsy DeVos really didn't like being held in contempt of court, so she wants to make federal student loans someone else's problem. 

Of course, there's a simpler idea: Universal free college and technical school, and canceling student loan debt.

Congrats on the move, Larry Page! Quick reminder: We do still expect you to testify before Congress. And changing your title while staying on the board and retaining effective control of it will not exempt you from accountability.

Donald Trump is pushing out talented diplomats, hollowing out the State Department, and appointing his own donor buddies to be our ambassadors. Our next president will have to rebuild the State Department—and I've got a plan for that.
Fine by me. I’m fighting to give every person in America the opportunity to build a good life for themselves and their loved ones—not to protect giant banks and their billionaire customers.

#UniversalChildCare
#GreenNewDeal
#EndCorruptionNow

All of this is possible and more—if we fight hard together. Chip in $3 to help us keep fighting.

We're all deeply grateful for @KamalaHarris's leadership on issues from protecting our democracy and advocating for our teachers to ending the Black maternal mortality crisis—and I know my friend will continue fighting for justice.

Donald Trump abused our diplomatic relationships and undermined our national security for his personal, political gain.

The past few years have shown that unless we hold him accountable now, he will do this again.
Bailey's loving his snow day!

It's not just about having a job—it's about having a good job. Workers are struggling with unpredictable schedules and jobs that won't give them enough hours to qualify for benefits, support their families, or build a future. 

I've got a plan for that.

Thank you @KamalaHarris for your commitment to fighting for the people, for justice, and to holding Donald Trump accountable.

Kamala is right—our system is deeply broken when billionaires can buy their way in. I'll fight with you to make sure our government works for all of us.
I stand with @hgsuuaw. Grad student workers deserve fair pay, benefits, and labor protections—and it's time for @Harvard to negotiate with them in good faith.

We can free students from crushing debt, boost the economy, and reduce both the Black-white and Latinx-white wealth gaps by canceling student loan debt and by providing universal technical, two-year, and four-year public college. And we can pay for it all with my #WealthTax.

Giant companies are raking in profits while squeezing working families to the breaking point. It's time to put more power in the hands of workers. My plan ensures that the 27 million part-time workers in America are treated with respect and can build a future for their families.

And it's time to remove the perverse incentives that keep giant corporations from making their workers full-time. I'll extend leave and benefit protections to part-time workers, and require employers to offer additional hours to existing part-time workers before hiring new ones.

My plan will give workers who work at companies with more than 15 employees the rest they desperately need by guaranteeing workers 11 hours between shifts and compensating them with higher pay for hours voluntarily worked within that window.

Under my Fair Workweek Plan, employers with 15 or more employees will be required to give two weeks’ advance notice of work schedules. And employees will be empowered to ask for schedules that work for them, without fear of retaliation.

These unpredictable schedules make it nearly impossible to work another job, go back to school, or schedule child care. And workers of color—especially women of color—bear the brunt of these abusive scheduling practices.

Millions of workers face unpredictable schedules that can change dramatically day-to-day—even by the hour—with almost no advance warning. A third of workers involuntarily work part-time because they aren't assigned enough hours by giant corporations trying to keep costs down.

I guess some billionaires figured it'd be a lot cheaper to spend a few hundred million to buy the American presidency than paying their fair share in a #WealthTax so that everyone can succeed. I put an ad on Bloomberg TV to let them know—I'm not backing down from this fight.
