Truvada’s manufacturer, Gilead, relied on $50 million in federal grants to develop it, but today they rake in multi-billion dollar profits while Americans struggle to afford it. Only a fraction of patients benefit from it, thanks to its hefty $2,000-a-month price tag.

Humira is used by millions of patients around the world to treat diseases like arthritis, psoriasis, and Crohn’s disease. But its manufacturer, AbbVie, doubled its price—and used blatantly anti-competitive behavior to prevent a competitor from entering the market.

Health officials agree that naloxone is critical to curbing the opioid epidemic, and it can be as cheap as 5¢ a dose. But one company spiked the price of their product by over 550% to “capitalize on the opportunity” of the opioid crisis.

EpiPens deliver life-saving doses of epinephrine, a drug that reverses severe allergic reactions to things like peanuts and bee stings. In 2016, EpiPens’ manufacturer jacked up prices by 400%, leaving families unable to afford this life-saving medication.

Insulin was discovered nearly 100 years ago as a treatment for diabetes. But three drug companies dominated the market and jacked up prices. Now, Americans with diabetes are rationing their insulin—and taxpayers are spending billions on it through Medicare and Medicaid.

Prescription drug companies' obscene price gouging is leaving patients without access to lifesaving medical treatments. I've got a plan to lower costs on several key drugs that millions rely on. Here are just a few examples.

Donald Trump is hollowing out our State Department and undermining our ambassadors—putting our diplomacy efforts in grave danger. We'll need to rebuild our State Department, and I have a plan for that.
I'm going to fight my heart out for #MedicareForAll—and here's how I'll get us there in my first term.

37 million Americans didn't fill a prescription last year because of costs. Within my first 100 days as president, I will act to lower the cost of essential medications like insulin, EpiPens, and naloxone.

Millions of Americans will experience the full benefits of a #MedicareForAll option and see how it compares to high-priced coverage and fighting their insurance company tooth and nail. And when we move to complete the transition to #MedicareForAll, the choice will be clear.
And I'll give every American over the age of 50 the choice to enter into a substantially improved Medicare program.

This option will include all of the health care benefits of #MedicareForAll, including primary and preventive services, pediatric care, emergency services and transportation, vision, dental, audio, long-term care, mental health and substance use, and physical therapy.

In my first 100 days, I'll fight to create a true #MedicareForAll option that will be immediately free for millions of  Americans, including children under the age of 18 and families making at or below 200% of the federal poverty level.
Thank you, @PramilaJayapal. You've been doing incredible work in the House and have kept the momentum moving forward. I’m honored to keep working alongside you for #MedicareForAll!

No one should have to ration their medication or skip filling it because of the cost. As president, I will act immediately to lower the cost of prescription drugs—and I'll fight my heart out for #MedicareForAll.
I hope I'll see you at Clark Atlanta University on November 21!

This is how Wall Street's corrupt grip on Washington will end. Not with a bang, but with the tears of some sad billionaires—who will still be unimaginably rich, but will have paid their fair share so America could cancel student loan debt, have universal child care, and more.

Billionaires like Blankfein can say whatever they want, but I've spent my career holding big banks accountable and fighting for working families—and I'm going to keep building a movement to make America work for working families.

One of the billionaires who's so upset with me is Lloyd Blankfein. He ran Goldman Sachs while it misled its own clients in order to turn a profit, which helped create the 2008 crash. His bank then took billions in backdoor taxpayer bailouts, and no one was held accountable.

On Thursday, my campaign started airing an ad about my #WealthTax. Now, some of the scared billionaires who oppose it are going on TV and tweeting their complaints. It clearly struck a nerve. But we need this tax to help working families—so we’re increasing our ad buy.
I've spent a lifetime studying why families go broke—and the number one reason is health care costs. That's why I'll fight my heart out for #MedicareForAll. Here's how we get there.

I’ll fight my heart out at each step of this process, for one simple reason: No one should ever die or go bankrupt because of health care costs. And when I’m president of the United States, I’ll do everything in my power to make sure that never happens to another person again.

Any candidate who believes modest reforms will avoid the wrath of industry is not paying attention. So why not dream big and fight hard for the plan that will cover everyone and provide the best care at the lowest cost?

The health care industry spent $4.7 billion over the past decade on lobbying. Let's not kid ourselves—every Democratic plan for expanding health care, big or small, is going to be drowned in money to make sure nothing ever happens.

At each step of my plan, millions more Americans will pay lower costs for care and see the quality of their coverage improve. And millions more Americans will be able to ditch their private insurance and enter a high-quality #MedicareForAll plan.

By the end of my third year, I’ll fight to pass legislation to complete the transition to #MedicareForAll. Once millions have experienced the full benefits of a #MedicareforAll option and compared it to the corrupt and wasteful system we have today, the people will demand it.
We will continue to move forward on health care throughout my term, including by investing $100B in breakthrough medical research and by creating a new drug development institute at the NIH.
I’ll also let anyone over the age of 50 join the existing Medicare program—and I'll improve its benefits and reduce its costs for everyone.

This #MedicareForAll option will be open to everyone and includes all the health care benefits of #MedicareForAll. It will be immediately free for nearly half of all Americans, including all children under 18 and anyone with income at or below 200% of the federal poverty level.

Next, in my first 100 days, I’ll use the same process Mitch McConnell used to try and kill the ACA to bypass the filibuster and create a true #MedicareForAll option—more generous than one proposed by any other campaign—to begin the transition to #MedicareForAll.

First, I’ll act immediately as president to lower the costs of critical drugs—including specific drugs that millions of Americans currently rely on, like insulin and EpiPens. And I'll crack down on corruption to rein in health insurers and drug companies.

As president, I’ll reverse Donald Trump’s efforts to sabotage the Affordable Care Act and will protect people with pre-existing conditions. And in my first 100 days, I’ll take executive and legislative action to reduce health care costs and improve coverage.

Today, I'm sharing my plan to transition to #MedicareForAll. In my first term, we will reverse Trump’s sabotage of the ACA, lower drug prices, lower the Medicare age to 50 and create a true Medicare for All option—and fully transition to #MedicareForAll.

Algorithms are only as good as the data that gets packed into them, which means discriminatory biases just keep getting perpetuated. It's not on the women who've been discriminated against to fix the problem—it's on Goldman Sachs.
Congratulations Ady, Rachael, and big brother Carl on welcoming baby Willow into your beautiful and courageous family! Bruce and I are sending you all of our love.

Alexis Crawford was an incredible woman with a bright future ahead of her. Black women and girls, especially black trans women, face disproportionately higher rates of violence and homicide, often with impunity. This must stop.
Gun violence is a public health crisis, and we need to start treating it like one.
Congratulations @rgay and @debbiemillman—sending you both my love!

Congratulations @rgay and @debbiemillman—sending you both my love!

I’m fighting Big Money by funding my campaign differently. Other candidates might attend fancy fundraisers and take checks from PACs, but I’m only accepting grassroots donations. 

Will you chip in now? Together, we can change the way campaigns are funded.

Red tide devastated Florida for sixteen months and now it’s back—killing fish and causing beaches to “smell like death.”

I am fighting for a #GreenNewDeal so that our beaches stay safe.

From sponsoring fancy dinners to spending millions of dollars on lobbying, the wealthy and well-connected are able to make Washington work for them at the expense of everyone else. It's time to root out corruption in Washington. I've got a plan for that.

Facebook is spending millions lobbying the government as they face antitrust scrutiny. They're going on a charm offensive with Republican lawmakers. Now, they're sponsoring a dinner headlined by Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh. Let's call this what it is: Corruption.
Thank you for your courage and your dedication, @BJoeWolf. Together, we can root out corruption in Washington, end gun violence, and ensure that everyone can live safe and free.

I welcome the Gaza ceasefire. Dozens were killed in Gaza, and hundreds of rockets fired at Israel. We must work to end rocket attacks on Israel, eliminate the Gaza blockade, and solve the humanitarian crisis so that all Israelis and Palestinians live in security and freedom.

I'm heartsick for the victims of this horrifying shooting and their families. We shouldn't have to live like this. Students shouldn't live in fear when they go to school.

We must act now to end gun violence.

Maybe if I were sticking $3 trillion under a mattress. But I'm not. I'm using it for:

✅ Universal Child Care
✅ Canceling student loan debt for 95% of those who have it
✅ Investing in public K-12 schools

Which will grow the economy and provide economic security for families!

These proposed changes to Puerto Rico's Civil Code are appalling, and would dramatically roll back LGBTQ+ rights. I stand with Puerto Rico's LGBTQ+ activists fighting for their right to live and love freely.
I knew Mark Zandi was skeptical, so I had him check the numbers on my plan to pay for #MedicareForAll. He confirmed they add up.

Other campaigns run on fancy, closed-door fundraisers, but you won’t see me doing that. 

Our campaign isn’t powered by the wealthy and well-connected—it’s powered by donors like you:

I got my degree thanks to a quality public college where tuition was just $50 a semester. That kind of opportunity doesn't exist for students today. I'm fighting for universal free public two year, four year, and technical college so that every student can live their dream.
Separating parents and children and detaining families is cruel, unnecessary, and traumatizing. My administration will end unnecessary detention and welcome asylum seekers.
Some billionaires don’t like my #TwoCentWealthTax? I’m shocked.

Registered apprenticeships give workers the opportunity to get good-paying union jobs, and ensure we have the best workers building our infrastructure. The Trump administration misused funds meant for this program, but we'll fight to protect these apprenticeships.
We are officially on the ballot in New Hampshire! Let's keep up the momentum for big, structural change—follow @NHforWarren to learn about our upcoming events and how you can volunteer.
The Sandy Hook community organized against the gun lobby and won a major victory in their fight to hold them accountable. Now let's keep fighting to end gun violence.
The student loan debt crisis is disproportionately burdening Black students. I have a plan to cancel student loan debt and help close the racial wealth gap.
We need to strengthen the Code of Conduct for all federal judges, and extend it to Supreme Court Justices. I've got a plan for that.

Let's be clear: This is a callous attempt to create more barriers for immigrants and asylum seekers. I'll overturn Trump's discriminatory policies, expand legal immigration, and welcome more asylum seekers.

The American people deserve to know the truth. And it's time to show Trump that no one is above the law—not even the president of the United States.

The Mueller report made it clear that Donald Trump repeatedly obstructed justice. Many reports have shown he is abusing diplomatic relationships for his own political gain. Now, it's time for the public to see the evidence the House has gathered in these public hearings.

2020 is our moment in history. It’s our time to dream big, fight hard, and win. But we can only do it together!

If you chip in to our campaign now—$15, $5, heck, even $1—I’ll be grateful down to my toes.
I stand with the Little Rock teachers making their voices heard for collective bargaining rights. We should be strengthening the voices of teachers in our public schools.
I’m grateful down to my toes for your support. I don’t take it lightly— and I’ll continue to fight alongside you to make big, structural change.

Redlining often pushed people of color into neighborhoods that were vulnerable to climate change or faced more pollution risks. When we fight for environmental justice, we're also fighting for economic justice.

If we want to make big, structural change, we need great candidates running up and down the ballot. And we need to show the next generation that they can run—and win. On #NationalRunforOfficeDay, learn more about how you can run for office!

Bruce and I are sending our best wishes to our Sikh friends celebrating the 550th anniversary of the birth of the first Sikh Guru, Guru Nanak Dev Ji, and his teachings of gender equality, racial equality, and religious tolerance for all.
Under my plan to pay for #MedicareForAll, we'll put that $11 trillion back in the pockets of American families—while covering everyone.
Thank you to all of the brave protesters who showed up and raised their voices outside of the Supreme Court this morning. #HomeIsHere, and we'll keep fighting for DACA recipients all the way.

A thinner and thinner slice of the top has taken a massive amount of wealth while America’s middle class has been hollowed out. We need a #TwoCentWealthTax—and we need big, structural change so that our economy and our government works for everyone.

After Sandra Pezqueda was fired for reporting sexual harassment at @TerraneaResort, workers pushed for a measure to guarantee basic safety. Terranea spent $1 million to defeat it. I stand with Sandra and the workers—this fight isn't over.

My plan prevents companies like Exxon from using industry-funded fake research to mislead federal regulators and strike down regulations in court. And if they knowingly lie, we'll treat them the same way the law treats anyone who lies in court—by prosecuting them for perjury.

Industry players and their allies also knowingly submit false and misleading information to regulatory agencies, giving right-wing judges the chance to later use their junk science as an excuse to invalidate regulations.

Exxon’s scientists knew that climate change was real decades ago. They could've shared their science with the public. Instead, they and the fossil fuel industry launched a decades-long campaign to cover up the facts and deceive government regulators and the American people.
It’s illegal to lie to Congress, to a court, and even to your shareholders. It should also be illegal for Exxon and other giant corporations to lie to federal regulators. I've got a plan for that.
I called Chad, a WWII veteran who cast his first vote while serving abroad for President Franklin D. Roosevelt. He's committed to fighting for big, structural change again.
Grateful for your service, @wjrue. Together, I know we’ll make a big difference for service members, veterans, and their families.
We must honor the promises we've made to service members, veterans, and military families.

Si eres beneficiario de DACA y se vence en menos de un año, toma acción hoy para renovar tu DACA. Puedes encontrar ayuda en   y   para residentes de CA. Si estás cerca de Washington D.C., únete mañana frente a la Corte Suprema.

Nuestro país le hizo una promesa a más de 700,000 personas de poder ir a la universidad, trabajar, y cuidar a sus familias, sin tener miedo de ser deportados. Donald Trump rompió esa promesa. Pero estamos alzando nuestra voz y luchando para defender DACA. #HomeIsHere

If you're a DACA recipient and your DACA is expiring in less than a year, take action today. Help is available at  , and for CA residents at  . And if you're near DC, join the rally outside the Supreme Court tomorrow.

Our country made a promise to over 700,000 people that they could go to school, go to work, and take care of their families—safe from deportation. Donald Trump broke that promise. But we're raising our voices and fighting back.

On #VeteransDay, we honor our veterans and thank them for their service. But we have to back our platitudes with meaningful action and policies that support our military both during and after service—not just today, but every day.

All three of my brothers served in the military, so I know the responsibility we have to our veterans, and the unique burdens that military families carry. On #VeteransDay, I'm thinking of all our veterans and their families. I'm grateful for your service.

I’ve spent my career studying why so many hard-working middle-class families are going broke. The number one reason? Health care costs. Even with insurance, families are being crushed by deductibles, copays, and surprise bills. We need #MedicareForAll.

Let’s be clear: When private equity firms acquire companies, suck out all the value they can, and walk away rich—leaving workers, their families, and their communities suffering with the consequences—it’s legalized looting. I have a plan to end it.

There is a long history of mistakes in capital punishment, especially when it comes to Black and Brown people. Rodney Reed's execution should be halted—and it's time to end the death penalty for good.

Well-connected billionaires are given plenty of space to complain about my #TwoCentWealthTax. Let's give more space to the stories of working-class and middle-class families whose lives would be transformed by Universal Child Care and free public college.
I'll be making more calls to grassroots donors soon! Chip in whatever you can now, and you could get a call from me to say thank you. We can only do this together:

Small-dollar donation by small-dollar donation, grassroots donors are powering our campaign. I'm grateful for everyone who chips in what they can to our campaign, and grateful that @JVN was able to give some of you a call to say thanks! Me, you, Jonathan—we're in this together.

My daddy couldn’t work after his heart attack. We lost the family station wagon, and we nearly lost the house. But my mother got a minimum wage job at Sears that saved our house.

Today, a minimum wage job can’t support a family of three. I'm fighting so every family can succeed.

Thank you to everyone who came out to our Goose Creek town hall, and thank you to everyone who stayed for the photo line!

South Carolina is ready for the big, structural change we’re fighting for together.

When I set up the CFPB, I made protecting service members and veterans from scams and predatory lenders a priority.

As president, I'll strengthen the CFPB to protect our military families. They shouldn't have to worry about their families while they're protecting our country.

Our campaign is by the people, for the people—and we’re growing one small-dollar donation at a time! I was glad that @JVN called some grassroots donors to say thank you this week. Here he is, talking to Lauren!

Generation after generation, communities of color have been devastated by environmental racism. At last night’s #EJPresForum, I spoke about how my environmental justice plan will lift up the Black and Brown families who have been left behind.
Fortunately, they can both use my calculator to find out exactly how much they’d have to chip in under my #TwoCentWealthTax:

One billionaire calls another billionaire and asks him to run for president—I'm shocked! Here's the deal: Companies like Amazon have too much power, and billionaires like @JeffBezos and @MikeBloomberg should pitch in so that everyone can succeed.

It is disgraceful and dangerous that Republicans are holding up the VAWA reauthorization to allow those convicted of stalking to keep their guns.

Domestic violence and gun violence are deeply connected—we need to keep guns out of the hands of abusers.

Journalists do important work under increasingly difficult circumstances—from private equity takeovers to attacks from Trump. I'll always stand with workers and unions like @GMGUnion fighting for their rights. We must protect the right to join a union and strengthen union voices.

Nuestro país le hizo una promesa a más de 700,000 personas de poder ir a la universidad, trabajar, y cuidar a sus familias, sin tener miedo de ser deportados. Donald Trump rompió esa promesa. Pero estamos alzando nuestra voz y luchando para defender DACA. #HomeIsHere

There is a long history of mistakes in capital punishment, especially when it comes to Black and Brown people. Rodney Reed's execution should be halted—and it's time to end the death penalty for good.

Well-connected billionaires are given plenty of space to complain about my #TwoCentWealthTax. Let's give more space to the stories of working-class and middle-class families whose lives would be transformed by Universal Child Care and free public college.
I'll be making more calls to grassroots donors soon! Chip in whatever you can now, and you could get a call from me to say thank you. We can only do this together:

Small-dollar donation by small-dollar donation, grassroots donors are powering our campaign. I'm grateful for everyone who chips in what they can to our campaign, and grateful that @JVN was able to give some of you a call to say thanks! Me, you, Jonathan—we're in this together.

My daddy couldn’t work after his heart attack. We lost the family station wagon, and we nearly lost the house. But my mother got a minimum wage job at Sears that saved our house.

Today, a minimum wage job can’t support a family of three. I'm fighting so every family can succeed.

Thank you to everyone who came out to our Goose Creek town hall, and thank you to everyone who stayed for the photo line!

South Carolina is ready for the big, structural change we’re fighting for together.

When I set up the CFPB, I made protecting service members and veterans from scams and predatory lenders a priority.

As president, I'll strengthen the CFPB to protect our military families. They shouldn't have to worry about their families while they're protecting our country.

Our campaign is by the people, for the people—and we’re growing one small-dollar donation at a time! I was glad that @JVN called some grassroots donors to say thank you this week. Here he is, talking to Lauren!

Generation after generation, communities of color have been devastated by environmental racism. At last night’s #EJPresForum, I spoke about how my environmental justice plan will lift up the Black and Brown families who have been left behind.
Fortunately, they can both use my calculator to find out exactly how much they’d have to chip in under my #TwoCentWealthTax:

One billionaire calls another billionaire and asks him to run for president—I'm shocked! Here's the deal: Companies like Amazon have too much power, and billionaires like @JeffBezos and @MikeBloomberg should pitch in so that everyone can succeed.

It is disgraceful and dangerous that Republicans are holding up the VAWA reauthorization to allow those convicted of stalking to keep their guns.

Domestic violence and gun violence are deeply connected—we need to keep guns out of the hands of abusers.

Journalists do important work under increasingly difficult circumstances—from private equity takeovers to attacks from Trump. I'll always stand with workers and unions like @GMGUnion fighting for their rights. We must protect the right to join a union and strengthen union voices.

.@YuhLine and I are fighting for big, structural change—and that includes building a future in which women always have a seat at the table, and young girls see themselves represented in our government.

30 years ago, Berliners came together to tear down the wall that had divided their city. We are still inspired today by their brave protest and pursuit of freedom and unity—and we recommit ourselves to a Europe that is united, democratic, and at peace.
Apparently, a few billionaires don't like my #TwoCentWealthTax. But here's the deal—if you made it big, you should chip in two cents to make sure that everyone else can make it, too.
Coopermans support candidates who will fight for people like them—and I've got a lot more Coopermans on my side.
It's time to put power in the hands of the people. Grateful my friend @AyannaPressley could join me in North Carolina as we fight for big, structural change!
Congratulations to everyone who had their right to vote restored today! Now, let’s keep fighting to protect our fundamental right to vote.

One year ago this week, women were elected to office in record numbers. One year from today, we’ll have a chance to make history again. If we want to make big, structural change, we need to elect another wave of women up and down the ballot.
Fighting for the #GreenNewDeal is the right thing to do. When Democrats aren’t afraid to fight for big ideas—we win.

Good. 

The status quo is working great for the wealthy and the well-connected, but not so much for everyone else. Big, structural change is coming—and I’m not afraid to fight for it.

I’m still waiting. Voters have a right to know who is buying access and recognition with the possible future leaders of our party—and how much it costs. We can talk all we want about how to get big money out of politics, but nothing will change unless we start leading the way.

Last month, I called on every candidate in this race to disclose any donor or fundraiser who has a special title on their campaign, and to disclose the dates and locations of their fundraising events and the names of every person who appears on their host committees.

I'm running a grassroots campaign. I don't take money from federal lobbyists or PACs, and I don't take contributions over $200 from fossil fuel, Big Pharma, Big Banks, or Big Tech executives. And I’m not doing call time with wealthy donors or giving them special access.
I loved reading your father’s letter, Michelle. Thank you both so much for being part of our movement—stay strong out there!

.@KatiePorterOC and I both know what it's like to watch our families come close to skidding off a financial cliff. It's time to make sure our government works for families again. I'm proud to be fighting alongside her for big, structural change.
The wealthy and well-connected will always have each other's backs. We're building a movement to change that. We're building a movement for big, structural change.

We make many kinds of promises—promises to ourselves, to others, and promises for our future. When I make a pinkie promise with young girls, we promise to run for office, to help elect more women, and to build a future in which women always have a seat at the table.
LGBTQ+ people need and deserve equitable, gender-affirming, and culturally-competent health care, no matter where they live. And I've got a plan for that.
I'm glad that Mark is finally getting his wheelchair—but no one should have to publicly shame an insurance company to get the care they need. We need #MedicareForAll.
See you soon, Atlanta!

Bruce and I had the opportunity to visit the Woolworth's Lunch Counter at the International Civil Rights Center and Museum in Greensboro.

Courageous young activists ignited a movement against segregation. Now it's our responsibility to carry on their fight for racial justice.

The wealthy and the well-connected can get all the airtime they want to complain about my #TwoCentWealthTax—but we've got the power of a movement. So share your stories about what child care, good public schools, and universal free college would mean for you.
And this calculator can show you how much of your student loan debt would be cancelled under my plan:
And yeah, we've got calculators for those plans too! See how much you could save on child care under my plan for universal child care:

—Universal child care
—Invest in public K-12 schools
—Cancel student loan debt
—Universal free public college and technical schools

This would make a real, tangible difference in the lives of millions of American families.
Billionaires get so much airtime to talk about how they don't want to pay more taxes. Instead, let’s talk about what a #TwoCentWealthTax would mean for middle-class and working-class families.
My heart goes out to @DenzelCummings’ family and friends. He was thoughtful, intentional, and compassionate, and my entire team and I are deeply saddened by his passing.
It's time to put power in the hands of the people. @AyannaPressley and I are fighting for the big, structural change that our country needs.
Welcome to the race, @MikeBloomberg! If you're looking for policy plans that will make a huge difference for working people and which are very popular, start here:

The time for small ideas is over.
We need big ideas that can fix the big challenges that we face.
We need big ideas that can inspire people.
We need big ideas that will bring people out to vote. 
And we need someone willing to fight for those big ideas.
I stand with the @Teamsters25 sanitation drivers on strike. They deserve a living wage, and Republic Services must negotiate with them in good faith.

Many of these workers have gone without a raise for nearly a decade while getting squeezed by rising health insurance costs. I stand with @Teamsters and @Steelworkers who are going on strike to demand fair wages, good health care, and labor protections.

Some billionaires seem confused about how much they would pay under my #TwoCentWealthTax. Don’t worry, we've got a calculator for that, too. 

The bottom line: If you made it big, you should chip in to make sure everyone else also has a chance to succeed:

Thank you, @BlackWomxnFor! Black trans and cis women, gender-nonconforming, and nonbinary people are the backbone of our democracy and I don’t take this endorsement lightly. I'm committed to fighting alongside you for the big, structural change our country needs.

.@TMobile and @Sprint’s merger will stifle competition, costing thousands of jobs, reducing wages, and giving consumers fewer options. We need a government willing to stand up to these monopolies and protect consumers.

Far too many of our veterans and service members die by suicide. Every single one is a tragedy that could have been prevented. I've got a plan to cut the number of veteran suicides in half in my first term.

While millions of McDonald’s workers are living paycheck to paycheck, their fired CEO gets to leave with millions of dollars in his pocket. 

The economy is working great for a thinner and thinner slice at the top. We need big, structural change.
We aren't going to get farmers the resources they need or challenge the stigma around mental health and suicide if Republicans refuse to confront the problem. Farmers need action—now.

My family lived on the ragged edge of the middle-class. When my daddy had a heart attack, it nearly sent us over a financial cliff. Today, the cost of health care is the number one reason why families go broke. No more. We need #MedicareForAll.

I'm always happy to meet with people, even if we have different views. @BillGates, if we get the chance, I'd love to explain exactly how much you'd pay under my wealth tax. (I promise it's not $100 billion.)

I miss my friend Elijah, but I'll always carry the most important lesson he taught me: Keep fighting from the heart—because it’s the right fight to have.
Facebook used their users' data to limit competition and grow their power, all while cynically portraying themselves as acting to protect users' privacy. It's time to #BreakUpBigTech.
If we want to make big, structural change, then we need to build a movement from the ground up that can fight for it. I talked with @VotingWhileBlk about how we build that movement together.
.@_SheThePeople helped Democrats win crucial seats in yesterday's elections, and this work will be key to helping elect even more Democrats up and down the ballot in 2020.
Congratulations to @KendraForPhilly on winning her election to the Philadelphia City Council! Her passion and commitment will make real change for Philadelphia’s working families.

When I was a young mom, child care nearly knocked me off track. My Aunt Bee saved me, but not every family has an Aunt Bee who can step in. I remember the stress and fear I felt. That's why I'm fighting to build a future in which every young family has a chance to succeed.

The Veterans Health Administration has pioneered innovations in medical care and provides high-quality, evidence-based, culturally competent programs that our veterans rely on. I won't let it be privatized. I've got a plan to invest in it.
Power belongs in the hands of the people. I'm proud to fight alongside @AyannaPressley for the big, structural change that we need.

No student should have to learn in an environment where there's a threat of incarceration. I've got plans to close the school to prison pipeline and ensure every student has a safe and welcoming place to learn.
Insurance companies make their profit by refusing coverage. We need #MedicareForAll because no one’s health care should depend on whether they can shame an insurance company.
Congratulations to @PWCDanica on winning re-election! I admire your dedication to the people of your district, and am inspired by your commitment to making infrastructure a priority in Virginia.

.@ChrisHurstVA is a powerful advocate for gun violence prevention—and I know he’ll continue to bring that fight to the House of Delegates and keep advocating for working families. Congratulations on your re-election, Chris!

Congratulations to @TucsonRomero on her historic election as the first Latina and first woman mayor of Tucson, Arizona! Regina is a champion for our environment and working families—and I'm looking forward to the big, structural change she'll bring to her community.

I’m glad to see @Shelly_Simonds win her seat in the House of Delegates. She will be a real fighter for working families in coastal Virginia—and there’s no need for a hat draw when the people of Virginia vote and make their voices heard! #FlipVABlue

Woo-hoo! Congratulations to the people of Virginia for flipping both the state House and state Senate. Voting is what our democracy is all about, and Virginia proved that today as they elected @VADemocrats up and down the ballot. #FlipVABlue

Iran’s decision to restart enrichment at Fordow is deeply concerning. Before Donald Trump ripped it up, the Iran Deal was working. We must return to serious diplomacy with allies to constrain Iran’s nuclear program and de-escalate the crisis.
Congratulations @JoyceCraigNH on winning your re-election! Manchester needs a mayor who is fighting for working people, and Joyce will keep fighting to make sure they can succeed.
.@JumaaneWilliams is fighting for big, structural change so that New Yorkers’ voices are heard. Make sure to get out and vote tonight by 9 PM, New York!

I was proud to endorse @KendraForPhilly for Philadelphia City Council, and together, she and @WorkingFamilies have built a movement that is putting power in the hands of the people. Philadelphia, get out and vote—if you’re in line by 8 PM, you will be able to vote!
Thank you, @JayInslee. The only way we're going to end this climate crisis is with big, structural change.

Mental health care is a human right. I stand with @NUHW represented clinicians who are going on strike across California to demand that @kpthrive ensure patients get the mental health care they need.

The fact that they've reacted so strongly—so angrily!—to being asked to chip in more tells you all you need to know. The system is working great for the wealthy and well-connected, and Jamie Dimon doesn't want that to change. I'm going to fight to make sure it works for everyone.

It's really simple: Jamie Dimon and his buddies are successful in part because of the opportunities, workforce, and public services that we all paid for. It's only fair that he and his billionaire friends chip in to make sure everyone else has a chance to succeed.
It turns out if you're a giant corporation with millions to spend misleading people on your record of accelerating the climate crisis, that's exactly what you can—and probably will—do.

Twitter's new ad policy will allow fossil fuel companies to buy ads defending themselves and spreading misleading info—but won't allow organizations fighting the climate crisis to buy ads holding those companies accountable. We need accountability.
All three of my brothers served, so I understand the responsibility we have to honor our promises to our service members and veterans. I've got a plan to invest in the VA—not privatize it.

My plan to protect our democracy directly targets this type of racist voting suppression. We will have federal standards to ensure everyone can vote—and where racist or corrupt politicians refuse to follow the law, the federal government will step in.

This isn't just an inconvenience—long lines and delays prevent people from voting, and it isn't a surprise or secret that racist and corrupt politicians have allowed these problems to suppress the vote in minority communities.
It's simple: #MedicareForAll is the best way to ensure that everyone gets the care they need and that no one ever goes broke because of health care costs.

By leaving the Paris Climate Agreement, Trump is ceding American leadership and giving away American jobs in the clean energy economy of the future. We should be leading the fight to end the climate crisis—and I've got a plan for that.

Albuquerque, you've got a chance to vote for an innovative way to move beyond the influence of big money in politics. #VoteYesOnProp2 and show that bold reforms work—and build momentum for big, structural change!

As Commander-in-Chief, I will lead our armed forces with awareness of the unique challenges service members, veterans, and military families face. I’ll honor our troops by not only executing sound military strategy, but also caring for them after they take off the uniform.

Finally, my administration will invest in the VA and reject attempts to privatize it. Under #MedicareForAll, veterans will also have the option to get high-quality health care from non-VA doctors and hospitals at no additional cost.

My administration will ease the transition of veterans leaving military service and help prepare them to return to civilian life. We’ll create a seamless transition from the DOD to the VA, eliminate the benefits backlog, and expand career opportunities for our vets.

A Warren administration will protect the rights of LGBTQ+, women, Black, and Latinx service members. I'll reverse Trump's shameful ban on trans service members on Day One. My administration will protect veterans and family members of serving military personnel from deportation.

We must ensure the safety of those who serve or have served in uniform. I'll fight to eliminate military sexual assault, expand mental health services and work to end military and veteran suicide, and treat the opioid and addiction crisis.

Military families are the backbone of our armed forces, but they face unique challenges. I'll prioritize military spouse employment, ensure families have high-quality child care and education, provide safe and affordable housing, and protect wounded warriors and their caregivers.

Our all-volunteer military has struggled to attract and retain sufficient personnel. A Warren administration will preserve best-in-class benefits for military personnel, and ensure we honor our commitments to those who have served.

We can honor our veterans by ending endless wars, reining in our bloated defense budget and reducing the influence of defense contractors at the Pentagon, and bringing our troops home responsibly—and then providing our veterans with the benefits they’ve earned.

This starts with care in how we deploy our forces. Decades of wars have sapped our strength, and the burden has fallen primarily on military personnel and their families. It's not fair to ask them to solve problems that don’t have a military solution.
Mental health care is a human right. I stand with @NUHW represented clinicians who are going on strike across California to demand that @kpthrive ensure patients get the mental health care they need.

A Warren administration will protect the rights of LGBTQ+, women, Black, and Latinx service members. I'll reverse Trump's shameful ban on trans service members on Day One. My administration will protect veterans and family members of serving military personnel from deportation.

We must ensure the safety of those who serve or have served in uniform. I'll fight to eliminate military sexual assault, expand mental health services and work to end military and veteran suicide, and treat the opioid and addiction crisis.

Military families are the backbone of our armed forces, but they face unique challenges. I'll prioritize military spouse employment, ensure families have high-quality child care and education, provide safe and affordable housing, and protect wounded warriors and their caregivers.

Our all-volunteer military has struggled to attract and retain sufficient personnel. A Warren administration will preserve best-in-class benefits for military personnel, and ensure we honor our commitments to those who have served.

We can honor our veterans by ending endless wars, reining in our bloated defense budget and reducing the influence of defense contractors at the Pentagon, and bringing our troops home responsibly—and then providing our veterans with the benefits they’ve earned.

This starts with care in how we deploy our forces. Decades of wars have sapped our strength, and the burden has fallen primarily on military personnel and their families. It's not fair to ask them to solve problems that don’t have a military solution.

All three of my brothers served, so I know the responsibility our country has towards military personnel and their families. Today, I'm sharing my plan to honor our promises to our nation’s veterans, service members, military families, and survivors.

Happy #ElectionDay to all the states holding elections! Today’s our chance to elect Democrats up and down the ballot. Find your polling place at   and head to the polls to make your voice heard—make sure to bring your friends and family!

Our democracy shouldn’t be bought and paid for by the wealthy and powerful. I stand with Seattle council members, activists, and voters who are standing up to Amazon. It's time to get big money out of politics.
I'm not afraid to fight for the big, structural change we need. Thank you, Grinnell, for being a part of this fight for big ideas!

I’m grateful for every grassroots donor who keeps our people-powered campaign going. We’re ramping up for the next phase of this campaign—all the way to Iowa—and it’s going to take real resources. 

Will you chip in now to help keep up the momentum?

We need to be strengthening our response to climate change—but Trump and his administration are running away from our responsibilities. I'll move to rejoin the Paris Climate Agreement on day one of my presidency.
Facebook can rebrand all they want but they can’t hide the fact that they are too big and powerful. It’s time to #BreakUpBIGTECH.

I care about an entire generation of students being crushed by student loan debt—deferring their American dream because they can't afford it. I care about making sure every American has the opportunity to succeed. I'm not afraid to stand up to the wealthy and well-connected.

One thing I know he cares about—his fortune. He's a shareholder in Navient, a student loan company that has cheated borrowers and used abusive, misleading tactics. He even went so far as to ask how I might impact his investment in the last earnings call with Navient.

37 million people didn’t fill a prescription last year.
36 million people skipped a recommended test or treatment.
40 million people didn’t go to a doctor to check on a health issue.

Even with insurance, costs keep people from getting the care they need. We need #MedicareForAll.

The Trump administration's expanded global gag rule has had catastrophic affects worldwide, leaving millions without access to safe reproductive health care. When I'm president, I'll overturn the global gag rule and protect reproductive health care.
No one should avoid seeing a doctor because they don’t have insurance—or because the cost, even with insurance, is too high. This is why we need #MedicareForAll.

Wall Street is scared because the status quo is working great for them—but we know it's not working so great for everyone else. I'm not afraid to fight for a country where everyone can succeed, not just the wealthy and well-connected.

It shouldn't take a federal court to see Trump's tax returns. I've got a plan to require presidential candidates to release at least eight years of their tax returns—so voters can hold candidates accountable.

2020 is our time in history.

Our time to dream big, fight hard—and win.

Take it from @EricDicksonCEO, president of @UMassMemorial Health Care: #MedicareForAll is the only solution that gives everyone good insurance by cutting out waste and inefficiency from the system—so doctors can focus on patients instead of paperwork.

This cruel Trump administration policy harms immigrant families and has no effect on Cuba's government. What we need is a policy that puts humanity and families before politics. I’m thankful to Reps @DebbieforFL and @DonnaShalala for leading that effort.

I’m in this fight because I believe every person in this country should have a fighting chance at the American dream—and together, we’re building a grassroots movement to make it happen.

Washington is working great for the wealthy and well-connected, but not so great for everyone else. 

It won't be enough to just nibble around the edges. If we want to root out Washington corruption, we need big, structural change.

Teachers already have one of the most important jobs in our country. They shouldn't have to get a second job just to survive.

Teachers need and deserve fair pay—and I've got a plan for that.
This is disgraceful. We must do everything we can to block this rule—and we must pass the Equality Act to ensure that LGBTQ+ people's rights are explicitly protected by law.

We win when we offer solutions big enough to touch the problems that are in people’s lives. Fear and complacency does not win elections—hope and courage wins elections. #LJ19

The time for small ideas is over. We need big ideas to solve the challenges we face—and we need someone willing to fight for them. #LJ19

We win elections when we have solutions that are big enough to meet the challenges that people face in their lives. Because fear and complacency don’t win elections; hope and courage do. #LJ19

When you give up the fight on a big idea, you’re giving up on the people whose lives it would touch. Those fights are all of our fights. And anyone who tells you to dream small and give up early is not the person who will lead us to victory. #LJ19
We need big ideas that can fix the challenges we face, that can inspire people, that bring people out to vote. But most importantly, we need someone willing to fight for those big ideas. #LJ19

Your stories are written on my heart. I’m grateful to everyone who has shared their health care stories with me today. We need #MedicareForAll to fix our broken health care system—and I have a plan to pay for it.

Private sector employers are projected to spend $9 trillion on health care over the next ten years. Under my #MedicareForAll plan, employers will save $200 billion—while families will save $11 trillion. Read more about what my plan will mean for you.

Thank you, @BetoORourke. Your commitment to ending gun violence and uplifting the voices of the victims and their families has made this presidential race—and our country—stronger. I look forward to working together in the fight to end gun violence.
That’s my big boy! #LJ19
Woo-hoo! I love the energy at #LJ19. And there’s more fun to come—follow along at @TeamWarren.

I did the homework. I got the experts to check my math, and the numbers are clear: #MedicareForAll is the only plan that gives everyone in America full coverage. And we can do it without raising taxes one penny on middle-class families.

A clear majority of voters support my plan for #MedicareForAll, and a Democrat who supports #MedicareForAll easily beats Donald Trump. Fighting for #MedicareForAll is the right thing to do—and when we dream big and fight hard, we win.

I just released my plan to pay for #MedicareForAll. It puts $11 trillion back in the pockets of American families, and doesn’t raise taxes on the middle class by even a cent. Here’s how we’re going to get it done:

We wouldn't have gotten this far in the fight for #MedicareForAll without courageous activists like you, @AdyBarkan, speaking out and putting it all on the line. Let's keep fighting—and together, we'll win.

The Trump administration has pushed construction of the Keystone XL pipeline despite the known environmental and public health risks. North Dakotans deserve better than this. We need clean energy to protect our public lands and waters.
We can pay for #MedicareForAll without raising taxes one penny on middle-class families. Use my new calculator to find out what my plan to pay for Medicare for All will mean for you:

In addition to providing coverage for everyone, they concluded that my plan would slightly reduce the amount of money that the United States would otherwise spend on health care over the next 10 years.

This analysis was led by Dr. Donald Berwick, one of the nation's top experts in health care improvement who ran the Medicare and Medicaid programs under President Obama; and Simon Johnson, the former Chief Economist at the International Monetary Fund and a professor at MIT.
I asked top experts to examine my #MedicareForAll plan, and they concluded we can cover everyone and give them vastly better coverage—without a tax increase on middle-class families.

I am fighting for #MedicareForAll. I have the only detailed plan to pay for it. And we are the only Democratic primary campaign that has laid out the true, full costs of any health care plan, Medicare for All or otherwise. I look forward to others doing the same.

Achieving #MedicareForAll isn’t going to be easy, but I’m in this race to fight for American families. In the coming weeks, I will also release a transition plan—and I will start lowering health care costs and increasing coverage as soon as I’m sworn in as president.

We cover the remaining $11 trillion largely with taxes on big corporations, Wall Street, and the top 1%—and enforcing the tax laws we have now. Add in a targeted cut to a Defense Dept slush fund and that’s it. You’ll find full details in my plan here:
To cover the cost, we start by taking the money that employers are currently paying in the form of premiums to private insurance companies and have them pay it to Medicare instead.

I’m here to talk about something that people all across Iowa and all across America already know deep down in their bones: Our democracy has been hijacked by the rich and the powerful. We need big, structural change—and that change starts right here in Iowa. #LJ19
In a few minutes, I'll be live at the #LJ19 dinner talking with Iowans about the big, structural change we're fighting for. I hope you'll tune in!

In addition to providing coverage for everyone, they concluded that my plan would slightly reduce the amount of money that the United States would otherwise spend on health care over the next 10 years.

This analysis was led by Dr. Donald Berwick, one of the nation's top experts in health care improvement who ran the Medicare and Medicaid programs under President Obama; and Simon Johnson, the former Chief Economist at the International Monetary Fund and a professor at MIT.
I asked top experts to examine my #MedicareForAll plan, and they concluded we can cover everyone and give them vastly better coverage—without a tax increase on middle-class families.

I am fighting for #MedicareForAll. I have the only detailed plan to pay for it. And we are the only Democratic primary campaign that has laid out the true, full costs of any health care plan, Medicare for All or otherwise. I look forward to others doing the same.

Achieving #MedicareForAll isn’t going to be easy, but I’m in this race to fight for American families. In the coming weeks, I will also release a transition plan—and I will start lowering health care costs and increasing coverage as soon as I’m sworn in as president.

We cover the remaining $11 trillion largely with taxes on big corporations, Wall Street, and the top 1%—and enforcing the tax laws we have now. Add in a targeted cut to a Defense Dept slush fund and that’s it. You’ll find full details in my plan here:
To cover the cost, we start by taking the money that employers are currently paying in the form of premiums to private insurance companies and have them pay it to Medicare instead.
How is it paid for? Well, if you’re not in the top 1%, Wall Street, or a big corporation—congratulations, you don’t pay a penny more and you’re fully covered by #MedicareForAll.

Instead, we’re going to spend more on care itself. And thanks to getting rid of all the waste in the system, we can offer top-of-the-line care for all 331 million people in the U.S. for LESS than what we’ll pay if we do nothing to fix our broken system now.

Let’s get to the math! (All backed up by independent experts and economists.) First, we’re going to rein in the waste, inefficiency, and corporate profiteering by insurance and drug companies. And we’ll bring down out-of-control costs.

My #MedicareForAll plan would end the stranglehold of health costs on American families. It would return a whopping $11 trillion to families who will never pay another premium or medical bill. It would be one of the greatest federal expansions of middle-class wealth in history.

#MedicareForAll finally brings true choice to the health care system. The choice to see the doctor you want, to get the prescriptions you need, pick the job or start that small business you want without worrying about where your health insurance will come from.

The best plan is #MedicareForAll—the only plan that gives everyone in America full coverage, with the freedom to see any doctor, with no premiums, copays, and deductibles—so getting sick doesn’t mean you go broke. No restrictions, no surprises, no more bills.

Health care costs are rising and crushing families. And a serious diagnosis can financially ruin a middle-class family even if they have insurance. We let private insurance and drug companies profit from that pain. Enough. We need a system that reflects our values.

Today, I’m releasing my plan to pay for #MedicareForAll. Here’s the headline: My plan won't raise taxes one penny on middle-class families. In fact, we'll return about $11 TRILLION to the American people. That's bigger than the biggest tax cut in our history. Here's how:

Donald Trump doesn't want the state of New York to see his taxes—I wonder why. Let's call this out for what it is: Corruption, plain and simple. Under my anti-corruption plan, all presidential candidates would be required to release their tax returns.

It was so great to get a chance to speak with @AdyBarkan for his Uncovered project—sad to see it come to an end. I'm sending all my love to Ady and his family as they focus on his health.

I’m running my campaign differently: No fancy fundraisers, no federal lobbyists, or PACs of any kind.

Will you chip in $3 to help make our October fundraising goal tonight?

Industrial pollution has been disproportionately concentrated in low-income communities and communities of color like in Louisiana's Cancer Alley. We need to be reducing harmful emissions—not permitting more. These communities need environmental justice.
I love when math teachers take a look at my plans—the math checks out!
Thanks for being in this fight for big, structural change, @PGSittenfeld! We’re going to do this together.

A person's wealth shouldn't determine the amount of time they can spend with me—or any other presidential candidate.

That’s why our campaign is funded with small dollar donations. Will you chip in $3 now before our October fundraising deadline?
Thanks, @jvn! Calling grassroots donors is one of my favorite things to do—you're going to love it.
Rising sea levels will be catastrophic for coastal cities. Our climate is in crisis and the time to act is now.

I applaud my colleagues in the House for passing a resolution acknowledging and condemning the Armenian genocide. If we don’t recognize the horrors of the past, we risk repeating them in the future. We must honor the victims and pledge: Never again.

Uber, Lyft, and Doordash are prepared to spend millions pushing a ballot measure to undermine California's new protections for gig workers. We should all fight these companies' attempts to wield their wealth to block protections for their workers.
I’m so grateful to have you on #TeamWarren, @ZachWahls! Together, we’ll make the big, structural change our country needs.
I’m proud to be fighting alongside @Krasner4DA for criminal justice reform and an economy that works for all of us, not just the wealthy and well-connected.

I'm running to be the best president that money can't buy—but I can't do it alone. Will you chip in $3 to help grow our campaign? We’ve only got two more days before our big October fundraising deadline.

Giant corporations shouldn't be able to rig the system by scooping up government officials to get favorable treatment. So I'll ban them from hiring senior government officials for at least four years after they leave office. And if they break these rules, they'll have to pay up.

I gave up on not offending big donors and giant corporations a long time ago—because when we have big ideas, we get out there and fight for them.

I'm not afraid, and for Democrats to win in 2020, you can't be afraid, either. That’s how we'll make real change.

Person by person, community by community, we're building a grassroots movement to make our government work for the people.

But I can’t do it alone. Chip in $3 and join the fight—and I might call you to say thanks!
Communities are tired of seeing families torn apart and immigrants and asylum seekers detained—and they're speaking out. It's time to end unnecessary detention.

GM, Toyota, and Fiat should know better than this. The American auto industry should be leading the way to reduce emissions, not siding with the Trump administration to further pollute our communities.
We have to break the political influence of giant corporations and federal contractors on our government. I’ve got a plan for that.
Politicians are supposed to compete over how many voters they can persuade, not how many they can disqualify. It's time to end these arbitrary, undemocratic voter purges.

It's time to put power in the hands of working people—not just a select wealthy few.

That's why our campaign is people-funded: No fancy fundraisers, no PACs, and no special interest groups.

Executives have made it clear they're ready to “go to the mat” to fight, but that’s not how our economy or our democracy is supposed to work. Together, we’ll close the revolving door and break the grip of giant corporations on our economy and our government.

If giant corporations violate these rules, they will have to pay up: 1% of net profits for the first violation, 2% for the second, and 5% for any subsequent violation. For a company like Facebook, that could mean over $1 billion.

Giant corporations shouldn't be able to rig the system by scooping up government officials to get favorable treatment. I'll ban giant federal contractors, banks, and market-dominant companies from hiring senior government officials for at least four years after they leave office.

It's not just Facebook. Giant corporations regularly hire people from their government regulators to leverage their connections and use the allure of future jobs to get favorable treatment. It’s no wonder these companies have consolidated power without any real accountability.
Facebook is now spending millions on lobbying amid antitrust scrutiny—and Kaplan is flexing his DC rolodex to help Mark Zuckerbeg wage a closed-door charm offensive with Republican lawmakers.

Two years after serving as George W. Bush’s Deputy Chief of Staff for Policy, Joel Kaplan was hired by Facebook as its Vice President for US Public Policy. Since he was hired, Facebook spent over $71 million on lobbying—nearly 100 times what it had spent before Kaplan joined.

Giant market-dominant companies like Facebook, Pfizer, and Comcast strategically hire senior government officials who can leverage their contacts for corporate gain. If we want to root out Washington corruption, that must end—and I've got a plan.

I'm not taking a dime from federal lobbyists, corporate PACs, or PACs of any kind—because our campaign is powered by the people, not special interest groups with Big Money to spend.

Chip in now and I might just call with a big “Thank you!”
I'm grateful down to my toes for your support, @johnlegend! Looking forward to the day @chrissyteigen doesn't have to fight with the president of the United States on Twitter.
Good. Now it's time to end all ICE contracts with private detention providers. No one should profit off of our inhumane immigration policies.

Facebook's own employees know just how dangerous their policy allowing politicians to lie in political ads will be for our democracy. Mark Zuckerberg should listen to them—and I applaud their brave efforts to hold their own company accountable.

I've been a teacher, a law professor, a senator, and a candidate for president of the United States thanks to the opportunities a public education gave me.

Senator Kay Hagan was a tireless fighter for women, veterans, and military families, and a dear friend and colleague. I'm heartsick for Kay's family and friends.
Frances Perkins saw what was broken in our country and had a plan to fix it. One woman—backed by millions of people—was able to make big, structural change. And we can do it again in 2020.

John Conyers fought to make our government work for Black Americans as a civil rights leader and co-founder of @TheBlackCaucus—and that important work continues to inspire us. I’m keeping him and his loved ones in my thoughts.

Our students shouldn’t have to worry about where they’ll get their next meal. Under my public school plan, we’ll cancel student breakfast and lunch debt and provide free and nutritious school meals so our kids can succeed in school.

When someone is sent into our criminal justice system, it's not a single person. When a person is arrested, we have to think about how that pulls their entire family into the system—and how that family is treated.

We lost my friend Senator Paul Wellstone nearly two decades ago today—but we're still continuing his fight to make sure that the government works for all of us, not just the big banks, giant corporations, and the wealthy and well-connected.

The Democratic primary should belong to grassroots supporters and grassroots donors, not the rich and powerful.

Every Democratic candidate should agree: Super PACs have no place in our primary.

I attended public school—and when I grew up, I taught at public schools. 

I'm #PublicSchoolProud. If a public school made you, too, get your free sticker before they're gone:

I’ve got your back, Noor. Every kid should be able to feel safe and welcome at school—and Muslim students should never be denied participation in school activities. My public school plan fights discriminatory dress codes that exclude students like Noor.

We should fight back against measures that criminalize homelessness—not propose ones that will only perpetuate it. I'll fight to make sure those experiencing homelessness get affordable housing and access to the services they need.

Public workers who provide services that children, seniors, and low-income families depend on deserve fair wages and adequate resources to do their jobs. I stand with @SEIU521 and @SCCgov workers on strike to #ProtectSantaClaraCounty.
Thank you @TimRyan for helping ensure that American workers are a primary focus of this election. I'll keep fighting alongside you to level the playing field for working families.
Thanks for telling your story, Cecelia. I’m in this fight for families like yours.
I rang the alarm before the 2008 economic collapse, and I’m seeing serious warning signs again—but we’ve still got time to stop it. And I’ve got a plan for that:

I’m glad someone from the Trump administration figured out that our student loan debt crisis is crushing an entire generation.

Republican, independent, or Democrat—my plan to cancel student loan debt is a win for our economy and all of our students.

I'll move to rejoin the Paris Climate Agreement on day one of my presidency. We need to strengthen our response to the climate crisis, not run away from it.

America is at its best when we dream big and fight hard, and we must fight hard to defeat the climate crisis together.

American diplomacy was critical in bringing the world together to adopt the Paris Climate Agreement and commit to fighting climate change. Pulling the U.S. out of this deal threatens our security and economy—and our ability to fight climate change.

U.S. weapons may have ended up in the hands of al Qaeda-linked fighters and separatist militias in Yemen, undermining our national security and worsening the humanitarian crisis in Yemen.

The USDA owes them the truth—and the Trump administration must stop burying its head in the sand. The climate crisis will only get worse until we act.

It's time to live up to the promise of a high-quality public education for every student. My plan makes big, structural changes that would help give every student the resources that they need to thrive.

We must stop the privatization of public schools. My administration will end federal funding for the expansion of charter schools, ban for-profit charter schools, and ensure existing charter schools are held to the same level of transparency and accountability as public schools.

My administration will work with states to sustainably increase the pay of teachers, paraprofessionals, school staff, and school leaders, and ensure that they have the resources they need. And I'll strengthen their ability to organize and bargain collectively.
I will also push to cancel all existing student meal debt and increase federal funding to school meal programs so that students everywhere can get free and nutritious school meals.

I'll ensure that every student has the opportunity to learn in a welcoming and safe public school. That's why my administration will eliminate high-stakes testing, invest in evidenced-based school safety, and end zero-tolerance discipline policies.

My administration will also protect the rights of students with disabilities, LGBTQ+ students, English Language Learners, and immigrant students and their families so that every kid has access to a high-quality public education.

Integrated schools improve educational outcomes for students of all races. And integrated schools are demanded by our Constitution. My administration will fund integration efforts, strengthen Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, and robustly enforce it.

And we'll provide more funding for IDEA grants, repairing and improving school facilities and infrastructure, developing sustainable community schools, and providing grants to public schools for the programs and resources that are most important to their students.

Next, I'll make sure that we fund schools adequately and equitably by quadrupling Title I funding—investing an additional $450 billion over the next 10 years—and working with public education leaders and school finance experts to ensure that this money is allocated equitably.

I’ll start—as I promised in May—by replacing Betsy DeVos with a Secretary of Education who has been a public school teacher, believes in public education, and will listen to our public school teachers, parents, and students.

Funding for public schools is inadequate and inequitable, and our schools are more segregated now than decades ago. We don't treat teachers and staff like professionals, and we're diverting money from public schools. It's time to live up to our promise of a good public education.

I attended and taught at America’s public schools, and I believe in them. That's why I've got a plan to invest in public schools and ensure every kid in America has the same access to a high-quality public education.
What a fantastic night in Des Moines! This is how we're going to win—with a grassroots movement that's not afraid to fight for the change we need.
Thank you, Indianola! Together, we can make big, structural change. I’m ready to roll up my sleeves and get to work.
I'm grateful down to my toes for every single contribution to this grassroots movement. This is how we're going to win—by fighting together for big, structural change.

The CFPB was created because we needed an agency dedicated to protecting consumers and holding big banks accountable. Big banks haven't stopped trying to kill it since—but I'll never stop fighting. We need Washington to work for all of us, not just the wealthy and well-connected.

Big banks and their Republican allies have been trying to kill the CFPB for years, and the Trump administration is hoping the right-wing, pro-corporate Supreme Court will help. I've got news for them: Like it or not, the CFPB is constitutional.

The @CFPB was an example of dreaming big and fighting hard. People told me, go for something little. Go for something that the big corporations will be able to accept. I said no. Let's go for an agency that will make big, structural change in our economy. #DemDebate

After the financial crisis, I had an idea for a consumer agency that would stop banks from cheating people. Republicans, big banks, even Democrats told me: You’ll never get it passed. But I fought hard. To date, the @CFPB has returned $12 billion to American consumers. #DemDebate

We need to address the elephant in the room: How campaigns are financed. Today, I announced that I’m not taking any money from Big Pharma, Big Tech, or Wall Street executives. You can’t go behind closed doors, take their money and then expect them to enforce the rules. #DemDebate

I’m not willing to give up and let a handful of monopolies dominate our economy and our democracy. You get to be the umpire in the baseball game or you get to be a team—but you can’t be both. It’s time to #BreakUpBigTech. #DemDebate

I will outwork, out-organize, and outlast anyone—and that means Donald Trump, Mike Pence, or whoever the Republicans get stuck with. We can’t nibble around the edges. Democrats win when we call out what’s broken, and when we give people a reason to get in the fight. #DemDebate

My #TwoCentWealthTax on the richest top 0.1% of households will pay for:
✅ #UniversalChildCare
✅ Universal free public college
✅ $50 billion investment in HBCUs
✅ Cancelling student loan debt for 95% of the people who have it
✅ And more!
#DemDebate

The opioid crisis has been driven by greed, pure and simple. Big pharmaceutical companies pumped 13 million prescription pills into the small town of Kermit, West Virginia. During that time these companies made $17 billion shipping opioids to West Virginia. #DemDebate

The gun violence epidemic isn’t one and done. We have been so close to getting something done for years. We must attack the corruption and get rid of the filibuster—or else the gun lobby will always have a veto over gun legislation. #DemDebate

We need to get our troops out of Syria, but we need to do it the right way. Donald Trump has sucked up to dictators, cut and run on our allies, and worsened a humanitarian crisis in Syria. We need a president who makes our country and the world safer. #DemDebate

Here’s how I see it: If you make it to the top 0.1%, then pitch in two cents so that every kid in America has a fighting chance. My #UltraMillionaireTax would mean #UniversalChildCare, free public college, a raise for child care workers—and a whole lot more. #DemDebate

Taxing income isn’t going to get you where you need to be like taxing wealth will. We need a wealth tax in order to make investments in the next generation. As Democrats, we succeed when we dream big and fight hard—not when we think small and give up. #DemDebate

With a two-cent tax on the richest top 0.1% of households, we’d have enough to pay for #UniversalChildCare, provide universal free public college, put $50 billion into HBCUs, cancel student loan debt for 95% of the people who have it, and more. #DemDebate

We’re all looking forward to strengthening America's middle class. It’s why I have a new plan for expanding Social Security—starting with an extra $200 a month that will lift millions of seniors out of poverty. #DemDebate

We’ve had a lot of problems losing jobs. The reason is bad trade policy and giant multinational corporations that have no loyalty to American workers. They’re only loyal to their own bottom line. I have a plan to fix that. #DemDebate

I spent most of my career studying one question: Why do hardworking people go broke? One of the major causes is the cost of health care. The problem we’ve got right now is the overall cost of health care. We must stop Americans from going bankrupt from health care. #DemDebate

Let’s be clear: Whenever someone hears the term “Medicare for all who want it,” it really means “Medicare for all who can afford it.” #MedicareForAll is the gold standard—that’s how we make sure everyone gets health care. #DemDebate

I have made clear what my principles are on #MedicareForAll: Costs will go up for the wealthy and big corporations, and for hardworking middle class families, costs will go down. I will not sign a bill into law that does not lower costs for middle-class families. #DemDebate

We took a constitutional oath: No one is above the law, and that includes the President of the United States. Impeachment is the way that we establish that Donald Trump—and future presidents—won’t be able to break the law over and over again without consequences. #DemDebate

Sometimes there are issues that are bigger than politics. That’s the case with this impeachment inquiry. When the Mueller report came out, I read all 448 pages. When I got to the end, it became clear: This president obstructed justice, and did it repeatedly. #DemDebate

Two years ago, #MeToo started a movement—millions spoke out and shared their stories. I'm fighting for an America where survivors receive the care they need, perpetrators are held accountable, and we can all be safe.
