2020 is about the direction America goes, not just for four years, but for generations to come. There’s a lot at stake in this election, and I know people are scared. But we can't choose a candidate we don't believe in just because we're too scared to do anything else. #WarrenNYC

Corruption has put our planet at risk. Corruption has broken our economy. And corruption is breaking our democracy. I know what’s broken, I’ve got a plan to fix it, and that’s why I’m running for President of the United States. #WarrenNYC

When you see a government that works great for those with money and connections and doesn’t work much for anyone else, that’s corruption—plain and simple. It’s time to call it out for what it is. #WarrenNYC

Join us live from Washington Square Park tonight as I share the story of how working women organized to change the course of history—and how we can make the big, structural change our future depends on. #WarrenNYC
Honored to have you sing the National Anthem at today’s event. Together, we’re going to build a better future for your family and for every immigrant family living in this country. #WarrenNYC
The power to authorize the use of American military force belongs to Congress—not to the president, and definitely not to the Saudi royal family.
We need to break the grip that big donors have on our government—and one of the best ways to do that is with public financing for elections. I hope New York takes this important step.

Hispanic and Latinx Americans fighting for big, structural change have transformed their communities and our country—and we are stronger for their contributions. This #LatinxHeritageMonth, we recognize and celebrate their achievements.
What cheering in the Quiet Car looks like. Thanks @WorkingFamilies!
Grateful for @WorkingFamilies endorsement today. Together, we're going to make the big, structural change we need so that government works for all of us—not just the wealthy and well-connected.
Together, we can root out the corruption in Washington. We can make big, structural changes that will restore our trust in government. And when I’m President, that’s exactly what I plan to do.

That’s not all. I've also released plans to make sure that no president is above the law, to tackle defense contractor coziness at the Pentagon, and to expand oversight, transparency, and enforcement for all contractors hired by the federal government.

We'll fix our criminal laws to make sure we can hold corrupt officials accountable. And we'll ensure that our federal agencies and courts work for the people. That includes holding our federal judiciary—including the Supreme Court—to the highest ethical standards.

We'll end lobbying as we know it, strengthening our lobbying laws and helping to break the grip that lobbyists have on our government. The voices of corporations and powerful interests shouldn’t be the only voices influencing government—but that’s exactly what’s happened.

We'll start by strengthening public integrity rules for federal officials in every branch of government, rooting out financial conflicts of interest, and slamming shut the revolving door between government and industry.

My plan lays out the most sweeping set of anti-corruption reforms since Watergate—nearly one hundred proposals. The goal is simple: Take power away from the wealthy and the well-connected and put it back where it belongs—in the hands of the people.

But these problems didn’t start with Trump. On issue after issue, widely popular policies are blocked because corporations and billionaires use their money and influence to stop any progress. To fix it, we’ll need big, structural change to fundamentally transform our government.

The Trump administration is the most corrupt of our lifetimes. Trump is a walking conflict of interest, and many of his cabinet secretaries are no better. His Supreme Court Justices were hand-picked by right-wing extremist groups, and some of his donors are now ambassadors.

In 2019, just 17% of Americans trusted government to do the right thing. Why? Because our government works great for the wealthy and well-connected, but not for everyone else. That’s corruption, plain and simple—and I’ve got a plan to fight back.

Auto workers deserve good wages, comprehensive benefits, and economic security. I stand with @UAW as they strike to get what they deserve, and urge GM to come to the table and negotiate in good faith.

2020 is about the direction America goes, not just for four years, but for generations to come. There’s a lot at stake in this election, and I know people are scared. But we can't choose a candidate we don't believe in just because we're too scared to do anything else. #WarrenNYC

Grateful to be a part of the @MassDems convention yesterday. Serving the people of Massachusetts is an incredible honor. In 2020, we're going to dream big, fight hard, and elect Democrats up and down the ticket—in Massachusetts and everywhere in our country. #ActionAgendaCon2019
Grateful down to my toes for your hard work, Ara. But please do your homework!

Tomorrow, September 16th, I’ll be in New York City to tell the story of how working women organized to change the course of history after the Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire. I hope to see you there:   #WarrenNYC

Last year the Kavanaugh nomination was rammed through the Senate without a thorough examination of the allegations against him. Confirmation is not exoneration, and these newest revelations are disturbing. Like the man who appointed him, Kavanaugh should be impeached.
.@janicero is doing an incredible job leading @IAforWarren, and I'm grateful down to my toes to have her on #TeamWarren!
Woo-hoo! I love seeing Massachusetts ready to dream big, fight hard, and elect Democrats up and down the ballot in 2020. #ActionAgendaCon2019
Thank you, Massachusetts! If we dream big and fight hard together, we can win in 2020.
Amazon needs to answer for the dangerous and unfair conditions that too many of their delivery drivers are forced to work under.
I'm heartsick for Bee Love Slater and her loved ones. The murder of Black trans women is a crisis—and we have to act now to stop it.
It’s also another reason why we need to #BreakUpBigTech. Amazon's anti-competitive merger with Whole Foods isn't just bad for consumers—it's bad for employees.

Jeff Bezos committed to providing his employees "important benefits"—right before Whole Foods cut health care benefits for hundreds of employees.

This is exactly why we need #MedicareForAll.

Giant corporations don’t get to ruin the water for everyone else because it increases their profitability. When I’m president, I’ll reinstate the clean water rule to protect our streams and wetlands—and the drinking water they provide.
Keep fighting, @DebButlerHD18. Democracy depends on all of us being willing to speak out. #WeWillNotYield

This is appalling. We must use every tool at our disposal to end the HIV epidemic. That means funding research, reducing transmission rates, and ensuring that those living with HIV get the care that they need.
I know what’s broken in our country, and I’m in this fight to fix it.
Public defenders are under-resourced, overworked, and overwhelmed. My plan to reform our criminal justice system will empower our public defenders and make sure they have the resources they need.

That's why I'm fighting for #MedicareForAll. So that people like @AdyBarkan get the care they need. So that Rachael doesn't have to spend hours on hold, filling out forms, and fighting to get Ady's care covered. And Ady can enjoy the time he has left with his family.

The basic profit model of an insurance company is to bring in as much money as they can in premiums and pay out as little as possible in health care coverage. We like our doctors and our nurses—but I've never met anyone who actually likes their insurance company.

My friend @AdyBarkan has "good" health insurance, but it's not nearly enough. Every month, he has thousands of dollars in medical bills that his insurer won't cover. His wife Rachael spends hours every week arguing with their insurer. That's time she can't spend with Ady.

Our Social Security system should value the work of caregiving. My plan updates outdated rules to raise benefits for caregivers—on top of immediately increasing Social Security benefits by $200 a month for everyone.

That's why I'm fighting for #MedicareForAll. So that people like @AdyBarkan get the care they need. So that Rachael doesn't have to spend hours on hold, filling out forms, and fighting to get Ady's care covered. And Ady can enjoy the time he has left with his family.

The basic profit model of an insurance company is to bring in as much money as they can in premiums and pay out as little as possible in health care coverage. We like our doctors and our nurses—but I've never met anyone who actually likes their insurance company.

My friend @AdyBarkan has "good" health insurance, but it's not nearly enough. Every month, he has thousands of dollars in medical bills that his insurer won't cover. His wife Rachael spends hours every week arguing with their insurer. That's time she can't spend with Ady.

Our Social Security system should value the work of caregiving. My plan updates outdated rules to raise benefits for caregivers—on top of immediately increasing Social Security benefits by $200 a month for everyone.
The system is working great for giant pharmaceutical companies, but not so great for everyone who needs prescription drugs. I've got a few plans to fix that.

I absolutely believe we can make big, structural changes to tackle the gun violence epidemic head on. If we turn our heartbreak and our anger into action, we can take the power from the NRA and the lawmakers in its pocket and return it to the people.

Right now, Congress is held hostage by a small group of well-financed gun lobbyists. I will break the NRA’s stranglehold on Congress and sign comprehensive gun violence prevention legislation within my first 100 days.
At last night’s #DemDebate, I made it clear: We can't ask our military to solve problems that can't be solved with military force. We need to bring our troops home.
And that’s a wrap! #DemDebate
I’ve been a public school teacher. We need a Secretary of Education who believes in public schools—that's why I'll appoint one who has been a public school teacher too. #DemDebate

My story has a lot of twists and turns, but I was resilient. I kept fighting, and I lived my dream. I'm standing here today because I got back up, and I fought back. I know what's broken, and I want to be in the fight to fix it. #DemDebate
We like our doctors, our nurses, and our pharmacists—not the insurance companies. What people want is affordable health care. What we need to fight for is #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate

I just stepped off the #DemDebate stage feeling fired up about the movement we’re building together. Our campaign is 100% grassroots funded—no fancy fundraisers, no federal lobbyists, no PACs.

Will you chip in whatever you can to my campaign right now?

I got to live my dream of being a public school teacher. But by the end of my first school year, I was visibly pregnant. The principal said, “Good luck!” and didn’t ask me back. But I got back up, and I fought back. That's why I'm standing here today. #DemDebate

I’ve proposed a two-cent wealth tax that would mean #UniversalChildCare for every baby and child aged 1-4, would cancel student loan debt for 95% of people who have it, invest $50 billion in HBCUs, and strengthen our unions. #UltraMillionaireTax #DemDebate

I think I’m the only person on stage who’s been a public school teacher. Money for public schools should stay in public schools. I’ve already made my commitment: When I’m president, we will have a Secretary of Education who has been a public school teacher. #DemDebate

We need to fight climate change on every front. It is the threat to every living thing on this planet—and we're running out of time. I’ve adopted Governor @JayInslee’s proposal to cut all carbon emissions by 2030, and we need to tackle corruption in Washington head on. #DemDebate

What we’re doing right now in Afghanistan is not helping the safety and security of the U.S., Afghanistan, or the world. We cannot ask our military to solve problems that can’t be solved with military force. We need to bring our troops home. #DemDebate

Our trade policy is broken because it works for giant multinational corporations and no one else. If they can save a nickel by moving to a foreign country, they'll do it. When I’m president, corporations won’t shape our trade policy: Unions, farmers, and workers will. #DemDebate

I want to start with a statement of principal: Immigration does not make us weaker—it makes us stronger. As president, I will expand legal immigration and create a pathway to citizenship, not only for DREAMers, but for their families. #DemDebate.
I want to be as clear as I can: When Democrats next have power, we should be bold. It’s time to get rid of the filibuster. #DemDebate

Nearly 90% of Americans want to see background checks. Why isn’t anything getting done? Because Congress is beholden to the NRA. It’s corruption, plain and simple. Unless we address systemic problems, like the filibuster and the gun lobby, we won’t get anywhere. #DemDebate

Our punitive criminal justice system is devastating entire communities. If we want real justice in our country, then we need big, structural changes to reform our system from beginning to end. I’ve got a plan to do just that. #DemDebate

I've got a few! Tooba, a biology student, flew down from Kalamazoo, Michigan to join us. I also invited Melody, Erin, and Luigi, a few of our local volunteers. And of course, I have my husband Bruce. Houston holds a lot of memories for us—it's where we started dating!

At tonight’s #DemDebate, I’m looking forward to talking about our fight to make our government work for everyone, not just the wealthy and well-connected. If we work together, we can win in 2020.

Will you chip in $3 to help power our grassroots campaign?

Partly because of work and pay discrimination and caregiving responsibilities, women's average monthly Social Security benefits are just 78% of the average monthly benefit for men. That's not right, and my new plan to expand Social Security helps fix it.

I'm proud to be fighting alongside @maura_healey for big, structural change in 2020. We’re going to do this together.

Today's Social Security benefits are too small to give retirees financial stability, and the situation is even more dire for Americans who haven’t retired yet. So today I called for the biggest, most progressive increase in Social Security benefits in nearly 50 years.
Thank you, @SheaCoulee, for representing #TeamWarren and our grassroots movement at @RuPaulsDragCon! Excited to have you in this fight.

Everyone deserves a decent retirement. Try my new retirement calculator to see how much your Social Security benefits would increase under my plan:
Another big benefit: My plan will increase economic growth in the long term and reduce the deficit by more than $1 trillion over the next ten years.

So how will we pay for this? Easy. We can immediately increase Social Security benefits and extend the program’s solvency by nearly two decades by asking the top 2% of families to contribute their fair share to the program.

Those who face work and pay discrimination, like women and caregivers, low-income workers, people of color, and people with disabilities, have lower benefits in retirement. I'll update outdated Social Security rules to ensure everyone gets fairer benefits.

For the 63 million Americans who count on Social Security—including the 10 million Americans with disabilities and their families—my plan will provide more economic security. Money to see the doctor or do necessary home repairs.

My plan would immediately increase Social Security benefits by $200 a month—$2,400 a year—for every current and future Social Security beneficiary in America. This would immediately lift around 4.9 million seniors out of poverty and cut the senior poverty rate by nearly 70%.

Social Security has become the main source of retirement income for most seniors, but the benefits today are quite small. 14% of seniors live in poverty—another 28% of seniors are close to it. Seniors are cutting pills and skipping meals to save money. This is unacceptable.

It’s getting harder for families to save enough for a decent retirement. A generation of stagnant wages and rising costs for basics like housing and health care have squeezed family budgets. Millions of Americans are sacrificing saving for retirement just to make ends meet.

We face a retirement crunch that's only going to get worse unless we take bold action. I've got a plan to provide the biggest increase in Social Security benefits in decades—an immediate $200-a-month increase for everyone.

My stance couldn’t be clearer: These executives and CEOs know the system has been rigged in their favor—and they’ve gotten away with it for a long time. 

That stops when I’m president.
It's time for corporations to pay their fair share and put #SchoolsAndCommunitiesFirst. This reform is long overdue.

This is excellent news for Uber and Lyft drivers—and for every employee who has been misclassified as an "independent contractor" by their employer. Now let's keep up the fight for full employee status for workers across the country.

It is cruel and unnecessary to separate a kid from their family—especially after surviving Hurricane Dorian. We should be protecting and supporting families fleeing natural disasters, not punishing and traumatizing them.

Let’s be clear: This decision is racist and cruel. We should grant Temporary Protected Status to Bahamians fleeing Hurricane Dorian. A Warren administration will reinstate TPS to protect refugees who are at risk in their home countries.

Today, I’m thinking about the lives we lost on September 11th and the courage of the first responders, service members, and citizens who risked their lives that day and in the aftermath of that tragedy. We will always remember them.
When we dream big and fight hard, we win! Thank you, Austin—I’m grateful down to my toes.

I'm Elizabeth Warren and I approve this message.

This is a much needed investigation into Google's behavior. You can be an umpire or you can own a team, but you can't do both in the same game. My plan to #BreakUpBigTech would fix this problem on Google's ad exchange.

But that’s why we’re gonna keep fighting for #MedicareForAll—for families like yours and mine. Thank you for opening up your home to me and asking these important questions. We’re in this fight together.

Exactly. I spent a big chunk of my life studying why families go broke, and one of the top reasons is the cost of health care. After my daddy had a heart attack, we lost the family station wagon, and we nearly lost the house.

Insurance companies. Right now, the system is working great for them. They pull in as many dollars as they can in premiums, and pay out as few dollars as possible for health care. You know firsthand how difficult this system can be even for people with good insurance.

It looks like #MedicareForAll. Our current system works great for the insurance companies making big profits, but not for the families who have to fight them to get the health care they need. Big, structural change means fighting for a system that works for all of us.
My friend @AdyBarkan understands firsthand how our current health care system is failing patients and their families. I’m honored to be fighting alongside him for #MedicareForAll.

I am not afraid—and if Democrats are going to win, you can’t be afraid either. This is our moment in history. This is our moment to dream big and fight hard. Thank you, @NHDems! #NHDems2020

Everyone should own a piece of our democracy. At the #NHDems2020 convention, I talked about how we’re building a grassroots movement.

No PACs and giant corporations, just people—in New Hampshire and all around our country. Let’s dream big, fight hard, and win in 2020!
The energy of our grassroots movement—that’s what keeps me going. Thank you for coming out today for the #NHDems2020 convention!

Corruption.

Plain and simple.

This is why I’ve introduced the biggest anti-corruption bill since Watergate. #EndCorruptionNow

Woo-hoo! Let’s do this. #NHDems2020

Four auto manufacturers decided to reject Donald Trump’s rollback of fuel economy standards. Now Trump's using the Justice Department to attack those companies for embarrassing him.

That’s disgraceful.

For some candidates, “call time” means dialing up millionaires and asking for big checks.

Not me. Last night, I spent “call time” thanking supporters and talking with voters. Will you chip in $3 to our grassroots campaign? I might call you to say thanks!

.@AdyBarkan is fighting to make sure every family has the health care they need. Health care is a basic human right, and we fight for basic human rights. I'm proud to be fighting alongside Ady for #MedicareForAll.

Defense contractor influence is part of why we have a wasteful, unsustainable Pentagon budget. It's corruption, plain and simple. I'll make real cuts, and I've introduced sweeping anti-corruption legislation to limit lobbyist influence at the Pentagon.

Betsy DeVos's Education Department is denying nearly all applications for the updated Public Service Loan Forgiveness program and making it very difficult to apply for the program at all. It's time to fix this student loan debt crisis once and for all.
I’m sorry I missed you! I’m grateful down to my toes for everything you’ve done for this grassroots movement.

I absolutely love your designs! Thank you so much—I’m grateful down to my toes.

What the Trump administration has done to these children and their families is cruel and inhumane. We must stop unnecessary detention.

Farmers want to be stewards of our land and part of the solution to climate change—and we should be supporting them. That's why my plan will provide farmers with the tools and resources they need to invest in sustainable farming practices.

The best part of the #ClimateTownHall was getting to see all of the incredible young activists who built a grassroots movement to make it happen. That's how we'll stop climate change—by dreaming big, fighting hard, and organizing together!

You don’t get to ruin the air, the water, and the soil for everyone else because it increases your profitability. #ClimateTownHall

Washington is taking money from fossil fuel industries and big polluters and doing exactly what they want, which is mostly nothing. As long as those guys continue to call the shots, we won’t be able to make the changes we need. #ClimateTownHall

This is exactly what fossil fuel industries want us to talk about—they want to stir up a lot of controversy around your light bulbs, straws, cheeseburgers. But 70% of the pollution comes from three industries. We can set our targets and say no more by 2035. #ClimateTownHall

Don’t sit around and tell me what’s not possible. Look around and tell me what happens if we don’t make change. #ClimateTownHall

I have an aggressive plan to reduce our carbon footprint: By 2028, we won’t have any more new buildings that have any carbon footprint. By 2030, we'll do the same for our cars and trucks. By 2035, we'll do the same for our electricity generation. #ClimateTownHall

Climate change is an existential crisis, and it's going to take big, structural change to stop it before it's too late. Catch up on all of my plans to combat the climate crisis, and then join me on @CNN tonight at 9:20 P.M. ET for the #ClimateTownHall.
Why has Washington been dragging its feet on fighting the climate crisis? Corruption, plain and simple.

Barriers that hamper reentry for formerly incarcerated people—like restrictions on occupational licensing—make it harder for those who have served their time to find work and fully rejoin their communities. We should remove those barriers.
If we want more good American jobs, we need stronger unions and more power in the hands of the people. That's why we need #UnionsForAll.
This undermines Congress’ constitutional duties and is an insult to our service members. Trump’s border wall isn’t about security—it’s nothing more than a sign of his administration’s hate.

Climate change disproportionately impacts communities of color, indigenous people, and low-income Americans. To tackle our climate crisis, we must address the legacy of environmental racism and listen to those living on the front lines of climate change.

.@JayInslee provided bold, detailed ideas for how to combat climate change, and his ideas should remain at the center of our agenda. Every candidate for president should adopt his ten-year action plan for 100% clean energy.

I'm committing an additional $1 trillion to help transition to clean and renewable electricity, zero emission vehicles, and green products for buildings. We'll pay for it by reversing Trump’s tax cuts for the wealthiest individuals and giant corporations.
Climate change is accelerating, and we are already dealing with the consequences. We're running out of time. Combating climate change will be a top priority when I'm president.

Ohio lawmakers are bending over backwards to gut renewable energy and energy efficiency standards. This is a dangerous law. We need to act fast to stop climate change, not bail out its biggest culprits.

Climate change is an existential crisis. We need aggressive action—and we need it now. Nothing less than a national, grassroots movement will be required. Together, we can make the big, structural change we need to tackle this crisis head-on.

We won’t solve the climate crisis with a one-size-fits-all approach. That's why I've woven policies tackling climate change throughout many of my plans, from how we approach trade to sustainable agriculture and protecting our public lands. Take a look:

I’m committing $1 trillion to decarbonizing our electricity, our vehicles, and our buildings. This is on top of the $2 trillion I've already committed to green research, manufacturing, and exporting. We'll create millions of jobs and achieve the goals of the #GreenNewDeal.

.@JayInslee provided bold, detailed ideas on how to confront climate change, and his ideas should remain at the center of the climate agenda. Today, I'm adopting and building upon his ten-year action plan to achieve 100% clean energy for America.

Climate change costs lives, causes hundreds of billions of dollars in damage, and disproportionately impacts vulnerable communities. This is an emergency—but we also have a once-in-a-generation opportunity to tackle it head on with big, structural changes.

Thank you, New Hampshire, for letting me spend Labor Day with you! Let’s dream big, fight hard, and win together.

I began my campaign in Lawrence, MA, where textile workers—mostly women, nearly all immigrants—went on strike after their pay was cut. They put aside their differences and fought together for a better life. Their fight inspires and moves us today.

No matter how many times strikers and organizers have been told "it’s too hard, give up now," they've persisted. When workers organize and fight together, they win—and they can change America. #LaborDay

Unions built the middle class—and unions will rebuild the middle class. If we want more good American jobs, then we need stronger unions and more power in the hands of the people. I’m proud to be fighting alongside our unions. #LaborDay

DoorDash—recently caught pocketing tips intended for their drivers—is joining the fight for a ballot initiative that will allow them to exploit their workers and deny them protections. All Democrats should speak out against this proposed ballot measure.

Glad I got a chance to talk with ABS-CBN News about improving access to health care, strengthening our economy, and reforming our immigration system. I’m in this fight all the way for Filipino families and to build an America that lives up to our values.

Gun violence is a public health crisis—and our country is being held hostage by a small group of well-financed extremists. I will break the NRA’s stranglehold on Congress and sign comprehensive gun violence prevention legislation within my first 100 days.

My thoughts are with the people of the Bahamas today as they face #HurricaneDorian.

Florida, Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina: Be prepared, make sure you have an emergency plan, and stay safe.

I'm heartsick for the victims of this latest mass shooting in Odessa and Midland. We shouldn't have to live with this near daily fear and horror. We've already lost far too many to gun violence—Congress must act now.

Uber and Lyft are prepared to spend millions so they can continue classifying their workers as "independent contractors" to exploit them and deny them protections. The California Senate must pass AB 5, and all Democrats should fight this ballot measure.
I will nominate a Secretary of Education who has been a public school teacher—Betsy DeVos need not apply.

I’m proud of the movement we’re building together. We can dream big, fight hard, and win in 2020—with a campaign that’s 100% grassroots-funded. Own a piece of our campaign and chip in whatever you can before midnight.
As Hurricane Dorian nears Florida, please be prepared and stay safe.

I’m not taking applications from billionaires to start a Super PAC for me. You won’t find me at a fancy fundraiser asking millionaires for big checks.

Not me.

I spend “call-time” talking with voters and grassroots donors. Will I call you next? Chip in $3 now.

2020 is our chance to:

✅ Return the power to the people
✅ Save our planet from climate change
✅ Make our economy work for working families

✅ Return the power to the people
✅ Save our planet from climate change
✅ Make our economy work for working families

Will you chip in $3 or whatever you can right now to help make it happen?
Climate change is an existential crisis. We should be enforcing and strengthening our environmental regulations—not rolling them back.

If you own a home, you already pay a wealth tax—it’s just called a property tax. My #UltraMillionaireTax makes sure the 75,000 wealthiest American families pay their fair share of taxes on all other forms of wealth too, so everyone has a chance to succeed.
The Trump administration’s cruelty knows no bounds. Making it harder for the children of even one U.S. service member to achieve citizenship is a dishonor to everyone who serves.
Grateful down to my toes for your support, @BrandonCCD1! Let’s win this fight together.

I'm standing in solidarity with @UNITEHERE26 as they push @WestmontHotels for a fair contract at the Battery Wharf Hotel. My campaign and I won’t spend any money at the Battery Wharf Hotel until this labor dispute is settled—because one job should be enough. #1job #1u
I'm excited to be on the Democratic debate stage again on Thursday, September 12th to talk about the big, structural change we're fighting for!

Nicol wants to be a doctor.
Hilary wants to be an engineer.
Ilich wants to be an American.

As president, I'll reverse the Trump administration's cruel "Remain in Mexico" policy and ensure that asylum seekers will be welcomed at ports of entry.

My plan to protect our democracy would put an end to this kind of voter suppression. No more registration problems. No more voter purges. And no more letting states make it even more difficult for historically disenfranchised populations to vote.
This has to stop. Politicians are supposed to compete over how many young voters they can turn out, not how many they can keep from the polls.
If we want to fix the criminal justice system, we have to listen to those who have been directly impacted by it. I was proud to sit down with @BetterFuturesMN—and I’m ready to fight alongside them.
We’re up against our August fundraising deadline at the end of the week. Will you chip in $3 right now to our 100% grassroots-funded campaign? I might just call you to say thanks!
I’m grateful down to my toes to fight alongside you, Emmanuel. Let’s build a better world for every child in America.
Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s dream lives on. It’s our responsibility to carry on the fight for justice.

Thank you for being part of this race, @SenGillibrand, and for your unwavering commitment to fighting for women—from reproductive rights to paid leave. Your voice has been strong and clear, and your determination is always on display. I'm proud to keep fighting alongside you.

After release from prison, people are more likely to be unemployed, more likely to be rearrested, and more likely to overdose. Why? In part, because our prisons are not fulfilling their rehabilitative function. I talked with @BetterFuturesMN about my plan to change that.

Not good enough. Under my Corporate Executive Accountability Act, executives of major companies that knowingly hurt people through criminal negligence won’t just pay a fine, they'll face real criminal penalties.
It is our responsibility now to carry on the fight for Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s dream. We must continue the work—today and every day—for social, racial, and economic justice.

I'm particularly concerned that Trump is pulling millions of dollars from FEMA to detain more immigrants and implement his administration’s inhumane immigration policies. This is a cruel, dangerous move—especially at the height of hurricane season.

As Dorian heads towards Puerto Rico, the Trump administration must be prepared to provide assistance and resources. Puerto Rico is still suffering the effects of last season's hurricanes. Now is not the time for insults, delays, or playing politics. Lives and homes are at risk.

How candidates fund their campaigns matters. Ours has been 100% grassroots-funded since the beginning. No PACs or closed-door meetings with millionaires or CEOs—just people like you chipping in what they can. Will you donate $3 and join the movement?
This is a welcome—but temporary—victory. Make no mistake: These threats will continue. Congress must pass new federal laws that protect access to reproductive care from right-wing ideologues.
Big internet service providers have excluded millions of families from fast, reliable internet access in order to maximize their profits. I've got a plan to fix that.
Health care is a basic human right, and we fight for basic human rights. I'm proud to be fighting alongside my friend @AdyBarkan for #MedicareForAll.
Grateful down to my toes for your support, Alyssa. We’re gonna do this—together.
Here’s the idea: My #UltraMillionaireTax is a two cent tax on the 75,000 biggest fortunes in the country. So. What can we do with those two cents? Here are just a few things.

We have to protect our public lands for future generations. That’s why, on my first day as president, I'll sign an executive order that sets a total moratorium on all new fossil fuel leases, including for drilling offshore and on public lands.
You might’ve heard, but I’ve got a plan for that

Trans and non-binary people shouldn't have to face invasive and dehumanizing screenings to travel. We must do better—and I’ll keep working to ensure that every trans and non-binary American is able to live without fear or discrimination.

I can’t do this alone.

Person by person, we’re building a grassroots movement together. Can I count on you to chip in $3 or whatever you can to help keep up the momentum?
On #WomensEqualityDay we celebrate the progress we've made for women's rights, and acknowledge how much further we have to go. #EqualityCantWait—it's time to pass the Equal Rights Amendment.
Thank you to everyone who got out there and knocked doors for our #WeekendOfAction. This is how we’re going to win this fight—together.

We need a constitutional amendment to guarantee the right to vote—and we need to take action now to put a stop to racist voter suppression. I’ve got a plan for that.

The 19th Amendment enshrined a woman's right to vote in the Constitution, but the right to vote for women of color wasn't protected until the Voting Rights Act in 1965. In 2013 the Supreme Court gutted the VRA, and voter suppression is on the rise. #WomensEqualityDay
I can’t wait to meet her and hear all about her plans! Thank you for being in this fight.
Let’s win!

I stand with all the @CWAUnion members who are making their voices heard. @ATT must respect workers' rights to join a union and bargain collectively, and they should come to the negotiating table in good faith. #ATTUnfair

As part of my plan to combat the opioid crisis, I'll invest $100 billion for prevention, treatment, and recovery services in the states and communities on the front lines of this crisis. It's time to treat this epidemic like the public health crisis it is.

Under my Corporate Executive Accountability Act, executives of major companies that knowingly hurt people through criminal negligence—such as fueling the opioid crisis—will face real criminal penalties for their actions.

It's encouraging to see @JNJCares held responsible for their role in fueling the opioid crisis, but this penalty is much smaller than the harm they've done—or the money they made. We need more accountability, and more resources to fight this crisis.
I don’t want a government that works for giant corporations. I want one that works for our families.
I never get tired of these!

I love this! 

But did Spencer ever get to finish the last chapter, @TheRock?

Whenever I meet a little girl, I tell them "I'm running for president because that's what girls do." Then we pinky promise that they'll remember. I want every girl to know that when they fight from the heart, they can win. #WomensEqualityDay

Good luck to all the college students heading back to class this week. You’ve got this! Know I’m fighting for you all the way—from canceling student loan debt to making public college and technical schools free. (PS: Yep, that’s me as a college freshman in a dress I made myself).
Thank you, Seattle! I’m grateful for all of the hugs and photos, and a great conversation about how we’re going to make our government work for the people.
Smiling ear to ear!
Can’t wait for the Season 5 premiere of @BallersHBO tonight (Bruce and I still can't believe there won't be a Season 6). And congrats @TheRock on your marriage!
In just a few moments, we’ll be live from our Seattle town hall! Tune in to join us.

Donald Trump is a walking, talking conflict of interest. No president should be allowed to push the rules of our government to benefit their personal bottom line. My anti-corruption bill—the biggest since Watergate—tackles this kind of corruption head on.

Art Ramalho was an icon, not just in the boxing world, but in the fight for change. It was an honor to work with him during our 2012 campaign. He taught me how to be a fighter. Thinking about him and his loved ones today.

Two years ago the Burmese military began a campaign that killed thousands of Rohingya and forced over 700,000 people to flee their homes. Today and every day we must stand up for the Rohingya, for reconciliation and  accountability in Burma, and for human rights around the world.

A lot of giant companies refer to themselves as “American.” But let’s face it, they only have one real loyalty: Their shareholders. A Warren administration will halt the hollowing out of American cities and create good American jobs. Here’s how.
It's going to take big ideas and bold, structural changes to achieve the goals of the #GreenNewDeal. Climate change is an existential threat to all of us—and we need to act now.
Every American deserves a safe, decent, and affordable place to live—in Iowa and across the country. It's going to take big, structural change to tackle this crisis, and I've got a plan for that:
So good to see you, Randi—we’ll get a real selfie next time!
Great job, Atticus!

Right now in America, working people are getting squeezed. Wages have barely budged for a generation, but the cost of housing, health care, and education is rising. It's time to level the playing field. 

I’m running for president to make our government work for the people again.

My plan for immigration reform will end unnecessary detention—but I’ll also enforce strict standards for medical care for anyone in our custody. The government has a basic responsibility to keep the people in its care safe and healthy.
At least three children held in U.S. custody have already died of the flu. This is cruel and inhumane—and it will lead to more preventable deaths.
Climate change is an existential crisis that threatens all of us—and we need to take bold action now to stop it before it's too late. That's why we need to have a #ClimateDebate.

Donald Trump has no strategy or plan. His reckless actions drove his own companies into bankruptcy—now they threaten the global economy and increase the risk of a recession that will hit working families hardest.
I believe down to my bones that we can make our government work for the people. It’s the fight of our lives—but I’m not afraid, because we’re in it together.
There was a lot of energy at our town hall in Los Angeles on Wednesday. Day by day, community by community, we’re building a movement together.
Great meeting you, Sarah! Thanks for being in this fight.
Yup. The time for small ideas is over. We’ve got to be the party of big, structural change.

“Student loan debt.”

That’s an answer I get a lot when I’m talking to voters about why they’re in this fight with me. If we turn my plan to cancel student debt and make public college free into action, we can free an entire generation of Americans.

We can’t make big, structural change unless we elect Democratic women up and down the ticket and across the country. I’m proud to support you and all the women like you who have stepped up to put their names on a ballot!

The #AmazonRainforest is still burning, with thousands of acres of wildlife in flames. World leaders must come together to end this crisis—and President Bolsonaro must step up and take responsibility for these fires and their consequences.

We have a moral responsibility to protect our planet. My Green Manufacturing Plan invests $2 trillion over the next ten years in green research, manufacturing, and exporting. It will link American innovation directly to American jobs, and help us reach a #GreenNewDeal.

Every single day of this campaign matters. As Democrats, we have to be willing to get out there and fight for our country. No more defense—we need to play offense and be the party of big, structural change.

Black women are more likely to be breadwinners for their families, yet they’re paid less on average. That’s just wrong. We have a lot of work to do to close that pay gap—and I’m in this fight all the way. #BlackWomensEqualPay

My granddaughter Lavinia helped me welcome the crowd last night at our Los Angeles town hall. I love being her Gammy and sharing this fight with my family.

I loved her cardigan! Thank you both for coming out last night, it was wonderful to meet you.

Surprise, surprise. Donald Trump and his administration are rolling back regulations for their Wall Street big bank buddies. The rich and powerful are tilting the rules to work in their favor, putting everyone else at risk.

That ends when I’m president.

Our punitive system does little to keep us safer—and it is separating families and devastating entire communities. If we want real justice in this country, we have to make big, structural changes to reform the criminal justice system.

For the exact same crimes, Black Americans are more likely than whites to be arrested, charged, wrongfully convicted, and given harsher sentences. The evidence is clear that there are structural race problems in the criminal justice system. #1619Project
I hope to see you there! Chip in any amount to our 100% grassroots-funded campaign, and you’ll be automatically entered to win.

I've argued for years that corporate capture of the federal courts is a serious problem. It's getting worse. The next president must address it—and that starts by committing to dramatically increase the professional diversity of the federal bench.
Tonight’s town hall in Los Angeles will be a lot of fun—and the good news is that anyone can join. Bookmark this link, then tune in at 6:00 PM PT to join us live!
The Bailey bandana is my favorite! #TeamWarren
I love it!
It would've been even better if she’d brought her own Bailey!

Donald Trump and his team have hurt the economy, and now they can't get their stories straight on half-baked ideas to clean up the mess they caused. If they want an actual plan for how to avert another economic downturn, they should read mine.

The period after release from prison is challenging. I was honored to talk to @BetterFuturesMN about my plan to reform our criminal justice system and learn about the important work they do to help returning citizens with re-entry.
Happy birthday, Lisa! Let’s dream big and fight hard together so that your birthday wish comes true.
Persist, @DelegateGuzman!
I’m grateful that Brittany and Nikki came to our St. Paul town hall!
Notes from last night’s town hall! Can’t wait to read them.
Thanks for chatting with me, Ruth! I’m ready to work hard for the people of Minnesota.
I promised Willa’s dad: We’re going to fight for an America where every kid has a chance to succeed.
I loved meeting you and your whole family, Andrew! Can’t wait to see Cora run for president one day.
Let’s hear it for Minnesota! I’m thankful for everyone who came out to our St. Paul town hall last night. We had a lot of fun—and took a lot of photos.
Hope you had a great birthday, Kevin!
I’m glad to have met you, Bryce! I am so grateful to be in this fight alongside you.
Great meeting you both! Thank you for fighting to hold Big Ag accountable.
Yes we do. Proud to fight alongside @ItsDShawna every day.
We need to repeal the 1994 crime bill. It was a mistake, and the bulk of it needs to go.

The United States has the highest incarceration rate in the world. Our policies are tearing families apart and devastating communities—and they aren't making us safer. I've got a plan to completely reform the criminal justice system from front to back.

If the Trump administration gets its way on this, employers could legally fire trans Americans just for being themselves. This is discrimination, plain and simple, and we’re going to fight it with everything we’ve got.
Washington is failing Native communities, and it's time to fulfill our obligations to Tribal Nations. Deeply grateful for the opportunity to speak at #NativeVote2020 yesterday.
Great meeting you and your sister, Rachel. Persist!
Looking great!

I stand with @PPact.

The Trump administration’s gag rule is a deliberate attempt to keep providers like Planned Parenthood from serving patients—and an attack on women with low incomes who depend on them to get the care they need. We’ll fight this.

Our system is the result of choices we’ve made—choices that together stack the deck against the poor and the disadvantaged. We can create real law and order and real justice in our country by making long overdue big, structural change.

The majority of people in prison will be returned to their communities. We should ensure that returning citizens have a chance to succeed, by reducing discrimination and promoting opportunity during reentry and eliminating needlessly punitive parole requirements.

As we fight to end mass incarceration, we need to ensure humane conditions for those who are imprisoned. That means meeting basic human rights standards, protecting vulnerable populations, investing in rehabilitation programs, and expanding mental health and addiction treatment.

The president can grant clemency and pardons herself. I'll empower a clemency board to make recommendations directly to the White House, identifying broad classes of potentially-deserving individuals for review, such as those serving mandatory minimums that should be abolished.

Our criminal system places enormous power in the hands of the state, and we need better checks in place to ensure that it's just: by investing in our public defenders, reining in prosecutorial abuses, and allowing those wrongfully imprisoned to challenge their conviction.

Officers who violate someone's constitutional rights are often shielded from civil rights lawsuits by qualified immunity. That’s wrong—and needs to change. When an officer abuses the law, that’s bad for law enforcement, victims, and communities.

The president can grant clemency and pardons herself. I'll empower a clemency board to make recommendations directly to the White House, identifying broad classes of potentially-deserving individuals for review, such as those serving mandatory minimums that should be abolished.

Our criminal system places enormous power in the hands of the state, and we need better checks in place to ensure that it's just: by investing in our public defenders, reining in prosecutorial abuses, and allowing those wrongfully imprisoned to challenge their conviction.

Officers who violate someone's constitutional rights are often shielded from civil rights lawsuits by qualified immunity. That’s wrong—and needs to change. When an officer abuses the law, that’s bad for law enforcement, victims, and communities.

Most police officers sign up so they can protect their communities. But too many people of color have experienced trauma at the hands of law enforcement. It’s time to change how we police: funding what works, and building trust between police and the communities they serve.

We also have to stop criminalizing poverty. As president, I will fight to end cash bail and limit excessive fines and fees. There’s no justice in imposing high, punitive financial burdens on those who are least able to bear them.

Next, we have to rethink what we choose to criminalize. That starts with repealing the 1994 crime bill—the bulk of which needs to go—and legalizing marijuana. Overcriminalization has filled prisons and devastated communities—and it's time for it to end.

Investing in public safety should mean investing in good schools, safe housing, access to mental health services and treatment for addiction, protecting LGBTQ+ Americans, and violence intervention programs diverting young people from criminal activity—before police are involved.

Let's start by reimagining how we talk about public safety. It's a false choice to suggest a tradeoff between safety and mass incarceration. Instead of putting people in prison, we should focus on services that lift people up and make our communities safer.

The U.S. makes up 5% of the world's population, but nearly 20% of the world's prison population. And the evidence is clear that there are structural race problems in our criminal justice system. At every level, the system disadvantages or discriminates against people of color.

The United States has the highest incarceration rate in the world—yet our harshly punitive system isn’t making our communities safer. I've got a plan to make big, structural changes at every step of the criminal justice system:

Here’s the bottom line: If Dimon and the Business Roundtable are serious about their statement, we need to see real action. They can start by empowering workers and supporting my Accountable Capitalism plan.

Another question: Dimon and the Business Roundtable have been busy lobbying for NAFTA 2.0. Will they change their tune now and back American workers and unions who are fighting for a better agreement?

Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase, leads the group that put out yesterday's statement. Will he put his money where his mouth is and actually raise pay for workers instead of spending billions on stock buybacks for shareholders?

A year ago, I called out CEOs and the Business Roundtable for their single-minded focus on maximizing shareholder value at the expense of workers. Looks like they finally got the memo. But without real action, their announcement is meaningless.
Thank you to everyone who came out to our St. Paul town hall this evening! Minnesota is ready to fight for big, structural change.

Today at the @4DirectionsVote #NativeVote2020 presidential forum, @Deb4CongressNM and I talked about our new proposal: The Honoring Promises to Native Nations Act. Our federal government owes Native communities a fighting chance to build stronger communities and brighter futures.

Where our country spends its money tells you about our values. That’s why full funding for tribal infrastructure, education, and health care is at the heart of my ideas for Indian Country. #NativeVote2020

A problem not seen is a problem not fixed. We must raise awareness and tackle the ongoing epidemic of missing and murdered indigenous women. My administration will launch an unprecedented initiative to collect data, empower Tribal Nations, and address this crisis. #NativeVote2020
Proud to fight alongside you, @Deb4CongressNM!

Our federal government must recognize its ongoing failure to honor its trust and treaty obligations to Tribal Nations. Proud to work alongside @Deb4CongressNM on a proposal to uphold the federal government’s promises to Tribal Nations and empower Native communities.

I’m deeply grateful for the opportunity to participate in @4DirectionsVote’s #NativeVote2020 forum this morning. It’s time for Tribal Nations to have the resources they need to see the prosperity they deserve.
Glad to see some justice for Eric Garner and his family. But Daniel Pantaleo should have been fired a long time ago. And our criminal justice system needs big, structural change.

I met with Frank LaMere's family before today’s Native American Presidential Forum. I first met Frank when I launched my campaign, and I'm proud to talk today about how we can carry on his legacy by strengthening the relationship between the federal government and Tribal Nations.

I love calling grassroots supporters to thank them for chipping in to my campaign. Will you chip in $3 or whatever you can? I just might call you to say thanks.

The CFPB student loan ombudsman is supposed to protect students from getting cheated. But the Trump administration’s pick for the job is an executive at a student loan servicer that got over 9,000 complaints from borrowers. In my administration, the CFPB will work for the people.
Let’s hear it for America’s public school teachers!
These guys are looking good in Columbia, SC.
Congratulations on your final treatment, Claire. Your strength inspires me. Persist!

Yesterday, I talked with @BlackChurchPac about how the Black maternal mortality crisis is threatening the lives of Black women. I’m way past “Let’s raise awareness about this problem.” We have to do something about it.

I took on giant banks, and I beat them.
I took on Wall Street C.E.O.s, and I beat them.
I took on a popular Republican incumbent senator, and I beat him.

When we fight, we win—and I’m not afraid of a fight.
Woo-hoo! See you in September, @MassDems!
This is wonderful. Thank you so much, @erindraws!
Ayanna and I are running for president, because that’s what girls do.
Thank you Aiken, South Carolina! I’m ready to fight alongside you until every family in this country has the opportunity to succeed.
My plans aren’t just lists of policy ideas—they’re a statement of my values. Thank you to @blackchurchpac for inviting me to talk about how we can make big, structural change together.

The Line 3 pipeline would threaten Minnesota’s public waters, lands, and agricultural areas important to several Tribal Nations. I’m with @MN_350 and Minnesota organizers fighting to #StopLine3 and protect our environment.

We're having these important conversations everywhere—in parks, in grocery stores, on farms and at the corner store! And now we're making sure you can organize everywhere, too. I hope you'll sign up for this training and join us on Reach!

Wells Fargo forced Xavier to close out his accounts, yet he was still hit with over $1,000 worth of overdraft fees. It’s not right. I’ve been fighting for years to hold Wells Fargo accountable, and I’m not going to stop until they clean up their act.

I’m proud to team up with @Deb4CongressNM on our new bill to uphold our responsibilities to Tribal Nations and indigenous peoples and provide them with predictable, guaranteed funding.
Proud to fight alongside @PaaWeeRivera every day.
We must stand united with Tribal Nations and indigenous peoples to ensure that Native voices are heard and their rights are respected. With real structural change, we can write a new story.
Thank you, @Deb4CongressNM. It’s an honor to fight alongside you.
To everyone who gives me letters at town halls: Thank you! These came from the people of Nevada after our Henderson town hall. I love reading about what gets you in this fight—we’re in it together.
I got a lot of letters to read at our first-ever town hall in Arizona. Your stories inspire me to keep fighting. And yes, Casey: I’ll give Bailey an extra pet for you!

I’ve fought for a brighter future for Tribal Nations during my time in the Senate and I’m proud to work with @Deb4CongressNM on our new bill in Congress. And when we win the White House, I’ll be committed to achieving that future as President of the United States.

Right-wing courts have ruled that religious freedom laws allow corporations to deny employees birth control, but don’t protect tribes that object to dumping sewage water on sacred sites. Absurd. Congress should pass a new law protecting tribal religious interests in sacred sites.

When tribal concerns have conflicted with corporate profits or resource extraction, tribes lose. This has to change. When I’m president, energy projects that impact Indian Country won’t proceed without consent. That means revoking Trump’s KeystoneXL and DAPL permits.

In 2013, the Violence Against Women Act crucially recognized some criminal jurisdiction by Tribal Nations, and I support reauthorizing and building on it. But we need to go further and I support a full Oliphant fix.

Washington has refused to fully respect tribal sovereignty in criminal justice matters. This has deprived countless crime victims the opportunity to get justice. And it has fed the ongoing epidemic of missing and murdered indigenous women. This must change. #MMIW

Funding critical programs for Indian Country isn't optional. It's required to fulfill the United States’ trust and treaty obligations. So @Deb4CongressNM and I have teamed up on writing a bill to ensure predictable, guaranteed funding to Tribal Nations and indigenous peoples.

Washington is failing Native communities, and it's time to fulfill our obligations to Tribal Nations. Today I’m announcing ideas to ensure that tribal sovereignty and our trust and treaty obligations are binding legal and moral principles—not just slogans.

Last month, the FTC tweeted and advertised that the nearly 150 million Americans who had their data exposed in the @Equifax breach were eligible for $125 each in compensation.

Now they’re saying, “Just kidding!” I’m demanding answers.
My heart breaks for Tracy Single and her loved ones. This is an escalating crisis—and we need to treat it like one.

Our Grassroots Donor Wall is almost done! Every sticker has the names of Americans who’ve chipped in to help build our movement. I’m proud of this 100% grassroots-funded campaign! There’s still time for your name to be included—will you donate $3 now?

Eight towns, four days, one RV—and lots of terrific people and delicious food at the @IowaStateFair! Iowans are fired up to make real change in 2020, and it inspires me down to my bones. Here’s a behind-the-scenes look at our week in Iowa.

At our Wolfeboro house party last night, I listened to grassroots supporters explain why they’re in this fight.

One thing’s clear: People are determined to win in 2020 and make our government work for the people!

I love the North Country! Grateful to everyone who came out to our Franconia town hall yesterday. From ending the opioid epidemic to leveling the playing field for rural workers, I’m in this fight for the people of New Hampshire.

Heartsick to hear that anti-LGBTQ+ violence increased during Pride Month. Hate and homophobia should have no place here in America. Now is the time to get in this fight for a country where LGBTQ+ Americans can live without fear.
You bet I do. Here it is:
I’m humbled and grateful for your support, @DanielBiss! Welcome to @TeamWarren.

This is a crucial moment in the fight for workers in this country, and it’s time for us to show whose side we’re on. All Democrats need to stand up and say—without dodging or weaving—we support AB 5 and back full employee status for gig workers.
It was great meeting you, Tracy. Thank you for being in this fight!

First Disney acquired 21st Century Fox.

Now CBS and Viacom are merging. 

Consolidation raises serious concerns for consumers, employees, and the entire sector. The Department of Justice should be paying close attention.

It was inspiring to see @Hickenlooper’s commitment to bettering our country during his campaign. I’m looking forward to fighting alongside him as we work to elect Democrats up and down the ballot in 2020.

Activists, organizers, and community leaders are fighting tirelessly to end gun violence in their communities. We need to build on that momentum to tackle this epidemic head on. From executive action to comprehensive legislation to ending the filibuster—I've got a plan for that.

Israel doesn't advance its case as a tolerant democracy or unwavering US ally by barring elected members of Congress from visiting because of their political views. This would be a shameful, unprecedented move. I urge Israel’s government to allow @IlhanMN and @RashidaTlaib entry.

I'm heartsick for the Philadelphia officers and their loved ones, and grateful for the brave first responders helping people get to safety.

We don't have to live like this. We must pass gun reform laws to end the gun violence epidemic—now.

The warning signs for another recession are flashing. We need to pay attention and act now, while we still have time to avert a downturn. I'm calling on Congress and regulators to take action before families lose big—again.

I stand with airport catering workers at @DFWAirport and across the country who are fighting for a living wage. When workers fight, workers win—and we won’t stop making our voices heard until #1Job is enough.
Steve King must resign. His latest comment is a disgusting attack on victims of sexual assault. The people of #IA04 deserve better. We must work together to elect @JDScholten in 2020.

Thank you to the @WorkingFamilies Party for coming by our campaign headquarters yesterday! I was proud to partner with you to fight for the @CFPB, and I'm proud to keep fighting alongside you for big structural change in 2020!

For decades, Washington has done the bidding of giant multinational corporations that have no loyalty to American workers like Kim and Bella. They deserve a government that’s on their side.

As president, I’ll use every tool available to defend and create American jobs.

The Trump administration is making it easier to remove protections for endangered species. We have a moral responsibility to protect these vulnerable species and our environment. My administration will undo this disastrous move.

My plan for a new farm economy tackles this ugly history and levels the playing field for farmers of color. As president, I’ll end the policies that have perpetuated this dispossession and strengthen oversight of USDA to root out discrimination for good.

Farmers of color have experienced a long history of discrimination. From 1910 to 1997, Black farmers were stripped of 90% of their land—a staggering loss and a major contribution to the racial wealth gap.
One way we can break the NRA’s stranglehold on Congress? Eliminate the filibuster. Our country should no longer be held hostage by a small group of well-financed extremists.

"Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free."

Our values are etched in stone on the Statue of Liberty. They will not be replaced. And I will fight for those values and for our immigrant communities.

Heartsick to hear that anti-LGBTQ+ violence increased during Pride Month. Hate and homophobia should have no place here in America. Now is the time to get in this fight for a country where LGBTQ+ Americans can live without fear.

It was inspiring to see @Hickenlooper’s commitment to bettering our country during his campaign. I’m looking forward to fighting alongside him as we work to elect Democrats up and down the ballot in 2020.

Activists, organizers, and community leaders are fighting tirelessly to end gun violence in their communities. We need to build on that momentum to tackle this epidemic head on. From executive action to comprehensive legislation to ending the filibuster—I've got a plan for that.

Israel doesn't advance its case as a tolerant democracy or unwavering US ally by barring elected members of Congress from visiting because of their political views. This would be a shameful, unprecedented move. I urge Israel’s government to allow @IlhanMN and @RashidaTlaib entry.

I'm heartsick for the Philadelphia officers and their loved ones, and grateful for the brave first responders helping people get to safety.

We don't have to live like this. We must pass gun reform laws to end the gun violence epidemic—now.

The warning signs for another recession are flashing. We need to pay attention and act now, while we still have time to avert a downturn. I'm calling on Congress and regulators to take action before families lose big—again.

I stand with airport catering workers at @DFWAirport and across the country who are fighting for a living wage. When workers fight, workers win—and we won’t stop making our voices heard until #1Job is enough.
Steve King must resign. His latest comment is a disgusting attack on victims of sexual assault. The people of #IA04 deserve better. We must work together to elect @JDScholten in 2020.

Thank you to the @WorkingFamilies Party for coming by our campaign headquarters yesterday! I was proud to partner with you to fight for the @CFPB, and I'm proud to keep fighting alongside you for big structural change in 2020!

For decades, Washington has done the bidding of giant multinational corporations that have no loyalty to American workers like Kim and Bella. They deserve a government that’s on their side.

As president, I’ll use every tool available to defend and create American jobs.

The Trump administration is making it easier to remove protections for endangered species. We have a moral responsibility to protect these vulnerable species and our environment. My administration will undo this disastrous move.

My plan for a new farm economy tackles this ugly history and levels the playing field for farmers of color. As president, I’ll end the policies that have perpetuated this dispossession and strengthen oversight of USDA to root out discrimination for good.

Farmers of color have experienced a long history of discrimination. From 1910 to 1997, Black farmers were stripped of 90% of their land—a staggering loss and a major contribution to the racial wealth gap.
One way we can break the NRA’s stranglehold on Congress? Eliminate the filibuster. Our country should no longer be held hostage by a small group of well-financed extremists.

"Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free."

Our values are etched in stone on the Statue of Liberty. They will not be replaced. And I will fight for those values and for our immigrant communities.

Student loan debt is crushing hardworking Americans like Danielle.

That’s why I’m calling for something truly transformational: Universal free public college and cancelation of student loan debt for 95% of Americans who carry it.
Grateful for your support, Mike! We’re in this fight together.

Cherith is an Okie educator who teaches AP English Literature. She chipped in to my campaign because she’s in this fight with me to end gun violence, and to fix our broken education and immigration systems. I’m deeply grateful for your support, Cherith!

Person by person, dollar by dollar, we can win with a 100% grassroots movement: No federal lobbyists, no fundraisers with mega-donors, no money from PACs of any kind.

Will you chip in now to keep up the momentum?

Everyone should be able to access high-quality, affordable, gender-affirming health care. But the Trump administration is trying to roll back important protections for trans Americans. Help fight back by leaving a comment for HHS in protest:
Strawberries are in season and my grandson’s in town—that means strawberry shortcake!

The Walmart heirs make $4 million an hour.

A new Walmart associate makes $11 an hour.

My two-cent wealth tax on families like the Waltons would help level the playing field for working families and rebuild the middle class.
It was an honor to meet you, Chase! Keep dreaming big and fighting hard.
Got some lemonade at the @IowaStateFair!
This is a big win for @GavinGrimmVA and trans Americans across the country. When we fight, we win—and we won’t stop fighting until all trans people can live without fear or discrimination.

Trump’s #PublicCharge policy makes it harder for immigrants who rely on government services to get permanent legal status. Families shouldn't be forced to choose between staying in our country & having access to basic health care & housing. As president, I'd overturn this rule.
We’re going to win in 2020 by getting organized at the grassroots level—like at our house party in Des Moines on Sunday. Democracy starts in our backyards!
Ready to talk with @WorkingFamilies tomorrow about how we can rebuild the middle class and make our government work for the people.
The people of Hong Kong are making clear that they will not tolerate repression, and their movement affirms: The power is with the people. They deserve our support and the support of the world.
I’m grateful to be in this fight alongside you, @SophiaBush! We’re going to make our government responsive to the will of the people, not a handful of corrupt extremists.
Two years ago, white supremacy left another ugly mark on our history in #Charlottesville. We won't forget—and we'll continue to fight hate wherever it appears.
Making plans!
I loved meeting Masada and her family! Motion sickness is no fun for anyone—mom or kid. It happens to the best of us.
Bruce and I wish all Muslims celebrating #EidAlAdha a good holiday. Eid Mubarak!

I had a terrific time at the @IowaStateFair yesterday! What happens in 2020 is going to determine the direction of our country for generations to come—and Iowa is right at the heart of it. #ISF2019

When I’m president, I will send Congress comprehensive gun violence prevention legislation and sign it into law within my first 100 days. And we will revisit that legislation every single year based on new data to continually reduce the number of gun deaths in America.

Over fifty years, comprehensive safety measures reduced per-mile driving deaths by almost 80% and prevented 3.5 million automobile deaths. We have to do the same for gun deaths—and I have a plan for that.

I was honored to join activists, organizers, and community leaders at today's #GunSenseForum. And I’m ready to fight alongside them for big, structural change to tackle our gun violence epidemic. Here’s how:
Hey there, @KamalaHarris! 👋

Increasing taxes on gun manufacturers will reduce gun and ammunition sales and bring in new federal revenue that we can use for both gun violence prevention and enforcement of existing gun laws. Together, we can hold gun manufacturers accountable.
Thank you to everyone who came out to the Iowa State Fair to talk, share your concerns, and grab a selfie. I had a fantastic day!
Fun night at the @IowaWingDing dinner! Grateful for the opportunity to talk about my plans to make our government work for the people of Iowa.
It's past time to turn our heartbreak and anger into action. We need to take power from the NRA and corrupt lawmakers and return it to the people.
Thank you, @PeterMAmbler. Together we can end the gun violence epidemic and make our country safer for everyone.

Mass shootings capture our attention, but they’re just the tip of the iceberg of gun violence in America. Every day, we lose one hundred Americans to gun violence, with countless more injured and traumatized. My plan makes big changes to address all kinds of gun violence.
In just a few minutes, I’ll be at the #GunSenseForum talking about how we can address the gun violence epidemic head on. I hope you’ll tune in.

The dialogue about gun violence in America is shifting, thanks to the work of activists, organizers, community leaders, and survivors. It's time to turn our heartbreak and anger into action, and take power from the NRA and corrupt lawmakers and return it to the people.

And we'll revisit this legislation every year—adding new ideas and tweaking existing ones—to keep reducing the number of gun deaths in America. My budget will invest $100 million for DOJ and HHS to study gun violence, evaluate the reforms we pass, and suggest new ones.

We have to chart a new path, and that starts with investing in evidence-based community violence intervention designed to stop gun violence before it occurs. As president, I’ll establish a grant program to invest in and pilot intervention programs at scale.

Black and Latinx Americans have borne the brunt of the gun violence tragedy. But after being traumatized by gun violence, these communities have been doubly victimized by increased policing and strict sentencing laws.

In addition to ending the special legal immunity gun manufacturers have now, Congress should hold manufacturers strictly liable for gun-related injuries and give victims of gun violence a private right of action to recover compensatory damages from manufacturers.

This legislation will ensure that safe, responsible ownership is the standard for everyone who chooses to own a gun. We'll create a federal licensing system, require universal background checks, establish a real waiting period, and cap firearms purchases.
I will send Congress comprehensive gun violence prevention legislation and sign it into law within my first 100 days.

My administration will also protect survivors of domestic abuse by closing the "boyfriend loophole." And we'll reverse the Trump administration's efforts to weaken gun safety, including rules that enabled 3-D printed guns and make it easier to create untraceable weapons.
I had a terrific time at the @IowaStateFair yesterday! What happens in 2020 is going to determine the direction of our country for generations to come—and Iowa is right at the heart of it. #ISF2019
