This legislation will ensure that safe, responsible ownership is the standard for everyone who chooses to own a gun. We'll create a federal licensing system, require universal background checks, establish a real waiting period, and cap firearms purchases.
I will send Congress comprehensive gun violence prevention legislation and sign it into law within my first 100 days.

My administration will also protect survivors of domestic abuse by closing the "boyfriend loophole." And we'll reverse the Trump administration's efforts to weaken gun safety, including rules that enabled 3-D printed guns and make it easier to create untraceable weapons.

We'll require background checks for the vast majority of private gun sales, including at gun shows and online. We'll extend the existing requirements on reporting bulk gun sales. And we'll raise the minimum age for purchasing a gun.

From the White House, I will take executive action to rein in an out-of-control gun industry. Gun manufacturers make billions by knowingly selling deadly products, and it’s time to hold gun dealers and manufacturers accountable for the violence promoted by these products.

In 2017, almost 40,000 people died from guns in the U.S. My goal is to reduce that number by 80%. We’ll start with solutions we believe will work. We’ll update those solutions based on new research—and stop corrupt extremists from blocking action by ending the filibuster.

It’s easy to despair when our government refuses to act. But we are not incapable of solving big problems. Over fifty years ago, we took big steps to make our cars safer and since then, we reduced per-mile driving deaths by almost 80% and prevented 3.5 million automobile deaths.

The statistics are horrifying. Our firearm homicide rate is 25x higher than other comparable countries. Our firearm suicide rate is nearly 10x higher. Women are 21x more likely to be shot to death—most killed by an intimate partner. 21 children and teenagers are shot every day.

Gun violence is a public health crisis. That’s why I have a comprehensive gun violence prevention plan—a plan to make big, structural changes to end the NRA and corrupt lawmakers’ ability to block our government from defending the lives of our people.

In America, you ought to have a chance to build a real future for yourself and your family. But in farming communities in Council Bluffs and across Iowa, that’s getting harder and harder. 

We must invest in our farmers and our farm communities.
I’m proud to sign the #DownBallotPledge! When we fight, we win—and in 2020, we have a real shot to elect Democrats up and down the ballot and make the big, structural changes our country needs.

I applaud the 5th Circuit's decision upholding the constitutionality of the Indian Child Welfare Act. ICWA has been crucial in protecting the best interests of Native children, their families, and their communities for over 40 years and must be protected.

Fran’s home in Pacific Junction, Iowa was devastated by flooding earlier this year. As she showed me where you can still see the water line, I asked her why she thought this was happening. Her answer: Climate change. I agree, and I’m ready to take bold action to fight back.

Watching this little girl cry out for her father is a punch in the gut. The Trump administration’s cruelty knows no end.

I want to be very clear here: Families belong together. And when I am president, they will be.
Looking forward to participating in @MomsDemand and @Everytown’s presidential #GunSenseForum this Saturday in Iowa. I’m in this fight for our kids, for our communities, and for our futures.

5 years ago Michael Brown was murdered by a white police officer in Ferguson, Missouri. Michael was unarmed yet he was shot 6 times. I stand with activists and organizers who continue the fight for justice for Michael. We must confront systemic racism and police violence head on.
Voters shouldn’t have to worry about whether their ballot is vulnerable to hackers. We need state-of-the-art voting machines, ballots, and election security—and I’ve got a plan for that.
It’s true—I joined Snapchat! Can’t wait to continue to connect with our grassroots supporters.

Climate change is getting worse and is putting our families’ futures in jeopardy. We need to help American farmers use all the tools in their toolbox to fight climate change—before food shortages become a reality.
I’m standing with @gunsdownamerica, @AMarch4OurLives, and @AFTunion as they rally this weekend to urge @Walmart to stop selling guns. I hope you’ll join them.

Companies that sell guns have a responsibility to the safety of their communities. @Walmart is one of the largest gun retailers in the world. The weapons they sell are killing their own customers and employees. No profit is worth those lives. Do the right thing—stop selling guns.

Sometimes, companies recognize that they have an obligation to the lives, health, and safety of their communities. In 2014, for example, CVS voluntarily stopped selling tobacco products. Cigarette sales went down, and more smokers tried to quit. That's progress.
When I first ran for Senate in 2012, my team and I drove from event to event in a bright blue used SUV. It was great—but I think driving across Iowa in this takes the cake!

Congratulations, @AlphonsoDavid! Looking forward to fighting alongside you for a world where LGBTQ+ communities can live without fear or discrimination.
My heart aches for Pebbles LaDime Doe, Kiki Fantroy, and their loved ones. The murder of Black trans women is a crisis that we must call out—and address head-on.
Today I was asked whether the president is a white supremacist. I said yes.

Here’s a statistic that Donald Trump and the Republicans should pay attention to: Our country is losing a football field’s worth of natural land every 30 seconds. We must make our public lands part of the climate solution—and I have a plan to do just that:
Stopped for a quick drink at a lemonade stand in Harlan, Iowa. When life gives you lemons, make big structural change!
We’re building a grassroots movement to save our environment and restore opportunity to every corner of this country.
Yesterday, we stopped in Pacific Junction, Iowa, to see the damage caused by this year’s extreme floods. Climate change is real—and we’re already facing the consequences. We need to take action now.
Thank you, Sarah! I’m grateful to have you in this fight. That’s how this is going to work: You, me, and this grassroots movement are all in this together.
I'm grateful down to my toes for all the meaningful conversations we're having during our Iowa road trip. Thanks for coming out last night, Council Bluffs!

This is inhumane and will have devastating effects on the children that are left behind. Make no mistake: I'll keep fighting my heart out for our immigrant communities—and in a Warren administration, immigrant families will be able to live without fear.

Just days after the massacre in El Paso, fueled by anti-immigrant rhetoric, the Trump administration carried out the largest ICE raid in more than 10 years—separating families and targeting communities of color.
This is alarming—but there is still time to avert the next economic crash. I've outlined a plan for how to do it. And we need to act now.

Meanwhile, the potential shocks I identified are looming larger. Trump is escalating his incoherent tariff-by-tweet strategy against China. The chances of a no-deal Brexit have risen. No wonder markets are assessing a high risk of a potential recession.
New data confirmed other weaknesses too. New Q2 economic data showed slowing growth. There's a slowdown in construction jobs and manufacturing job hours declined.
We got more confirmation of my concern that middle class families are falling deep into debt trying to bridge the gap between rising household costs and stagnant incomes.

Two weeks ago I warned about a coming economic downturn. Since then, we've already seen more signs that our economy is in precarious condition and that Trump's rhetoric and actions are pushing us closer to the brink.
Mitch McConnell and Donald Trump won’t act—but we will. Together, we can stand up to the NRA and demand real gun reform to keep our communities safe.
I’m inspired by every activist making their voice heard in El Paso today. We are #ElPasoStrong—and ready to tackle gun violence and white supremacy head-on.
Amazon is using its monopoly in online sales to force companies to raise prices at its competitors like Walmart. That’s bad for families and another reason we need to #BreakUpBigTech.

Let’s create a federal Office of Broadband Access, and invest $85 billion into making sure every home in America has a broadband connection. That means publicly-owned and operated networks—no giant telecom companies running away with taxpayer dollars.

Just like workers need a living wage, farmers need a fair price. It’s time to fix the failed policies that are squeezing our family farmers.

Cyntoia Brown is finally free—but we can’t forget that she was denied justice for over 14 years. The words above the Supreme Court say "Equal Justice Under Law." We need to start acting like it, and that means standing up for survivors of sexual violence.
You heard it at the #AFSCMEForum first—I want a labor leader as my Labor Secretary.
I stand in solidarity with the people who protested Donald Trump’s racist rhetoric and inaction on gun violence yesterday. We must fight for #GunReformNow—and I believe we will win.

Farms are being crushed by failed Washington policies and giant agribusinesses, and many rural communities lack access to health care and fast, reliable internet. Our rural communities are being cut off from opportunities to thrive, and I have a plan to fix it.

I want Washington to work for communities all over the country—and make sure every community has the resources it needs to thrive. Together, we can make big improvements in the lives of rural Americans.
Agriculture has become one of the biggest polluters in our economy, thanks to decades of failed policy. By paying farmers to fight climate change and investing in R&D we can tackle climate change.

I have plans that will help bring affordable housing, child care, and accessible banking to rural communities. My new approach to trade policy will make sure we're keeping good jobs here in America and giving rural communities a voice in trade negotiations.

A whole bunch of my other plans will help rural communities, too. My plan to cancel student loan debt and provide free public college will help young people build a future in rural communities, instead of driving them to cities to find a job that can pay down their debt.

Here’s my new approach: Guaranteeing farmers a fair price—raising farm incomes and reducing taxpayer expenses. We'll pay farmers for sustainable farming that protects our environment and provide consumers with affordable, local food.

Finally, I've got a plan to overhaul our country's failed approach to the farm economy. For decades, government policy has subsidized industrial agriculture at taxpayers' expense while driving environmentally unsustainable farming practices and starving farmers.

This ends when I’m president. I'll create a public option for broadband and make sure every home has affordable high-speed internet. I'll crack down on anti-competitive practices and appoint FCC Commissioners who'll restore net neutrality and provide open access to the internet.

One of the best tools to expand access to health care—and unlock other economic opportunities—is high-speed internet. But big broadband companies exclude entire communities—especially tribal communities and communities of color—from fast, reliable internet access.

I'll also tackle consolidation in health care. If a proposed merger is a first step to closing hospitals or slashing basic services, then a Warren administration will block it. And I'll invest more resources in community health centers and closing today’s rural doctor shortage.

My plan starts with protecting access to health care in rural communities, which are rapidly losing access to basic services. That's why I support #MedicareForAll—and why I'll increase Medicare reimbursement rates to help rural hospitals stay afloat.

Everyone should have the opportunity to build a good life wherever they live. But as giant corporations and Washington keep cutting off opportunities for huge parts of the country, the shot to succeed gets further out of reach for rural families. I've got a plan to fix that.
I'm kicking off my Iowa road trip today! As we head into Iowa, I'm sharing my new plans to invest in rural communities. It's time to put their interests ahead of giant companies and Wall Street.

Voting is a fundamental right, and we won't let racist politicians undermine it. On the 54th anniversary of the #VotingRightsAct, I’m re-committing to making it safer and easier for all Americans to vote. It’s part of my plan to strengthen our democracy:

I’ve answered over 530 audience questions this year, and the hardest to swallow was from a little boy named Owen in Michigan. He asked, “How will you keep kids safe at school?”

No child should have to go to school fearing for their lives. We must take action on gun violence—now.

Two background check bills passed the House months ago. But Mitch McConnell is refusing to let the Senate vote on them.

@SenateMajLdr: Call us back into session. We need #GunReformNow.
Just like workers need a living wage, farmers need a fair price. It’s time to fix the failed policies that are squeezing our family farmers.

Cyntoia Brown is finally free—but we can’t forget that she was denied justice for over 14 years. The words above the Supreme Court say "Equal Justice Under Law." We need to start acting like it, and that means standing up for survivors of sexual violence.
You heard it at the #AFSCMEForum first—I want a labor leader as my Labor Secretary.
I stand in solidarity with the people who protested Donald Trump’s racist rhetoric and inaction on gun violence yesterday. We must fight for #GunReformNow—and I believe we will win.

Farms are being crushed by failed Washington policies and giant agribusinesses, and many rural communities lack access to health care and fast, reliable internet. Our rural communities are being cut off from opportunities to thrive, and I have a plan to fix it.

I want Washington to work for communities all over the country—and make sure every community has the resources it needs to thrive. Together, we can make big improvements in the lives of rural Americans.
Agriculture has become one of the biggest polluters in our economy, thanks to decades of failed policy. By paying farmers to fight climate change and investing in R&D we can tackle climate change.

I have plans that will help bring affordable housing, child care, and accessible banking to rural communities. My new approach to trade policy will make sure we're keeping good jobs here in America and giving rural communities a voice in trade negotiations.

A whole bunch of my other plans will help rural communities, too. My plan to cancel student loan debt and provide free public college will help young people build a future in rural communities, instead of driving them to cities to find a job that can pay down their debt.

Here’s my new approach: Guaranteeing farmers a fair price—raising farm incomes and reducing taxpayer expenses. We'll pay farmers for sustainable farming that protects our environment and provide consumers with affordable, local food.

Finally, I've got a plan to overhaul our country's failed approach to the farm economy. For decades, government policy has subsidized industrial agriculture at taxpayers' expense while driving environmentally unsustainable farming practices and starving farmers.

@SenateMajLdr: Call us back into session. We need #GunReformNow.

Toni Morrison's powerful writing taught us all new ways to lead, new ways to fight, and reminds us of the humanity in others. As I think about her passing, her words fill me with hope. “Your life is already a miracle of chance waiting for you to shape its destiny.”

.@JDScholten is a true fighter for working people and is ready to stand against the white supremacist propaganda that Steve King regularly spews. I’m certain that he can win in 2020. Let’s work together to elect JD and return the power to the people! #IA04
This is how we’ll end the gun violence epidemic: Taking real action to stop tragedies like the ones in El Paso and Dayton from ever happening again.
No parent should have to think like this. I'm in this fight for you and your daughter, Elena.
And we need a president willing to take executive action herself. I'll do everything I can—and I'll lead the fight for gun legislation from the White House.

Donald Trump is enabling white supremacy—and Republicans are enabling him. And when Congress and the American people have tried to fight the gun violence epidemic, @SenateMajLdr has put the NRA first. If we want action, we need to take back the Senate and end the filibuster.

If we want to end gun violence, we need to tackle corruption in Washington head-on. 

Right now the gun manufacturers—the guys who hire all the lobbyists and make all the campaign contributions—are pulling all the strings. We must fight it together.

Two background check bills have already passed the House. The Senate has an opportunity to pass them—but Mitch McConnell refuses to act. 

@SenateMajLdr, you must bring the Senate back into session to vote on this important legislation.
White supremacy is not a mental illness. We need to call it what it is: Domestic terrorism. And we need to call out Donald Trump for amplifying these deadly ideologies.

Republicans won’t act—because gun lobbyists are signing their checks. We must take back the Senate in 2020.

Will you chip in to help elect Democrats to the Senate? Let’s build a grassroots movement to beat back the gun lobby and end gun violence.

Make no mistake, tomorrow the @NRA will go back to doing the dirty work of gun manufacturers and blocking progress at every turn. @SenateMajLdr must call us back into session to vote on the two background check bills that have already passed the House.

I just talked to @Kasie Hunt about how white nationalism is domestic terrorism. And as Donald Trump has made one ugly statement after another, we’ve seen it on the rise. White nationalists embrace him, and the Republicans enable him.

Enough.
I’ll be there. Grateful to be fighting alongside you to end this epidemic.
We need to call it out: Fox News is a hate-for-profit machine that gives a megaphone to racists and conspiracists.
We must treat this like the public health crisis that it is. @SenMajLdr: Bring the Senate back from recess to vote on legislation to address the gun violence epidemic.

In March, I was asked about the increase in hate crimes since the election of Donald Trump. I want to be very clear: White supremacists pose a threat to the United States like any other terrorist group—and we need to use the full force of the Justice Department to go after them.

We need to call out white nationalism for what it is—domestic terrorism. It is a threat to the United States, and we've seen its devastating toll this weekend. And we need to call out the president himself for advancing racism and white supremacy.

We're waking up to the second mass shooting in as many days. I’m heartsick for the 29 people killed this weekend in El Paso and Dayton—and all the other lives we lose every day due to senseless gun violence. We need to take urgent action to end the gun violence epidemic.

Gun violence happens at schools, at places of worship, at work, at malls, at movie theaters, at festivals, and at home.

Gun violence can claim dozens of lives at once—and its daily toll claims dozens.

We have a gun violence epidemic in this country. We need to act—now.
I’m so grateful that everyone on your team is safe and accounted for. My staff and I are mourning with you for your friends and neighbors.

I’m so grateful that everyone on your team is safe and accounted for. My staff and I are mourning with you for your friends and neighbors.

The news out of El Paso is devastating. I'm heartbroken for the victims and their families. Far too many communities have suffered through tragedies like this already. We must act now to end our country's gun violence epidemic.

For decades, our country’s trade policy has worked great for giant multinational corporations—and failed American workers and their families.

We need a new approach to trade, and I’ve got a plan for that.
Whenever I meet a little girl, I say: “I’m running for president, because that’s what girls do,” and we pinky promise so they’ll remember.
The #DemDebate was a gazillion times more fun with family in the audience! I’m grateful that my nephew Mark, his wife Melinda, and the kids came to Detroit from Oklahoma City to cheer me on.
Conversion therapy is cruel and inhumane. I’m glad to see North Carolina ban it. I won’t stop fighting till every LGBTQ+ American is free to be who they are and live without fear or discrimination.
I’m glad I stayed till the end to meet you, David!
Michelle Wu has always been a fighter—as one of my students at Harvard law, and now as a Boston city councilor. I’m deeply grateful to have you on our team, @WuTrain!
Officer Pantaleo should be fired. Eric Garner's family has waited too long for justice—we need more civilian oversight to hold police accountable when they fail.
Looking great, @RogerLau and @Deb4CongressNM!

We're not going to solve the urgent problems our country faces with small ideas and spinelessness. We're going to solve them with big, structural change.

I know what's broken in this country, I know how to fix it, and I will build a movement to make it happen.

Grateful for the warm welcome at last night's town hall in Tempe, Arizona! I’ve been to 25 states and Puerto Rico (and counting!) since launching my campaign, because I’m running to be president of all the United States.
We’re live from our Tempe, Arizona town hall! Tune in now.
Looking forward to being a part of @AFSCME’s presidential forum on Saturday. I’ll never stop fighting for America’s workers.

Income for middle class families hasn’t kept up with the rising costs of basics like housing, child care, and education. We need big, structural change to our economy so families have more financial security. That’s why I’m running for president.

We need an entirely new approach to trade that uses every tool in the toolbox to help American families. My trade plan focuses on investing in American workers & using our leverage to raise global standards so that we can compete on a level playing field.
We absolutely must be tough on China, but this haphazard approach of tariff by tweet is hurting American farmers and consumers. There’s no coherent plan beyond more and more escalation.
Tech giants have armies of lawyers and lobbyists working around the clock to protect their interests. It’s dangerous for our democracy and our economy. We must #BreakUpBigTech.

Billionaires like an heir to the Walmart fortune shouldn't be able to shovel unlimited funds into super PACs on a candidate’s behalf. It’s why I’d reject a billionaire-funded super PAC, and why I support overturning Citizens United. We can win with a 100% grassroots movement.

Let’s be clear: Layleen Cubilette-Polanco should still be alive. Solitary confinement is cruel and inhumane. We must end this practice, enforce strict standards for medical care, and provide extra layers of protection for LGBTQ+ people.
I promise to fight my heart out for workers across the country.

Under my trade proposal, we will:

☑️ Negotiate and approve trade agreements through a transparent process

My team sends great texts! Text FIGHT to 24477 for updates from @TeamWarren (and maybe the occasional photo of Bailey).
This is what optimism is all about, @VanJones68!

The way you run a campaign should reflect your values. Ours is 100% grassroots-funded—no federal lobbyists, mega-donor fundraisers, or PAC money of any kind.

Will you join our movement and chip in $3 before our July fundraising deadline at midnight?

I read the Mueller report the day it came out, and it was clear to me that it’s a referral for impeachment. Now it’s up to Congress to act. No one is above the law—not even the president of the United States. #DemDebate2

America’s trade policies have put giant multinational corporations ahead of American workers, families, farmers, and the environment. I’ve got a plan to change that. I’m proposing a new approach to trade—on our terms. #DemDebate2

Last month was the hottest June on record. Flooding and extreme weather have devastated communities and caused billions of dollars in damage this year. Climate change is real and it’s here. We need to take big, bold action now—starting with a #GreenNewDeal. #DemDebate2

Immigrants are our neighbors, colleagues, and friends—and every bit as American as those who were born in the U.S. We need a rule-based immigration system that is fair, humane, and reflects our values. I've got a plan to make that a reality. #DemDebate2

Patients are rationing medication, putting their lives and health at risk. Families are begging strangers to help cover medical costs—including necessary care their insurance refuses to cover. This system is failing us. That's why I'm fighting for #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate

We need to know how many U.S. citizens have been detained, how long they've been held, and under what conditions. And we need to know whether agents are using racial profiling when making these wrongful arrests and detentions.

U.S. citizens—including 18-year-old Francisco Erwin Galicia and 9-year-old Julia Isabel Amparo Medina—have been detained by @CBP and @ICEgov despite presenting proof of citizenship. I'm demanding an investigation into this unacceptable abuse of power.

Equifax has botched its response to the data breach at every step. We can't count on @Equifax to do the right thing. We need to pass laws that will actually hold them accountable—and I’ve got a bill to do just that.

The government works great—for a thinner and thinner slice at the top. If we want big, structural change, we need to get big money out of politics and #EndCitizensUnited. I'm proud to sign the @USAPromise Candidate Pledge in support of the #28thAmendment.
I love it! Thank you for your support.

There’s a lot at stake for our democracy. But we can't choose a candidate we don't believe in just because we’re afraid. 

I’m not afraid.
I’m not here to talk about what’s not possible. I’m here to fight for big, structural change.
Running for president: That’s what girls do! I’m grateful for your support.

Climate change. Student loan debt. Big tech monopolies. You bet I have a plan to help solve these problems—and I believe down to my bones that we can make it happen if we work together. Chip in $3 now if you believe it, too.

Thank you, Jackie. We can only do this together!
I’m not afraid—and for Democrats to win in 2020, you can’t be afraid either.

I’m so grateful for your support tonight. Whether you joined this grassroots movement a few months or just a few minutes ago—it’s an honor to have you in this fight. Help keep powering this movement, and chip in tonight. #DemDebate
We can’t choose a candidate we don’t believe in just because we’re too scared to do anything else. And we can’t ask other people to vote for a candidate we don’t believe in.

I just stepped off the #DemDebate stage feeling grateful and inspired. Person by person, community by community, I believe we can win in 2020. Will you chip in $3 right now to help me return the power to the people?

The Democrats are the party of big, structural change. We need to give people a reason to show up and vote. We must build a grassroots movement across this country, person by person, dollar by dollar. I will not only beat Trump—I’ll start making real change come 2021. #DemDebate

The U.S. is not going to use nuclear weapons preemptively, and we need to say so to the entire world. Our first responsibility is to keep ourselves safe. Our military is the best on earth—but we need to use every diplomatic tool we have to prevent nuclear conflict. #DemDebate

I’m proposing a two-cent wealth tax on the 75,000 wealthiest families—those worth over $50 million. We’d use that to pay for big, structural changes like #UniversalChildCare, universal free public college, & cancel student loan debt for 95% of Americans with that debt. #DemDebate

People want access to our markets—so we need to hold other countries to standards. Right now the whole game is working for the big multinational corporations, not American workers. We need to change that. #DemDebate

For decades we’ve had a trade policy written by giant multinational corporations. They have no loyalty or patriotism. If they can make a nickel by moving a plant overseas, they’ll do it. My new trade plan puts small businesses, farmers, and entrepreneurs at the table. #DemDebate

My education plan invests a minimum of $50 billion in HBCUs and Minority-Serving Institutions. That’s one step our country must take to level the playing field for Black and Brown Americans. #DemDebate
We need to call out white supremacy for what it is: Domestic terrorism—and that poses a threat to America. #DemDebate
I genuinely do not understand why anyone would go to all the trouble of running for president just to get up on this stage and talk about what’s not possible. #DemDebate

Climate change is an existential crisis in our world. It puts everything living on our planet at risk. My Green Manufacturing plan would invest $2 trillion in green research and exporting, and create 1.2 million new American jobs in green manufacturing. #DemDebate
I genuinely do not understand why anyone would go to all the trouble of running for president just to get up on this stage and talk about what’s not possible. #DemDebate

I took on the big banks, and I beat them. I took on Wall Street CEOs, and I beat them. I took on a popular incumbent senator, and I beat him. 

Democrats win when we go out there and fight for it. I’m not afraid. And for Democrats to win, you can’t be afraid either. #DemDebate

Rules matter. And it matters if we say our rule is to put people in cages. What we need to do is have a sane immigration system that keeps us safe, but does not criminalize mothers and babies fleeing violence and seeking refuge in America. #DemDebate
We have to be an America that is clear on immigration. We need to expand legal immigration and fix the crisis at the border. What we can’t do is play into Donald Trump’s hands. #DemDebate

The problem is that right now the criminalization statute is what gives Trump the ability to take children away from their parents & lock up people at our borders. We must be a country that lives our values. That means we cannot make it a crime to come to our country. #DemDebate

Washington works great for the giant drug companies and insurance companies. Let’s be clear: These insurance companies don’t have a god-given right to suck billions of dollars out of our health care system. We need to have the courage to fight back. #DemDebate

We can’t choose a candidate we don’t believe in just because we’re too scared to do anything else. And we can’t ask other people to vote for a candidate we don’t believe in.

I just stepped off the #DemDebate stage feeling grateful and inspired. Person by person, community by community, I believe we can win in 2020. Will you chip in $3 right now to help me return the power to the people?

The Democrats are the party of big, structural change. We need to give people a reason to show up and vote. We must build a grassroots movement across this country, person by person, dollar by dollar. I will not only beat Trump—I’ll start making real change come 2021. #DemDebate

The U.S. is not going to use nuclear weapons preemptively, and we need to say so to the entire world. Our first responsibility is to keep ourselves safe. Our military is the best on earth—but we need to use every diplomatic tool we have to prevent nuclear conflict. #DemDebate

I’m proposing a two-cent wealth tax on the 75,000 wealthiest families—those worth over $50 million. We’d use that to pay for big, structural changes like #UniversalChildCare, universal free public college, & cancel student loan debt for 95% of Americans with that debt. #DemDebate

People want access to our markets—so we need to hold other countries to standards. Right now the whole game is working for the big multinational corporations, not American workers. We need to change that. #DemDebate

For decades we’ve had a trade policy written by giant multinational corporations. They have no loyalty or patriotism. If they can make a nickel by moving a plant overseas, they’ll do it. My new trade plan puts small businesses, farmers, and entrepreneurs at the table. #DemDebate

My education plan invests a minimum of $50 billion in HBCUs and Minority-Serving Institutions. That’s one step our country must take to level the playing field for Black and Brown Americans. #DemDebate
We need to call out white supremacy for what it is: Domestic terrorism—and that poses a threat to America. #DemDebate
I genuinely do not understand why anyone would go to all the trouble of running for president just to get up on this stage and talk about what’s not possible. #DemDebate

Climate change is an existential crisis in our world. It puts everything living on our planet at risk. My Green Manufacturing plan would invest $2 trillion in green research and exporting, and create 1.2 million new American jobs in green manufacturing. #DemDebate
I genuinely do not understand why anyone would go to all the trouble of running for president just to get up on this stage and talk about what’s not possible. #DemDebate

I took on the big banks, and I beat them. I took on Wall Street CEOs, and I beat them. I took on a popular incumbent senator, and I beat him. 

Democrats win when we go out there and fight for it. I’m not afraid. And for Democrats to win, you can’t be afraid either. #DemDebate

Rules matter. And it matters if we say our rule is to put people in cages. What we need to do is have a sane immigration system that keeps us safe, but does not criminalize mothers and babies fleeing violence and seeking refuge in America. #DemDebate
We have to be an America that is clear on immigration. We need to expand legal immigration and fix the crisis at the border. What we can’t do is play into Donald Trump’s hands. #DemDebate

The problem is that right now the criminalization statute is what gives Trump the ability to take children away from their parents & lock up people at our borders. We must be a country that lives our values. That means we cannot make it a crime to come to our country. #DemDebate

Washington works great for the giant drug companies and insurance companies. Let’s be clear: These insurance companies don’t have a god-given right to suck billions of dollars out of our health care system. We need to have the courage to fight back. #DemDebate

The basic profit model of insurance companies is taking as much money possible in premiums, and pay as little as possible in coverage. Giant corporations and billionaires should pay more taxes, and middle-class families should pay less out of pocket for health care. #DemDebate

Families are losing their loved ones because they can’t afford life saving medication like insulin. Congress has a duty to act. That’s why I’m fighting to make high-quality, affordable health care accessible to everyone—no exceptions. #DemDebate

One third of donations made through @gofundme go towards helping people pay for health care—including plenty of families who have health insurance and still get hit with crushing medical bills. The system is broken. #DemDebate

Insurance companies sucked $23 billion out of our health care system last year. They profited on the backs of people like @AdyBarkan. Unfortunately, there are so many other stories like his. #DemDebate

My friend @AdyBarkan is a hero not just to me, but to everyone whose health care he’s fought for. When the #GOPTaxScam was poised to cut Medicare—a program that millions of Americans rely on—Ady fought back hard. His story reminds us: We need #MedicareForAll.
Health care is a basic human right—and we fight for basic human rights. I'll keep fighting until everyone has access to the health care they need. #MedicareForAll #DemDebate

We’re not going to solve the problems we face with small ideas and spinelessness. We need to be the party of big, structural change. I understand what’s broken, I know how to fix it—and I’m willing to fight to make it happen. #DemDebate
Looking forward to taking the stage at the #DemDebate in just a few minutes. Let’s do this!

My second-grade teacher, Mrs. Lee, changed my whole world (and gave the best hugs). I was happy to learn that Ellie, who won @TeamWarren’s contest to join us for the #DemDebate in Detroit, is a second-grade teacher, too! Let’s hear it for America’s teachers.
On my way to the #DemDebate!
Wow! Thankful for your support, @McGovernMA. Together we’ll fight for the big, structural change that Americans want to see.
Grateful to have your support, @KatherineClark. I promise to fight for every family as hard as I fight for mine.
Thank you, @EdMarkey! You don’t get what you don’t fight for—and I’m ready to give this fight all I’ve got. Grateful for your friendship and support.
Adam and Miranda—thank you for the letters you gave me at our Toledo town hall last night. You inspire me to keep fighting.
Thank you, @Andy_Levin! We’re in this fight to build a  grassroots movement together.
Thankful for your support, @standwithraul. I’m ready to fight my heart out for working families and make sure our country works for everyone—not just the wealthy and well connected.
This fight is about a brighter future for Native communities, for New Mexico, and for our country. Humbled to fight alongside a trailblazer and friend like @Deb4CongressNM.

It was great talking with @Jaden_Reports after last night’s town hall in Toledo. He had some important questions for me, and I answered. Keep up the great work—you’ve got a bright career ahead of you in the newsroom!
I’m jazzed up for the #DemDebate tonight!

I got to live my dream of becoming a teacher because an affordable higher education opened a million doors for me.

But chances like the ones I got don't exist anymore. My plan for universal free public college and cancelling student debt would create new opportunities for all.

But chances like the ones I got don't exist anymore. My plan for universal free public college and cancelling student debt would create new opportunities for all.

In this primary, we have an opportunity to make a real difference in the way campaigns are funded. It’s why I’m fighting my heart out to cut dark money out of politics—and why my campaign is 100% grassroots-funded.

The #GOPTaxScam wasn’t reform—it was a heist. It showered corporations and the wealthy in tax giveaways and kicked everyone else to the curb. I’ve proposed real reform to ensure the wealthiest Americans and corporations pay their fair share.

One of the best parts of my trip to Detroit in June was reading your hand-written notes about what got you into this fight. Your stories keep me going—and I’m glad to be back in Detroit for the second #DemDebate!
I stand in solidarity with the people of Anchorage, Alaska who are fighting to make their voices heard against extreme budget cuts that could hurt the people of their state.
I’m grateful for the opportunity last night to talk with the people of Toledo about big, structural change—including my new plan to make our trade policy actually work for American families.

I don’t spend my time chasing big checks from wealthy donors and special interest groups—so I have time to make thank you calls to as many grassroots donors as I can. Chip in $3 now to help build our movement, and I might give you a call to say thanks!

For decades, America’s trade policy has worked great for the rich and the powerful. American workers? Not so much. Tonight in Toledo, I talked about our need for trade policy that favors the American people, not multinational corporations.
40,000—and counting! Grateful for each and every one of you.
Powerful corporate interests have poured gigantic sums into capturing our courts. We need judges who value justice for all, not just for the rich and powerful.

No student should live in fear of discrimination. As president, I will not only fight my heart out for LGBTQ+ students' rights, I will nominate a former public school teacher as education secretary. We need a leader who will actually fight for our kids.
No, it’s not a prank. It’s really me! Thank you, Felipe, for making a contribution to my campaign. We make each other stronger in these fights.

Our government is broken. Wall Street has tilted our laws to favor the rich and the powerful, while working Americans foot the bill.

I’m running for president to return the power to the people. Will you chip in $3 now to help me keep up the fight?
Thank you so much! I can’t wait to read it.
Wow! That does look delicious.
We need data-based, ecologically sensitive solutions to the threat of fire on our public lands—not giveaways to special interests.

We need to fundamentally transform our approach to trade—and that means using trade to raise wages and combat climate change instead of padding the bottom lines of big multinational corporations who have no allegiance to America.

For decades, our trade policies have been written by corporations to benefit their bottom line. It's time for a new approach. The president has a lot of authority to remake trade policy herself. When I’m elected, I intend to use it.

.@TheRevAl has dedicated his life to the fight for justice for all. No amount of racist tweets from the man in the White House will erase that—and we must not let them divide us. I stand with my friend Al Sharpton in calling out these ongoing attacks on people of color.

Trade can be a powerful tool. My plan represents a new approach—one that uses America’s leverage to boost American workers and raise the global standard of living. The president has a lot of authority to remake trade policy herself. When elected, I intend to use it.

I’ll end “Investor-State Dispute Settlement”—the favorable enforcement we offer corporations which they've used to undermine laws that benefit workers & families (like minimum wage increases). And I’ll create a new, stronger approach to enforcing labor & environmental standards.

We need data-based, ecologically sensitive solutions to the threat of fire on our public lands—not giveaways to special interests.

We need to fundamentally transform our approach to trade—and that means using trade to raise wages and combat climate change instead of padding the bottom lines of big multinational corporations who have no allegiance to America.

For decades, our trade policies have been written by corporations to benefit their bottom line. It's time for a new approach. The president has a lot of authority to remake trade policy herself. When I’m elected, I intend to use it.

.@TheRevAl has dedicated his life to the fight for justice for all. No amount of racist tweets from the man in the White House will erase that—and we must not let them divide us. I stand with my friend Al Sharpton in calling out these ongoing attacks on people of color.

Trade can be a powerful tool. My plan represents a new approach—one that uses America’s leverage to boost American workers and raise the global standard of living. The president has a lot of authority to remake trade policy herself. When elected, I intend to use it.

I’ll end “Investor-State Dispute Settlement”—the favorable enforcement we offer corporations which they've used to undermine laws that benefit workers & families (like minimum wage increases). And I’ll create a new, stronger approach to enforcing labor & environmental standards.

Finally, our approach to enforcing trade deals is driving down standards worldwide. We offer corporations fast and powerful methods to enforce the provisions that benefit them, but make it nearly impossible to enforce labor and environmental protections. It's time to change that.

I'll make combating climate change a key focus of our trade deals—and make sure America lives up to the same standards we hold other countries to. I'll require countries we negotiate trade deals with to comply with the Paris Climate accord and end fossil fuel subsidies.

I'll also go further to make sure our trade deals ensure consumer safety & protect America's family farms. And I'll fight to bring down the costs of prescription drugs here & around the world by supporting price controls & seeking out opportunities to reduce exclusivity periods.

I'll establish a set of standards that countries must meet as a precondition for any trade agreement: covering labor rights, human rights, religious freedom, human trafficking, protecting the environment, currency practices, and combating tax evasion and bribery.

For too long, we've made trade deals with countries with abysmal records on labor, environmental issues, and human rights. They get concrete access to the American market while we get vague commitments to do better—which we hardly enforce. This must end.

Our trade negotiations give special access to corporate interests before the agreement is rushed through Congress. I'll end this undemocratic, corrupt practice and negotiate and approve trade deals through a transparent process that offers the public a real chance to shape them.

My plan is a whole new approach to trade that will transform every aspect of our current process, from how we negotiate deals, to the negotiating objectives we pursue, to the way we enforce agreements. This isn’t about tough talk—it's about big, structural change.

America has enormous leverage in trade negotiations. I won’t hand that leverage to corporations to boost their own profits—I’ll use it to create and defend good American jobs, raise wages, fight climate change, lower drug prices, and raise living standards worldwide.

For decades, America’s trade policy has put the profits of big multinational corporations ahead of American workers, farmers, and the environment. I have a new approach: Trade on our terms and only when it benefits American families. Here's my plan.

Yesterday, 4 people were killed and dozens more injured in senseless gun violence attacks in Gilroy and Brooklyn. One of the victims was a 6-year-old child. And these are just the few that made headlines. I’m heartsick. We have a gun violence epidemic. It’s our duty to act—now.
I won’t! I promise to fight for your family as hard as I fight for mine.

That’s right.

Gottlieb’s trip through the revolving door—from head of the @US_FDA to a spot on @Pfizer’s board—is a huge conflict of interest. Under my plan to #EndCorruptionNow, that would be illegal.

From day one, Trump has made his disdain for the intelligence community clear. Our Director of National Intelligence should be above partisan politics, speak truth to power, and resist Trump's abuses of authority. John Ratcliffe doesn't fit that bill.
Great meeting you, Molly!

Our campaign is 100% grassroots funded. So I spend my time calling as many people as I can to thank them for chipping into this movement. I love making these calls—and I’m planning on making more soon. Donate now and you could be next!

I could feel the energy the moment I stepped through the door. Thank you to the people of Bow for hosting a terrific #WinWithWarren house party! If you’re ready to get in this fight with me, find an event in your community:
Our government should keep Americans safe—not allow private prisons to profit off of locking people up. Here’s how my plan to ban private prisons works.
Woo-hoo, thanks for coming out today, New Hampshire! I'm grateful down to my toes that we got to talk about the big, structural change we're fighting for.
Thank you so much for your letter, Wade. We’ll keep fighting the good fight, together.

To get serious about climate change and reduce our reliance on fossil fuels, we need to end Big Oil’s stranglehold on Washington. As president, I’ll eliminate fossil fuel subsidies and put a moratorium on new fossil fuel leases offshore or on public lands.

Donald Trump’s tweets are ugly and racist. They’re purposefully designed to turn us against one another. We cannot let that happen. Instead, we must follow my friend Elijah Cummings’ example and keep doing the work for the American people.

Teaching law at @UHouston was a dream come true, but incredibly hard while raising two little kids. Lack of high-quality, affordable child care almost sunk me—until Aunt Bee came to help. The fight for #UniversalChildCare is personal for me.

Every letter I read gives me yet another reason to keep dreaming big and fighting hard for the big, structural change that Americans everywhere want to see. I’m grateful down to my bones for your support.

I’m running my campaign differently. No federal lobbyists. No fundraisers with mega-donors. No money from PACs of any kind. Instead, I’m spending my time talking with you. Will you chip in $3 right now? It will go a long way—and I might call to say thanks!
Our federal government has underserved HBCUs and MSIs for decades. We need to right these wrongs—starting with my plan to invest at least $50 billion in these important institutions.
Thank you for having me, #PeoplesConvention19!

A person’s HIV status has no bearing on their ability to parent. This is just the latest in a long line of the Trump administration’s cruel attacks on immigrant communities. I want to be clear here: Families belong together—no exceptions.

The ADA is about civil rights, opportunity, and our values—but there’s more work to be done. As I celebrate the ADA today, I'm committing to continue the fight to protect these rights every step of the way. #ADA29

That changed with the passage of the ADA—which came about thanks to activists and leaders in Congress like Rep. Major Owens. It not only helped dismantle prejudices about Americans with disabilities, it recognized their right to live, work, and love independently. #ADA29

On the 29th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act, I’m thinking about my first job out of college—teaching students with speech and learning disabilities at a public school. I saw the difficulties my kids faced navigating a world that wasn’t designed for them. #ADA29

The playing field is tilted against entrepreneurs and small business owners of color. A typical Black entrepreneur starts a business with $35,000 in capital—a third of the startup capital for the typical white entrepreneur. Here’s how we change that:
HBCUs have always had to do more with less. Many are in danger of closing, or have already closed. That's why I have a plan to invest at least $50 billion in HBCUs.
Wow! I love it.
For black moms in particular, this maternal mortality crisis is an epidemic. I have a plan to hold health systems accountable for protecting them.

We have the power to prevent these deaths. We need paid leave so that new moms have time to recover—and we need #MedicareForAll so that moms (and their babies!) have access to the health care they need.
I’m running a different kind of campaign. Since I don’t spend my time asking rich donors for big checks, I get to spend it with voters instead. That way everyone can get a selfie!

Trump's Department of Justice just approved @TMobile and @Sprint’s $26 billion merger. This merger will cost thousands of jobs, reduce wages, and further reduce competition in a sector that badly needs it. We need antitrust regulators with the courage to stand up to monopolies.

Exciting news: We just passed one million contributions made to our campaign!

We’re 100% grassroots-funded, & every person who chips in owns a piece of our movement. I couldn’t be more grateful. After Caitlyn made the millionth donation, I called with a double woo-hoo thank you!
After Wanda, a math teacher, chipped in to our campaign, I gave her a call to say thanks! Teachers see the worth in every human being—the guy in the White House doesn’t know what he’s up against.

I'm thrilled to see that the House has passed #VenezuelaTPS! If Donald Trump really cared about the plight of the Venezuelan people, he wouldn't be deporting those in the U.S. back to violence and fear. Now I hope my Senate colleagues will pass this bill.

Exciting news: We just passed one million contributions made to our campaign!

We’re 100% grassroots-funded, & every person who chips in owns a piece of our movement. I couldn’t be more grateful. After Caitlyn made the millionth donation, I called with a double woo-hoo thank you!
After Wanda, a math teacher, chipped in to our campaign, I gave her a call to say thanks! Teachers see the worth in every human being—the guy in the White House doesn’t know what he’s up against.

I'm thrilled to see that the House has passed #VenezuelaTPS! If Donald Trump really cared about the plight of the Venezuelan people, he wouldn't be deporting those in the U.S. back to violence and fear. Now I hope my Senate colleagues will pass this bill.

Racist voter suppression is real—and we need federal muscle in the fight. Under my plan, there’ll be no more problems with voter registration, no more arbitrary voter purges, and no more gerrymandering. The right to vote is fundamental & we'll protect it.

Sandra Pezqueda worked at @TerraneaResort in Southern California. After reporting sexual harassment, she was fired—but her courage launched a movement. I stand in solidarity with Sandra and everyone supporting the Terranea boycott, and you can too:

Have you ever deposited a check—then had to wait days for it to hit your bank account? My bill with Rep. @AyannaPressley will help eliminate that wait time and make a huge difference for Americans with bills to pay.

If eight children died every day from some mysterious virus, we'd be doing everything we could to research ways to stop it. #WeNeedToKnow how to end the gun violence epidemic. It's time to #FundGVPResearch.
We’re in this fight together, Jeri. #1u
Good luck at the conference!
I loved our phone call! Our nation’s future rests with young people—and we have an obligation to do whatever we can to help you succeed. Thanks for taking the time to talk with me. #NationalInternDay

Mueller’s testimony yesterday confirmed what we already knew: A hostile foreign power attacked our democracy, and we haven’t done anything to stop it from happening again. That’s why I have a plan to secure our elections from foreign threats:

Today, it’s a different story. An entire generation is being crippled by student debt and skyrocketing tuition costs. My plan to cancel debt for 95% of Americans with student loan debt, make public college free, and invest in HBCUs would end this crisis.

When I was a senior in high school, my family didn’t have the money for college application fees—let alone a college education. Through a mix of scholarships and part-time jobs, I ended up getting my 4-year degree at a commuter college that cost $50 a semester. #TBT

Our criminal justice system has a long history of mistakes when it comes to capital punishment—especially when it comes to Black and Brown people. We cannot let a broken system decide the fate of incarcerated Americans. I oppose the death penalty.
It was great meeting you, Tracy! Glad you’re in this fight.
This is an important step to ensure that non-binary Americans are seen and respected. Way to go, New Hampshire. All states should do the same.

The people of Puerto Rico have endured so much—disaster and tragedy, economic crisis, government corruption, generations of disrespect. I'm inspired by my fellow U.S. citizens and their movement to hold their government accountable.

I'm running to be the best president that money can't buy, but I can't do it alone. Will you chip in $3 before our July fundraising deadline? One person at a time, we'll stop Washington from answering to billionaires and giant corporations.

Our government let the student loan debt crisis spiral out of control, especially for people of color. My bill provides a $50 billion investment in HBCUs & cancels student loan debt for 95% of borrowers—so that we can begin to close the racial wealth gap.

This is a joke. Facebook repeatedly violated users' privacy and this settlement imposes no real individual accountability and no major structural changes to the company—only a fine that's a fraction of what Facebook makes in a year.
I have a plan to cancel student loan debt for millions of Americans—and yesterday, Rep. James Clyburn and I introduced a bill in Congress that will start to make that plan a reality. #CancelMyDebt

My two-cent #UltraMillionaireTax would cover big, structural changes like:

✅ Universal Child Care
✅ Canceling student loan debt for 95% of borrowers
✅ Universal free college

#NAACPConvention
I agree with the @NAACP’s vote. We must begin impeachment proceedings.

I was proud to stand with airline food workers and @UniteHere at DCA yesterday. Airline corporations make millions of dollars in profits, and their workers should be paid a living wage. We’ll keep making our voices heard. #1u
Here’s the good news: We have the chance to head off another financial crisis if we take action now.
If we stay the course, the odds of another economic downturn are high—and growing. If we take bold action now, we can head off another financial crisis before it’s too late.

I read the Mueller report the day it came out. Three things were clear: A hostile foreign government attacked our 2016 election, Trump welcomed their help, and Trump obstructed the investigation into that attack. I agree with @NAACP—it's time to begin impeachment proceedings.
In just a few minutes, I’ll be speaking live at the 110th #NAACPConvention. I hope you’ll tune in!

Robert Mueller’s report is an impeachment referral, and it’s up to Congress to act. But impeachment shouldn’t be the only way that a sitting president can be held accountable for committing a crime. No president is above the law.

I read all 448 pages of the Mueller report, and this much is clear: The president obstructed justice. Attorney General Barr can try to cover it up, but the American people deserve to hear the full truth from Mueller himself. I hope we get that tomorrow.
It’s about time. Our 9/11 first responders are American heroes—they deserve to be treated with dignity and respect, and guaranteed the support they need.
Thank you for being in this fight, Norelia. Your voice matters.
This is what happens when government works for the rich and powerful instead of everyone else. Enough is enough. We need #MedicareForAll.

I'm not taking a dime from Washington lobbyists or PACs of any kind—because this campaign is powered by the people. Will you chip in $3 or whatever you can? Every dollar will help keep up our momentum before next week’s fundraising deadline.
Our budget reflects our values, and Trump’s new budget proposal makes his perfectly clear. The SNAP program helps working families and students keep food on the table. We should expand it—not cut it.

But we should be wary that this administration doesn't abuse this necessary review in order to pursue its own partisan agenda. This issue is too important to be dragged into Trump's petty grievances against these companies. This requires careful congressional oversight.

Big tech companies like Amazon, Facebook, and Google wield enormous, monopolistic power. I've been saying that we need to #BreakUpBigTech for a long time and I support a legitimate antitrust investigation into these companies.

Our economy’s shaky foundation could crumble, but let me be clear: There’s still time to prevent it. That’s why I’m calling on regulators and Congress to act before another crisis gut-punches American families.
Tell you what, we can get a photo next time! And in the meantime, @TeamWarren has some great volunteer events coming up in Queens where you can meet someone new:
The murders of Black trans women in America are a crisis. We must call it out and fight back, until everyone is free to be who they are without fear. Say her name: Denali Berries Stuckey.
I warned about an economic crash years before the 2008 crisis—but the people in power wouldn’t listen. We can stop it from happening again, but they must listen this time.
This is cruel and unjust. My plan for humane immigration reform will eliminate the use of expedited removal proceedings, guarantee hearings, and ensure access to counsel in immigration courts.

Mauna Kea is sacred to Native Hawaiian people. The Hawaiians who have been protesting construction of the Thirty Meter Telescope are trying to protect a sacred site from further desecration. I stand in solidarity with them. #TMT

Tell you what, we can get a photo next time! And in the meantime, @TeamWarren has some great volunteer events coming up in Queens where you can meet someone new:
The murders of Black trans women in America are a crisis. We must call it out and fight back, until everyone is free to be who they are without fear. Say her name: Denali Berries Stuckey.
I warned about an economic crash years before the 2008 crisis—but the people in power wouldn’t listen. We can stop it from happening again, but they must listen this time.
This is cruel and unjust. My plan for humane immigration reform will eliminate the use of expedited removal proceedings, guarantee hearings, and ensure access to counsel in immigration courts.

Mauna Kea is sacred to Native Hawaiian people. The Hawaiians who have been protesting construction of the Thirty Meter Telescope are trying to protect a sacred site from further desecration. I stand in solidarity with them. #TMT
Tomorrow, I’ll be standing in solidarity with @UniteHere at DCA. When workers fight, workers win. Let’s make our voices heard!

I warned about an economic crash years before the 2008 crisis. But the people with the power to stop it didn’t listen—and families lost it all. When I look at the economy today, I see a lot to worry about again. The good news is that we can head off a crisis—and I've got a plan.

George, I see you and the thousands of home health care workers who deserve a living wage. No American should work full-time and live in poverty—that’s why I’m in the fight to increase the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour.
It was great chatting with you, Tiffany!

My bill with @MarkWarnerVA would have made @Equifax pay double and ensured more relief for people who were hurt. And my Corporate Executive Accountability plan could have held Equifax executives criminally liable. We need more accountability.

.@Equifax exposed nearly 150 million Americans' data, lied about their recklessness, and tried to make money off the scandal. We must go even further to hold Equifax accountable than current law allows—and I have a plan for that.
I stand with the people of Puerto Rico as they continue to make their voices heard.

Betsy DeVos is the worst education secretary we’ve ever had. We need someone who will actually fight for our students, which is why I’ve pledged to nominate a former public school teacher to lead @USEdGov in a Warren administration.

The warning lights are flashing. Whether it’s this year or next year, the odds of another economic downturn are high. This time, though, we can head it off. Congress and regulators should act immediately.

With an economy this vulnerable, we need to reduce the odds of the potential shocks that can send us into another downturn. That means Congress should eliminate the debt ceiling & the Trump administration should replace its trade-war-by-tweet with China with a coherent strategy.

We need to strengthen manufacturing by investing in it instead of undercutting it. My Green Manufacturing plan will invest $2 trillion in American green research, manufacturing, and exporting over the next decade, creating more than a million new American jobs.

Next, we have to tackle corporate debt. After the 2008 crisis, Congress created the Financial Stability Oversight Council to monitor market risks. But the Trump-era FSOC is falling down on the job. The FSOC should meet to discuss these risks and announce a plan to address them.

First, we can reduce household debt by raising wages and bringing down household costs. My plans tackle both sides of this problem, from raising the minimum wage to $15 to canceling student debt and making housing more affordable:

The good news is that we have the chance to head off a crisis, just like we had the chance to head it off in 2008, if we take bold action now to address the underlying problems in our economy. Here's what we need to do:

Our country’s economic foundation is fragile, and a single shock could bring it all down. Trump's reckless behavior makes that shock more likely. Financial markets and experts agree: We face a serious risk of another recession by the end of 2021—maybe even by the end of 2020.

Despite Donald Trump’s promises of a manufacturing “renaissance,” the country is now in a manufacturing recession. For the first time ever, the hourly wage for manufacturing workers has dropped below the national average.

Corporations are deeply in debt and taking risky loans, spreading that risk throughout our financial system. These high-risk loans look a lot like pre-2008 sub-prime mortgages: poorly underwritten and with minimal protections, packaged up and sold to investors.

I know it sounds stark, but here's what I see today: Families are taking on more debt than ever, thanks to a generation of stagnant wages and rising costs. Student debt has more than doubled since 2008. More than 30% of American adults have debts in collection right now.

I warned about an economic crash years before the 2008 crisis, but the people in power wouldn’t listen. Now I’m seeing serious warning signs again—and I’m calling for action before another crisis costs America’s families their homes, jobs, and savings.

I had a terrific time with Mike (our @TeamWarren “Grab a Beer* With Elizabeth” contest winner) and his wife, Linda, from Elma, New York! We had beer and iced tea at my house, then grabbed dinner down the street. Bruce had a lot of fun and Bailey got to meet his new friend!
Tomorrow, I’ll be standing in solidarity with @UniteHere at DCA. When workers fight, workers win. Let’s make our voices heard!

I had a terrific time with Mike (our @TeamWarren “Grab a Beer* With Elizabeth” contest winner) and his wife, Linda, from Elma, New York! We had beer and iced tea at my house, then grabbed dinner down the street. Bruce had a lot of fun and Bailey got to meet his new friend!
Ricardo Rosselló must listen to the people of Puerto Rico and resign.
Cleaning up before meeting some new friends tonight!

After the big banks crashed our economy, the @CFPB was the big, structural change our country needed. Now, the Trump administration is on a mission to destroy it. I’ll keep fighting for consumers—today, and as president of the United States.

Today the @CFPB turns 8! I helped President Obama create an agency that would protect consumers—and that’s exactly what happened. The CFPB has forced financial companies to return an estimated $12 billion to the people.
It’s time to tackle Washington corruption head-on. And yes, I’ve got a plan for that!
But above all, it's time to end unnecessary detention. Read my full plan for a more humane and fair immigration reform here:

This is good news—but Chin should never have been held in solitary confinement. My plan for immigration reform would end solitary confinement, enforce strict standards for medical care, and provide extra layers of protection for LGBTQ+ people.

If you made it big, you should have to put a little back in to help everyone else make it, too. My #UltraMillionaireTax on the wealthiest 0.1% of Americans would help level the playing field for everyone.

I've been traveling across the country talking about the change I'm fighting for—which means I've been through a lot of airports. I'm grateful every day for these workers, and they deserve a wage that can keep their families out of poverty. I'm proud to join @unitehere's protest.

The Apollo 11 mission is a perfect reminder that if we dream big enough, fight hard enough, and invest in American ingenuity, we can accomplish incredible things. In fact, we can protect our planet for generations to come.

That's why I’ve proposed a Green Apollo Program to tackle climate change head on, including $400 billion in government funding over the next 10 years for clean energy research and development—more than 10 times what we invested in the last 10 years.

President Kennedy knew that we didn’t have the technology to achieve this goal at first—and his commitment spurred a decade of scientific and technological mobilization leading up to the moon landing. To tackle climate change today, we need to make another bold commitment.

Fifty years ago today, our country put Americans on the moon. At first it seemed impossible, but we got it done because our government made bold investments in science, innovation, and American workers.

I'm proud to stand with @HopkinsMedicine RNs as they fight for a union with @NationalNurses. Hopkins management must respect their right to organize without interference, harassment, or intimidation. #UnionStrong

People ask me how I stay energized on the trail (I don’t drink coffee). Here’s the answer: Grassroots supporters like you! If you’re dreaming big, fighting hard, and ready to win in 2020, then chip in to my campaign. We can only do this together.
We need to build a lasting foundation for LGBTQ+ rights so everyone can feel safe to be who they are. I’m honored to work alongside @AshleeMPreston in this fight.

Zero. This is cruel and inhumane. America should not turn away good people fleeing from violence and suffering. A Warren administration will increase the number of refugees that we welcome into the United States.

You're absolutely right, Charlotte. Your confidence and grace inspires me, and I promise I'll continue fighting every step of the way until every trans American can live their best lives, free of fear and discrimination.
I've been standing with the people of Puerto Rico in their protests against corruption and their governor’s behavior. The people have spoken—loud and clear: @RicardoRossello should resign.

Big Pharma and corporate greed are root causes of the opioid epidemic. That’s why I proposed the CARE Act with Rep. Elijah Cummings to hold drug executives accountable and invest in our communities so we can end this crisis.
Ricardo Rosselló must listen to the people of Puerto Rico and resign.

Private equity firms are destroying our free press. They buy newspapers like the Monterey Herald for cheap, cut the staff, and bleed them dry. My new plan to hold Wall Street accountable would end this looting.
Thank you for a fantastic night, Sioux City. This is how we’re going to do it—together.

Eugene Scalia spent his career putting giant corporations over American workers. This should concern anyone who believes that the Department of Labor should protect workers’ rights—not corporate interests. The Senate must reject his nomination for Secretary of Labor.
In just a few minutes, I’ll be live at @AARPadvocates’ presidential forum. Tune in to be part of our conversation:

For generations, our government’s redlining policies prevented Black families from owning a home—and the effects are still being felt today. My plan for fair housing confronts this racist legacy head on.
Let’s be real. Private equity firms are like vampires—bleeding companies dry and walking away enriched. My new plan reins in these monsters to save our economy.
That’s right, Sara. We’re in this fight together.
I agree with Lori @LightfootForChi all the way. The Fair Workweek Ordinance would help level the playing field for working families in Chicago. Thank you for sharing your mother’s story!
I had a great time visiting the @GoIUPAT painters training facility. Unions built the middle class—and unions will rebuild the middle class. I'm proud to be fighting alongside you!
Thank you so much, Claire. I’m grateful for your time and your support!
For decades, Washington has lived by one rule: If it’s good for Wall Street, it’s good for the economy. Today in Sioux City, Iowa, I talked about my new plan to change that rule.

Wall Street is scared. That’s why the big banks are building a “political machine” to keep Washington in their vice grip. I’m fighting back—and I’ve got a new plan to end Wall Street’s stranglehold on our economy.
Grateful for another chance to talk about our grassroots movement at @CNN’s Democratic presidential debate on July 30th. I’m fired up for big, structural change—let’s do this!

As I head back to Iowa today, I’m thinking about farmers who have faced extreme flooding and billions in damage to their communities this year. Climate change is real and it’s here. Here's just one of my plans to make a #GreenNewDeal a reality:

When I was a kid, a minimum-wage job could support a family of three. Today it won’t keep a mom and her baby out of poverty. I’m glad to see the House pass the #RaiseTheWageAct to increase the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour. Now the Senate must act.
I’m glad to see @AndreaSCousins elected as chair of @TheDLCC board! We’ll need her trailblazing leadership heading into 2020 as we work to elect Democrats up and down the ballot.
Thank you @SenGillibrand—I'm so proud to be fighting alongside you!
Students shouldn’t have to worry about going hungry. Our new bill will help the nearly one in three college students who are food insecure.

Read this thread. These tactics make a handful of Wall Street managers very rich, but are costing thousands of people their jobs, putting valuable companies out of business, and hurting communities across the country.
#IStandWithIlhan against attacks from this racist president, and we should all remember this definition of patriotism.

Private equity firms are destroying our free press. They buy newspapers like the Monterey Herald for cheap, cut the staff, and bleed them dry. My new plan to hold Wall Street accountable would end this looting.
Thank you for a fantastic night, Sioux City. This is how we’re going to do it—together.

Eugene Scalia spent his career putting giant corporations over American workers. This should concern anyone who believes that the Department of Labor should protect workers’ rights—not corporate interests. The Senate must reject his nomination for Secretary of Labor.
In just a few minutes, I’ll be live at @AARPadvocates’ presidential forum. Tune in to be part of our conversation:

For generations, our government’s redlining policies prevented Black families from owning a home—and the effects are still being felt today. My plan for fair housing confronts this racist legacy head on.
Let’s be real. Private equity firms are like vampires—bleeding companies dry and walking away enriched. My new plan reins in these monsters to save our economy.
That’s right, Sara. We’re in this fight together.
I agree with Lori @LightfootForChi all the way. The Fair Workweek Ordinance would help level the playing field for working families in Chicago. Thank you for sharing your mother’s story!
I had a great time visiting the @GoIUPAT painters training facility. Unions built the middle class—and unions will rebuild the middle class. I'm proud to be fighting alongside you!
Thank you so much, Claire. I’m grateful for your time and your support!
For decades, Washington has lived by one rule: If it’s good for Wall Street, it’s good for the economy. Today in Sioux City, Iowa, I talked about my new plan to change that rule.

Wall Street is scared. That’s why the big banks are building a “political machine” to keep Washington in their vice grip. I’m fighting back—and I’ve got a new plan to end Wall Street’s stranglehold on our economy.
Grateful for another chance to talk about our grassroots movement at @CNN’s Democratic presidential debate on July 30th. I’m fired up for big, structural change—let’s do this!
