Read this thread. These tactics make a handful of Wall Street managers very rich, but are costing thousands of people their jobs, putting valuable companies out of business, and hurting communities across the country.
#IStandWithIlhan against attacks from this racist president, and we should all remember this definition of patriotism.

Letting financial firms run wild is undermining our economy. I am done with Washington ignoring the evidence and acting as if boosting Wall Street helps families. It's time to stop the looting, boost wages, grow our economy, and rein in Wall Street.

I’ve spent a lot of my career studying how financial firms make money by tricking and trapping families. And after I proposed a new federal agency to protect consumers, I spent nearly a year setting up the @CFPB and helping write new rules to crack down on financial scams.

Finally, Wall Street sucks money away from companies that need it to grow. My Accountable Capitalism Act would end big companies catering to the short-term interests of Wall Street and let our companies focus on long-term growth and their obligations to workers.

Too many families face a choice of paying a late fee on their bills, an overdraft fee to the bank, or a sky-high interest rate to a payday lender while waiting on checks. The government should adopt real-time payment technology so families don't have to wait for checks to clear.

I’ve spent years advocating for postal banking—allowing the United States Postal Service to partner with local community banks and credit unions to provide access to low-cost, basic banking services. As President, I’ll make it happen by appointing people committed to the cause.

It's also time to push our financial system back to its core purpose—giving people a place to put their money & connecting savers with borrowers. Our system doesn’t serve a huge slice of the country: 25% of American households don’t have adequate access to a simple bank account.
And we need to end the system where bankers can make huge bonuses if risky bets pay off but lose nothing if they fail. I'll appoint regulators who will impose tough new rules to rein in banker pay.
First, we should enact my 21st Century Glass-Steagall Act, which rebuilds the wall between commercial and investment banks and ends taxpayer subsidies for excessive risk-taking and speculation.

Next, my plan would address the incentives that fuel useless speculation that can make bankers rich but undermines the rest of the economy. Washington has encouraged this speculation with giveaways, subsidies, and lax rules. I want to end these practices immediately.

My plan starts by ending this looting and fundamentally changing the industry. Private equity firms will only make money if the company succeeds. And if they make bad investments, they'll be held accountable instead of walking away with millions.

Just look at the private equity industry. They buy companies and bleed them dry. And when the company fails, the Wall Street guys walk away with millions while workers are left holding the bag. It's legalized looting.
Study after study shows that, past a certain point, a growing financial sector hurts the rest of the economy by extracting money from it. And America is way past that point.

For decades, Washington has lived by a simple rule: If it’s good for Wall Street, it’s good for the economy. But it just isn’t true. Big banks are making record profits and handing out huge bonuses as average wages barely budge.

Wall Street is looting the economy—and Washington is helping them do it. I’m tired of big financial firms padding their own pockets while the rest of the economy suffers, and that’s why I’ve got a plan to end it:

We must call out those who remain silent. We must initiate impeachment proceedings to hold him accountable. And we must build an unstoppable grassroots movement that resoundingly defeats not just Trump, but complicit Republicans everywhere.

This president is desperate. Calling out his racism, xenophobia, and misogyny is imperative. But he’s trying to divide us and distract from his own crimes, and from his deeply unpopular agenda of letting the wealthy and well-connected rip off the country. We must do more.
On #HIVPreventionDay, let’s recommit to HIV research and treatment, and work to ensure that everyone has access to PrEP, HIV testing, and other vital health care services.

Our fight for a federal minimum wage will not come at the cost of employment for Americans with disabilities. Creating a false choice between the two is cruel and ableist. Americans with disabilities are Americans deserving of equal pay and opportunity.

Looking forward to being a part of @AARPadvocates’ candidate forum this Friday. I’m in this fight for our seniors all the way—and that includes fighting for Social Security, lower drug prices, and more. #AARPIowaForum
It was terrific meeting you, Marvell! Grateful to be in this fight alongside you (and I like your new profile photo).

It was terrific meeting you, Marvell! Grateful to be in this fight alongside you (and I like your new profile photo).

Voting should be safe and easy for everyone, including Americans with disabilities. Throughout National Disability Voter Registration Week, we must recommit to ensuring that everyone’s voice is heard in our democracy.

Last month, I went to a migrant detention center in Florida. I saw children being treated like prisoners. We must clean up the mess at the border, reverse Donald Trump’s vile policies, and build a fair immigration system. Here’s my plan to make it happen:

Last weekend at @Netroots_Nation, I was very clear: When I’m president of the United States, we will end the criminal abuse of immigrants and hold the Trump administration responsible for its cruelty.

I stand with Puerto Ricans who are taking to the streets this week to protest government corruption & Governor @RicardoRossello's deeply offensive comments. His actions are hurtful & undermine the public trust. He must answer to the Puerto Rican people.

Toxic chemicals are contaminating communities in New Hampshire and throughout our country—and Donald Trump's corrupt EPA isn’t moving fast enough to help. Enough. We need real action now to clean up contamination and keep our communities safe.
Why not both of us? I’ll be looking for your campaign in 2040!

The American people shouldn’t have to wonder if our Department of Defense is working for them or for giant defense contractors. Mark Esper won’t fully address his conflicts of interest, and it’s a big red flag.

Every time I meet a grassroots supporter, I feel grateful down to my bones. Person by person and plan by plan, we’re building a movement to make our country work for working people. Will you join this fight and chip in $3 today?

I read all 448 pages of the Mueller report the day it came out three months ago. When I finished it, I called for impeachment. No one is above the law, and that includes the president of the United States.

Race matters—and we need to call it out. Black Americans are more likely to be arrested, wrongfully convicted, and serve longer sentences than white Americans. We must end mass incarceration and fix our broken criminal justice system.

I’m fighting for an America where everybody gets an opportunity. An opportunity for a great education, an opportunity for a good job, an opportunity to marry the person you love and maybe start a family or buy a home.

It’s not equal justice when a kid with an ounce of pot can get thrown in jail, while a big bank executive who cheats and defrauds Americans can get a bonus. The words above the Supreme Court say "Equal Justice Under Law"—we need to start acting like it.

This is an injustice. We have a responsibility to protect our citizens—and to hold police accountable when they fail. No one is safe in a country with a broken criminal justice system. My heart goes out to Eric Garner's family today.
Good.
What a guy!

This is another targeted, xenophobic attack from the Trump administration. As president, I’ll reinstate TPS designations and Deferred Enforced Departure to protect those at risk back in their home countries, including migrants from Central America.

This rule silences doctors and puts women's lives at risk. I stand with @PPact in their fight to overturn these punitive regulations. A Warren administration will protect the right to choose. Here's how:
You may have heard, but I’ve got a plan (several, actually) for that!

I’d never been to a national convention before 2012. My heart was hammering and my mouth was dry. I was in the homestretch of my Senate race, and I was still behind. But after a few seconds, I took a deep breath. I looked at the crowd—this was our moment.

Giant corporations like Amazon have too much power—in fact, nearly half of all e-commerce goes through Amazon. My administration will make big, structural changes to the tech sector to promote more competition—including breaking up Amazon, Facebook, and Google. #BreakUpBigTech
I fully support Amazon workers' Prime Day strike. Their fight for safe and reliable jobs is another reminder that we must come together to hold big corporations accountable.

Will you sign my petition to make it clear that we won’t shy away from holding the Trump administration accountable for their abuses? We’re going to fight these human rights violations with everything we’ve got. And we won’t ever back down.
When people come to our borders desperate—people whose lives have been turned upside down, people trying to build a better future—we need to treat them with humanity, and we need to follow the law.

Trump may look the other way—but President Elizabeth Warren will not. I'll launch a task force in the Department of Justice to investigate the Trump administration’s criminal abuses at the border, and we’ll hold perpetrators accountable. Here’s the plan:

I’ve got a message for the Trump administration: When you physically abuse immigrants, sexually abuse immigrants, or refuse to supply immigrants with the medical care that they need, you break the law of the United States of America.
I always have a “Mr. Rogers moment” when I put on my sneaks.
Babies and toddlers belong with their families—full stop. The Trump administration is morally bankrupt and I’m fighting their cruelty every step of the way. #HereToStay
It was great meeting you, Tom. Unions should be quick and easy to join—and we can’t win if we don’t fight.

Let’s be clear about what this vile comment is: A racist and xenophobic attack on Democratic congresswomen. This *is* their country, regardless of whether or not Trump realizes it. They should be treated with respect. As president, I’ll make sure of it.
I sure do! Conan, DM me and we'll get it sorted out.
Thank you, Marielena. Grateful to be in the fight for a more humane immigration system alongside you.

Immigrant families, working families, families on the ragged edge of the middle class—when I’m president, I promise to fight for your family as hard as I fight for mine. Will you chip in $3 or whatever you can to help our grassroots movement keep fighting?
Grateful down to my toes for the opportunity to talk with and listen to this powerful group of activists.

Trump has taken our immigration system to its most punitive extreme. In a Warren administration, we’ll right his wrongs. And we’ll start by holding those responsible for the abuses perpetrated against immigrants during the Trump Era accountable.
Thank you, Graham! We’re going to do this together.
It was an honor to spend time with you and your niece this afternoon.

Thank you for sharing your story, @J_Mac1422. Like you and so many other parents, I struggled to find high-quality, affordable child care for Amelia and Alex. It’s why I’ve got a plan for #UniversalChildCare.
Yesterday in Milwaukee, I made it clear: Immigration makes America stronger—and I’ve got a plan to remake our broken immigration system from top to bottom.

My plan to reform the State Department would end the practice of auctioning off American diplomacy to the highest bidder. Trump may think a fat wallet qualifies someone to represent our country abroad—but I don’t.

Wow—thank you, Milwaukee! It was wonderful talking with everyone who came out to our town hall last night. I’m grateful for every person, family, and community getting in this fight for big, structural change.
Thank you for having me last night, @LULAC! We had a fantastic conversation about protecting the rights of our immigrant communities.

After Patrick Pizzella lobbied against labor laws in the Northern Mariana Islands so that companies could run sweatshops, I opposed his nomination for Deputy Secretary of Labor. Picking him as Acting @USDOL Secretary is yet another slap in the face to American workers.

It made me think about my family, too, how my mother would work her grocery list to squeeze out every last nickel. In that moment, I knew Bruce and I would be bound to each other forever. And when I proposed to him, he said yes. Happy anniversary, Bruce! I love you.

One day at the grocery store soon after we first met, I saw Bruce gazing at the strawberry display. I said, “We can get some if you want!” He smiled, picked up a carton, and told me he was thinking about his family. “We didn’t eat things like fresh strawberries,” he explained.
Grateful down to my toes to have you in this fight alongside me, @Liuba4Congress!

I stand in solidarity with @Lights4Liberty activists around the world shining a light on the inhumane practices at our border. We must ban for-profit detention centers and treat immigrants with the dignity and respect they deserve.

I’m deeply saddened to hear that Héctor Figueroa—a tireless fighter for workers and unions—has passed. Héctor’s leadership as president of @32BJSEIU deeply inspired me, and I’m honored to have known him.
I’m praying for New Orleans and its resilient people as they brace for major flooding from Tropical Storm #Barry. Climate change is an existential threat—and we must take action now.

Then we must go a step further: Universal free public college and the cancellation of student debt for 95% of Americans who carry it. My plan would fix the student loan debt crisis—and prevent another one from happening again.

But under @BetsyDeVosED's watch, fewer than 1% of borrowers who applied to the program have had their loans forgiven.

I stand with @AFTunion in fighting back and making things right for these borrowers.

When thousands of public servants were at risk of being denied federal student loan relief, I pushed back. I helped expand the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program by $700M to help teachers, firefighters, and other Americans get the relief they earned.
Good.
Thank you, Derrick. Looking forward to chatting with you soon!

President Trump has weaponized deportation in ways that are costly, ineffective, and designed to maximize pain. It’s time to end this cruelty. Here’s my plan to do just that:
We need big, structural change in our immigration system. Today, I announced my plan for fair, humane immigration reform that reflects our values. Read the plan and join our fight:

This ruling on #TitleX is part of a targeted attack on women with low incomes and women of color by right-wing ideologues. We must pass new federal laws that protect access to reproductive health care. I have a plan for that:
Necesitamos un cambio estructural: un sistema de inmigración justo que preserve nuestra seguridad, ayude a crecer nuestra economía y refleje nuestros valores.
Trabajaré con el Congreso para aprobar una reforma de inmigración de gran alcance, pero también estoy lista para ejercer el poder ejecutivo si se niegan a actuar.

No podemos enfrentar la migración hasta que no enfrentemos sus causas—pobreza, cambio climático, violencia e injusticia. Como presidenta, restauraré e incrementaré esfuerzos para enfrentar el crimen transnacional. Y mi administración protegerá a las personas que busquen asilo.

Trabajaré para expandir la inmigración legal e implementaré acciones ejecutivas para proteger a los Dreamers y aquellos que han formado sus vidas en nuestro país, mientras trabajamos para crear una solución legislativa que asegure una ruta justa y asequible a la naturalización.

Nuestras leyes y valores nos impulsan a ayudar a los que huyen de la violencia y la opresión. Como presidenta, rechazaré las políticas de exclusión basadas en raza, religión o nacionalidad. En mi primer día, revertiré la política racista de la prohibición de los musulmanes.

Eliminaremos la expulsión rápida y proveeremos el debido proceso bajo la ley para inmigrantes enfrentando deportación, garantizando que tengan vistas en la corte y dándoles acceso a consultoría legal.

Acabaré con la detención innecesaria, enfocando estos esfuerzos en personas que presenten un riesgo de fuga o riesgos a la seguridad de otros. Y, para prevenir abusos futuros en nuestro sistema de inmigración, mi administración establecerá cortes independientes de inmigración.
Reduciré la detención de manera drástica. Separar a las familias y detener a los vulnerables es costoso, inhumano, y se ha comprobado que no tiene un efecto disuasivo.

Mi administración exigirá la rendición de cuentas por los abusos cometidos bajo la administración de Trump. Designaré un grupo de trabajo en el DOJ para investigar acusaciones graves y les daré autoridad independiente para que puedan presentar denuncias penales.

Las agencias de inmigración deberían proteger a los estadounidenses y defender nuestras leyes, en vez de dedicarse a perseguir políticas punitivas y anti inmigratorias que afectan—mayormente—a las comunidades de color. Como presidenta, reconstruiré el CBP y ICE de pies a cabeza.

Entrar al país sin autorización siempre ha sido una violación civil bajo la ley de inmigración, pero gracias a un ex senador segregacionista, también es una violación criminal. Esto es innecesario para la seguridad fronteriza y deberíamos eliminar esta prohibición criminal.

Mi plan comienza por eliminar el cumplimiento de la ley de manera abusiva. Trump ha usado la deportación como un arma costosa, ineficaz y diseñada para maximizar el dolor. Como presidenta de los Estados Unidos, acabaré con esta crueldad.

Los inmigrantes son nuestros vecinos, colegas y amigos. Son tan parte de EE.UU. como aquellas personas que han nacido en este país. Nuestro sistema de inmigración debería ser justo, humano y debería reflejar nuestros valores. Nuestros vecinos no deberían vivir con miedo.

Trump ha llevado nuestro sistema de inmigración al extremo más punitivo. Sus políticas racistas se basan en un sistema roto y una infraestructura del cumplimiento de la ley que es abusiva. Hoy anuncio mi plan para reformar nuestro sistema de inmigración.

I’ll work with Congress to pass broad-reaching reform, but I’m also prepared to move forward with executive action if they refuse to act. We need big, structural change: A fair immigration system that preserves our security, grows our economy, and reflects our values.

But we cannot fully address migration until we address its root causes—poverty, climate change, violence and injustice. As president, I’ll restore and increase aid and step up efforts to address transnational crime. And my administration will protect those seeking refuge here.
Immigrants are woven into the fabric of our country—and they are #HereToStay.

Los inmigrantes son nuestros vecinos, colegas y amigos. Son tan parte de EE.UU. como aquellas personas que han nacido en este país. Nuestro sistema de inmigración debería ser justo, humano y debería reflejar nuestros valores. Nuestros vecinos no deberían vivir con miedo.

Trump ha llevado nuestro sistema de inmigración al extremo más punitivo. Sus políticas racistas se basan en un sistema roto y una infraestructura del cumplimiento de la ley que es abusiva. Hoy anuncio mi plan para reformar nuestro sistema de inmigración.

I’ll work with Congress to pass broad-reaching reform, but I’m also prepared to move forward with executive action if they refuse to act. We need big, structural change: A fair immigration system that preserves our security, grows our economy, and reflects our values.

But we cannot fully address migration until we address its root causes—poverty, climate change, violence and injustice. As president, I’ll restore and increase aid and step up efforts to address transnational crime. And my administration will protect those seeking refuge here.

I’ll also work to expand legal immigration and take executive action to provide a measure of protection for our Dreamers and those who have built careers and families here, while pursuing a legislative solution that provides a fair and achievable path to citizenship.

Our laws and our values compel us to help those fleeing violence and oppression. As president, I’ll reject exclusionary policies based on race, religion and nationality, and I’ll reverse Trump’s bigoted Muslim Ban on my first day in office.

To prevent future abuses of our immigration system, my administration will establish independent immigration courts. We'll eliminate expedited removal and provide due process for immigrants facing deportation, guaranteeing hearings and providing access to counsel.

Next, I’ll significantly reduce immigration detention. Separating families and detaining the vulnerable is expensive, inhumane, and has no proven deterrent effect. I’ll end unnecessary detention, detaining only those who pose a safety risk, and stop for-profit detention entirely.

And my administration will demand accountability for the abuse committed under the Trump administration. I'll set up a DOJ task force to investigate accusations of serious violations and give it independent authority to pursue any criminal allegations.

Our immigration agencies should protect Americans and uphold the rule of law, not pursue punitive anti-immigrant policies that target communities of color. As president, I'll reshape CBP and ICE from top to bottom.

Entering the country without authorization has always been a violation of civil immigration law, but thanks to a former segregationist senator, it’s also a criminal violation. This is totally unnecessary for border security, and we should repeal the criminal prohibition.
My plan starts with eliminating abusive enforcement. Trump has weaponized deportation in ways that are costly, ineffective, and designed to maximize pain. As president, I will end this cruelty.

Immigrants are our neighbors, our colleagues, and our friends—and every bit as much a part of America as those who were born in the United States. Our immigration system must be fair, humane, and reflect our values. Our neighbors shouldn’t have to live in fear.

President Trump has taken our immigration system to its most punitive extreme, but his racist policies build on a broken system and an enforcement infrastructure already primed for abuse. Today, I'm announcing my plan to reform our immigration system.
Like a lot of Americans, my life has had a lot of twists and turns. Here’s my story—from falling in love and dropping out of college, to chasing my dream of being a public school teacher.
From the overflow to the front row, I’m so inspired by the energy in New Hampshire. Thankful for everyone who came out to our Peterborough town hall this week!
Let's call this what it really is: Exploitation for profit. We must put an end to for-profit immigration detention centers and private prisons, and I've got a plan to do just that:
These stories are horrifying. Children are in danger. We need answers.
I believe in you. Persist!

For a lot of candidates, “call time” means phoning millionaires and asking for big checks.

Not me. 

I spend my “call time” thanking supporters and talking with voters. Our campaign is a 100% grassroots-funded movement, fueled by the people.

We need to take bold action to attack climate change. I'm proud to support the #GreenNewDeal. I've also got plans to invest in clean energy tech and to stop drilling and promote renewables on public lands. This plan is another tool we can use to attack climate change.

My Climate Risk Disclosure plan requires companies to publicly disclose both environmental & financial climate-related risks to their business. Investors are already divesting from fossil fuel companies, and this will push more investors to divest and transition to clean energy.

Publicly traded companies have an obligation to share important information about their business. But right now they don't share much about how climate change might affect them, their customers, and their investors.

I've got a new plan to accelerate the transition to clean energy and combat climate change. I'm proud it has the support of former Vice President @algore, and @EdMarkey and @AOC—the original authors of the Green New Deal.

My mother’s minimum wage job at Sears saved our family after my daddy’s heart attack. In today’s America, it won’t keep a mama and baby out of poverty. We must raise the minimum wage to $15. Working families deserve living wages. #FightFor15

Today, Republican lawmakers in VA ignored their responsibility to protect the people of their state from another mass shooting like the one in Virginia Beach. I stand behind leaders like @SheilaForVA who know what it takes to end this crisis.

In this primary, we have a chance to build a 100% grassroots movement. Face to face, family by family, dollar by dollar, we’re gaining the momentum we’ll need come November 2020. Your contribution will make this movement stronger:
The selfies are the best part! I’m grateful for every person who chips in a dollar here or an hour there to help grow this grassroots movement. This is how we’re going to win—together.

The Democratic primary should not be decided by billionaires, whether they’re funding Super PACs or funding themselves. The strongest Democratic nominee in the general will have a coalition that’s powered by a grassroots movement.

For generations, our federal government denied Black and Brown families the same kinds of homeownership subsidies available to white families. My housing plan tackles the legacy of racist redlining head-on.
I opposed Secretary Acosta's nomination, and voted against his confirmation. The last few days have only highlighted how ethically compromised and unfit to serve he is. Acosta must resign—now.
.@AmyMcGrathKY is a real fighter for working families in Kentucky and across the country. She inspired us in 2018, and now she’s running for the U.S. Senate. Go Amy!
I’ve been to 23 states and Puerto Rico since launching this grassroots campaign—and later this week, Wisconsin will make 24! I hope I’ll see you in Milwaukee on Thursday.

No closed-door fundraisers. No D.C. lobbyists. No PACs of any kind. I’m incredibly grateful for every grassroots donor who is helping grow this campaign. Will you chip in $3 or whatever you can to keep up the momentum? I may even call to say thanks!
At today’s town hall in Peterborough, we had a terrific conversation about how we can make our government and our economy actually work for the people of New Hampshire. Let’s do this together!

For every dollar white men made in 2017:

▪️ Black women made 61 cents
▪️ Native women made 58 cents
▪️ Latinas made 53 cents

On day one of a Warren administration, I will take executive action to boost wages for women of color. Here’s how:

Thank you @EricSwalwell for your commitment to making gun reform front and center in this election. Gun violence is a public health crisis, and I’ll keep fighting alongside you for a safer future. The American people are lucky to have you in this fight.
It was lovely chatting with you again this weekend at #EssenceFest, @AshleeMPreston! I’m grateful down to my toes to be fighting alongside you for big, structural change.

I am humbled by the depth of grassroots commitment to our campaign. This is how we make our government and democracy work for everyone, not just the wealthy and well-connected. Thank you, and let’s keep at it.

I called for an investigation into Elliott Broidy's actions surrounding president Trump's inauguration last year. Now a real investigation is happening. This is exactly why I'm fighting to end corruption in Washington.
It’s a long way to Election Day. But our fight starts here, with you.

Help build a grassroots operation across the country to return the power to the people and save our democracy. Will you chip in $3 or whatever you can right now to keep up the momentum? We can only do this together.
They bring home the ratings, the revenue, and the wins. But even if they didn’t, the players of the @USWNT deserve equal pay.
A nation is great when it lives its values. And right now, our nation has an immigration policy that is designed to maximize cruelty toward our immigrant communities. We need to change it.

Just about a year ago, Bruce brought home Bailey, and no matter how difficult my day’s been (or how many cushions Bailey’s chewed), he never fails to cheer me up. I’m so grateful to have this pup in my life!
We all want a country where everyone—not just the wealthy—can take care of their families and participate in our democracy.
Woo-hoo! Congratulations to the @USWNT on their World Cup win. Your persistence on and off the field inspires girls and women everywhere to dream big, fight hard, and win. #FIFAWWC #OneNationOneTeam
I loved getting the chance to talk in person, @Ashleyn1cole!

I’m grateful to have been a part of the 25th annual @EssenceFest! We need to use every tool in the toolbox to make our government and our economy work for communities of color, and I’m glad we had the opportunity to talk about that today. #EssenceFest
Here’s what I would’ve said to a 25-year-old me.
I’m running for president of the United States—and yeah, I’ve got a lot of plans. Thank you, @EssenceFest!
On day one of a Warren administration, I will take a series of executive actions to boost wages for women of color and open up new pathways to the leadership positions they deserve. #EssenceFest

Black women are paid less and are less likely to be able to afford basic human rights like health care, child care, and housing. It’s no accident: It’s the legacy of systemic discrimination. My new plan helps right these wrongs. #EssenceFest
It was great meeting you too. Go Cougars!

The experiences of women of color are not one-dimensional: Sexual orientation, gender identity, and ability all shape how a person’s work is valued in the workplace. Women of color work hard for their families. Our economy should work hard for them.
I’m grateful to be a part of the 25th annual @EssenceFest today. I’ll see you soon!

My diploma from @UHouston gave me a second chance at my dream of becoming a public school teacher. What an honor to be back last night talking with voters and grassroots supporters. Thank you, Houston—you have a special place in my heart!
I hope I see you there!

I knew exactly what I wanted to do since I was in second grade: I wanted to be a public school teacher—and I had the opportunity to make that dream come true. Today, I’m in this fight for our educators, students, and #StrongPublicSchools. Thank you, @NEAToday and @Lily_NEA!
America’s public school teachers are real heroes—I’m glad we got to talk today backstage at @NEAToday’s presidential forum. Tune in to watch my remarks live at the conference in just a few minutes.

Our government saddled a generation with $1.5 trillion in student loan debt. That’s why I’m calling for universal free college and cancelling student loan debt for more than 95% of Americans who have it. We must end the student debt crisis.

Betsy DeVos is the worst Secretary of Education in our history. We need someone who will actually fight for students, not for giant corporations. So when @Liat_RO suggested that the next Secretary of Education should be a former public school teacher, I pledged to make it happen.
Looking forward to @NEAToday’s presidential forum today and the opportunity to talk about my plan to appoint a public school teacher as the next education secretary. Tune in!

Black women are more likely to be breadwinners for their families, yet they are paid less and are less likely to be able to afford health care, child care, and housing. I'm proud to share my new plan to address this head on at #EssenceFest this weekend:

This is just the first step—but it’s a necessary one. It’s time to build an America that recognizes the role that women of color play in their families and in the economy, that fairly values their work, and that delivers equal opportunity for everyone.

Finally, I will strengthen enforcement against systemic discrimination. I will direct federal agencies to target enforcement towards industries where we know women of color face higher rates of discrimination.

I will also make sure the senior ranks of the federal government look like America. My administration will ensure that federal agencies recruit women of color and develop leadership paths for them. The government should do better if it demands more from the private sector.

First, I will have new requirements for federal contractors: companies with bad track records on equal pay and management diversity won’t get new contracts. No contractor will be permitted to use forced arbitration and non-compete clauses for low- and medium-wage workers.

The government has helped perpetuate the systemic discrimination that has denied women of color equal opportunities, and it’s time to right those wrongs. I've got a plan to boost their wages, open up career advancement, and fight systemic discrimination.

The gender pay gap hits women of color particularly hard. When future employers use salary history to make new offers, they trap women of color in lower wages. Black and Brown women are disproportionately mistreated at work. Their path to higher-level management jobs is rockier.

Women of color face a steeper climb to provide financial security for their families because of systemic discrimination. On Day One of a Warren administration, I’ll take a series of executive actions to help boost their wages and leadership opportunities.

On #IndependenceDay, I’m celebrating our democracy—and recommitting to protect it. Our elections should be as secure as Fort Knox. Instead, they’re less secure than an Amazon account. I have a plan to make voting easy and secure for everyone.
Thank you, Nevada! Your energy inspires me.
It was great to see @sleslienv and meet the wonderful people at Mari Chuy’s Mexican Kitchen yesterday. Thanks for having me!

Today we celebrate our country and recommit to the big, structural changes we need to make our government and our economy work for everyone—not just for those at the top. I’ll fight my heart out for that. Happy #IndependenceDay!

Big Tech companies like Facebook hire armies of lobbyists and lawyers to help shape the rules in their favor and throw around their economic power to snuff out every potential competitor. That’s another reason why we need to #BreakUpBigTech.
Are you telling me that billionaires aren’t in favor of my being president of the United States? I’m shocked!
It should be illegal for former U.S. Senator @DavidVitter to go from serving the American people one day to lobbying for Russian oligarchs the next. Under my plan to #EndCorruptionNow, it would be.

Talk about a conflict of interest: Former @US_FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb just joined the board of @Pfizer—a Big Pharma corporation he once regulated. Under my plan to #EndCorruptionNow, that would be illegal.

No, Jamie. Corporate greed and corruption in Washington are what’s really wrong with America. That’s what got your bank a no-strings-attached taxpayer bailout after the crash back in 2008, and it’s still rigging the system against working families today.

Running for president: That’s what women do.

I’m glad to see people in Massachusetts and across the country fighting for our immigrant communities today. I stand with you in solidarity all the way.
Sickening. Human beings are being herded like animals right now in our country. This goes against our American values. It’s cruel and it must end—now.
There’s still time to RSVP to our community conversation tonight in Nevada. I hope I’ll see you there!
This kind of xenophobic fear-mongering is sick. In a Warren administration, immigrant communities will be able to live without fear or discrimination. I will fight for them every step of the way.

When I’m president, I’ll make certain that every person—regardless of race, creed, or economic background—is paid a living wage so they can build a secure future for themselves and their families. That’s how we’ll make our economy work for working people.

I’ve got a new plan to protect our democracy! We must:

🗳️ Make voting easy and convenient
🗳️ Stop racist voter suppression
🗳️ Secure our elections

Arbitration lets giant banks like @JPMorgan get away with scamming customers out of money. CEO Jamie Dimon should be working to protect consumers—but all he cares about is making a profit off of them. No more.
Our national security institutions should reflect the diversity of the country they serve and represent. I was proud to sign the #5050in2020 Pledge for Gender Parity.

My affordable housing plan would:

🏠 Reduce rental costs by 10% over the next 10 years
🏠 Create 1.5 million new jobs
🏠 Build millions of new housing units

Rising housing costs have Americans in a vice grip, and Nevadans are among the hardest-hit. One of the root causes of the problem? A severe lack of affordable housing supply, and state and local land-use rules that needlessly drive up housing costs.
These racist and sexist comments are completely unacceptable. We need answers—and the @CBP agents involved must be held accountable.
I’m grateful to have you in this fight, Joan.
Thank you for the support, Wayne!
Go for it.

Lots of candidates spend time on the phone with millionaires asking for checks. Not me. I’m spending my time talking with voters & thanking grassroots donors. I love hearing why people get in the fight. Will you chip in before our FEC deadline at midnight?
I’m so inspired by you, Lisa. Grateful down to my bones to have you in this fight. Together, we can end the gun violence epidemic in our country.
It was great to talk with you, Mia! I’m so grateful to have you in this fight.
Keep persisting, @SenatorMuth.

Yes, I do! I’m also fighting to:
✔ Ban assault weapons.
✔ Prevent domestic abusers from legally obtaining guns.
✔ End the gun show loophole.
I’m relying on grassroots donors like Nell to fuel this campaign.

We’ve got an FEC deadline at midnight tonight—can you chip in whatever you can to our campaign? We’re building a grassroots operation across the country to return the power to the people, and we can only do it together.
I had a little time in the car to call grassroots donors like Ada.
I’m not doing fundraisers with bazillionaires. I’m counting on grassroots support to fuel this campaign. Our big FEC deadline is at midnight, and every little bit helps. Chip in before tonight.

Our President shouldn’t be squandering American influence on photo ops and exchanging love letters with a ruthless dictator. Instead, we should be dealing with North Korea through principled diplomacy that promotes US security, defends our allies, and upholds human rights.
Don’t worry—Bailey got a belly rub!
I just called some grassroots donors who gave today to tell them I’m grateful down to my toes for them. Keep it up—our FEC fundraising deadline is tomorrow at midnight.

As president I’ll fight for you as hard as I fight for my own family. We’re powering our campaign without PACs or fancy fundraisers, just person to person—one small-dollar donation at a time. Will you chip in to my campaign before Sunday’s FEC deadline?
The photo line is always my favorite part of our events—and last night I took my 35,000th selfie!
Our fight is a righteous fight. And in a righteous fight, we fight until we win. #RPCCONV2019

I’m on my way back to Boston tonight. First, I’m going to walk Bailey. Then, I’m going to call a few grassroots donors who give this afternoon. Reply to this tweet and let me know that you've donated—and hopefully I'll get to chat with you tonight!

In just a few minutes, I’ll be live with @RevJJackson at the @RPCoalition to talk about why I’m in this race. Tune in! #RPCConv2019

Every girl should grow up knowing that they can fight from the heart and win. If you agree it’s time for a woman president to make big, structural change, chip in $3 or whatever you can before our big June FEC deadline.

Our country faces a housing crisis that disproportionately affects Black and Brown Americans. @HUDGov must address this—not just in the policies it pursues, but in the people it hires. Blankenstein's racist writings disqualify him from working there.

Our kids shouldn’t have to go to school every day fearing for their lives. I’m fighting for common-sense gun reform, including banning assault weapons, preventing domestic abusers from legally obtaining guns, and ending the gun show loophole.
We need to fight for immigrant families and stop Donald Trump’s racist policies—and we can only do it together.
Dream big, fight hard, and climb high, Ashli!
Disgusting. My democracy plan would re-enfranchise those who have served their time and left prison—and prevent states like Florida from overriding their rights with Jim Crow-era nonsense.

Our campaign is 100% powered by the people: Grassroots supporters who chip in whatever they can to dream big, fight hard, and win in 2020. Will you chip in $3 and join the fight? I might call you to say thanks!

Fifty years ago at #Stonewall, LGBTQ+ rights activists knew it wouldn’t be easy. But they also knew what was at stake. They kept going and they changed the course of history. Today, we recommit to fighting for LGBTQ+ equality. #Stonewall50
I’m glad to see Kansas take this necessary step and recognize trans Americans for who they are. The rest of the country should do the same.
As the Supreme Court prepares to take on the #DACA case, I want to make something clear: Immigrant youth are #HereToStay and I will fight my heart out to protect Dreamers.

I don’t spend my time at fancy closed-door fundraisers trading favors for money, and I’ll appoint only the most qualified person for the job. In a Warren administration, I pledge not to give ambassadorial posts to wealthy donors or bundlers. Period.

Trump has perfected the act of selling swanky diplomatic posts to rich buffoons. He's appointed political cronies to nearly half the available ambassadorial positions. He may think a fat wallet and a big campaign check qualifies someone to represent our country abroad. I don't.

To do this, we need to recruit a new generation of foreign service officers and retain talented officers. I’ll also significantly expand the pool of diplomatic talent. Today’s foreign service is 79% white and 65% male. Our foreign service must reflect the diversity of the U.S.

Our foreign policy should not be run out of the Pentagon. Under a Warren administration, it won’t be. So I’ll start by doubling the size of the foreign service and opening new diplomatic posts in underserved areas to broaden U.S. diplomatic presence.

The Pentagon is nearly 40 times bigger than the State Department—we employ more people in military grocery stores than we do foreign service officers. Our underinvestment in diplomacy causes our leaders to default to military action, instead of treating it as a last resort.

Senior career officials at the State Department have been pushed out & others have resigned in protest. We've lost 60% of our career ambassadors & 20% of our most experienced civil servants. Too often they've been replaced with totally unqualified campaign donors & Trump cronies.

To take a meaningful leadership position in the world, protect our interests, and avoid conflicts, we need world-class diplomats. But through a toxic combination of malice and neglect, Donald Trump has declared war on the State Department.

The practice of auctioning off American diplomacy to the highest bidder must end. I'm pledging to end the corrupt practice of selling cushy diplomatic posts to wealthy donors—and I call on everyone running for President to do the same. Read my full plan:

It’s true! Atticus is a terrific dancer.
I do! I love my team.

Today, Trump joked with Putin about interfering in our elections. He joked about getting "rid of" journalists with a man who has reporters murdered. The president is looking out for himself—not the American people. We need a president who will always stand up for American values.

We can make the #GreenNewDeal a reality and lead the global effort to combat climate change. My Green Manufacturing Plan would invest $2 trillion in green research and manufacturing and create more than a million good jobs here at home. #DemDebate2

#RoeVWade established a woman’s constitutional right to safe, legal abortion and has been law for over 46 years. Congress should pass new federal laws that protect access to reproductive care no matter what the Supreme Court does. #DemDebate2

Immigration is our strength. But an immigration system that can’t tell the difference between a 7-year-old and a criminal or a terrorist is deeply broken. It’s time for real reform to make our immigration policies consistent with our values. #DemDebate2

I'm tired of insurance company executives getting rich while denying care to you and your family. You should get the care you need, where you need it, from your doctor. Health care is a basic human right. That's why I'm fighting for #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate

My #UltraMillionaireTax is a two-cent tax on the 75,000 biggest fortunes in the country—those worth over $50 million. We’d use it to pay for #UniversalChildCare, student loan debt cancellation, free public college, and more. Here’s how it works. #DemDebate
This is my promise to you.

America supports #RoeVWade. Congress should pass new federal laws that protect and ensure real access to birth control and abortion care—laws that will stand no matter what the Supreme Court does. And I've got a plan for that.   #DemDebate
I know @TeamWarren is working hard to win in 2020. Something else we need to work hard on: Protecting our democracy. At our Miami town hall, I made a commitment to protect our elections.

Here’s what’s covered under my new plan to protect U.S. elections: 

🗳️ No more voter registration problems
🗳️ No more voter purges
🗳️ No more gerrymandering 
🗳️ Election Day will be a federal holiday

Yesterday, I met activists who’ve been standing outside Homestead for months. I met grandmas and moms, dads and uncles. I met little children and a woman who said, “I’ll be here every day.” Together, we’re fighting for immigration policies that reflect our values.

The Census must count every person. Our Constitution demands it. Our democracy requires it. And I hope that the courts will continue to keep this racist and blatantly partisan question off of the 2020 Census.
.@NALEO's ¡Hágase Contar! Census 2020 Campaign is already working to ensure that immigrant and Latinx communities are fully counted, and I join them in calling on these communities to be heard.

Finally, we'd ban the use of citizenship questions in government surveys and implement lasting reforms to the Census to prevent any president from using these kinds of tricks to take political representation or other resources away from immigrant communities.

Next, my administration would conduct a second Census—without any questions about citizenship—to replace Trump's tainted Census in advance of the 2022 midterm elections. And I would have an aggressive, well-funded outreach campaign to reach historically undercounted communities.

Here's how this would work. First, I would immediately direct all executive agencies to ignore the tainted Census data until a new Census is complete. States receive nearly $600 billion per year from 16 programs tied to Census data, & we won't allow a tainted Census to skew that.

If the Trump admin somehow manages to get that question back on the Census, I will cancel that rigged Census and replace it with a fair and accurate one. And I'll make this promise right now: A Warren administration would never include a citizenship question on the Census.
I won’t forget it either, Leah. We’re in this fight together.

Finally, we'd ban the use of citizenship questions in government surveys and implement lasting reforms to the Census to prevent any president from using these kinds of tricks to take political representation or other resources away from immigrant communities.

Next, my administration would conduct a second Census—without any questions about citizenship—to replace Trump's tainted Census in advance of the 2022 midterm elections. And I would have an aggressive, well-funded outreach campaign to reach historically undercounted communities.

Here's how this would work. First, I would immediately direct all executive agencies to ignore the tainted Census data until a new Census is complete. States receive nearly $600 billion per year from 16 programs tied to Census data, & we won't allow a tainted Census to skew that.

If the Trump admin somehow manages to get that question back on the Census, I will cancel that rigged Census and replace it with a fair and accurate one. And I'll make this promise right now: A Warren administration would never include a citizenship question on the Census.

The Supreme Court's ruling blocking the citizenship question on the 2020 Census is a welcome relief—but the Court has left open the possibility that the Trump administration could still add a citizenship question to the Census. And if they do, I have a plan for that.

I'm done playing by a different set of rules. As president, I'll push to require states to use independent redistricting commissions to draw fair districts. And if Republicans keep standing in the way of fair elections, I'll push to end the filibuster.

Mitch McConnell says efforts to stop gerrymandering are "socialist". Chief Justice Roberts pays lip service to the idea that gerrymandering is bad—but then hands the keys to our democracy over to a bunch of cheats. Republicans are trying to rig the game, and they're winning.

The Supreme Court's decision is an abomination. Five Republican-appointed justices gave the green light to partisan gerrymandering—which lets Republicans pursue their extreme agenda without accountability to the people. It's bad for our democracy and we need to fight back.

You bet I have a plan to deal with Mitch McConnell. We need leadership from within our government—but we also need a grassroots movement to push from the outside and make Congress reflect the will of the people. And we have to get rid of the filibuster. #DemDebate
The economy is doing great for a thinner and thinner slice at the top. It’s time to build an economy that works for all of us. And I’ve got plans for that. #DemDebate

I spent a big chunk of my life studying why families go broke, and one of the top reasons is a medical emergency. That's not right. Our system is working for corporations making a profit, but not for families. That's why I'm fighting for #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate

I just stepped off the #DemDebate stage. I have a lot of plans for big, structural change, but we can only do this together. Chip in $3 or more before our big FEC deadline and help power our grassroots campaign.
I’m in this fight for a government and an economy that works for the people, not the rich and the powerful. I promise you this: I will fight for you as hard as I fight for my family. #DemDebate
No one should be above the law—that includes the president of the United States. I’ve got a plan to ensure that a sitting president can be held accountable for committing a crime. #DemDebate
The threat posed by climate change is real, it’s man-made, and we are running out of time. We need to take big, bold actions now—starting with the #GreenNewDeal. #DemDebate

We’re fighting for big, structural change to our economy, our government, and our democracy. And if Senate Republicans continue the same playbook of blocking legislation like they did with President Obama, I’ll get rid of the filibuster. #DemDebate

I have a LOT of plans—and you bet I have one to deal with Mitch McConnell. In the 2020 elections, we have to push from outside, have leadership on the inside, & make congress reflect the will of the people. The fight still goes on to make Congress work for the people. #DemDebate

Since running for president, I’ve answered thousands of questions. Earlier this month, a kid asked me, “What are you doing to keep children safe?” We need to fight this with every tool in the toolbox—that means treating it like the public health emergency that it is. #DemDebate
As president, I would make sure our country gets back on the 2015 Iran Deal. We can't afford another forever war, and I’m fighting to stop Donald Trump from dragging us into another one. #DemDebate

I went to the Homestead, FL detention center today. It’s hot and barren, with a completely enclosed fence. I saw children being marched from one building to another in single file lines. No laughing, no playing. These are children who are prisoners. #DemDebate

Every woman should have access to the full range of reproductive services, including safe, legal abortion. Most people in this country support #RoeVWade, and we need to make it the law. Here’s my plan to protect reproductive health. #DemDebate

Women’s rights are human rights. We need to:

✔ Protect #RoeVWade.
✔ End the #HydeAmendment.
✔ Defend #TitleX family planning funding.
✔ Ensure that #MedicareForAll includes contraception and abortion coverage.

 
#DemDebate
Yes, I would support government-run insurance. Health care is a basic human right, and we fight for basic human rights. We need #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate

I’ve spent my life studying why families go broke, and one of the biggest reasons is the cost of health care. Well, I'm tired of insurance companies getting rich while families get stretched to a breaking point. We need #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate

Some politicians say Medicare for All isn’t possible. What they’re really saying is that they don’t want to fight. Well, I do. Health care is a basic human right. We fight for basic human rights, and that’s why I’m fighting for #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate

As president, I will pursue an agenda of economic patriotism, using new and existing tools to defend and create quality American jobs and promote American industry. It's time to put American workers ahead of Wall Street bonuses and multinational profits.

There’s way too much consolidation in our economy. It hurts our workers, our entrepreneurs, our consumers, and our economy. I want to return the government to the people, and calling out the names of monopolies is saying that I have the courage to go after them. #DemDebate

Right now our economy is doing great for a thinner and thinner slice at the top. It’s not doing great for the rest of Americans. It’s corruption plain and simple—and we need to address it head on and make big, structural change to fight it. #DemDebate
I’m on my way to the first #DemDebate with Bruce and the team! I’m looking forward to talking about why I’m in this race and my plans for big, structural change.

Person to person, one dollar at a time, we’re building a grassroots movement. Our personal fundraising pages will make it easy to bring your friends and family into this fight! Here’s how to create your own:
I hope you’ll tune in at 9:00 PM ET tonight! #DemDebate
When women fight, women win. Congratulations, @CabanForQueens!

Homestead is hot and barren, with a completely enclosed fence. I saw children being marched from one building to another in single file lines. No laughing, no playing. These are children who are prisoners.

At Homestead, a young girl named Lea gave me a hand-written note. She wrote about the fear of losing her parents to deportation and asked me to fight for immigration reform.

No child should have to grow up with that fear. Lea, I promise: We’re in this fight together.

I went to the Homestead, FL detention center this morning to shine a light on what’s happening. There’s no place in this country for operating private prisons that profit off of cruelty. Detention centers like the one in Homestead should be shut down.

These are children—children. 

Mark Morgan’s racist comments disqualify him from leading @ICEGov.

.@ICEGov needs to answer for its misuse of solitary confinement. Immigrants in custody who are disabled or are sexual assault survivors may be especially in need of protection. Locking them up for at least 22 hours a day is cruel and unnecessary.

“They had been detained for weeks without access to soap, clean clothes or adequate food.”

This is inhumane. In a Warren administration, we will treat immigrant children with the dignity and respect they deserve.
There are a lot of different ways that we get in the fight. And one of them is that you show up. I'm at the Homestead detention center today and I hope you'll be watching.

A year ago today, SCOTUS made the wrong decision in upholding Donald Trump’s bigoted and xenophobic Muslim ban. We won’t forget and we won’t stop fighting until Muslims are treated with dignity and respect.

Yesterday at my town hall in Miami, I got asked an important question: Would I go to the Homestead detention center to shine a light on what's happening? The answer is yes. I'll be there today and I hope you'll join me.

The Mueller report made clear that the president obstructed justice multiple times. If he were anyone else, he'd be in handcuffs. Attorney General Barr can try to cover for the president all he wants, but the American people deserve to hear the full truth from Mueller himself.

At tonight's town hall in Miami, an audience member asked me to go to the Homestead detention center—where the Trump administration is holding immigrant children separated from their families—and shine a light on what's happening. I'll be there tomorrow—and I hope you'll join me.

One way I’m fighting is through my plan to end for-profit detention centers, which have made millions implementing Trump’s cruel immigration policies. Today 73% of detained immigrants are held in private detention facilities. Under my plan, we’ll end this.

Some politicians say Medicare for All isn’t possible. What they’re really saying is that they don’t want to fight. Well, I do. Health care is a basic human right. We fight for basic human rights, and that’s why I’m fighting for #MedicareForAll. #DemDebate

As president, I will pursue an agenda of economic patriotism, using new and existing tools to defend and create quality American jobs and promote American industry. It's time to put American workers ahead of Wall Street bonuses and multinational profits.

There’s way too much consolidation in our economy. It hurts our workers, our entrepreneurs, our consumers, and our economy. I want to return the government to the people, and calling out the names of monopolies is saying that I have the courage to go after them. #DemDebate

Right now our economy is doing great for a thinner and thinner slice at the top. It’s not doing great for the rest of Americans. It’s corruption plain and simple—and we need to address it head on and make big, structural change to fight it. #DemDebate

One way I’m fighting is through my plan to end for-profit detention centers, which have made millions implementing Trump’s cruel immigration policies. Today 73% of detained immigrants are held in private detention facilities. Under my plan, we’ll end this.

I saw the same thing at a @CBP processing center in McAllen, TX. I'll never forget listening to traumatized moms and children begging to be reunited. Let me make this clear: I'll never stop fighting Trump's cruel immigration policies.

This week marks a year since I visited the Port Isabel Reunification Center in Los Fresnos, TX to find out what was really happening to immigrant families ripped apart at our border. I saw right away: It wasn’t a unification center—it was a prison.

I agree with @JulianCastro: We shouldn't criminalize families trying to build a better future. We need comprehensive immigration reform that's in line with our values and creates a pathway to citizenship for undocumented immigrants, including our DREAMers.
Queens: I hope you make your voices heard today and vote for @CabanForQueens if you haven’t already! Polls are open until 9:00 PM ET.

I stand with the hundreds of @Wayfair employees who are planning to stage a walkout at their Boston headquarters tomorrow. The safety and well-being of immigrant children is always worth fighting for.
Amazon has too much power. Under my plan to #BreakUpBigTech, entrepreneurs would have a fighting chance to compete against tech giants.

My #UltraMillionaireTax is a two-cent tax on the 75,000 biggest fortunes in the country. We’d use it to pay for #UniversalChildCare, student loan debt relief, free public college, and a lot more. Here’s how it works.

The Trump administration’s treatment of the people of Puerto Rico continues to be a complete failure. Our government needs to follow through and provide the aid that is rightfully owed to the island immediately.
It’s time to make voting easy and convenient, stop racist voter suppression, and secure our elections. I've got a plan to protect our democracy.

Our democracy is too important for our elections to be under-resourced, undermined, and vulnerable. We need to do everything we can to make sure our elections are convenient, professional, and secure. Read my full plan here:

Finally, we'll provide incentives and resources for states to improve state elections—and where racist or corrupt politicians refuse to follow the law, the federal government will temporarily take over the administration of their federal elections to guarantee the right to vote.

Next, we'll establish federal standards to ensure everyone can vote, including mandating automatic and same-day registration, early voting, and vote by mail. No more arbitrary voter purges, registration issues, or gerrymandering. We'll make Election Day a national holiday.

I'll start by making sure federal elections get state-of-the-art machines, ballots, and security. We'll replace every voting machine in the country with state-of-the-art equipment and require adoption of a uniform federal ballot. And we'll make sure those systems are secure.

We need a constitutional amendment to guarantee the right to vote. But we can also take action now. The federal government has the power to regulate federal elections, secure our democracy, and put a stop to racist voter suppression.

Our elections are less secure than your Amazon account. They're under-resourced and undermined by partisan and racist officials who try to stop people from exercising their right to vote. We need to protect our democracy—and I’ve got a plan for that:
We have a plan for #UniversalChildCare—and a bill to make it happen. I’m glad we’re in this fight together, @Deb4CongressNM!
Our laws should reflect our values. A two-cent tax on the wealthiest 75,000 fortunes will help rebuild the middle class and give every family a shot at the American dream.

Donald Trump’s cruel threats of ICE raids are fear-mongering of the worst kind. In a Warren administration, we’ll protect immigrant families, fix our broken immigration system, and treat immigrant communities with dignity.
Private immigration detention centers are exploitation for profit, and I’m glad to see Illinois ban them. My plan to end private prisons would require the rest of the country to do the same.

My friend and colleague, Senator @JeanneShaheen, is a champion for working families in New Hampshire. Today a Republican opponent announced he’s running against Jeanne in 2020. We re-elected Jeanne in 2014, and we’ll do it again. Let’s help her win:

People are dying at our border: Moms, babies, families sacrificing everything. We need to fix the Trump administration’s hateful immigration policies that treat immigrants like animals. Immigrant families belong together and deserve to be treated with respect.

The cost of child care held me back until my Aunt Bee stepped in to help take care of Alex and Amelia. Today, it’s holding Amber and her family back. Every family should have access to high-quality, affordable child care. #UniversalChildCare

Together we can rebuild the middle class and make our economy work for the people—and I’ve got plans to actually make it happen. Will you chip in $3 to help build our grassroots operation across the country? Let’s dream big, fight hard, and win.

The 8 Mile Wall was built in the 1940s to separate Black families from white families. It’s a powerful reminder that Black Americans still feel the impact of generations of racist federal laws—and a reminder that our government needs to make it right.
When workers fight, workers win.

Our criminal justice system is broken—and race is right at the center of what's wrong. Black Americans are more likely to be arrested, wrongfully convicted, and serve longer sentences than white Americans. It’s time to end mass incarceration.
This is an attempt to block the young people at @IowaStateU from voting and making their voices heard. The HD46 special election should be held on a different Tuesday.
I was glad to celebrate with you, and I’m proud to fight alongside you for reproductive justice!

If we want to beat Donald Trump, we have to grow this grassroots movement. I'm not spending my time behind closed doors with millionaires—I'm doing town halls and talking with grassroots voters. I need you to be a part of this fight:
If you don’t want to take a bath, hide under the bed. No one will notice.

It wasn’t until marriage equality became law that gay & lesbian couples could jointly file tax returns—so they paid more in taxes. Our government owes them more than $50M for the years our discriminatory tax code left them out. We must right these wrongs.

Twenty years ago, SCOTUS made a landmark decision in #Olmstead v. L.C.: All people have a right to live a life of dignity and independence. Let’s recommit to fighting to see this promise truly fulfilled for the disability community.

Thank you @PPact for having me at today's #WeDecide Forum. It's time to go on the offense to protect #RoeVWade—and, in a Warren administration, we will defend and expand access to reproductive health care for everyone.
Thank you, @SenGillibrand!

I had a fabulous time at the @scdp convention! This election is about one fundamental question: Who does this government work for? Right now it's working great for a thinner and thinner slice at the top. I'm in this fight because I want to make government work for all of us.
Grateful for everyone who came out to the #ClyburnFishFry last night—I had a fantastic time. Thank you for welcoming us to South Carolina, Rep. Clyburn!
I’m so glad you listened! Bodie is adorable, and I know you two will be a great team.
Fun fact: Meryl Streep and I share a birthday down to the year. (One of us has won multiple Oscars. Hint: It was definitely not me.) Happy birthday, Meryl!
Thank you all so much! I couldn’t think of a better way to spend my birthday than by being out on the trail with all of you.

Happy #NationalSelfieDay! Want to grab a drink soon with Bruce and me? Make a donation of any amount and you’ll automatically be entered for the chance to win a trip to meet us. Of course, Bailey will be there too.
Welcome to the fight, Ella! I can tell she’s already dreaming big (and napping hard).

Extremist Republicans are afraid of young people and communities of color making their voices heard. It should be safe and easy to vote—that’s why I’m fighting for a constitutional amendment that guarantees the right to vote and to have that vote counted.

I do! My latest plan would ban all private prisons & detention facilities and stop companies from charging incarcerated & detained people for essential services, so we can finally put an end to private profiteering off of cruelty. Read all about it here:
.@NALEO is a powerful advocate for the Latino community and for making sure everyone’s voice is heard. Deeply grateful for our conversation this morning at #NALEOMiami!

Deporting hundreds of families—separating more children from their parents in the process—is inhumane. Our immigration policies should reflect America's values, not betray them. My administration will defend and protect immigrants and their families.

We need to face the systemic problems in our immigration system by providing a pathway to citizenship, protecting our #DREAMERs, and keeping families together. My new plan to shut down private prisons and detention facilities is a step in that direction. #NALEOMiami

It's not enough to say that we don't want conflict—we must make one less likely. Congress must make clear that war with Iran is not authorized. We should work with our allies to deescalate tensions and create space for diplomacy. We can't afford another forever war.

When it comes to the future of our country, it’s not a question of more government or less government. It’s about who government works for.

In a Warren administration, our government will work for the people.
In just a few minutes, I’ll be on the stage at #NALEOMiami. I hope you’ll tune in!

Washington hands billions to corporations profiting off of inhumane detention and incarceration policies while ignoring the families that are destroyed. It's corruption, plain and simple. Incarcerating and detaining millions for profit doesn’t keep us safe. We must do better.
Finally, I'll hold contractors accountable by expanding oversight, transparency and enforcement. It’s time to shine sunlight on the black box of private services that receive taxpayer dollars.

Next, I'll prohibit contractors from charging service fees for essential services, like phone calls, bank transfers, and health care. Companies shouldn’t be able to treat incarcerated individuals as captive profit centers.

First, I'll end all contracts between the Bureau of Prisons, ICE, and the U.S. Marshals Service and private detention providers. There should be no place in America for profiting off of putting more people behind bars or in detention.

The government has a basic responsibility to keep the people in its care safe—not to use their punishment and detention as an opportunity for profit. As president, I'll ban all private prisons and detention facilities:

Our criminal and immigration systems are tearing apart communities of color and devastating the poor, including children. Women—especially women of color—are particularly saddled with the financial burden.

And the exploitation doesn’t end when people leave these facilities. For-profit supervision companies (which are often run by the same private prison corporations) get rich by charging outrageous fees for monitoring and supervision services like ankle monitors.

The companies running prisons and detention centers regularly sacrifice safety to boost their bottom line. Private contractors in both public and private centers regularly cut corners to maximize margins and come up with schemes to make millions off of incarcerated people.

The private prison population has grown rapidly since 2000. And with Donald Trump in the White House, private prison companies saw an opportunity to make millions off of his cruel immigration policies. Today, 73% of detained immigrants are held in private detention facilities.
It was wonderful to speak with @RevJJackson about our vision for the future of this country and the big, structural change we need in order to make it a reality.

Private prison companies have spent millions to turn our criminal and immigration policies into ones that prioritize making them rich instead of keeping us safe—with terrible consequences. Today I’m announcing my plan to end this private profiteering off of cruelty.

Donald Trump promised to bring our troops home. Instead he has pulled out of a deal that was working and instigated another unnecessary conflict. There is no justification for further escalating this crisis—we need to step back from the brink of war.
Here's my big idea: I want to cancel student loan debt and provide universal free college. And we can pay for it all with my Ultra-Millionaire Tax.

This is what happens when the president of the United States picks a former big coal lobbyist to lead the @EPA. I’ve got not one but two plans to ensure that, in a Warren administration, we’ll make big, structural changes to protect our environment.
We’re ready to fight this with all we’ve got.
This is more than just a bad ruling—it’s condoning an ugly attack targeted at women with low incomes and women of color. We’ll fight this.

CA’s Student Borrower Bill of Rights will help thousands of students. I'll keep fighting to go a step further: Making public college free for all and canceling student debt for 95% of Americans who have it.

I already introduced the most sweeping plan since Watergate to root out corruption. And when it comes to national security, I went even further: A bill that would slam the revolving door between giant contractors and the Pentagon. Read more about it here:

Donald Trump named a former top @Raytheon executive to replace a former @Boeing executive at @DeptOfDefense. We need to call this out for what it is: A transition of power at the Pentagon from one huge defense contractor to another. #EndCorruptionNow
Thanks for fighting the good fight every day, Shannon. Together, we will end the gun violence epidemic in America.

Trump provoked this crisis, and his reckless foreign policy by tweet will only worsen it. I've co-sponsored legislation to prohibit a war with Iran. We need to de-escalate tensions—not let the war hawks in this administration drag us into conflict. #NoWarWithIran

This @UN investigation makes it clear: The Saudi Arabian government deliberately planned to murder @WashingtonPost journalist Jamal Khashoggi. He and his family deserve justice—but Donald Trump has done nothing to hold the Saudis accountable.

I'm glad to see the Oklahoma Supreme Court has upheld a petition allowing the people to vote on Medicaid expansion. Health care is a basic human right, and all Okies should be able to access health care.

A few months ago I met @Liat_RO, a public school science teacher and activist, at an organizing event in Brooklyn, NY. Liat gave me a great idea: The next Secretary of Education should be a former public school teacher. I agreed—and pledged to make it happen.

I’m glad to introduce the Refund Equality Act in the Senate. Our bill ensures legally-married, same-sex couples can claim the tax refunds they earned, but were denied before marriage equality was the law of the land.

I’ve got a plan:

✔ For Universal Child Care
✔ To break up Big Tech
✔ For student debt cancellation and free public college

And I’m just getting started! Donate $3 to help me keep the momentum going and meet our FEC fundraising deadline.

America needs to face the things we’ve done wrong and take steps towards making it right. My housing plan creates a first-of-its-kind down-payment assistance program to help Black and Brown families living in formerly redlined neighborhoods buy a home.

On #Juneteenth, I’m thinking about how our country needs big, structural change to confront the oppression that Black Americans still face today. Black lives matter, Black citizens matter, Black families matter.
Our country must confront the impact that generations of slavery and racist policies still have on Black Americans. I support legislation to study and develop plans for reparations.

It’s long past time to bring our troops home, and Congress should always have a vigorous and very public debate before sending our troops into harm's way. I support @BLeeForCongress's amendment to repeal the current AUMF and help #EndForeverWar.
