Right now, the average cost of child care for one child can take up to 36% of a family’s total income. My plan for #UniversalChildCare would make child care free for millions of families and affordable for everyone.
This is exactly right. Congress should pass new federal laws that protect access to reproductive health care for everyone.

Facebook has too much power and a terrible track record when it comes to protecting our private information. We need to hold them accountable—not give them the chance to access even more user data. #BreakUpBigTech
Woo-hoo! I’m deeply grateful that you’re part of this fight. One by one, we’re going to return the power to the people and win in 2020. #NVertheless

I’m proud to endorse Tiffany Cabán for Queens DA in New York. @CabanForQueens will fight for working families and work to end mass incarceration. Make sure you get out and vote for Tiffany next Tuesday, June 25th. In the meantime, head to   to volunteer!

We need the people making investment decisions to look like the rest of America. That’s why I have a new plan: A Small Business Equity Fund to help close the startup capital gap for entrepreneurs of color.

Juneteenth isn’t just about celebrating the end of slavery in Texas. It’s a necessary reminder that 154 years later, Black Americans still feel the harsh reality that the fight for racial equality in our country is far from over. I’m in that fight all the way.
Donald Trump’s treatment of those seeking a better life in our country is inhumane. Make no mistake: In a Warren administration, we will defend and protect immigrants and their families.

#UniversalChildCare is personal for me. I struggled to find care for my babies—until my Aunt Bee stepped in. Not everyone is lucky enough to have an Aunt Bee, and this plan is for them. Try my calculator to see how much you'd save under my plan.

I’ve got a plan—and now a bill—for #UniversalChildCare. Today, Rep. @Deb4CongressNM and I introduced a new proposal that would make high-quality, affordable child care a reality for every family in America.

At @UniteThePoor’s #PPCMoralCongress yesterday, I talked with @RevDrBarber and Rev. @LizTheo about how @TeamWarren is building a grassroots operation across the country. I’ve been to 20 states and Puerto Rico—and we’re just getting started!
I’m fighting for @CDCgov funding to study gun violence alongside @BradyBuzz and @AMarch4OurLives. #WeNeedToKnow how to end the gun violence epidemic in our country once and for all.

If you’re getting crushed by student loan debt, there’s a good chance our new bill will help. Use my calculator to see how much of your debt would get canceled under the Warren-Clyburn proposal:   #CancelMyDebt

My new plan with Rep. James Clyburn:

✅ Cancels student loan debt for more than 95% of people who carry it
✅Wipes out *all* debt for more than 75% of people who carry it 

It’s the big, structural change that our economy and our students need.

Part of confronting America’s racial wealth gap is acknowledging the role that our federal government played in keeping Black and Brown Americans from home ownership. That’s why my plan for fair housing provides assistance for families living in formerly redlined areas.

Health care is a basic human right, but right now our health care is under attack. The rules are written in favor of Big Pharma and health insurance executives—while rural communities get kicked to the curb. Time for #MedicareForAll.

I hope Iran chooses a different path. But let's be clear: Trump provoked this crisis. He has no strategy to contain it, he's burned through our friends and allies, and now he's doubling down on military force. We can't afford another forever war.

I don’t spend time at fancy fundraisers. Instead, I spend my time meeting voters and thanking grassroots donors who chip in what they can. Donate $3 to my campaign, and you might just get a call from me to thank you!

It was never about a cake—it’s about making sure no one has a license to discriminate against LGBTQ+ Americans. The lower court needs to make the right decision, and until then, we’ll keep fighting for equal rights.
Deeply saddened by the loss of my friend Frank LaMere. Frank was a longtime @DNC member and @WinnebagoTribe activist, and I’m going to miss him.

We’re in the fight for racial and economic justice. Thank you @RevDrBarber and Rev. @LizTheo for a powerful conversation at the #PPCMoralCongress!
I agree with @IAmJohnOliver: No president is above the law. Congress should do its job and begin impeachment proceedings.
At the #BlackPresidentialForum this weekend, we talked about how discrimination was actively fostered by the U.S. government—and how I have multiple plans to close the racial wealth gap.
I’m still heartsick for the lives we lost that day. In a Warren administration, we will use the Justice Department to end the rise of white supremacy.

It’s an honor to fight for economic justice alongside @RevDrBarber and Rev. @LizTheo! Looking forward to the @UniteThePoor’s #PPCMoralCongress today and discussing how we can overcome systemic racism and inequality. Tune in at 4:00 PM ET to watch:

We can end the student loan debt crisis that’s crushing millions of Americans—and we can make universal free college a reality. Will you become a citizen co-sponsor of Rep. James Clyburn’s and my bill to solve the student loan debt crisis? #CancelMyDebt

We can’t build a future by crushing the dreams and hopes of our young people. That's why Rep. James Clyburn and I introduced a bill to cancel up to $50,000 of your student loan debt, so that you can achieve your goals and dreams. #CancelMyDebt

For far too long the American Dream has been out of reach for Black business owners. I've got a plan to fix that, starting with a $7 billion dollar fund to help them start and grow their own small businesses. #BlackPresidentialForum
I hope you’ll read this powerful story from my friend, @AdyBarkan. We need #MedicareForAll—and you bet I’m fighting for it all the way.
I knew my father always had my back. He wanted to make sure I could chase after my dreams. Here’s why I wouldn’t be here today if my daddy hadn’t pushed open a door so I could have a fighting chance.

Happy Father’s Day to all the dads who are fighting for their children’s futures—and who set the example every day of what it means to care for the people you love. My daddy was a cool guy. He taught me to dream big and fight hard, and I wish I could call him today.

Dana Martin. Ashanti Carmon. Claire Legato. Muhlaysia Booker. Paris Cameron. Michelle “Tamika” Washington. Chynal Lindsey. Jazzaline Ware. Chanel Scurlock. And now Zoe Spears. The murder of Black trans women is a crisis. We’ll fight this, and we will continue to say their names.

Today seven years ago, President @BarackObama implemented #DACA to give a generation of immigrants a chance to build a future in the country they call home. I will #DefendDACA and keep standing up to Donald Trump’s cruel attacks on immigrant communities.
My new plan will create jobs, spur economic growth, and move us closer to an America where everyone has a fair shot to succeed.
It should be quick and easy to join a union. Let’s keep up this fight so casino workers in Nevada and across the country have the right to unionize and collectively bargain. #FightFor15
We need to do better by America’s workers—and that means economic justice. I’m in the #FightFor15 because we need to make living wages a reality.
My friend @JasonKander is a powerful advocate for our veterans and breaking down the stigma around PTSD. Thank you for your bravery, Jason.
Every American should have a fair shot at starting a small business—but today, the playing field is tilted against Black and Brown entrepreneurs. My new plan would put an end to that.

My first Democratic presidential primary debate is on Wednesday, June 26 on @NBCNews—and I can’t wait to discuss my plans for big, structural change. Will you chip in $3 now to keep up the momentum before June 26?

Jared Kushner is a walking conflict of interest. After he failed to fully divest from his family’s real estate empire, Freddie Mac is now guaranteeing Kushner Cos. an $800 million loan. We need answers on whether his company got special treatment.

Let’s fight hard and #FlipVABlue, together!

If you have good ideas and work hard, you should be able to build a small business and make a living. Black and Brown entrepreneurs are held back by a start-up capital gap that makes it harder to start and grow their business. I've got a plan to fix that.
I’d love to grab a drink and chat with you. Donate here to be automatically entered—and I hope I’ll see you soon!

I’m looking forward to the first debate of the Democratic presidential primary on Wednesday, June 26 on @NBCNews and having an opportunity to discuss my plans for big, structural change in this country. Let’s dream big, fight hard, and win!
Don’t take the selfie without me!

I’m relieved that the governor of Puerto Rico has requested that this bill, which would allow religious freedom to be used as an excuse to discriminate against the LGBTQ+ community, be withdrawn. Now let's keep fighting for the LGBTQ+ community.

The Small Business Equity Fund will create jobs, spur economic growth, and move us closer to an America where everyone has a fair shot to succeed. And the entire cost of this plan will be paid for by my Ultra-Millionaire Tax. Read my full plan here:

This tilts the field against entrepreneurs of color. So I plan to address this disparity head on too. I will require states and cities administering my new Fund to work with diverse investment managers—putting $7 billion in the hands of minority-and women-owned managers.

But even if we fully close the startup capital gap, deep systemic issues will continue to tilt the playing field. 86% of venture capitalists are white, and studies show that investors are more likely to partner with entrepreneurs who look like them.

$7 billion ensures that if Black, Latinx, & Native American entrepreneurs start businesses at the same rate as white entrepreneurs, we could fully close the startup capital gap for the next ten years—supporting over 100,000 new businesses and 1.1 million new jobs.

As president, I will launch a $7 billion Small Business Equity Fund to provide grants to entrepreneurs—not loans or loan guarantees. Loans aren’t as good as equity because they leave businesses with debt when they’re trying to grow. Equity helps businesses thrive from the start.

That disparity in startup capital is creating a small business gap that costs us millions of jobs & billions in economic growth. And it's another example of how the racial wealth gap in America hurts Black, Latinx, Native American, and other minority families & communities.

On average, Black, Latinx, Native American, and other minority households have significantly less wealth than white households. So they have less to put into their small businesses, and less collateral to get outside credit.

The racial wealth gap tilts the playing field against entrepreneurs of color, holding back our economy. The government helped create that wealth gap, and the government has an obligation to address it. I have a new plan to tackle it head on.
Thank you, @EdOfTheNotch. I’m honored to have your support.

Mueller’s statement made clear what those of us who have read his report already knew: He’s referring Trump for impeachment. Yesterday, Trump said—once again—that he’d take information from a foreign government. It’s up to Congress to act.

A hostile foreign government interfered in the 2016 election, and Trump welcomed their help. Now Trump says he’ll welcome that help again. I've said it before, and I'll say it again: We have a constitutional responsibility to begin impeachment proceedings.

This bill is an important first step. But we can't let future generations be trapped by another student debt crisis. That's why I've also got a plan to provide universal free public college for all. Read all about it here:
You can use my student debt calculator to find out how much you could save if we pass the Warren-Clyburn proposal:

We'll free up an entire generation so that they can buy homes, launch businesses, and start their families. And our bill will also provide an enormous middle-class stimulus and reduce the racial wealth gap.
Let’s fight hard and #FlipVABlue, together!

If you have good ideas and work hard, you should be able to build a small business and make a living. Black and Brown entrepreneurs are held back by a start-up capital gap that makes it harder to start and grow their business. I've got a plan to fix that.
I’d love to grab a drink and chat with you. Donate here to be automatically entered—and I hope I’ll see you soon!

I’m looking forward to the first debate of the Democratic presidential primary on Wednesday, June 26 on @NBCNews and having an opportunity to discuss my plans for big, structural change in this country. Let’s dream big, fight hard, and win!
Don’t take the selfie without me!

I’m relieved that the governor of Puerto Rico has requested that this bill, which would allow religious freedom to be used as an excuse to discriminate against the LGBTQ+ community, be withdrawn. Now let's keep fighting for the LGBTQ+ community.

The Small Business Equity Fund will create jobs, spur economic growth, and move us closer to an America where everyone has a fair shot to succeed. And the entire cost of this plan will be paid for by my Ultra-Millionaire Tax. Read my full plan here:

A hostile foreign government interfered in the 2016 election, and Trump welcomed their help. Now Trump says he’ll welcome that help again. I've said it before, and I'll say it again: We have a constitutional responsibility to begin impeachment proceedings.

This bill is an important first step. But we can't let future generations be trapped by another student debt crisis. That's why I've also got a plan to provide universal free public college for all. Read all about it here:
You can use my student debt calculator to find out how much you could save if we pass the Warren-Clyburn proposal:

We'll free up an entire generation so that they can buy homes, launch businesses, and start their families. And our bill will also provide an enormous middle-class stimulus and reduce the racial wealth gap.
Our bill will cancel student loan debt for more than 95% of Americans who carry it, and wipe out student loan debt entirely for more than 75% of Americans with that debt.

Student loan debt is crushing an entire generation. That’s why Rep. James Clyburn—who has always been a leader on economic justice issues—and I are introducing a truly transformational bill to cancel up to $50,000 in student loan debt for 42 million Americans. #CancelMyDebt
This made me laugh. (You’re fine, Varsha!) It was great chatting with you.

Health care is a basic human right—and we fight for basic human rights. When I lead the Democratic Party, we will be a party that says: We’re the wealthiest nation in the history of the world, so yes, we can afford #MedicareForAll.

Massachusetts has always been a leader in the fight for quality, affordable health care, and I was proud to lend my support to their fight for Medicare for All. Now let's get this done for everyone across the country.

The #MuellerReport made it clear: A foreign government attacked our 2016 elections to support Trump, Trump welcomed that help, and Trump obstructed the investigation. Now, he said he'd do it all over again. It's time to impeach Donald Trump.

Trump’s companies continue to take money from foreign governments with business before his White House. This reeks of corruption. My #EndCorruptionNow bill would make these conflicts of interest illegal.

This is just another petty, cruel way for the Trump administration to signal they won't support or defend LGBTQ+ communities at home or abroad. We should fly the Pride flag proudly—and take real, meaningful actions to bolster & protect LGBTQ+ civil rights.

My heart is with the people of Hong Kong as they fight for their freedoms and the rule of law, even in the face of violence from their own government. The United States will always stand with those who stand up for democracy and human rights around the world.
No one should be afraid to be who they are at work. That's why I've co-sponsored the Equality Act in the Senate—and I urge my colleagues to join me in voting for it.

When 49 people were murdered at Pulse three years ago, it was an attack on our LGBTQ+ and Latinx communities. Today I’m remembering the victims and their loved ones, and I promise to #HonorThemWithAction by continuing to fight for #GunReformNow.
Running for president: That’s what girls do. I’m glad to have you both in this fight, Tracy!
Religious freedom cannot be used as an excuse to discriminate against the LGBTQ+ community. Everyone deserves to live and love freely—no exceptions.

Right now, America’s foreign policies work great for the rich and powerful but fail everyone else. We need to recognize that policies that undermine working families in this country also erode America’s strength in the world. As president, I’ll change that.

Our environment is in crisis—but I have a plan. My Green Manufacturing Plan helps our planet and creates over a million new green jobs. Will you chip in $3 to help keep up the momentum and turn this plan into reality?
My plan would provide thousands of families with a real chance to buy a home — the same opportunities the government denied to previous generations of residents of the area.

My housing plan creates a first-of-its-kind down-payment assistance program. First-time homebuyers who live in formerly redlined neighborhoods or communities that were segregated by law and are currently low-income are eligible for assistance.

The legacy of our federal government’s racist redlining policies still hurts Black and Brown families. The gap between white homeownership and Black homeownership rates today is about 30% — bigger than it was in 1960 when housing discrimination was legal.

I grew up on the ragged edge of the middle class. My daddy ended up as a janitor and my mother worked the phones at Sears. We didn’t have much money—but like millions of other families, we got by. Today I’m in this fight to make our government and economy work for working people.
Tech entrepreneurs should have a fighting chance to compete against giants like Amazon, Google, and Facebook. My plan to #BreakUpBigTech is good for small businesses and good for our economy.
Our bill will cancel student loan debt for more than 95% of Americans who carry it, and wipe out student loan debt entirely for more than 75% of Americans with that debt.

We’re looking for fired-up supporters to host #WinWithWarren debate watch parties—I hope you’ll considering hosting one!
Tomorrow is Primary Day in Virginia! I hope the people of Virginia head to the polls and make their voices heard. Find your polling place here:

I'm in this fight for our children's futures—starting with #UniversalChildCare and early education for all of our kids, paid for with a tax on the richest 0.1% of Americans. Chip in $3, or whatever you can, to help fight for big, structural change.

Saudi Arabia’s coalition has killed Yemeni civilians with bombs stamped Made in America. Now the White House is handing over sensitive smart bomb technology to Saudi Arabia. Enough. Time to end support for this cruel and senseless war.
Our government is failing those who have risked everything for a shot at a better life in our country. This is inhumane and we need answers—now.
Thank you @IowaDemocrats for a great Hall of Fame event!

Stopped by a #WinWithWarren organizing house party in Waterloo yesterday afternoon to thank grassroots @teamwarren supporters. From tackling climate change and flooding head on, to doing right by our farmers, I’m in this fight all the way.

For me, this fight is personal. From #UniversalChildCare to free public college, I’ve got plans to level the playing field for working families. With @iowademocrats and grassroots supporters across the country, we’ll turn those plans into big, structural change.
Running for president: That's what women do!

Loopholes, deductions, exemptions. There are lots of benefits to being a corporation like Amazon—which made over $10 billion in profits and paid $0 in federal corporate income taxes last year. My Real Corporate Profits Tax would make corporations like Amazon pay their fair share.

Today I'm thinking about the people marching in the National Puerto Rican Day Parade. We need leadership that puts the interests of all U.S. citizens—including our fellow citizens in Puerto Rico—ahead of Wall Street’s profit margins.
Last week when I was in Michigan, I rolled out a new plan to fight climate change and create over a million new jobs. Read more about my Green Manufacturing Plan here.

I didn’t march in last year’s @bostonpride Parade—I danced! The whole march is a celebration of unity and love, and a chance to recommit to fighting like hell for LGBTQ+ equality. Happy Pride, Boston! #WickedProud #BostonPride

I’m proud that Massachusetts was the first state to make marriage equality the law of the land—and I’m deeply grateful every time I get to march in the @bostonpride parade. Though I’m not there in person this year, I’m fighting alongside you today and every day! #WickedProud

I got an important question in Lansing earlier this week. On #NationalGunViolenceAwarenessDay, and every day, I’m fighting my heart out to end the gun violence epidemic in this country and fight the @NRA’s influence on our government.

Here’s what my Green Manufacturing Plan would do:

✅Make a real investment in science
✅Commit $1.5 trillion to our federal government to buy American and buy green
✅Develop and manufacture American products here to sell all around the world

Payday lenders spent buckets of money on Trump's campaign and properties. Then Trump's @CFPB director, Kathy Kraninger, did the predatory payday lending industry a huge favor by rolling back important regulations. It's corruption, plain and simple.
When I was in Michigan this week, I met a lot of young people who were fired up and ready to fight for big, structural change. I’m glad to see Michigan make it easier for college students to vote!

Trump's former chief of staff played a huge role in the inhumane family separation policy. Now John Kelly's joining the board of a company that runs Homestead, the largest detention center for migrant kids. Rep. @PramilaJayapal and I are demanding answers.
I’m deeply grateful for your support, Rod!

I’m grateful to fight alongside this team every day and celebrate #Pride with them all month long!

We had a great organizing event in Detroit earlier this week, and one of the best parts was receiving more notes from people in the selfie line! I love reading about what gets people into this fight for big, structural change.

Ninety-five town halls completed, 28,000 pictures taken, 425 audience questions answered—and we’re just getting started. Thank you to everyone who tuned in or showed up to our #WarrenTownHall last night!
The Hyde Amendment limits women's access to safe, legal abortion—particularly women of color.  It’s time for Hyde to go.

I'm in the fight for reproductive rights all the way. We need to:

✅End the #HydeAmendment and Trump’s gag rule
✅Pass the EACH Woman Act 
✅Ensure that #MedicareForAll includes contraception and abortion coverage
✅Defend #TitleX family planning funding

Thank you to the community of Elkhart for an inspiring organizing event yesterday. I’m grateful down to my toes to have you in this fight, and I’ll never stop fighting for new, good jobs in Indiana and across the country.

Here’s what really troubles me: The Trump administration keeps trying to deny science across the board. At our #WarrenTownHall, I made it clear: Climate change is one of the biggest crises we face, and we need to make big, structural changes in order to address it head on.
To me, this is what leadership is about: You start with what you believe is right, and you get out there and fight for it.

On today's #DDay75thAnniversary, we remember the courage and sacrifice of those who fought to liberate Europe and secure the world's freedom. We honor them by fighting to make the world a better and more just place, today and every day.

My campaign has submitted their support to join @IBEW 2320. Every worker who wants to join a union, bargain collectively, & make their voice heard should have a chance to do so. The labor movement has long fought for the dignity of working people, & we’re proud to be part of it.
Of course I stayed for selfies after our #WarrenTownHall! I’m deeply grateful for everyone who tuned in.

Gov. Inslee is exactly right. Climate change is the biggest challenge we face. Every candidate running for president should have a serious set of policies to address it, and should be eager to defend those proposals in a debate.
The Hyde Amendment harms the most vulnerable women and limits their ability to safely access abortion. It's time for Hyde to go. #WarrenTownHall

I’m here because I’m a fighter. We can give up or we can get in this fight together. That’s how we’re going to build our grassroots movement, win in 2020, and make big, structural change. Will you chip in $3 to our Official 2020 campaign? #WarrenTownHall
Mueller’s statement made clear what those of us who have read his report already knew: He’s referring President Trump for impeachment, and it’s up to Congress to act. And they should. #WarrenTownHall

If we want good jobs in our country, then we need stronger unions and more power in the hands of the people. It should be quick and easy to join a union. Unions built the middle class, and unions will rebuild the middle class. #WarrenTownHall

When our country went to the moon, we did it by investing in science, innovation, and our workers. That’s what we need to do right now to make the #GreenNewDeal a reality. Read more about how my Green Manufacturing Plan would help us get there.

In 2005, millions of families were at the edge: Losing their jobs, homes, and savings. Meanwhile credit card companies wanted to wring every last dime out of them. I got in the fight all the way for those families because you don’t get what you don’t fight for. #WarrenTownHall

Here’s the deal: Our opioid crisis is getting worse. We need big, structural change to address it. My opioid plan with Rep. Elijah Cummings includes $100 billion to hit this opioid epidemic head on and bring it to its knees. Let’s save the people we love. #WarrenTownHall

The immoral Hyde Amendment should not be the law. I’ll fight like hell to overturn it. Every time we deny women access to safe, legal abortion, we put their lives in danger. #WarrenTownHall

We’re in Fort Wayne tonight because the people of Indiana know we need an economy that works not just for the people at the top, but for everyone. We need our economy and government to work for the people—and that’s what we’re fighting to do. #WarrenTownHall
In just a few minutes, I’ll be live from Fort Wayne, Indiana at our @MSNBC town hall! I hope you’ll tune in. #WarrenTownHall
Don’t forget to tune in!
YAY, my @teamwarren Pride merch is here! Looking forward to wearing this shirt all #PrideMonth long.

Yesterday in Lansing, we talked about how we need to defend and create American jobs—not cater to the interests of Wall Street. My Green Manufacturing Plan would create over a million good, new jobs that will help working families in Michigan and across the country.

Roe v. Wade has been the law of the land for over 46 years—but that isn’t stopping extreme lawmakers who are closer than ever to outlawing safe, legal abortion. Read more about my plan for Congressional action to protect choice:
Our second @MSNBC town hall is tonight—see you soon, @chrislhayes! Tune in at 8 PM ET to watch me answer questions live from Fort Wayne, Indiana about the future of our country. #WarrenTownHall
Yay—William guessed that it was me on the first try! This is how I’m doing “call time” on our grassroots campaign: On the phone with grassroots donors, not at swanky fundraisers.
This is a big win for Nevada, and I’m glad to see state employees organize and make their voices heard. Unions built the middle class and unions will rebuild the middle class.

Right now, Washington is broken. But I still believe in Bobby Kennedy’s ripple of hope. I believe that history is shaped from numberless diverse acts of courage. And you bet I’ll keep fighting for a better America.

But that promise isn’t gone. It’s not gone in the eyes of the people I meet who remember Bobby’s presidential campaign in 1968. And it’s not gone in the millions of people who still believe that we can build a better future for our children and grandchildren.

I remember how, when Bobby Kennedy was assassinated 51 years ago today, the promise of a better America seemed to vanish. Our country continued down a dangerous road where the rich got richer, and everyone else got left behind.

Grateful down to my toes for the fired-up, grassroots supporters at our organizing event in Detroit today. Together we can level the playing field for working families in Michigan and across the country.
I’m glad to see House Democrats pass a Dream Act with 237 votes today. Now the Senate needs to do its job and pass the #DreamAndPromiseNow act.

As we celebrate 100 years of the #19thAmendment, we recommit to fighting the systemic barriers that have disenfranchised women of color for generations. Let’s start with a constitutional amendment guaranteeing the right to vote for everyone.
My Green Manufacturing Plan is a win for our planet, our workers, and our economy. Here’s how it works.
With big and bold investments in research, our industries, and our workers, we can lead the global effort to combat climate change—and create more than a million good jobs here at home.
This is sickening. Children belong with their families, period. We need answers on the Trump administration’s appalling practices at the border. And we need them now.

You can’t just wave your arms and make jobs happen. You have to have a plan—and I do. My Green Manufacturing Plan would create more than a million new, good jobs on which people can build a future. We need to do right by workers in Indiana and across the country. #WarrenTownHall
The immoral Hyde Amendment should not be the law. I’ll fight like hell to overturn it. Every time we deny women access to safe, legal abortion, we put their lives in danger. #WarrenTownHall

We’re in Fort Wayne tonight because the people of Indiana know we need an economy that works not just for the people at the top, but for everyone. We need our economy and government to work for the people—and that’s what we’re fighting to do. #WarrenTownHall
In just a few minutes, I’ll be live from Fort Wayne, Indiana at our @MSNBC town hall! I hope you’ll tune in. #WarrenTownHall
Don’t forget to tune in!
YAY, my @teamwarren Pride merch is here! Looking forward to wearing this shirt all #PrideMonth long.

Yesterday in Lansing, we talked about how we need to defend and create American jobs—not cater to the interests of Wall Street. My Green Manufacturing Plan would create over a million good, new jobs that will help working families in Michigan and across the country.

Roe v. Wade has been the law of the land for over 46 years—but that isn’t stopping extreme lawmakers who are closer than ever to outlawing safe, legal abortion. Read more about my plan for Congressional action to protect choice:
Our second @MSNBC town hall is tonight—see you soon, @chrislhayes! Tune in at 8 PM ET to watch me answer questions live from Fort Wayne, Indiana about the future of our country. #WarrenTownHall
Yay—William guessed that it was me on the first try! This is how I’m doing “call time” on our grassroots campaign: On the phone with grassroots donors, not at swanky fundraisers.
This is a big win for Nevada, and I’m glad to see state employees organize and make their voices heard. Unions built the middle class and unions will rebuild the middle class.

Right now, Washington is broken. But I still believe in Bobby Kennedy’s ripple of hope. I believe that history is shaped from numberless diverse acts of courage. And you bet I’ll keep fighting for a better America.

But that promise isn’t gone. It’s not gone in the eyes of the people I meet who remember Bobby’s presidential campaign in 1968. And it’s not gone in the millions of people who still believe that we can build a better future for our children and grandchildren.

I remember how, when Bobby Kennedy was assassinated 51 years ago today, the promise of a better America seemed to vanish. Our country continued down a dangerous road where the rich got richer, and everyone else got left behind.

Grateful down to my toes for the fired-up, grassroots supporters at our organizing event in Detroit today. Together we can level the playing field for working families in Michigan and across the country.
I’m glad to see House Democrats pass a Dream Act with 237 votes today. Now the Senate needs to do its job and pass the #DreamAndPromiseNow act.

With big and bold investments in research, our industries, and our workers, we can lead the global effort to combat climate change—and create more than a million good jobs here at home.
This is sickening. Children belong with their families, period. We need answers on the Trump administration’s appalling practices at the border. And we need them now.
Glad to stand with you in this fight. Together, we can save our planet.
America’s public school teachers deserve more respect. I stand with @WeAreNHTA and our teachers in California who are fighting for higher pay. #WeAreCTA

I’m praying for Johana Medina Leon and her loved ones. Not a single person should die in ICE custody. We need to call out the number of trans women of color who’ve died under ICE custody, and we need answers.

Today, I took @DemRedistrict’s pledge to support fair districts and end partisan gerrymandering. I’m with @EricHolder all the way. The power belongs to the people, and voters should choose their representatives—not the other way around. #FairMaps

Some big, “American” companies will ship jobs overseas and hollow out our cities if it'll save them a nickel. And many already have. I've got a plan to make sure a Warren administration will defend and create good American jobs.

My green manufacturing plan rewards American companies who invest at home. It's funded by my Real Corporate Profits Tax on giant companies who try to dodge their fair share in taxes. It'll create 1M new jobs & make the U.S. the leader in the global fight against climate change.

Third, a Green Marshall Plan. The government will use all its tools to boost American industry and cut global emissions abroad. We will deploy U.S.-manufactured clean energy technology to every corner of the world, and I'll commit at least $100 billion to do it.

Second: a Green Industrial Mobilization. I'll commit $1.5 trillion to buy clean, renewable, and emission-free energy products, supporting only American companies who manufacture here at home and treat workers with respect, to boost demand and galvanize our clean energy industry.

My green manufacturing plan has three parts. First: A Green Apollo Program, investing $400 billion in a National Institute of Clean Energy to invest in revolutionary clean energy tech. And I will require that production from this R&D takes place here in the U.S.—no excuses.

With bold investments, we can fight climate change, achieve the ambitious targets of the Green New Deal, and create more than a million good jobs here at home. I have a plan to invest at least $2 trillion in green research, manufacturing, and exporting:

This is not a question of more or less government: It’s about who the government works for. And in the weeks ahead, I’ll be releasing more plans on how this vision of economic patriotism should shape our economy, from trade policy to Wall Street. Here's my first proposal:

My administration will boost American workers—and I've already got a plan for that. We'll start with a new federal agency with one mission: Defend & create American jobs. That agency will use aggressive new tools to boost American workers, not Wall Street.

Giant companies who like to call themselves "American" have one real loyalty: Their shareholders. They'll ship jobs overseas and hollow out our cities if it'll save them a nickel. For too long, Washington politicians have let them call the shots. But not on my watch.
As the holy month of Ramadan ends, Bruce and I wish a joyous Eid al-Fitr to all Muslims celebrating in the United States and around the world. Eid Mubarak!

How are giant corporations getting away with this? Because the #GOPTaxScam lowered their effective tax rate to the lowest it’s been since 1947. My Real Corporate Profits Tax would make sure the biggest and most profitable corporations pay their fair share.

Our new campaign account just launched! My team wants to make it easier for our grassroots community to stay connected and get the latest on our plans for big, structural change. Give @teamwarren a follow and help spread the word.
I’m glad to see Illinois take a stand for women’s reproductive health care. Now, we need Congress to pass new federal laws that protect access to reproductive care across the country.

Amber pays $1,150 a month for child care, and it’s holding her family back. Her family is one of the reasons why I’m fighting for #UniversalChildCare: High-quality child care that’s free for millions of families and affordable for everyone.
Just got back from California and my pick up at the airport included a very sweet boy.
Thanks, Ashlee! I loved our conversation, and I’m grateful down to my toes that you’re in this fight.
Glad to stand with you in this fight. Together, we can save our planet.

We’ve got to do better for moms like Jennifer. Read more about my plan for #UniversalChildCare here:
If Donald Trump were anyone other than the President of the United States right now, he’d be in handcuffs and indicted. My new plan would actually hold presidents accountable for violating the law.
Thank you for fighting hard and living proud. Happy #PrideMonth!
I’ve answered 414 town hall questions since launching our campaign—and I’m looking forward to answering some more at our @MSNBC town hall with @chrislhayes this Wednesday. I hope you’ll tune in!

The time for small ideas is over. Big problems call for big solutions. If we’re going to save our democracy, clean up the corruption in Washington, and build an economy that works for all of us, then we need big, structural changes. And yeah, I have a plan for that.

Here’s the thing: When a candidate tells you about all the things that aren’t possible, about how political calculations come first, they’re telling you something very important. They’re telling you that they will not fight for you. Not me. I’m here to fight for our country.

#PrideMonth is a celebration. And it’s a time to remember the trailblazers who fought for LGBTQ+ civil rights. Today—and every day—we renew our commitment to fight until everyone can live proudly, without fear. I’ll be right there alongside you. Happy #Pride!

The barriers holding back the floodwaters failed, and the building in downtown Burlington where we filmed this video is now flooded. The impact of climate change in our country is real and we need to take action—now.
Our country is in a time of crisis—the time for small ideas is over. That's why I'm fighting for big, structural change. #CADem19
I'll be live soon at @MoveOn's #BigIdeas Forum to talk about how we're going to build big, structural change. Tune in!

When I lead the Democratic Party, we will not be a party that nibbles around the edges. We will be a party of bold, structural change—and that doesn’t happen on its own. We need to dream big and fight hard because the rich and powerful aren’t giving up anything without a fight.
What an amazing night, Oakland! We’re going to do this together.
This is what keeps me going: The energy of our grassroots supporters in Oakland and across the country. When we dream big and fight hard we can win in 2020. Let's do this together!
Last night I got my 25,000th selfie—and it was a pinky promise! We’re going to dream big, fight hard, and win.
Thank you for waiting!

We are live in Oakland, California talking with our grassroots supporters about how we can make big, structural change together.
I’m heartsick and praying for the victims and their loved ones. Eleven people should not have been murdered today. How many lives will it take before Congress acts to end this crisis?

Glad to see Colorado—and Maine—officially ban cruel conversion therapy this week. LGBTQ+ Americans should feel free to be who they are and live without fear or discrimination. I won’t stop fighting for them.

This is a win—but safe, legal abortion access for women in Missouri and across the country is still under attack. Extreme lawmakers are hell-bent on overturning #RoeVWade, and it’s more important than ever that we make our voices heard and #StopTheBans.

I’m the daughter of a janitor (yup, that baby is me) who went on to become a candidate for president. Our campaign is fighting to build opportunity for our kids. Try our new calculator and find out how my #UniversalChildCare plan would help your family:
I’m running to be the first woman president—but this campaign wouldn’t be possible without the terrific and talented women on our team. Honored to be fighting alongside you, @FarrellGabriell!

A California “Student Borrower Bill Of Rights” is a terrific idea! And we can help our students in all 50 states even more by making public college free and canceling student debt for 95% of Americans.
I’m glad to see the people of New Hampshire made their voices heard and repealed the death penalty. Thank you @rennycushing for leading the fight.

I've got a lot of plans—like my plan for #UniversalChildCare. We can win in 2020 and make high-quality, affordable child care a reality, but only if we keep fighting together. Will you chip in $3 before our May fundraising deadline tonight at midnight?

Website or no website, let’s be clear: Giant tech companies like Apple have too much power. In order to protect our economy and our democracy, we need to #BreakUpBigTech and level the playing field for everyone else.

This is a clear conflict of interest. We need to pull corruption out of Washington by the roots—and we can start with my plan to #EndCorruptionNow, the most ambitious anti-corruption plan since Watergate.
Our democracy only works if everyone can be held accountable. These changes will make sure that’s the case for generations to come. Read my full plan here:

I pledge to nominate an Office of Legal Counsel head who will reverse the Watergate-era rule that a president cannot be indicted for criminal behavior. The OLC’s purpose is to govern the conduct of the executive branch, not act as the president’s get-out-of-jail-free card.

Attorney General Bill Barr has disgraced himself by acting like Trump’s personal defense attorney. When I’m elected, I will appoint an Attorney General who shares my strong conviction that no one—not even a president—is above the law. And I’ll go one step further:

One of the strongest arguments against indictment is that the Constitution gives Congress the sole authority to decide when to interfere with the President's duties. These new laws would eliminate that argument and remove any statutory ambiguity.

Congress should pass a law clarifying that DOJ can indict the president if he or she commits a crime in office, and should amend our obstruction of justice statutes to explicitly allow for indictment when the President abuses the powers of the office—like Donald Trump did.

No president should be above the law. So why does this Justice Department act like he is? Because in the 1970s Richard Nixon’s Justice Department wrote a memo saying so (yes, really) and DOJ has continued to stand by that view.

The Mueller report is a clear roadmap for impeachment, because that’s the only path Mueller had. But impeachment shouldn’t be the only way that a president can be held accountable for committing a crime.

The Mueller report details crimes by the president that would lead to the indictment of any other citizen. But Mueller couldn’t bring charges because a Justice Department policy says you can’t charge a sitting president. That policy is wrong and needs to go. Here’s how and why.

I'm sorry I couldn't join you tonight, @BMCMovement. But I’m in this fight all the way, and I’ve got a plan to move our country forward.
Sylvia Rivera and Marsha P. Johnson were fearless foot soldiers in the fight for LGBTQ+ civil rights. I’m glad to see that they will be honored with this monument for decades to come.

In 448 pages, Special Counsel Mueller made it absolutely clear that Donald Trump obstructed justice, over and over again. Time for Congress to do its job and hold the President of the United States accountable.

My #UniversalChildCare plan guarantees high-quality, affordable child care and early learning for our kids—and will be free for millions of families thanks to my #UltraMillionaireTax on people worth more than $50 million. What will your family save?
Extremist lawmakers want to outlaw abortion—and they’re hoping the Supreme Court will back their scheme. Congress must pass new federal laws if we want to protect access to reproductive care.

Jaime Harrison will fight hard for the people of South Carolina and take our country forward. Go Jaime!

This is a great step. My higher education plan would go even further for American Indian and Alaska Native students by making tuition free at any two-year or four-year public college and investing $50B in a fund for colleges including Tribal Colleges and Universities.

We can provide affordable, high-quality child care to every child—& we can pay for it with my Ultra-Millionaire tax on the wealthiest 75,000 American families. I joined @TheView to talk about my plan for #UniversalChildCare & my new child care calculator:

In the wealthiest country on the planet, access to affordable, high-quality child care & early education should be a right for all, not a privilege reserved for a few. I have a plan—and a new child care calculator to help you find out how much you'd save:
I have a plan to provide affordable, high-quality child care and early education for every child. Find out exactly how much you'd save under my plan with our brand-new #UniversalChildCare calculator:

Our government is broken. But I have plans to fix it and return the power to the people. Will you chip in $3 to our Official 2020 Campaign? Whatever you’re able to give will help us hit our May fundraising goal and keep up our momentum.
I’m fighting for #UniversalChildCare because our kids deserve a fair shot at success. Here’s how my plan works.

No federal lobbyists. No PACs. No swanky fundraisers. We’re funding this campaign people to people. Will you chip in whatever you can and be a part of this movement? I might even call you to say thanks!

This is what keeps me going on the road: Seeing fired up supporters across the country. I’m grateful to have spent the weekend in Iowa—and looking forward to being in Michigan and Indiana soon. Will I see you there?

Corruption? I’ve got a plan for that. Income inequality? I’ve got a plan for that. Mountains of student loan debt crushing grassroots donors like Cody? I’ve got a plan for that, too! Let’s keep working on these issues together.

My plan to cancel debt for 95% of Americans with student loan debt is a win for our students and a win for our economy.

I stand with @MothersOutFront. We need to use every tool available to combat climate change.
“Global warming” isn’t a punchline—it’s a crisis. On day one of a Warren administration, I’ll sign a moratorium on fossil fuel drilling on public lands.

I grew up on the ragged edge of the middle class. Like a million other families, we got by. Today, I’m fighting to level the playing field so that every American family has a shot at building something real. Chip in and help keep up the momentum.
Looking forward to visiting Michigan and Indiana for the first time as a presidential candidate this week! I hope I’ll see you at an event soon.

My #UniversalChildCare plan quadruples the federal investment in child care, and offers high-quality options for every family. We’ll pay for it with my #UltraMillionaireTax on the wealthiest 0.1% of Americans. It’s a win for our kids and our economy.
Did @stevenmnuchin1 help his billionaire buddy siphon off more than $2 billion in Sears assets? @AOC and I are demanding answers.
When the Mueller report came out on April 18th, I read it. The next day, I told @maddow this is a point of principle.

Mueller leaves no doubt:
1) He didn't exonerate the president because there is evidence he committed crimes.
2) Justice Department policy prevented him from charging the president with any crimes. 
3) The Constitution leaves it up to Congress to act—and that's impeachment.
Mueller’s statement makes clear what those who have read his report know: It is an impeachment referral, and it’s up to Congress to act. They should.
He’s always so happy to see me (even if I’m just coming home from the grocery store).
Thank you for reading, Lizz and Theia!

This weekend in IA, I answered my 400th question as a presidential candidate—and it was all about health care. I promised Teresa: No one should go bankrupt over medical problems and you bet I’m going to fight for Medicare for All.

What gets you up in the morning? I ask that question everywhere I go. People are worried about corruption, climate change, inequality—and I’ve got plans to fight all that, plus more. Chip in $3, or whatever you can, and help me keep the momentum up.

If this health care center closes, Missouri will become the only state in our country where women won’t have access to safe, legal abortion. That’s why I’m urging Congress to pass new federal laws that protect access to reproductive care, including abortion, in every state.
I’m very grateful that Camille contributed to this campaign, so I left a voicemail thanking her. This is how we’re going to do it—all of us coming together to pitch in.

I’m the daughter of a janitor who became a United States senator and now candidate for president. Our campaign is fighting to build opportunity for our kids and grandkids. Will you chip in $4 to help grow our movement?
“It was a good walk, but let’s ride back home.”
The consequences of climate change are severe, and they are already affecting places like Burlington, Iowa. We have a moral responsibility to act—now.

My three older brothers all joined the military. We were lucky to get them back home. #MemorialDay is a reminder not only of the sacrifices our service members make, but of the responsibility we have to honor our promises to our service members, our veterans, and their families.

I’m honoring our fallen service members with @votevets this #MemorialDay. Please take a moment today to remember their names. No matter how you spend your Memorial Day—I hope you have a meaningful day.

Mueller’s statement makes clear what those who have read his report know: It is an impeachment referral, and it’s up to Congress to act. They should.

My three older brothers all joined the military. We were lucky to get them back home. #MemorialDay is a reminder not only of the sacrifices our service members make, but of the responsibility we have to honor our promises to our service members, our veterans, and their families.

I’m honoring our fallen service members with @votevets this #MemorialDay. Please take a moment today to remember their names. No matter how you spend your Memorial Day—I hope you have a meaningful day.

6,997 service members have died in service to our country since 9/11. Today, we grieve alongside their families. And we honor them by upholding our promises to our veterans when they come home, and by fighting to bring these forever wars to a close.

All three of my big brothers served in the military. I remember waiting by the mailbox with my mother for news—how days with a letter were extra sunny. My brothers made it home safely, but many service members did not. On this #MemorialDay and every day, we honor their sacrifice.
Loved stopping by the Smokey Row coffee shop in Oskaloosa. (I’m more of a tea person, but you bet my team loves coffee!)
Grateful for everyone who came out to our #WinWithWarren organizing house party in Oskaloosa, IA today. Our movement begins with fired-up grassroots supporters all across the country.
Greetings from our walk in Pella, Iowa. (That’s the Tulip Toren behind us.)

When our communities are hit by storms, floods, or hurricanes, we reach out and help our neighbors. But Washington is so broken that one Republican congressman is holding up a disaster relief package to help struggling families. That's not who we are as Americans.

The fight for #UniversalChildCare is personal for me. Back when I was a mom with two little kids, finding high-quality, affordable child care was make-it-or-break-it. My plan for #UniversalChildCare is a win for working families and our kids.

Woo-hoo! We have just about a month until the first presidential debates, and our team is looking for grassroots supporters to host debate watch parties across the country in June and July. Sign up to host here:
#PrideMonth is almost here and our team will be dreaming big, fighting hard, and living proud all month long. Get a new t-shirt, tank, and tote in our online store.
Another sick attack on transgender Americans coming from the White House. All LGBTQ+ people should be able to access high-quality, gender-affirming health care. Period.
A $2.3 billion compensation package—for one CEO. The system is rigged and we need to fix it.

These couples want to open their hearts and their homes—and the Trump administration wants to allow adoption agencies to discriminate against them and deny children loving homes. This is pointlessly cruel.

It's revolting to suggest that we need to help the Saudis kill civilians in order to stand up to Iran. Our only "emergency" is a President who cares more about making money for his defense contractor buddies than the democratic will of Congress or the moral catastrophe in Yemen.

Congress voted to tell @realDonaldTrump to end the United States' complicity in Yemen's ongoing humanitarian crisis. His response? Veto the resolution, then declare a fake "emergency" to keep selling weapons the Saudis will use to kill more civilians.
Missouri’s new abortion ban is unconstitutional and will hurt women. We need to #StopTheBans by passing federal laws that ensure real access to birth control and abortion care for all women.
Incarcerated Americans shouldn’t have to pay to talk to the people they love. I stand with the activists in Connecticut who are working to make prison calls free.

Alabama’s abortion law is dangerous and unconstitutional. I stand with @PPact and the @ACLU all the way, and I’ll keep fighting to pass new federal laws in Congress that protect access to reproductive care from right-wing ideologues in the states.
I’m proud to have signed the #NoFossilFuelMoney pledge. Our campaign isn’t beholden to Big Oil or any corporate interest—our campaign is by the people and for the people.

When I couldn’t find child care for Amelia and Alex, I felt like I was failing my babies—until my 78-year-old Aunt Bee stepped in.

But not everyone is lucky enough to have an Aunt Bee of their own. That’s why I have a plan for #UniversalChildCare:
Student loan debt is crushing an entire generation, but I’ve got a plan to change that. #CancelMyDebt

The Big Five defense contractors have too much power over the Pentagon. That’s why we need to pass basic ethics rules for the Department of Defense. Let’s make sure that all our national security decisions are driven not by special interests, but by what keeps Americans safe.

Wow, that looks great Meaghan! (I have to say, the cardboard cut-out was a nice touch.) Right now our team is organizing #WinWithWarren debate watch parties across the country next month. RSVP to one near you:
Bailey was a bad boy this morning. But at least he’s sorry.

When I called Nicholas after he made a small donation, he knew it was me right away! We’re both fired up about living wages, so we talked about @SEIU’s fight to raise the minimum wage to $15. We need to do better by America’s workers. #FightFor15
I stand in solidarity with the @McDonalds workers who are fighting for a living wage and better working conditions. #FightFor15
Six children have died after being detained by @CBP. That’s six children too many. We need answers—now.
Trump promised to bring our troops home, but now he’s willing to send thousands more to the Middle East. I'll fight to stop this administration from dragging us into another forever war.
Thank you, Sarah, this is an amazing program! Working on campaigns should be accessible to all people. Keep fighting the good fight.

I've been fighting against this anti-consumer proposal for years—and I'm glad it's been delayed so that it can be rewritten. People shouldn't be locked into unreasonable contracts that they didn't negotiate and that limit their right to go to court.

Everywhere I go, I talk about how we need to make big, structural change to solve the deep, systemic problems we face as a country. Take the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau: We had a plan, we got organized, and we turned it into a reality.
If we want to live in a world where our children have clean water to drink, then we need to take action now.
That’s exactly right. And I have a plan to open the door of opportunity for millions of Americans struggling with student loan debt. Read about it here:
I’m ready to fight for you, Allison, and the millions of people across the country who are getting crushed by student loan debt. Let’s do this together. #CancelMyDebt
It doesn’t have to be this way. And I have a plan to change it.
I’m fighting with you, Amber. We can change this.

My affordable housing plan would prohibit housing discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation and gender identity. LGBTQ+ Americans deserve good-quality, affordable housing. I’m ready to fight for them.

Young people are getting crushed by student loan debt. Not only can they not afford to buy homes or start families—it’s forcing some to drop out before even getting a degree. My plan to cancel student loan debt for 42 million Americans would level the playing field.

I’m keeping families in the Mississippi Delta in my prayers. Record flooding is pushing families out of their homes and submerging neighborhoods. Climate change is here and it’s hurting our communities. We have a moral responsibility to act.
This is a bad deal. Merging @sprint and @TMobile to create one giant telecom company will hurt small businesses, entrepreneurs, and working families.

Harvey Milk's campaign manager, Anne Kronenberg, once said that he "imagined a righteous world inside his head and then he set about to create it for real, for all of us." We will keep fighting every day to realize a righteous world. #HarveyMilkDay

Proud to fight alongside you in this grassroots movement. #APAHM
Logan from Virginia chipped in $20 to our grassroots campaign, so I called to say thank you. We talked about the issue that pulled Logan in: Student loan debt.
Next month is #PrideMonth, and our team is getting ready with new Pride t-shirts, tanks, and totes! Grab one for you or the people you love.

I loved being in Kermit, a resilient West Virginia town hit hard by the opioid epidemic. A lot of people told me, “You’re in the reddest of the red here.” But I’m running to be president of all the United States.

I joined @TJMShow and @rolandsmartin this morning to talk about my plan to cancel student loan debt for 42 million Americans. If we dream big and fight hard, we can take on structural racism and level the playing field for families across the country.

Trump's actions alienate us from our allies and empower Iran's hardliners. They raise the risk of conflict and make us less safe. Chaos and confusion isn't a strategy—it's a recipe for disaster. I won't let this administration drag us into another war in the Middle East.

The #IranDeal was working, but Trump ripped it up anyway—over the advice of his own national security team. For the last year, the administration has been goading and provoking the Iranian regime. Attempting to collapse their economy. Hinting at regime change.
I've read the intelligence. I attended yesterday’s briefing. The latest crisis with Iran didn't come out of thin air—it is a direct result of this president's actions.
I'm heartsick that five children have died after being detained by @CBP in the last six months. The American public is owed an explanation and a full account of what happened.
I do! Share your stories using #CancelMyDebt and find out how my plan to cancel student loan debt for 95% Americans that carry it would impact your life:  .

Last week in Nashua, NH, we talked about how extremist Republicans think that this is their chance to overturn #RoeVWade. Not on our watch. We’ll keep fighting to #StopTheBans today and every day after it.
A single child dying in U.S. custody is horrific. Five is unfathomable. We need answers.
Proud to see the people of Massachusetts making their voices heard and fighting for safe, legal abortion access and reproductive health care.
I love #PrideMonth—and my team does too! Take a look at our new Pride t-shirts, tanks, and totes for you or the people you love. Can’t wait to get mine.

I stand with Brittany and the @McDonalds workers who are taking a stand against sexual harassment on the job and retaliation for reporting it. Workers with low wages are especially vulnerable to sexual harassment at work—and it has to stop. #TimesUp

One in five American adults struggles with a mental health condition, but less than half of people who require treatment actually get it. Proud to be fighting with Rep. @joekennedy so that everyone gets the care they need.

The time to act is now. Get into the fight, run for office, and make these right-wing Republican lawmakers face the consequences of their actions. Here’s my plan to protect reproductive health care and #StopTheBans:

Let’s be clear: #RoeVWade established a woman’s constitutional right to safe, legal abortion & has been the law of the land for over 46 years. An overwhelming majority of Americans don’t want to return to a world before Roe. But extremist Republicans are fighting to do just that.

I was glad when the House passed the #EqualityAct last week. But the fight for equality is not over—not when the Trump admin and extremist Republicans try to unravel LGBTQ+ Americans’ rights. I’m ready to keep fighting their attacks every step of the way.

My #UniversalChildCare plan is personal. As a working mom, it was nearly impossible to find good child care—until my Aunt Bee stepped in. My plan guarantees high-quality child care for every child in America. It will be free for millions of families and affordable for everyone.
Proud to fight alongside you in this grassroots movement. #APAHM

Whenever I meet a little girl, I say: “I’m running for president, because that’s what girls do,” and we pinky promise so they’ll remember. If you agree it’s time for a woman president to fix our broken government, chip in $3 or more to our movement.
Yesterday, Bailey got to try on his new bandana in Portsmouth, NH. Thank you, @rcdcnh!

Thanks for sharing your story with me, Beth. Too many people are getting crushed by mountains of student loan debt. My plan would cancel debt for 95% of Americans who carry it. You can read all about it here:
Still thinking about the powerful town hall we had in Nashua yesterday. Big, structural change starts in rooms like this one!

Extremist lawmakers like Henry McMaster know that #RoeVWade is the law of the land, but they don’t care—they want to outlaw abortion. That’s why Congress must pass new federal laws to protect access to safe, legal abortion.
See you again soon, Iowa!
You bet, Karenna! Climate change is a serious threat and we need to address it head on.

My thoughts are with Muhlaysia & her loved ones. A record number of trans Americans were killed last year—a number that disproportionately affects trans women of color. We must call it out & fight back so everyone is free to be who they are without fear.
Look at the sign! Glad I got to spend time at River Road Tavern in Bedford, NH over the weekend.
Dr. J.W. Endicott is a doctor in Kermit, WV who saw pharmaceutical companies squeeze his town to a breaking point. His story reminds me why we’re in this fight against the opioid epidemic.
Still inspired by the energy of our movement in Rochester. We’re going to fight and we’re going to win! Follow @NH_for_Warren for more updates from our movement in New Hampshire.

We need to fight like hell to protect #RoeVWade and protect women’s rights to control our own bodies. Join @NARAL, @PPact, @MoveOn, and other activists for a day of action in all 50 states tomorrow, Tuesday, May 21. Find an event near you:   #StopTheBans

During selfie lines, people often press notes into my hands to explain why they’re in this fight. Last week in VA, I got a note asking if I support a climate debate. Yes! We need to do everything we can to save our planet. Thanks @usclimatestrike and @MoveOn for leading this.
Together, we can work with our military to fight climate change.
Let’s dream big, fight hard, and win. Grateful to @GeorgeMasonU and the community of Fairfax for the inspiring conversation last week.
In their rush to shovel tax giveaways to giant corporations and billionaires, Republicans also imposed huge new taxes on low-income college scholarship recipients. I’m ready to fight back.
DM me and let’s figure this out.
It was wonderful meeting you both, Margie!
This week, right-wing Republican lawmakers in Alabama enacted the most extreme abortion ban in over 40 years. Here’s my plan to protect Roe v. Wade and fight back.
Conversion therapy is cruel and wrong, and any attempt to use religion as an excuse to allow anti-LGBTQ+ discrimination is wrong too.

Whenever I meet a little girl, I say: “I’m running for president, because that’s what girls do,” and we pinky promise so they’ll remember. If you agree it’s time for a woman president to fix our broken government, chip in $3 or more to our movement.

See you again soon, Iowa!
You bet, Karenna! Climate change is a serious threat and we need to address it head on.

My thoughts are with Muhlaysia & her loved ones. A record number of trans Americans were killed last year—a number that disproportionately affects trans women of color. We must call it out & fight back so everyone is free to be who they are without fear.
Look at the sign! Glad I got to spend time at River Road Tavern in Bedford, NH over the weekend.
Dr. J.W. Endicott is a doctor in Kermit, WV who saw pharmaceutical companies squeeze his town to a breaking point. His story reminds me why we’re in this fight against the opioid epidemic.
Still inspired by the energy of our movement in Rochester. We’re going to fight and we’re going to win! Follow @NH_for_Warren for more updates from our movement in New Hampshire.

We need to fight like hell to protect #RoeVWade and protect women’s rights to control our own bodies. Join @NARAL, @PPact, @MoveOn, and other activists for a day of action in all 50 states tomorrow, Tuesday, May 21. Find an event near you:   #StopTheBans

During selfie lines, people often press notes into my hands to explain why they’re in this fight. Last week in VA, I got a note asking if I support a climate debate. Yes! We need to do everything we can to save our planet. Thanks @usclimatestrike and @MoveOn for leading this.
Together, we can work with our military to fight climate change.
Let’s dream big, fight hard, and win. Grateful to @GeorgeMasonU and the community of Fairfax for the inspiring conversation last week.
In their rush to shovel tax giveaways to giant corporations and billionaires, Republicans also imposed huge new taxes on low-income college scholarship recipients. I’m ready to fight back.
DM me and let’s figure this out.
It was wonderful meeting you both, Margie!
This week, right-wing Republican lawmakers in Alabama enacted the most extreme abortion ban in over 40 years. Here’s my plan to protect Roe v. Wade and fight back.
Conversion therapy is cruel and wrong, and any attempt to use religion as an excuse to allow anti-LGBTQ+ discrimination is wrong too.
Nevada is showing us what’s possible when we elect women. It’s wonderful to see the progress Democrats are making with the first women-majority legislature in our nation’s history.
“I hate what the rain does to my hair.”

Republican lawmakers want to outlaw abortion and deny women access to reproductive health care. People are scared and angry, and we’re right to be. But this isn’t a moment to back down — it’s time to fight back.
If you’re angry about right-wing Republicans’ plan to reverse Roe, now’s the time to get organized and fight back.

15 years ago today, Massachusetts became the first state to make marriage equality the law. I’m proud we led the country in this fight, and I want to be clear: I won't stop fighting until everyone is free to be who they are and love who they love without fear of discrimination.
Thank you, @ilyseh. Together, we’ll fight to protect women’s rights—and we’ll win.
Access to safe, legal abortion is a constitutional right and Congress can act to protect it. We’re going to fight every right-wing lawmaker’s attempt to overturn Roe v. Wade.

The fight for full LGBTQ+ equality is far from over. But I’m glad to see the House passed the Equality Act today to ban discrimination, protect transgender rights, and resist the Trump administration’s efforts to roll back our progress.
I stand in solidarity with the 85,000 Kaiser workers fighting for their fair share. #HealthCareJustice

Sixty-five years ago today, SCOTUS decided on the landmark Brown v. Board of Education: Hateful school segregation laws are unconstitutional. It was an important ruling, but it didn’t end systemic racism in our country. We need to keep calling out racism every chance we get.

When I was growing up, people still got abortions. Some were lucky—others weren't. They all went through hell. The overwhelming majority of Americans don’t want to return to that time. Congress should act to ensure that the will of the people remains the law of the land.

And the women of color who have led the repro justice movement teach us that these issues are bigger than Roe. We must go beyond abortion to ensure access to contraception, STI prevention & care, sex ed, care for pregnant moms, safe home & work environments, good wages, & more.

Finally, we must ensure equal access to health care and support reproductive justice. Systemic barriers have made it especially difficult for low-income women and women of color to get the access to reproductive care they need.

Congress must guarantee reproductive health coverage as part of all health coverage. That starts with repealing the Hyde Amendment. Congress must also pass the EACH Woman Act, which would also prohibit abortion restrictions on private insurance.

Next, Congress should pass federal laws to preempt state efforts to pass Targeted Regulations on Abortion Providers (TRAP) laws, which are designed to functionally limit and eliminate women’s access to abortion care with medically-unnecessary restrictions.

Popular new federal rights that parallel Roe would preempt state laws like the AL, GA, & OH bans. They'd end the political games played by right-wing courts to narrow Roe’s protections. And they'd ensure that choice remains the law—even if the Supreme Court overturns Roe.

First, Congress should create federal, statutory rights that parallel Roe’s protections. We must prohibit states from interfering in the ability of a health professional to provide medical care—including abortion care—& from interfering in the ability of a patient to access care.

We should pass new federal laws that protect access to reproductive care from right-wing ideologues in the states and ensure access to birth control and abortion care. Laws that will stand no matter what the Supreme Court does. Here’s what that looks like:

Our next President can begin to undo some of the damage by appointing neutral and fair judges who actually respect the law and cases like Roe instead of right-wing ideologues bent on rolling back our rights. But Congress has a role to play as well.

They’re hoping the Supreme Court will back their radical play, and it might work. Donald Trump packed the courts with extreme, anti-choice judges. Senate Republicans stole a SCOTUS seat & rammed through Justice Kavanaugh’s confirmation in order to cement an anti-choice majority.
Nevada is showing us what’s possible when we elect women. It’s wonderful to see the progress Democrats are making with the first women-majority legislature in our nation’s history.

They’re hoping the Supreme Court will back their radical play, and it might work. Donald Trump packed the courts with extreme, anti-choice judges. Senate Republicans stole a SCOTUS seat & rammed through Justice Kavanaugh’s confirmation in order to cement an anti-choice majority.

Right-wing lawmakers in Alabama just enacted the most extreme abortion ban in over 40 years, the latest in a wave of abortion bans across the country in states like Georgia, Kentucky, Mississippi, and Ohio. Republicans are on the march to overturn Roe v. Wade.
I agree. NAFTA 2.0 is a bad deal that works great for Big Pharma, but leaves workers in the dust. We need to fix it.
If there was ever a time for more women to run for office, it’s now.

Defense contractor influence is a big part of how we ended up with a bloated Pentagon budget that will cost more this year than Ronald Reagan spent at the height of the Cold War. It’s wasteful. It’s unsustainable. And it doesn’t keep us safe.
Our existing laws are far too weak to effectively limit the undue influence of giant military contractors at the Department of Defense. We need to change the rules.
Thank you, @rweingarten. We can work together to end the student loan debt crisis—and make sure it never happens again.

Kermit, West Virginia was slammed by the opioid crisis—and not by accident. Big pharmaceutical companies pumped 13 million prescription pills into this little town. In fact, these companies made $17 billion shipping opioids to West Virginia. Time for some accountability.

My plan will: 
—Shut the revolving door between giant contractors and the Pentagon
—Ban DoD officials from owning contractor stock
—Limit foreign government hiring of American national security officials
—Expose defense contractor lobbying

It’s wrong, wasteful, and bad for our national security. We have to call this what it is: corruption—plain and simple. I’ve already introduced a sweeping anti-corruption bill. Today, I introduced the Department of Defense Ethics and Anti-Corruption Act.

It’s time to cut our bloated defense budget. And that influence is a big part of how we ended up with a Pentagon budget that'll cost more this year than we spend on education, medical research, housing, disaster relief—everything else in the discretionary budget put together.

These giant contractors have deployed an extremely profitable strategy: First, recruit armies of lobbyists from former Pentagon officials and congressional staffers. Then, get those former officials to use their relationships, access, and influence to secure lucrative contracts.

The coziness between defense lobbyists, Congress, and the Pentagon tilts countless decisions, big and small, away from legitimate national security interests and toward the desires of giant corporations that thrive off taxpayer dollars.
Betsy DeVos hasn’t spent a day in the classroom teaching our students. I’m pledging to change that. Under a Warren administration, the Secretary of Education will be a former public school teacher.

Skyrocketing housing costs are squeezing families to the breaking point, and too many families are suffering from the legacy of racist housing policies. I'm proud to fight alongside @DataProgress for big ideas that will help us fix this crisis.

I'm glad to see institutions like the @metmuseum holding the Sacklers accountable. But we have to go further. Under my Corporate Executive Accountability Act, people like the Sacklers, who get rich off of the opioid crisis, could face criminal penalties.
This is far from over. We will fight this, and we will win. #StopTheBans
Twenty-five men in the Alabama Senate passed this ban. Women across the country are watching and we will fight back.
You bet I have a plan for all that.

We want to make it super easy for people to be #AllInForWarren and get in this fight—I hope you’ll sign up at  . Everyone owns a part of this campaign. If we dream big, fight hard, and work together, we can win in 2020.
I love the way that Rabiah and Tessa from our digital organizing team explain it: Think of it as the digital headquarters of this campaign.
