You bet I have a plan for all that.

We want to make it super easy for people to be #AllInForWarren and get in this fight—I hope you’ll sign up at  . Everyone owns a part of this campaign. If we dream big, fight hard, and work together, we can win in 2020.
I love the way that Rabiah and Tessa from our digital organizing team explain it: Think of it as the digital headquarters of this campaign.

It’s important to me that everyone has equal access to this campaign, so we created a new digital community for supporters to join! #AllInForWarren is where campaign staff, volunteers, and supporters from all over the country can join forces:

Republican men are on a march toward overturning #RoeVWade. And thanks to Trump stacking the courts with anti-choice judges, they’re closer than ever. Women are scared, women are angry—and we have a right to be. If you’re an ally of women, now’s the time to make that clear.

When I was growing up, people got abortions. Desperate women turned to back alley butchers or even tried the procedure on their own. Some were lucky, but others weren't. They all went through hell. Access to safe, legal abortion is a constitutional RIGHT. Full stop.

Basic health care includes safe, legal abortion. Alabama’s backdoor abortion ban is an unconstitutional attack on women—an attack happening all across America. Let’s be very clear: We’re going to fight this ban and defend #RoeVWade. And we’ll win.

We don’t have to choose between a green military and an effective one. My plan will improve our service members’ readiness and safety, and achieve cost savings for American taxpayers. Together, we can fight climate change—and win.

The Pentagon is the single largest government consumer of energy, and it’s dependent on fossil fuels. To improve military readiness and help us achieve a #GreenNewDeal, the Pentagon should achieve net zero carbon emissions for all its non-combat bases and infrastructure by 2030.

Today, I am introducing my Defense Climate Resiliency and Readiness Act to harden the U.S. military against the threat posed by climate change, and to leverage its huge energy footprint as part of our climate solution.

Senior military leaders have warned Congress of the national security challenge that climate change poses. The military is taking steps to become more energy efficient and resilient. But instead of meeting this threat head on, Washington is ignoring it—and making it worse.

Climate change is real, it’s worsening by the day, and it’s undermining our military readiness. More and more, accomplishing the mission depends on our ability to continue operations in the face of floods, drought, wildfires, desertification, and extreme cold.

This ban is dangerous and exceptionally cruel—and the bill’s authors want to use it to overturn Roe v. Wade. I've lived in that America and let me tell you: We are not going back—not now, not ever. We will fight this. And we will win.

Because of greedy pharmaceutical companies pumping drugs into town, Kermit, WV got hit hard by the opioid epidemic. I went there last week to say: Enough. I have a plan to end the opioid crisis and hold the people who caused it accountable.

Right now, our government cares more about increasing the profitability of multinational corporations than American families. That’s why this grassroots campaign is all about returning the power to the people.
Yesterday at Yards Brewing Co. in Philadelphia, I had the opportunity to thank grassroots donors for chipping in (and learn a little about brewing too).

Little by little, the Trump administration has chipped away at the Affordable Care Act and made it harder for people to get covered. It’s never been more important to protect the ACA and pass #MedicareForAll.
Thank you, Liat. This is a campaign of ideas—and when we work together, we can make the kind of big, structural change our educational system needs.

My three older brothers served in the military, so I know the responsibility we have to our service members, veterans, and their families. When we fail to provide them with a safe place to live, we’ve broken our promise to them.

I won’t do a town hall with Fox News because I won’t invite millions of Democratic primary voters to tune in, inflate ratings, and help sell ads for an outlet that profits from racism and hate. If you agree, sign our petition.

I’ve done 57 media avails and 131 interviews, taking over 1,100 questions from press just since January. Fox News is welcome to come to my events just like any other outlet. But a Fox News town hall adds money to the hate-for-profit machine. To which I say: hard pass.

I’m running a campaign to reach all Americans. I take questions from the press and voters everywhere I go. I’ve already held town halls in 17 states and Puerto Rico—including WV, OH, GA, UT, TN, TX, CO, MS & AL.

Here’s one place we can fight back: I won’t ask millions of Democratic primary voters to tune into an outlet that profits from racism and hate in order to see our candidates—especially when Fox will make even more money adding our valuable audience to their ratings numbers.

It’s important to me that everyone has equal access to this campaign, so we created a new digital community for supporters to join! #AllInForWarren is where campaign staff, volunteers, and supporters from all over the country can join forces:

Here’s one place we can fight back: I won’t ask millions of Democratic primary voters to tune into an outlet that profits from racism and hate in order to see our candidates—especially when Fox will make even more money adding our valuable audience to their ratings numbers.

But Fox News is struggling as more and more advertisers pull out of their hate-filled space. A Democratic town hall gives the Fox News sales team a way to tell potential sponsors it's safe to buy ads on Fox—no harm to their brand or reputation (spoiler: It’s not).

Hate-for-profit works only if there’s profit, so Fox News balances a mix of bigotry, racism, and outright lies with enough legit journalism to make the claim to advertisers that it’s a reputable news outlet. It’s all about dragging in ad money—big ad money.

Fox News is a hate-for-profit racket that gives a megaphone to racists and conspiracists—it’s designed to turn us against each other, risking life and death consequences, to provide cover for the corruption that’s rotting our government and hollowing out our middle class.

I love town halls. I’ve done more than 70 since January, and I’m glad to have a television audience be a part of them. Fox News has invited me to do a town hall, but I’m turning them down—here’s why...
Authoritarian tendencies. Gleefully undermining democracy. Corruption. No wonder Viktor Orbán was so warmly welcomed by Donald Trump yesterday.

Betsy DeVos is the worst Secretary of Education we’ve seen. Instead of championing our students, she protects for-profit colleges that break the law. So I’m making a pledge: In a Warren administration, the Secretary of Education will be a former public school teacher.

I grew up on the ragged edge of the middle class. My family didn’t have money for a college application—let alone college. I dropped out of school at 19 to get married. My second chance was a commuter college that cost $50 a semester—and I hung on for dear life.
When pharmaceutical CEOs pad their pockets and commit criminal negligence while pushing drugs, they should go to jail.
Family farmers across the country are being squeezed by the Trump administration’s terrible policies. Our farmers deserve better.

Feeling inspired after the #AFTVotes town hall this afternoon. I’ll always stand behind our teachers and their right to unionize. Thank you @AFTunion and @rweingarten for letting me be part of today’s powerful conversation.
Thank you for the questions and powerful conversation about teaching in America.
We need a Secretary of Education who actually cares about our teachers and students.

In my administration, the Secretary of Education will be a former public school teacher who is committed to public education. Add your name if you agree that we need to replace Betsy DeVos with someone who actually fights for our kids.
The next Secretary of Education should be a former public school teacher—someone who will fight for students and not for shady, for-profit colleges.
I’ll be speaking at the #AFTVotes town hall about how we can level the playing field for America’s public school teachers. Tune in at 4:30 PM ET today.

And we need to make it easier to join a union. Unions give teachers—and all workers—power in negotiations over the long run. That's good for teachers, good for students, and good for making sure we put the resources we need directly into our schools.

My Secretary of Education will be someone with real teaching experience, who understands how low pay, tattered textbooks and crumbling classrooms affect educators and students. Someone who understands the crushing burden of student debt and will fight back.

But Betsy DeVos is just a symptom of a badly broken system. We’re up against powerful forces, and to win, we need big structural change. So here’s my plan: Under a Warren administration, the Secretary of Education will be a public school teacher.

There's no greater example of how we're failing students and teachers than Betsy DeVos, the worst Secretary of Education we’ve seen. Appointed despite her conflicts of interest, she's spent her time protecting for-profit colleges that break the law and cheat students.

America’s teachers are being crushed. Too many teachers are working multiple jobs, drowning in student debt, and struggling to teach on shoestring budgets and insulting salaries. America is failing our teachers—and when we fail our teachers, we fail our future.

But Fox News is struggling as more and more advertisers pull out of their hate-filled space. A Democratic town hall gives the Fox News sales team a way to tell potential sponsors it's safe to buy ads on Fox—no harm to their brand or reputation (spoiler: It’s not).

But Betsy DeVos is just a symptom of a badly broken system. We’re up against powerful forces, and to win, we need big structural change. So here’s my plan: Under a Warren administration, the Secretary of Education will be a public school teacher.

There's no greater example of how we're failing students and teachers than Betsy DeVos, the worst Secretary of Education we’ve seen. Appointed despite her conflicts of interest, she's spent her time protecting for-profit colleges that break the law and cheat students.

America’s teachers are being crushed. Too many teachers are working multiple jobs, drowning in student debt, and struggling to teach on shoestring budgets and insulting salaries. America is failing our teachers—and when we fail our teachers, we fail our future.

Ever since I was little, I wanted to be a teacher. My 2nd grade teacher, Mrs. Lee, was the first person to tell me that I could be a teacher too. And thanks to a high quality, public education, I did become a teacher. I want kids today to have the same opportunities I did.

I want to make it clear during #MilitaryAppreciationMonth: Those who serve our country deserve a safe, affordable place to live—for themselves and their families. My plan to improve our military housing would protect families from abuse and hold private developers accountable.

Big tech companies like Facebook have too much power over our economy, our society, and our democracy. And when they buy out their competition, they stifle innovation and face less pressure to protect our privacy. That's why we need to #BreakUpBigTech.

We’ve had over 70 town halls and we do a selfie line after each one. Not only is it fun, it’s when I get to listen to people’s stories. I’m so glad I got to take my 20,000th selfie yesterday with Umeirra in Cincinnati.
Black moms are dying from childbirth-related causes at rates 3-4 times higher than white moms—and structural racism is the root cause of this problem. We need to call it out, and then fight back.

On #MothersDay, I’m thinking about Black and Brown moms in our country. Women of color are dying from pregnancy and childbirth-related causes at staggering rates and it is the direct result of institutional and structural racism. We need to call it out and address it head on.

My mother didn’t have much, but she knew that her kids had a fighting chance to build a future. Today, not every family has that fighting chance. That’s what I’m fighting for to honor my mother, on Mother’s Day and every day.

For a long time, I thought that was just a story about my mother. And then years later, I came to understand that it's a story about millions of Americans who—no matter how scared they are—reach down, dig deep, find it, and pull up what they need to take care of the family.

I watched her while she pulled it together, put that dress on, put on her high heels, blew her nose, walked to Sears, and got a minimum wage job. And that minimum wage job saved our house, but more importantly, it saved our family. That story is written on my heart.

Spread out on the bed was a black dress. It was that one dress that every mom had—it only came out for weddings, funerals, and graduations. She kept saying, “We will not lose this house. We will not lose this house.” She’d never worked outside the home, and she was terrified.

Happy #MothersDay! Today, I’m honoring my mother. One morning after my daddy’s heart attack, I remember standing in their bedroom. Her face was red and puffy, with wadded-up tissues next to her. We’d just lost our family station wagon. Our house was next.
Yay! Thanks for coming today and taking a selfie with me, Umeirra.

Communities in NH and across the country are getting squeezed by opioids. They’re fighting back, but they can’t do it alone. We need to step up, and I have a plan to provide real resources to the states and communities affected by the opioid crisis.
The energy in Columbus last night made me feel grateful down to my bones. We're going to dream big, fight hard, and win in 2020.

Alabama’s anti-abortion bill is dangerous and unconstitutional. I’m grateful to the Democratic lawmakers who are fighting their hearts out to protect women’s rights to control our own bodies. I’m with you all the way.
Earlier this week, I wanted to make sure I called some of the teachers who have donated to our campaign to thank them. #TeacherAppreciationWeek

This photo was taken the moment I asked people in the room if they knew someone or had been directly affected by the opioid epidemic. This crisis is hitting communities hard, & I'm grateful for the important conversation in Chillicothe. If we fight hard, we can fix this together.
We need to call out the history of discrimination in education, and honor the role HBCUs play in our country. Thank you @BlavityPolitics for the opportunity.

This photo was taken the moment I asked people in the room if they knew someone or had been directly affected by the opioid epidemic. This crisis is hitting communities hard, & I'm grateful for the important conversation in Chillicothe. If we fight hard, we can fix this together.
We need to call out the history of discrimination in education, and honor the role HBCUs play in our country. Thank you @BlavityPolitics for the opportunity.
As folks came through the photo line after our town hall in Kermit, West Virginia, a few of them pressed notes into my hand. I took a moment as we left town to read them.

Thank you to Kermit, West Virginia, for your warm hospitality today. This small but mighty town is fighting hard to hold massive corporations accountable for fueling the opioid crisis in their community—and I'm proud to join them in this fight.
Checking out the Kermit Public Library was fun. One day we might even be able to see a book about our country’s first woman president.

Today, 191 people will die from a drug overdose. I’m in this fight for everyone who’s been caught in the grips of addiction, or knows someone who is. By holding drug companies accountable and giving communities the money and tools to fight addiction, we can end the opioid crisis.
When a corporate executive is criminally negligent and people get hurt, that executive should face jail time.
This crisis has been driven by greed, pure and simple, and it’s time to change that. I’ve got a plan to make these companies pay up to ensure every person gets the care they need.

Here’s the truth: Fueling addiction is big business. The five companies being sued by Kermit earned $17 billion shipping prescription opioids to West Virginia during those few years, and their CEOs took home millions in bonuses and pay.

This small but mighty town filed a lawsuit against the pharmacy and five of the wholesale drug distributors who exacerbated the crisis. And it’s just one of many similar lawsuits lodged by towns, counties, and states across the country.

The companies shipping these pills repeatedly disregarded requirements to report suspicious patterns of behavior, and the state Board of Pharmacy failed to enforce its own rules. But Kermit is fighting back.

Over a period of just a few years, this town of only 400 people was flooded with approximately 13 million prescription opioid pills— that’s more than 30,000 pills per resident—all delivered to a single local pharmacy .
Today, I went to Kermit, a small town along the Kentucky-West Virginia border that’s been hard-hit by the opioid epidemic — and not by accident. I’ll tell you why.

The opioid epidemic is crushing communities across the country. My plan to fix it, the #CAREact, would provide $100 billion in federal funding directly to communities like Bethlehem, NH. That’s what’s needed to make sure every single person gets the treatment they need.

Governor Sununu’s veto of paid family and medical leave is absolutely shameful. Without paid leave, too many people will have to choose between their families and their paychecks. I'm going to fight for paid family and medical leave for every family.

Sen. Cruz’s new bill to eliminate the @CFPB would help the rich and powerful, and hurt American families. This agency has forced financial companies to return an estimated $12 billion to the people. I’ll keep fighting for it—like I have from the start.

You bet I do.

This is the fight of our lives—the fight to level the playing field for working Americans and return the power to the people. Will you be a part of our grassroots movement?

My debt cancellation plan helps 42M lower-income & middle-class families—and we'll pay for it with a 2 cent tax on the 75,000 richest fortunes. It also invests $50B in HBCUs & Minority-Serving Institutions. Find out how much relief you'd receive here.

My plan has broad public support, including from people who never had students loans or finished paying off their loans already. Americans are big-hearted—they recognize how this proposal would help millions of families and boost the economy for everyone.

This is just part of my plan for ending the student debt crisis with broad student loan debt cancellation and universal free college. Since the release of my plan, people across America have described the incredible difference it could make in their lives.

Bank lobbyists claimed that changing the bankruptcy rules for student loans would reduce costs. Instead, costs went up and private student lending exploded. It was great for banks and bad for students. Congress should pass our bill to change this law immediately.

In 2005, Congress passed a bad bankruptcy bill that made it harder for working families to stay afloat—including by making it nearly impossible for people to get rid of student loans in bankruptcy. Today, @DickDurbin and I introduced a bill to change that.
We’re headed to West Virginia and Ohio this weekend. Hope to see you there (or at an upcoming organizing event near you).

My proposal for an Ultra-Millionaire Tax on the largest fortunes in America would pay for plans like student loan debt cancellation, universal free college, universal child care, and ending the opioid epidemic. And we’d still have more than half a trillion dollars left over.

Nikita is a #TeamWarren volunteer in Utah who cares deeply about our environment and the urgency of climate change. I’m so grateful that she got in this fight. Sign up to volunteer, too:
I have a plan to make big, structural changes to the tech sector to promote more competition — and it starts with breaking up Amazon, Google, and Facebook. Learn more:

Chris Hughes is right. Today’s big tech companies have too much power—over our economy, our society, & our democracy. They’ve bulldozed competition, used our private info for profit, hurt small businesses & stifled innovation. It's time to #BreakUpBigTech.

Our democracy is broken. But I’ve got a plan—a lot of them!—to fix our government and give power back to the people. We can only do this together. Will you pitch in and join our movement? You might even get a call from me to say thanks.

Yesterday, Mitch McConnell stepped onto the Senate floor saying “case closed” on the Mueller report.

I don’t think so.
The student loan debt crisis in America falls hardest on Black students and their families. My plan for student debt cancellation addresses that head on.

The #CAREact is modeled after the Ryan White CARE Act, which—after a long fight—provided significant funding to help communities combat the HIV/AIDS epidemic. We need that kind of big, structural change to tackle the opioid epidemic today.

Real, structural change to address the opioid epidemic is going to take new leadership in Washington. If you’re with me in the fight to end this crisis, add your name and become a citizen co-sponsor of the #CAREact.

Nearly two decades into the 21st century—in the wealthiest country in the world—American life expectancy went down, and it’s largely driven by the opioid epidemic. The #CAREact gives us a fighting chance at ending the crisis and saving lives.

A year ago the Trump administration began its immoral family separation policy. Yesterday, the artist and activist @paolamendoza’s installation in front of the capitol building was a powerful reminder: We won’t stop fighting #UntilEveryFamilyIsReunited.

Let’s be clear: #HB1264 is nothing more than Governor Sununu’s attempt to impose a poll tax on college students to make it harder for them to make their voices heard. Gov. Sununu should listen to the people.
Let’s be clear: This bill, and others across the country like it, put women in danger. Women should have the right to control our own bodies. We won’t go back. Not now—not ever.

Under my plan, billionaires that got rich off of this crisis would pay to help ensure every person gets the care they need. And under my Corporate Executive Accountability Act, executives who deliberately hurt people through criminal negligence will face real criminal penalties.
That's a start. But this crisis has been driven by greed, pure and simple. To solve it, we need to hold business executives that cheat, defraud, and addict people accountable.

The CARE Act also works to strengthen our addiction treatment infrastructure—demanding states use Medicaid to its fullest to tackle the crisis, expanding access to medication-assisted treatment, and ensuring treatment programs and recovery residences meet high standards.

These resources would support the whole continuum of care, from early intervention, to harm reduction, to long-term support services. They would ensure access to mental health services and help provide critical wraparound services like housing support and medical transportation.

Today, Rep. Cummings & I—along with 80+ cosponsors—are rolling out the CARE Act, a comprehensive plan to end the opioid crisis by providing states & communities $100 billion over the next 10 years to ensure every single person gets the treatment they need.

70,000 Americans died in 2017 from a drug overdose—the majority due to opioids. Emergency room visits for opioid overdoses are skyrocketing, and too many are still not receiving treatment. This is a public health crisis. And it has also severely impacted communities of color.

Heartsick for the victims, their loved ones, and the Highlands Ranch community. How many more of our children’s schools must be torn apart by gun violence until Congress does something? We need gun reform. Now.
Tonight I’ll be on @allinwithchris to talk about how it’s never been more important to defend our constitution and fight for our democracy. Tune in to @MSNBC at 8 PM ET!

There are three inescapable facts from the Mueller report that Mitch McConnell can't hide:
1. A foreign government attacked our elections in order to help Donald Trump.
2. Trump welcomed that help.
3. Trump tried to obstruct the investigation into his actions.
Mitch McConnell is protecting and defending Donald Trump—not our Constitution or democracy. Congress needs to do its job and start impeachment proceedings now.

Mitch McConnell took the same oath of office as I did: To protect and defend the Constitution of the United States—not to protect and defend Donald Trump. Every elected official should read the Mueller report. Then Congress should do its job and begin impeachment proceedings.
Looks like a great walk—wish Bruce and I could have joined with Bailey! #WinWithWarren
My plan would wipe out student loan debt for millions of Americans—and I’ve got a calculator to show you how much you’d save.

Any efforts to address climate change must include our public lands. That’s why on the first day of a Warren administration, I will sign  a total moratorium on all new fossil fuel leases, including for drilling offshore and on public lands.

Our grassroots team is growing! Over half of our staff is on the ground in the early primary and caucus states, and I need your help to keep up the momentum. Chip in $5, or whatever you can, to power this grassroots campaign.
Somebody’s ready for spring.
Ramadan Mubarak! Bruce and I send our wishes for a blessed and meaningful month for all who observe.

My 2nd grade teacher, Mrs. Lee, told me that if I worked hard, I could be a teacher, too. That changed my world, and I’m still grateful. Thank you to our teachers across the country who fight every day so that our kids have the opportunity to succeed. #TeacherAppreciationWeek

It does! And you can see exactly how much debt would be cancelled by using my new calculator:

.@JulianCastro is right—no person is illegal, and our laws should reflect that. I admire his smart ideas on reforming our immigration laws. We should all pay attention to them.

Thank you, Osage and Mason City! Had a powerful conversation today about how we can level the playing field for working families in Iowa—and across the country.

It’s possible! Let’s keep growing our movement to make it a reality.

No one understands Iowa Democratic politics quite like Jan Bauer does. I’m grateful we had the opportunity to chat today about this grassroots fight and the work she does to grow this movement!

John Kelly pushed for family separation while in the White House. Now he'll profit off of separating mamas from their babies. It’s immoral, and under my plan to #EndCorruptionNow it would be illegal for someone like Kelly to do this.
It was great talking to you, @ZachWahls. I’m inspired by your dedication to the people of Iowa.

HBCUs have had to do more with less, and that’s wrong. We need to call out the discrimination that led us to this point, and we need to live up to our obligations. That means we need to start investing in HBCUs.

I've got a plan to cancel student loan debt for 42 million Americans—and we've got a new calculator to help you figure out how much of your debt would be cancelled. Give it a try & tell us how much of your student loan debt will be cancelled. #CancelMyDebt

Right now, Wall Street is squeezing Puerto Rico. We must do better by our fellow U.S. citizens. That’s why I have a plan to provide comprehensive debt relief to Puerto Rico so it can rebuild and thrive.
Grace, I’m so glad to have you on our team.

The flooding across eastern Iowa is just one example of how climate change is affecting us in real time. It’s our moral obligation to fight for our planet before it’s too late. Thank you for stepping up and helping the community, Karen!

A hostile foreign power attacked our democracy. The president welcomed that attack, obstructed the investigation into it, & is now cozying up with the leader who orchestrated it. Congress needs to do its job, stand up for our national security, and begin impeachment proceedings.
Health care is a human right, and we fight for human rights. #MedicareForAll

Grace from New Hampshire is absolutely right. My new plan to cancel student debt for 95% of Americans and make public college free would level the playing field for all of our students—not just a select few.

About a third of US student loan debt is held by people over the age of 40. The student loan debt crisis is a burden on all of us, and my plan to cancel debt for 95% of Americans with student loan debt helps everyone get ahead.

Candidates for president don’t always go to Utah or Tennessee or Alabama because they aren’t battleground states. But this is a 50-state campaign, and I'm traveling to every corner of our country because I’m running to be president of the entire United States.

I’ve got a plan to cancel student loan debt for over 95% of Americans with student loans—and a calculator to help you figure out how much of your debt would be cancelled. Try it out and let me know how it goes!
Dreaming big, fighting hard, and living proud!
Grateful down to my toes for every single person in this movement. Let’s keep fighting hard!
Yesterday, I stopped by our Win With Warren organizing house party in Iowa Falls—and oh boy, was there some great energy in the room. Iowa is in this fight all the way.

Women should be able to control our own bodies. Our rights aren’t just threatened in Alabama —all across the country, safe, legal abortion access is under attack. You bet I’ll keep fighting to protect it.
Thank you, Ames!
How much of your student loan debt could get canceled under my new plan? Give our new calculator a try:   #CancelMyDebt

The flooding in Davenport and across eastern Iowa is heartbreaking. Climate change is here, and it’s up to us to act.

On Yom HaShoah, we pause to remember the millions of victims of the Holocaust. This year, Remembrance Day falls in the shadow of yet another attack on a synagogue. We must keep fighting anti-Semitism, bigotry, racism, and hate.
I missed Shannon on the first try, and then I saw her tweet asking to call her back—so I did. I’m deeply grateful for Shannon and her dedication to this grassroots movement.

En Estados Unidos, se necesita un liderazgo que respete a todos sus ciudadanos—y en el caso de Puerto Rico, el respeto significa poner las vidas de millones de ciudadanos por encima de los márgenes de ganancia de Wall Street.

Puerto Rico shows us a clear example of how well the federal government works for Wall Street and how poorly it works for everyone else. I believe we should fight back—and treat Puerto Rico with respect.
Crippling student loan debt is holding families back. My new plan would change that for Valerie from South Carolina, and millions of other Americans across the country.
Esta legislación establecería una avenida para el alivio comprensivo de la deuda de Puerto Rico. Puedes leer todos los detalles aquí.

Los ejecutivos de Wall Street ven la desesperación en la isla como una oportunidad para obtener ganancias—y eso me da asco. Por eso estoy presentado nuevamente el Acta de Alivio para los Territorios Estadounidenses.

El Congreso tuvo la oportunidad de romper con el control de Wall Street. En vez de hacerlo, aprobaron una legislación llamada PROMESA, estableciendo una junta de supervisión fiscal que exigió recortes a servicios básicos, coartando la posibilidad de recuperación para PR.

Sin embargo, por causa de su estatus único, esas avenidas legales no están a su alcance. Gran parte de la deuda está en manos de Wall Street, quienes intentan exprimir hasta el último centavo de ganancia.

Si Puerto Rico fuera una corporación grande o una ciudad en los Estados Unidos en este tipo de crisis financiera, podría declararse en bancarrota: pagando parte de su deuda, liquidando el resto y así comenzar a reconstruir.

Los huracanes Irma y María devastaron a Puerto Rico y a los millones de ciudadanos estadounidenses que viven en la isla. Queda claro que la respuesta de la administración de Trump fue inefectiva, pero una de las mayores limitaciones frenando la recuperación recae en su deuda.

Wall Street executives see the island’s desperation as just another opportunity to make a profit—and it makes me sick. That’s why I’m re-introducing the U.S. Territorial Relief Act to provide Puerto Rico with a path to comprehensive debt relief.

Much of Puerto Rico’s debt is held by Wall Street, which is trying to squeeze out every last penny of profit. Congress had a chance to break Wall Street's grip. Instead, they passed PROMESA, imposing an oversight board which has slashed services, hindering the recovery.

If Puerto Rico were a big company or an American city in this kind of financial trouble, it could file for bankruptcy, pay some of its debts, discharge the rest, then start rebuilding. But because of its unique status, those legal options aren’t available.

Hurricanes Irma and Maria devastated Puerto Rico and the millions of U.S. citizens who live there. The Trump Administration's response was slow and ineffective—but one of the biggest constraints holding back the recovery has been Puerto Rico's debt.

My three big brothers served in the military: Don Reed and John joined the Air Force, and David joined the Army. I’m glad I got to talk with and listen to military families in Nevada on Saturday. They deserve better and you bet I’m going to keep fighting for them.
Hate has no place in our country. The threat of white nationalism is real. And when I'm president, the Justice Department will prosecute domestic terrorists to the full extent of the law.

The American people know we must take bold steps to address our student debt crisis. By asking the top 0.1% to pay their fair share, we can cancel student loans for 42 million Americans. That wouldn’t just help our students, it would help all of us.
Unions built the middle class, and unions will rebuild the middle class. I’m grateful I got the chance to talk with @SEIU members in Nevada last weekend.
The flooding in Davenport and across eastern Iowa is heartbreaking. Climate change is here, and it’s up to us to act.

Unions built the middle class, and unions will rebuild the middle class. I’m grateful I got the chance to talk with @SEIU members in Nevada last weekend.
Covering our eyes won't change the facts. It's long past time to bring our troops home from Afghanistan.
Since today is Bailey’s birthday, here’s a little something to celebrate! Our team has Bailey-themed bandanas and a lot more at our online store:

May is Asian Pacific American Heritage Month—an important time to honor #AAPI Americans and their history. I’m grateful for the AAPI leaders across the country who are driving the fight for big, structural change in their communities. #APAHM

Donald Trump isn’t king, and no one is above the law. We know Barr's deceptive "summary" was intended to protect the man in the White House, and Congress should begin impeachment proceedings against the President.
This is outrageous. We need answers on how @DHSgov obtained surveillance data from family separation protests and how that data was used.

AG Barr is a disgrace, and his alarming efforts to suppress the Mueller report show that he's not a credible head of federal law enforcement. He should resign—and based on the actual facts in the Mueller report, Congress should begin impeachment proceedings against the President.
It’s Bailey’s 1st birthday! Bruce and I are so grateful for this sweetie and the gentleness he brings into our lives. Happy birthday, boy. You make my heart happy.

On #MayDay, I’m thinking about our country’s long history of workers making their voices heard and demanding change—just like the Lawrence, MA mill workers did over a century ago. The Bread and Roses strike inspires me to this day, and reminds us to keep fighting for our rights.

I've read the Mueller report, and one thing is very clear: Donald Trump is the most corrupt president in our lifetime, and Congress should begin impeachment proceedings. No one is above the law. Not even the President.

I'm heartsick for the victims of the #UNCC shooting and their family, friends, and classmates. Schools should be a safe haven for students and faculty, but again we see a horrific act of violence on a school campus. Enough is enough.

Special Counsel Robert Mueller's letter objecting to the Attorney General's characterization of his report confirms what we already suspected: Barr's "summary" was a willfully deceptive interpretation intended to protect the man in the White House.

Free public college. Universal child care. Affordable housing. Yep, I’ve got a plan for all that—and more. But it starts with growing our grassroots movement so we can win in 2020. Chip in what you can and you might get a call from me to say thanks.
This is a campaign of ideas—and you bet I have a lot of them. It’s about identifying what’s broken and how we’re going to make the structural change to fix it.

Some giant companies make billions of dollars in profits but pay $0 in corporate income tax. My Real Corporate Profits Tax would make big and profitable companies pay their fair share and ensure none of them ever pay zero taxes again.
Thank you, Ady. I’m so grateful to call you my friend. We’re in this fight together.

Karen from New Hampshire has seen first hand how students are getting crushed by mountains of student loan debt. By making public colleges free and canceling student debt for 95% of Americans, we’ll do good by our students and our economy.
Every year that Washington keeps working for the rich and the powerful, Medicare is more likely to come under attack. Enough is enough. We need to protect and expand Medicare. #MedicareForAll
It was great meeting you, too. Unions built the middle class and unions will rebuild the middle class. I’m with you all the way.

I’m not taking PAC money or donations from federal lobbyists. I’m also not schmoozing with wealthy donors behind closed doors. That’s why I need your help. Help hit our April fundraising goal and chip in to our Official 2020 Campaign.

Black women are 3 to 4 times more likely than white women to die from pregnancy or childbirth-related causes. A major reason? Racism. It's time to hold health systems accountable for protecting Black moms.
Covering our eyes won't change the facts. It's long past time to bring our troops home from Afghanistan.

If you own a home, you’re already paying a wealth tax—it’s called a property tax. I just want the ultra-rich to pay a wealth tax on the diamonds, the yachts, and the Rembrandts too.

Our democracy is not for sale, and neither is my time. That’s why this campaign is powered by grassroots donors. We have less than 48 hours to hit our April fundraising goal—will you chip in what you can?
It was great to be in Las Vegas again this weekend to talk about how we’re going to fight for big, structural change. See you again soon!

She used to lobby for a Ukrainian oligarch. Now the Trump administration wants to give her a plum job at the Treasury Department. Under my plan to #EndCorruptionNow, it’d be illegal for former lobbyists like her to work for our government.
What would it be like to have a woman in the White House? I think it’d be great—and the crowd in Cedar Rapids last week agreed.
Women should be able to control our own bodies. Full stop.
Outrageous. Filing taxes should be simple and free. Big financial corporations like TurboTax shouldn’t be able to scam consumers like this—and my Tax Simplification Act would fix that.

For most candidates, “call time” means calling wealthy donors and asking for money. Not me. I’m spending “call time” thanking small-dollar, grassroots donors who give what they can. Chip in what you can, and you might get a call from me to say thank you:
Busy weekend in Iowa and Nevada. Somebody was waiting for me to come home!
Unions built America’s middle class and unions will rebuild America’s middle class. Thanks @SEIU and @CAPAction for inviting me to speak at the #WorkersForum!
Thank you, Iowa, for the warm welcome and for helping make Bruce’s birthday weekend truly special! We look forward to seeing you again soon.
I was proud to take the #WeAreIndivisible pledge—now let's do the work we need to do to defeat Trump in 2020.

I'm heartsick for the victims of today's horrific attack at the Chabad of Poway and their families. No one should ever have to face hatred and violence in a place of worship. It's on all of us to stand up to the rising threat of anti-semitism, racism, and hate.

As I told @JoyAnnReid, we've got to get organized, get mobilized, and build a grassroots movement if we want to make big, structural change. And we'll need a president who is willing to fight for it every inch of the way.

On her birthday, we remember activist and civil rights hero Coretta Scott King. Her powerful voice continues to resonate across the country—and we will never let anyone silence it. Nevertheless, we persist.
The food—and Bruce—were both better than ever. Happy birthday, sweetie.

I ordered him a huge lunch, and he wolfed down every bite. At the end, he said he loved it. Right then, I knew this was a guy I could live with forever. This week we were back in Houston for She the People, and we went back to Ninfa’s.

The first time Bruce came to Houston to meet my family, I picked him up at the airport and drove him directly to my favorite Tex-Mex place, Ninfa’s on Navigation. He’d grown up in Massachusetts and everything in this part of the world was new.
Today is Bruce's birthday, so yesterday we celebrated with cake. I’m very lucky to have him by my side this weekend in Iowa—and for all of life’s big adventures. Happy birthday, Bruce!

Surprise, surprise. The man in the White House wants to give a top government job to another one of his rich buddies. Barry Myers is a walking conflict of interest who doesn't belong anywhere near @NOAA.

I’m so glad to have you on our team, Dan!
Here's my plan: We fight side by side, @MajorPhilebrity.
On #LesbianVisibilityDay, I want to be clear: You matter. We see you. We won’t stop fighting until everyone is free to love without fear or discrimination.

People come up to me, introduce themselves, and then tell me how much student loan debt they have. Their debt is keeping them from buying homes, starting businesses, and pursuing the careers they want. It's time to cancel the debt that is crushing an entire generation.
Universal child care. Affordable housing. Student loan debt cancellation and universal free college. Yup, I’ve got a plan for that—and more.
Coastal communities have made it clear: No more offshore drilling that hurts our planet. On day one of a Warren administration, I promise to sign a total moratorium on new offshore drilling.

This week at @_shethepeople, I was asked if I’m afraid voters will think white male candidates are “safer” than voting for a woman.

I’m not afraid—not by a long shot.

Today, I’m thinking about the Iowans whose lives were torn apart by intense flooding this spring, and the first responders who are helping keep people safe. Climate change is real—and we need big, structural change to tackle it head on.
Yesterday’s meet and greet in Linn County was a meaningful one. People are fired up for big, structural change.

Today I’m rolling out a plan to improve our military housing, protect families from abuse, and hold private developers accountable. The very least we owe those who proudly defend our country and their families is a safe, affordable place to live.

Military families have been living with lead paint, faulty wiring, ceilings collapsing, and mice infestations. Mold has taken over entire rooms. Kids are getting sick from living in these homes. That's not how we should treat our servicemembers—and it needs to stop now.

A handful of private developers have taken over 99% of domestic military family housing. Driven by short-term payoffs and with no meaningful oversight, contractors have failed to maintain the homes they were entrusted with—and families are suffering the consequences.

The legacy of racist redlining practices still haunts Black and Brown communities. It’s wrong. Yesterday at #SheThePeople2020, I talked about my new housing plan that would level the playing field for communities of color.

New Hampshire is getting squeezed by our country’s opioid epidemic. Last month I had the opportunity to visit Friendship House, an opioid treatment center in Bethlehem, and had powerful conversations with patients about how we can end this crisis.

I wanted to be a teacher since 2nd grade. Here I am with my doll collection—I used to line them up and play “school.” Later, I had the chance to be a special education teacher and a law professor because America invested in kids like me. We need to invest in kids again. #TBT
More proof that Amazon has too much power. Tech monopolies hurt small businesses, innovation, and consumers. #BreakUpBigTech
Thank you for a great conversation, @JoyAnnReid.

Five years. An entire generation of children has lived all or most of their lives without access to clean, safe water. Activists like @LittleMissFlint have been fighting tirelessly for Flint—but we must do better to ensure no community ever faces a crisis like this ever again.

Donald Trump’s White House is a product of a system that’s rigged in favor of the rich and the powerful. But this is our time to change that. Join our fight to win in 2020 and return the power to the people:

This is despicable. A young life was lost and a family is grieving because of anti-LGBTQ+ comments like these. My thoughts and prayers are with the friends and family of Nigel Shelby. To the LGBTQ+ community: You are loved. You matter. You are deserving.
I’m so glad to have you on our team, Dan!

People come up to me, introduce themselves, and then tell me how much student loan debt they have. Their debt is keeping them from buying homes, starting businesses, and pursuing the careers they want. It's time to cancel the debt that is crushing an entire generation.
Universal child care. Affordable housing. Student loan debt cancellation and universal free college. Yup, I’ve got a plan for that—and more.
Coastal communities have made it clear: No more offshore drilling that hurts our planet. On day one of a Warren administration, I promise to sign a total moratorium on new offshore drilling.

This week at @_shethepeople, I was asked if I’m afraid voters will think white male candidates are “safer” than voting for a woman.

I’m not afraid—not by a long shot.

Today, I’m thinking about the Iowans whose lives were torn apart by intense flooding this spring, and the first responders who are helping keep people safe. Climate change is real—and we need big, structural change to tackle it head on.
Yesterday’s meet and greet in Linn County was a meaningful one. People are fired up for big, structural change.

Today I’m rolling out a plan to improve our military housing, protect families from abuse, and hold private developers accountable. The very least we owe those who proudly defend our country and their families is a safe, affordable place to live.

Military families have been living with lead paint, faulty wiring, ceilings collapsing, and mice infestations. Mold has taken over entire rooms. Kids are getting sick from living in these homes. That's not how we should treat our servicemembers—and it needs to stop now.

A handful of private developers have taken over 99% of domestic military family housing. Driven by short-term payoffs and with no meaningful oversight, contractors have failed to maintain the homes they were entrusted with—and families are suffering the consequences.

The legacy of racist redlining practices still haunts Black and Brown communities. It’s wrong. Yesterday at #SheThePeople2020, I talked about my new housing plan that would level the playing field for communities of color.

New Hampshire is getting squeezed by our country’s opioid epidemic. Last month I had the opportunity to visit Friendship House, an opioid treatment center in Bethlehem, and had powerful conversations with patients about how we can end this crisis.

I wanted to be a teacher since 2nd grade. Here I am with my doll collection—I used to line them up and play “school.” Later, I had the chance to be a special education teacher and a law professor because America invested in kids like me. We need to invest in kids again. #TBT
More proof that Amazon has too much power. Tech monopolies hurt small businesses, innovation, and consumers. #BreakUpBigTech
Thank you for a great conversation, @JoyAnnReid.

Five years. An entire generation of children has lived all or most of their lives without access to clean, safe water. Activists like @LittleMissFlint have been fighting tirelessly for Flint—but we must do better to ensure no community ever faces a crisis like this ever again.

Donald Trump’s White House is a product of a system that’s rigged in favor of the rich and the powerful. But this is our time to change that. Join our fight to win in 2020 and return the power to the people:

This is despicable. A young life was lost and a family is grieving because of anti-LGBTQ+ comments like these. My thoughts and prayers are with the friends and family of Nigel Shelby. To the LGBTQ+ community: You are loved. You matter. You are deserving.

Climate change is real and it is here—just ask farmers in Iowa who have felt the change in growing seasons, excessive flooding, and about $2 billion in damage to communities. We need real solutions like a #GreenNewDeal—and we need them now.

There is a student loan debt crisis, and it’s holding an entire generation back—from reducing home ownership rates to forcing students to drop out of school before getting a degree. It’s unacceptable and I want to change that. #CancelMyDebt

In Iowa, I met family farmers who are getting squeezed by decades of policies that favor giant agribusinesses like Bayer-Monsanto. Time for better policy choices . Learn more about my plan to level the playing field for America’s family farmers:

Giant agribusinesses like these have too much power, and family farms are getting hurt. My plan to level the playing field for America’s farmers tackles consolidation in the agriculture sector head on.

This is a slap on the wrist—a fraction of the profits Facebook makes in a year. Facebook is a repeat offender & fines like this won’t stop them from breaking the law & violating our privacy again. It's going to take big, structural change. #BreakUpBigTech
I’m so grateful for the work that @MOVE_texas does to register and turn out voters—it was so good to meet these powerful women and thank them for their work!
What a powerful room. Honored and grateful down to my toes. Thank you, @_shethepeople!
We have to right the wrongs for communities of color. And that starts by addressing the legacy of discrimination in our country.

Black moms in our country are dying from childbirth-related causes 3-4 times more often than white moms. Any meaningful solution to our maternal mortality crisis must address structural racism as a root cause of this problem. My new idea would tackle this crisis head on.

Grateful to be part of such a powerful conversation at #SheThePeople2020 this afternoon. Our country needs to do better by women of color—and for me, it starts with addressing and tackling the Black maternal mortality crisis head on.

We've done this in other areas of health care. Let's do it here. If providers deliver quality care to Black moms, they’ll make more. If they don’t, they’ll make less. Don't just observe and debate racism in health care. Make providers pay until this crisis is fixed. #SheThePeople

Advocates are forcing Black maternal mortality into the conversation. There are important ideas on the table. Here's mine: Hit health care providers in their wallets. Make it unacceptable for providers to tolerate our high rates of moms dying—especially Black moms. #SheThePeople

The evidence all points in the same direction. The mistreatment of Black and Brown women around maternal health is the direct result of institutional and structural racism. We need bold solutions to the epidemic of maternal mortality in America. #SheThePeople

Moms in our country are dying from childbirth at rates almost 40% higher than in other wealthy countries—and the Black maternal mortality rate is 3-4 times higher than it is for white moms, across all income levels. We have to call it out. #SheThePeople

The treatment of women and infants is a direct reflection of the values of a society—and the U.S. has the worst maternal mortality rate in the developed world. It's a national disgrace. Today, I talked about my idea to fix it. #SheThePeople

Student loan debt is holding back an entire generation and crushing families—but we can change that. José María, Eva, Jayme, Alexandria, Tasha, Alicia, and Michael have big plans for what they could do if we cancel their debt.

We need to start fixing our higher education system so it better serves everyone—including communities of color. That's why my plan invests a minimum of $50 billion in HBCUs and Minority-Serving Institutions (MSIs).
I’m grateful for the conversations we had in Keene and Weare last weekend about the future of our country. We're going to do this together!

We need to act on climate change before it’s too late. That’s why I’m making a promise. On the first day of a Warren administration, I’ll sign a total moratorium on all new fossil fuel leases, including for drilling offshore and on public lands.
We won’t go back on women’s health—not now, not ever. The Trump administration's gag rule is immoral, dangerous, and illegal. Period. #ProtectX

Go, Jane!

It was great meeting Ricardo at @AllenUniv in South Carolina yesterday. I’m grateful that young people like him are in this fight all the way to cancel debt for 95% of Americans and make public colleges free.
Young people in our country, like Aubrey from Utah, are getting absolutely crushed by student loan debt. It doesn’t have to be this way and I’ve got a plan to tackle the debt crisis head on.

I want every girl to grow up knowing that they can fight from the heart—and that they can win. So when I meet a little girl on the campaign trail, I say: “I’m running for president, because that’s what girls do.” And we pinky promise that they’ll remember.
When Amazon can tilt the online marketplace in its own favor, small businesses see an immediate impact in their profits. That can be absolutely crushing, it's not fair, and I’m fighting to end that.
Finally, I said that Amazon was about 49% of all online retail sales. And yes, you are. What an odd thing to deliberately misconstrue.
Second, Amazon's private label products are projected to reach $25 billion in online sales by 2022. An analyst said huge private label sales would give Amazon "a strong...competitive advantage":

Oh boy. Here are the facts:
First, there are multiple reports that Amazon is using the data it collects to copy successful goods sold by small businesses on the Amazon Marketplace and sell its own branded version.
Let’s be clear: Our #2020census must count every single person. Our Constitution demands it, and our democracy requires it.

My new plan for the cancellation of student loan debt applies to public technical schools, too. Wherever you pursue an education, you should be able to graduate without getting crushed by piles of debt.
Thanks, @NHYoungDems. I’m grateful for the work you do on this issue, including pushing NH to restore funding for public universities.

You've got to pay something back so that everyone can have a chance. A 2% tax on the wealthiest fortunes can let us provide universal Pre-K, universal free college, cancel student loan debt for 95% of Americans—and still have a trillion dollars left over. #WarrenTownHall

I was grateful to be at @AllenUniv this morning, where we talked about how we can level the playing field for all our students—not just a select few. My new college debt plan would establish a minimum of $50 billion for HBCUs and Minority-Serving Institutions.

We can make big, structural change—as long as we build a grassroots movement to fight for it. Add your name to say you support cancelling up to $50,000 in student loan debt for 42 million Americans and making universal free public college a reality.
Our government needs to do right by Americans getting crushed by debt—including you, Sarah. I’m in this fight to end the student debt crisis all the way.
I know we can make real, structural change for students like you, Olyvia. That’s what my new plan is all about.

Do you have a story about student loan debt and college affordability? How would this plan change your life? If this plan would be personally meaningful for you or someone you know, raise your voice and tell your story with #CancelMyDebt.

My new plan would cancel up to $50,000 in student loan debt for 42 million Americans, and completely wipe out student loan debt for more than 75% of Americans. This would free an entire generation of families from crushing debt and give our economy a boost.

Even better: I want to establish a *minimum* of $50 billion for HBCUs & Minority-Serving Institutions (MSIs)! The Secretary of Ed. would increase the amount of money in the fund as needed to ensure that spending per-student at these schools is comparable to colleges in the area.
This is personal because policy touches the lives of everyone in this country. Thanks for tuning in! #WarrenTownHall
Go, Jane!

Wow! Thanks for watching. We’re in this fight together.
I’m so grateful you tuned in, Zerlina.
Climate change is real and it is here. We just can’t wait any longer. It’s all hands on deck, and we’ve got to make change—starting with a  #GreenNewDeal. #WarrenTownHall

I believe the House should initiate impeachment proceedings against the President of the United States. There is no political inconvenience exception to the United States Constitution. I explained my position tonight. #WarrenTownHall
Here’s the deal: Girls dream big, fight hard, and win. #WarrenTownHall

We’re not going to win this by name-calling or talking about Donald Trump. The way we’re going to do this is by talking about our vision and how it affects families across the country. Our economy and our democracy are at stake. #WarrenTownHall

When I first ran for office, I was told that people weren't ready to elect a woman. But I organized, built a grassroots movement, and fought for working people. And I won. That's how I'm going to be the first woman elected President of the United States. #WarrenTownHall
The student loan debt burden is crushing millions of families and acting as an anchor on our economy. That’s just wrong. My new plan would end this crisis and clean up the mess it’s caused.

If we put a 2% tax on the wealthiest families in the country, we can provide universal Pre-K, universal free college, knock back student loan debt for 95% of Americans—and still have a trillion dollars leftover. #WarrenTownHall

I actually read the whole Mueller report. It’s clear Donald Trump obstructed an investigation into an attack on America and into his own behavior. Presidents are not above the law, and Congress has a constitutional duty to start impeachment proceedings. #WarrenTownHall
There is no political inconvenience exception to the United States Constitution. #WarrenTownHall
The only way we can make big, structural change is if we all work together. Chip in whatever you can and join our fight. Every donation makes a difference.
I’m making a promise. On my first day as President, I will sign a moratorium on new fossil fuel drilling offshore and on public lands. Read more about my new public lands plan here:   #WarrenTownHall
Here’s what I learned when I first ran for Senate in 2012. People care more about their families than name calling. I know because I grew up in a family that was paycheck-to-paycheck. #WarrenTownHall

I want every little girl to know that she can run for office. So when I meet girls on the campaign trail, I say, “My name is Elizabeth. And I’m running for president because that’s what girls do.” And we pinky swear. #WarrenTownHall

Every year that goes by, our Medicare system is a little further out of whack. Why? Because Washington keeps working for the rich and the powerful. Well I’m willing to take on that fight. We need to protect and expand Medicare. #WarrenTownHall

It’s true: I was a registered Republican. Then I started doing research on why families were getting crushed. All the money was on one side, and all the hurting was on the other. I realized that all of the Republicans stood with the rich and powerful. #WarrenTownHall

Our criminal justice system has a problem with race right at the heart of it, and we need to call it out for what it is. No one is safer in a world where we have a broken criminal justice system. #WarrenTownHall

I took an oath to uphold our Constitution & everyone else in Congress did too. If other members think we can ignore a president's repeated efforts to obstruct an investigation, then they should have to take that vote—and live with it for the rest of their lives. #WarrenTownHall

If any other human being in this country did what was described in the Mueller report, they’d be in jail. This isn’t about politics—this is about principle for me. We need to protect our democracy for generations to come. #WarrenTownHall

I stayed up late into the night reading the Mueller report. The facts are clear: A hostile foreign government attacked our 2016 election to help Donald Trump—and Donald Trump welcomed that help. Once elected, he obstructed the investigation into that attack. #WarrenTownHall

Right now in this country, Black Americans are far more likely to be arrested for marijuana use than white Americans. That’s not right. We need to legalize marijuana—and I have a bipartisan bill would end the federal ban on marijuana. #WarrenTownHall

Giant tech companies have too much power. My plan to #BreakUpBigTech prevents corporations like Amazon from knocking out the rest of the competition. You can be an umpire, or you can be a player—but you can’t be both. #WarrenTownHall

When I first ran for Senate, people told me that Massachusetts wasn’t ready for a woman Senator. I proved them wrong. So now when I meet girls on the campaign trail, I say, “My name is Elizabeth. And I’m running for president because that’s what girls do.” And we pinky swear.

Our criminal justice system has a problem with race right at the heart of it, and we need to call it out for what it is. We need to get rid of for-profit, private prisons—and when people leave prison, their right to vote needs to be reinstated. #WarrenTownHall

Student loan debt is crushing families and holding back our economy. So today, I proposed something truly transformational: Universal free public college and the cancellation of debt for more than 95% of Americans with student loan debt. #WarrenTownHall

You have to pay something back so that everyone gets a chance. If we put a 2% tax on the wealthiest families in the country, we can have universal Pre-K, universal free college, knock back student loan debt for 95% of Americans—and still have a trillion dollars leftover.

Student loan debt is crushing students. My new proposal is about opportunity for everyone. Let’s cancel student loan debt for about 95% of Americans, make college universally available, and invest more in Pell Grants and HBCUs. And we’ll pay for it with my #UltraMillionaireTax.
Woo-hoo! It was great seeing so many people fired up for our @CNN town hall tonight. Let’s do this.
We need to level the playing field and create opportunity for all of our students—not just a select few.
Thanks, Jason!
Your support means so much. Thank you, Ady.

Tonight, our grassroots movement will have a chance to talk more about our new plans for student debt and universal free public college. Grab a friend to watch and let’s do this together. #WarrenTownHall
This morning on CNN, I talked to @mj_lee about my new plan to level the playing field for families and students getting crushed by student loan debt. This will be transformational for our country.

America’s public lands are some of our greatest treasures. On #EarthDay and every day, I’m making a promise: On day one of a Warren admin, I'll sign a moratorium on new fossil fuel drilling leases offshore and on public lands. More about my plan here:

Higher education opened a million doors for me—but today, it’s almost impossible for young people to find that kind of opportunity. My new idea for cancellation of student loan debt and universal free public college would change that.

My new plan is a chance to talk about what’s broken and how we fix it. It’s how we can give our students a fighting chance at the American dream again.
This law is wrong—plain and simple. We need a constitutional amendment that protects every American citizen's right to vote and get that vote counted. Thank you, @JeanneShaheen for leading the fight.

I’m calling for universal free college and the cancellation of student loan debt for more than 95% of Americans. This is the kind of big, structural change we need to make sure our kids have opportunity in this country.

Finally, my plan will ban for-profit colleges from receiving any federal dollars. Time to cut off taxpayer money to schools that suck down billions while burying lower-income students, servicemembers, and students of color in mountains of debt.
We'll knock down artificial barriers to enrollment by prohibiting public colleges from considering citizenship status or criminal history in admissions decisions.

Next, my plan will dedicate $100 billion in new funding to help students cover non-tuition expenses at public colleges—a barrier that disproportionately affects lower-income students and students of color—to make zero debt at graduation a reality for everyone.

First, my plan will provide at least $50B—and potentially far more—to HBCUs and Minority-Serving Institutions. It’ll also make additional funding available to states that demonstrate serious improvement in enrollment/graduation rates for lower-income students & students of color.

Free tuition at public institutions isn’t enough. We must also make our higher education system better serve lower-income families and communities of color, and ensure everyone can graduate with zero debt.

That’s why I’m proposing a historic new federal investment in public higher education that will eliminate the cost of tuition and fees at every public two-year and four-year college in America, plus an additional $100 billion investment in Pell Grants.

I was able to get a quality, public education for just $50 a semester. That kind of opportunity is virtually impossible to find today. As states have invested less in community colleges and public four-year colleges, schools have raised tuition and fees to make up the gap.

Student loan debt is crushing millions of families. That’s why I’m calling for something truly transformational: Universal free college and the cancellation of debt for more than 95% of Americans with student loan debt. Read all about it here:
When workers fight, workers win. I’m glad to see that @StopandShop workers are returning to work with an agreement for higher wages and continued health and pension benefits. #UnionStrong
Why do I love #GameOfThrones? It’s the women (duh!). Looking forward to tonight’s episode. In the meantime, you can read my review of the season premiere here.

These hate crimes were meant to strike fear in the hearts of African Americans. I'm glad our country is coming together to rebuild the churches that were hatefully burned down. Every house of worship should be a haven for people to worship without fear.
I grew up in the McFarlin Methodist church in Oklahoma. Today, I’m remembering some of the lessons I learned in Sunday School: By doing good, we can live a righteous life. Happy Easter Sunday!

I'm heartsick for the victims of today’s terrorist attacks in Sri Lanka. Hundreds have been killed and wounded. To slaughter worshippers at church during Easter service is an act of great evil. My thoughts and my prayers are with the victims and their loved ones.

Last night on @maddow, I made it clear: We can’t ignore a president’s repeated efforts to obstruct an investigation into his own disloyal behavior. The House should initiate impeachment proceedings against the President of the United States.
What a guy.
Today, I got asked a really important question in New Hampshire. This is a matter of principle, and here is why I’m in this fight all the way.

I was out in Utah talking about environmental issues & on the plane back, the Mueller report came out—so I started reading, & read late into the night. The report hands this now to Congress & the fundamental question for us is: "Is there going to be some accountability here?"
LIVE: Yesterday I called on the House to begin impeachment proceedings. This is a matter of principle for me.  – at Keene State College
I read the Mueller report.  When I got to the end, I realized this is a point of principle. Because it matters not just for this president, but for all future presidents. No one is above the law.

The severity of this misconduct demands that elected officials in both parties set aside political considerations and do their constitutional duty. That means the House should initiate impeachment proceedings against the President of the United States.

To ignore a President’s repeated efforts to obstruct an investigation into his own disloyal behavior would inflict great and lasting damage on this country, and it would suggest that both the current and future Presidents would be free to abuse their power in similar ways.

Mueller put the next step in the hands of Congress: “Congress has authority to prohibit a President’s corrupt use of his authority in order to protect the integrity of the administration of justice.” The correct process for exercising that authority is impeachment.

The Mueller report lays out facts showing that a hostile foreign government attacked our 2016 election to help Donald Trump and Donald Trump welcomed that help. Once elected, Donald Trump obstructed the investigation into that attack.

I’m grateful to everyone who packed into the Depot on Wednesday. Person by person, city by city, we’re building a grassroots movement to win in 2020—and I’m glad that Salt Lake City is in this fight all the way!

With a stroke of his pen, the man in the White House rolled back protections for more than two million acres of our national lands. It doesn’t have to be this way. On my first day as president, I will commit to no new fossil fuel drilling on our public lands. Period.

Surprise, surprise. Former @Interior secretary Ryan Zinke resigned because of too many ethics investigations. Now he’s taking a plum job at a company he used to regulate. It's corruption, plain and simple.

Yesterday, @rweingarten gave a powerful speech on the crisis in the teaching profession. I stand with @AFTunion and America’s public school teachers. It’s time to #FundOurFuture and give teachers the #FreedomToTeach.
I loved the energy at our organizing event in Denver earlier this week. I’m grateful for our movement—and I’m grateful that the people of Colorado are in this fight for big, structural change.

I’m making a promise. On the first day of a Warren administration, I will sign a moratorium on new fossil fuel drilling leases on public lands. Climate change is here, it is real, and we need to do something about it.

Congress needs to see the full, unredacted report. Special Counsel Robert Mueller should testify before Congress and the American people as soon as possible. Add your name if you agree, and together, we’ll fight to get to the bottom of this.
This is a disgrace. The American people deserve answers—and Special Counsel Robert Mueller should testify publicly before Congress. #ReleaseTheFullReport
It's a disgrace to see an Attorney General acting as if he's the personal attorney and publicist for the President of the United States.
Salt Lake City is ready to dream big, and fight hard!

I had a great time hiking through Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest. This gorgeous place is one of our national treasures—and we have a moral obligation to protect it for our kids and our grandkids.

I’m here in the Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest with Carl Fisher, executive director of @SaveOurCanyons, a nonprofit dedicated to protecting our public lands. My new plan would ensure that places like this stay beautiful for generations to come.

I’m grateful to everyone who chipped in before our last FEC deadline. This grassroots movement is by the people, for the people—and that’s how we’ll keep fighting for big, structural change. Will you chip in $3, or whatever you can, to help us win in 2020?
It was an honor to meet you, Dr. Apryl.

Glad I got a chance to meet them!
Glad we got to meet, Charli!
Thank you, Denver!
.@AOC reminds us that, in our democracy—even while greed and corruption slow our progress—true power still rests with the people. Here’s my @TIME piece on her.
Early morning walk in Denver before we head to Utah. See you soon, Salt Lake City!

Our pop-up event yesterday at Lady Justice Brewery—a great small business in Denver, Colorado—was a lot of fun. We had an important conversation about how we can protect our environment for generations to come. We're going to do this together!
We need big, structural change—like my new public lands idea—to tackle climate change and protect our planet before it’s too late. You can read more about our new idea here:
Woo-hoo! The crowd in Denver is fired up. I’m grateful to have all of you in this grassroots movement. See you soon.
I believe we have a moral obligation to protect our public lands. We owe it to our children, our grandchildren, and generations to come.

Unions built the middle class, and unions will rebuild the middle class. I stand with the 31K @stopandshop workers who are making their voices heard, and fighting for better wages and working conditions.
I will always stand with our trans service members. If someone can handle the job, they should be allowed to serve—no exceptions. We’ll fight this tooth and nail.
Still smiling over the warm welcome I received in Beaufort yesterday. I agree—it’s about time we have a woman president. (That kettle corn was amazing, by the way!)

Climate change is an existential threat. There is no Planet B for us. At our house party in Lebanon, NH this weekend, I talked about how we need to protect our environment—and my new ideas to protect public lands is a step in that direction.

My big new idea bans new fossil fuel drilling offshore and on public lands, generates more renewable energy, establishes free entry to all national parks, and more. Sign our petition if you support more protection for public lands.
I stand with @PittGrads as they make their voices heard this week.

This list shouldn’t be this long—heck, there shouldn't be a list in the first place. Under my Real Corporate Profits Tax, giant corporations like these wouldn’t be able to get away with paying $0 in income taxes.
I’m grateful to the people of Charleston, South Carolina for welcoming me into their community yesterday. We had important conversations at our Coastal Community Forum about climate change and more.

Presidential candidates don’t always go to Utah because it isn't a battleground state. But I’ll be there this week because I’m running to be president of the entire United States. Join us and let’s do this together.

America’s public lands belong to everyone—so we should start acting like it. Read my full plan here:
I agree, and I’m grateful for the @sunrisemvmt’s leadership in the fight for our environment. My new plan for public lands is an essential part of any #GreenNewDeal. We're in this fight together.
Thank you, Charleston! Had a great time talking about the big, structural change our movement is fighting for.

I called for an investigation into Bernhardt’s conflicts of interests as a lobbyist-turned Acting Interior Secretary. The American people shouldn’t have to wonder if their government is working to protect them from climate change—or working for big corporations. Time for answers.

It’s time to make America’s public lands part of our climate change solution. That means we need to stop corporations from pillaging our public lands and leaving taxpayers to clean up the mess. My new idea puts our environment and our communities first.

America’s public lands belong to all of us. We should start acting like it. That means expanding access, ending fossil fuel extraction, more renewables, and maintaining and improving public lands. Together, we can protect our public lands for generations to come.

Trump is selling off public lands to oil, gas, and coal companies. It's wrong. Let's end it and make our public lands part of the climate solution—with a total moratorium on new fossil fuel drilling and a plan to get 10% of America's energy from renewables on these lands instead.

America’s public lands provide us with clean air and water, sustain fish and wildlife, and offer a place for millions to experience the beauty of nature. Right now, they're under attack. Read my new plan to protect them while fighting climate change:

No matter what you end up paying on #TaxDay, it’s more than what Amazon—which makes billions in profits—paid last year. Learn more about how my Real Corporate Profits tax would require billion-dollar corporations to pay their fair share.

Sara Mae was one of the first women to ever run in the #BostonMarathon (and fight for women to be allowed to compete in the first place). When I first ran for Senate, she was also one of my first grassroots supporters. Here’s why she’s in this fight all the way.
Happy #PatriotsDay! Bruce, Bailey, and I are wishing good luck to everyone running in the #BostonMarathon today.

Today marks six years since the Boston Marathon bombings. On #OneBostonDay, we remember the victims, survivors, and brave first responders—and honor the resilience of the city of Boston. #BostonStrong
Too late to audition to be a direwolf?
We had powerful conversations in Hanover and Concord yesterday about the future of our country. The environment, #MedicareForAll, education—we’re fighting our hearts out for it.

I want this movement to know that I’m grateful for their support—so yesterday, I FaceTimed into some #WinWithWarren parties like this one in Grand Rapids, Michigan to say thanks. (Don’t worry, Bruce was keeping his eyes on the road the whole time.)

I ended my day in a perfect way: At a #WinWithWarren organizing house party in Londonderry. It was packed with grassroots supporters who are ready to roll up their sleeves and start fighting for big, structural change in our country. That’s what this campaign is all about.
Thank you, Wade! I’m so glad to have you in this fight. #WinWithWarren
