We need to rein in the political and economic power of the giant tech companies. That’s why we’re fighting to #BreakUpBigTech.
This is just plain wrong. It’s unconstitutional. We’ll fight it. And we’ll win.

Giant companies have hired hordes of lobbyists to get the tax code written to create a special exception over here or a special loophole over there. They wouldn’t be able to get away with that under my Real Corporate Profits Tax.
LGBTQ+ rights are human rights. I’m glad to see Arizona make this their law.

While @StopandShop's parent company made $2 billion in profits and got a tax cut from the #GOPTaxScam, @UFCW workers were getting squeezed by low wages and lousy benefits. We’re not gonna put up with it. #UnionStrong.
I will always stand side by side with our workers and our unions.

I stand with the @UFCW and @StopandShop workers on the picket line. This strike is about 31K workers across New England making their voices heard and fighting for living wages and better benefits. When workers fight, workers win.
You can raise the corporate tax rate, but with loopholes companies could still pay $0. That’s where my Real Corporate Profits Tax comes in. Thanks for having me yesterday, @SRuhle.

Let me be very clear: If someone can handle the job, they should be allowed to serve—regardless of how they identify or who they love. We’ll stand with service members and fight this cruelty with everything we’ve got.

Thank you, Lisa, for hosting a #WinWithWarren organizing house party this weekend! These house parties are how we’ll continue building a national network of grassroots supporters. So gather your friends and neighbors, and sign up to participate:
.@StopandShop workers deserve fair wages and good benefits—and I’m behind them 100% of the way. I stand in solidarity with @UFCW and the 31K workers who are making their voices heard.
Happy #NationalPetDay! Missed my guy while I was in Washington.

Under my plan to #EndCorruptionNow, it would be illegal for David Bernhardt to serve as Secretary of the Interior. A former oil lobbyist has no business leading a department charged with protecting our environment.

National Weekend of Action is right around the corner—and we’re launching hundreds of #WinWithWarren organizing house parties across the country. Ashley stepped up to be a host, so I called her to say thanks. Find a party to attend this weekend:

This campaign isn’t like the others. I don’t get my money from PACs, corporate lobbyists, or fancy fundraisers. This movement is 100% powered by the people: Small-dollar donors who chip in $10 here, $5 there. Will you join our fight?
Tune in to @allinwithchris at 8 PM tonight as I talk about my new idea to make sure no company with billions in profits pays $0 in federal taxes. See you soon, @chrislhayes!
Last year, Amazon made more than $10 billion in profits and paid $0 in federal corporate income taxes. Yup—it’s outrageous. Here’s how my new Real Corporate Profits Tax idea works.

What are #WinWithWarren house parties? These are get-togethers hosted by grassroots supporters in your community, where you can learn how to get more involved in our movement. Troy is hosting one this Saturday—so I called him to say thank you! RSVP:

Thank you for the inspiring meet and greet this afternoon, @UofNH! Had a great time talking with students and others about how we’re going to level the playing field for families in Durham, New Hampshire and across the country.
The Trump administration’s treatment of Americans with disabilities is shameful and wrong. Social Security is a lifeline for millions of people with disabilities. We need to expand it, not make cuts.

In response to my plan, Amazon says it "pays all the taxes we are required to pay in the US." Yeah, I know. You made more than $10 billion in profits last year and you were required to pay $0 in federal corporate taxes. That's the problem.

For decades, our government’s racist redlining laws blocked Black families from home ownership and building wealth. My new housing idea would level the playing field so everyone can have access to safe and affordable housing.
This is a campaign about ideas and big, structural change. This is what we’re fighting for—and we’re just getting started.

Our corporate income tax rules are riddled with loopholes, exemptions, and deductions. Even companies that tell shareholders they have made more than a billion dollars in profits can end up paying no corporate income taxes. I want to tackle that problem head on.
To ensure every corporation pays their fair share,  we need a new kind of tax that big companies can’t get around. That’s what my new tax idea would accomplish.
You bet I do.

I guess Rep. Brady is fine with 60 of the biggest corporations in the US paying $0 in taxes on a combined $79 billion in profits—while the rest of us pay federal taxes to fund our military, our roads, and our bridges.

I'm not, and my Real Corporate Profits Tax would fix that.

My new idea, the Real Corporate Profits Tax, would fix some huge holes in our corporate tax code. Giant companies like Amazon shouldn’t be able to get away with paying $0 in federal corporate income taxes. Add your name if you agree.

So today I’m proposing a new idea: Tax the *real profits* very large American companies report to their investors—no loopholes or exemptions—and let’s make this year the last year any company with massive profits pays zero federal taxes.

Big corporations have lobbied relentlessly to fill our corporate tax rules with so many loopholes and exemptions that even when they report a billion dollars in profits to their investors and the public, they can report much lower “profits” to the IRS—and pay no taxes on them.

If you've already filed your taxes this year, chances are you paid more than a lot of the big corporations. They made hundreds of millions of dollars in profits this year—but many of them won’t pay a dime towards keeping our country safe and our economy strong.

Wishing a happy #NationalSiblingsDay to my three big brothers: Don Reed, David, and John. All three of them answered our country’s call to serve. I’m eternally grateful for their service and the service of all our men and women in uniform.

On Saturday April 13th during National Weekend of Action, hundreds of grassroots supporters are stepping up to host #WinWithWarren house parties in their homes—and we need you to participate! Find a party near you to attend or sign up to be a host:

On National Youth #HIV and #AIDS Awareness Day, I’m thinking about the over 60K youth living with HIV in the US, majorities of whom are LGBTQ+ Americans and people of color. We need to keep investing in research and treatment to end the AIDS epidemic.

The Trump administration is pushing the construction of the Keystone XL route over public opposition—putting our communities, our environment, and tribal lands at risk. Let me be clear: We need clean energy and protection for tribes, not another dirty investment in fuel.

We need to rebuild unions in this country. That's why I’ve proposed a new law banning states from passing so-called right to work laws that destroy labor unions. It will make sure that unions have a front-and-center seat at the table in any trade negotiation.
Unions have always been the backbone of our country—and I’ll always fight for them.

In life, there are some people who have more money. There are some people who have less money. But everybody should have an equal share of our democracy—no matter how much you donate. Let’s keep fighting hard, and if you’re able, make a donation today:

I’m really grateful for everyone who stepped up and chipped in before our first FEC deadline. Grassroots donations are the reason we can keep setting the tone for this race and fighting for big, structural change.
I told @NABTU: Unions built the middle class and unions will rebuild the middle class.

I told @NABTU: Unions built the middle class and unions will rebuild the middle class.
We need to do everything we can to make sure Black mothers and babies are safe and sound. I’m glad to see Rep. @LaurenUnderwood and Rep. Alma Adams form this caucus in the House.

I’m glad my housing idea has support from Boston Mayor @marty_walsh and @Mayor_Spicer of Framingham. We’re dreaming big and fighting hard for 3.2 million new homes and more than a million new jobs in MA and across the country.

Government should work for the people. That's why I've introduced a sweeping anti-corruption bill—requiring the IRS to release tax returns for presidential, vice-presidential, and congressional candidates.

Today, I'm releasing my 2018 tax returns, and last August I released ten years worth of tax returns—because no one should ever have to guess who their elected officials are working for. Doing this should be law.
There’s a crisis of faith in government—and that’s because the American people think the government works for the wealthy and well-connected, not for them. And they’re right.

We need to lower drug costs and protect the Affordable Care Act. Everyone in this country deserves health care at the lowest possible cost, with the highest possible outcomes. That’s why I’m fighting for #Medicare4All.

For most presidential candidates, “call time” means getting on the phone with ultra-wealthy donors who write out fat checks. Not me. This campaign is about the people. That’s why I’m spending “call time” thanking small-dollar donors. Maybe you’ll be next.

Two months ago today, we kicked off this campaign, and I'm fired up by the movement that we've built together. Change like this is gonna be hard. But when we work together, organize together, and persist together, we'll make big structural change. We’re gonna do this!
Conversion therapy is dangerous and cruel, and I'm proud to see that Massachusetts has banned it for children. I will keep fighting to ban it at the federal level.
I’ve been following the @PittTweet students’ fight to unionize. Your voices are important and I want to see you win this one.
We need a constitutional amendment that protects the right to vote for every American citizen—no exceptions.
See you soon, South Carolina!
Attorney General Barr: The American people still need to see the full report.
Wow, what a surprise. Two corrupt millionaires hanging out together.
In Reno and across the country, people are fired up about issues like health care, the environment, and affordable housing—and I have some ideas about how we can address these problems head on.
Our criminal justice system is broken—and the violence in Alabama prisons is just the latest example of why we need to change it.

David Bernhardt continued lobbying after formally declaring he was no longer a lobbyist. It’s outrageous. The Trump admin is a cesspool of corruption—and under my #EndCorruptionNow bill, it would be illegal for this guy to run the Department of @Interior.

I talked to families who had been separated at the border—mamas, babies, little boys and girls traumatized by the Trump administration’s inhumane policy. Make no mistake: If they try to reinstate his cruelty, we’ll fight this with everything we’ve got.

Our veterans deserve better than a @DeptVetAffairs that’s riddled with corruption. My bill to #EndCorruptionNow would close the revolving door between the VA and special interests—and ban people like Jeff Miller from lobbying our government.
Let me be as clear as I can: When Democrats next have power, we should be bold. It’s time to get rid of the filibuster if Senate Republicans abuse it to block the progress and change we need.
We need to do everything we can to make sure Black mothers and babies are safe and sound. I’m glad to see Rep. @LaurenUnderwood and Rep. Alma Adams form this caucus in the House.

I’ve watched Republicans abuse the filibuster rules when they’re out of power, then turn around and blow off the rules when they’re in power. We all saw what they did to President Obama.
My team put together this great update from the road. And let me tell you: It was an action-packed weekend in Nevada and New York.
It was great meeting your daughter, @Jakobsmama! She also promised to remember that running for president is what girls do.
I’m glad it arrived, @MsLisaHendricks! I’m in the fight with you every day to stop gun violence and protect our kids.
Thank you for having me, @AlexGoff84!

So happy to read this letter from Camille, who asked me a question at our organizing event in Glendale in February! Camille, I’m honored to hear that you think I’m someone to look up to. Just remember: When women fight, women win.
I love it! And what does he think about my idea for #UniversalChildCare?
Workers have a right to fight for higher wages, health care, and pensions, and I’m with @CWAUnion and @AFSCME all the way.

About time. @SecNielsen’s legacy of tearing innocent families apart will follow her for the rest of her life—and she should be ashamed of the role she played. She was completely unqualified to lead @DHS—and that's why I voted against confirming her.
Captain Marvel with the grandkids!
Thank you for sharing your story, @DonnaFEdwards. #UniversalChildCare would have helped families like yours and mine.
I’m glad we got to meet, @AlysonGilles. Our kids deserve better, and I’ll never stop standing up to the NRA or fighting for #GunReformNow.
I spent the day in Reno talking with Nevadans who want to see big, structural change in our country—like #MedicareForAll, 3.2 million new housing units, and a #GreenNewDeal.

Black and brown women work more, get paid less, face decades of systemic discrimination, and are the least likely to be able to afford decent child care. That’s why I’m proposing a big, structural change: #UniversalChildCare and early education for all our kids.

I have a new idea to tackle our housing crisis and provide relief to families in Nevada and across the country. We need big, structural changes in our country—like building 3.2 million new housing units—and I’m fighting for them.
Early morning walk before our organizing event in Reno, Nevada.

Ended an action-packed day with a pop-up event at Sweet Science in Brooklyn to thank grassroots donors for chipping in whatever they could to this fight. We’re building something big—one person at a time.
Everyone deserves access to affordable, quality child care. No exceptions.
We don’t get what we don’t fight for. We’re done with two sets of rules—one for the Republicans and one for the Democrats.

In 2021, we WILL make the change that our country needs.

(P.S. Welcome to Twitter, @dan_geldon!)

Congress voted to end US support of the war in Yemen. Now Donald Trump should sign this bill into law. Civilians are suffering, and #YemenCantWait.

In 2018, the Senate passed a bill to make lynching a federal crime. A similar bill was first introduced in 1918. It was killed repeatedly—by Senate filibusters. An entire century of obstruction because a small group of racists stopped the entire nation from doing what was right.

We don’t get what we don’t fight for. It was an honor to be at the #NANconv2019 with @TheRevAl to talk about my new idea: In 2021, if Mitch McConnell puts petty partisanship ahead of our country, then we should get rid of the filibuster.
Every family in this country should have access to #UniversalChildCare—period.

Voter suppression is real. We have to call it out and fight back—starting with a constitutional amendment that establishes a nationally-recognized right to vote and a right to get that vote counted. #NANCONV2019

For generations, the filibuster was used as a tool to block progress on racial justice. If the Republicans put small-minded partisanship ahead of solving the massive problems facing this country, then we should get rid of the filibuster.

With so much on the line for our country, there’s no place I’d rather be than standing shoulder to shoulder with grassroots fighters and the @NationalAction Network. Read my remarks from the #NANCONV19 here.

It was an honor to be at #NANCONV19 today. For decades under the leadership of my friend @TheRevAL, the @NationalAction Network and the people in this room have been on the front lines of the fight for social, racial, and economic justice.

In just a few minutes, I’ll be speaking at the @NationalAction Network Convention about the big, structural change we’re fighting for, and the powerful forces—including the Senate filibuster—that will try to hold progress back. Tune in here.

We’re done with having two sets of rules. When Democrats have the White House again, if Mitch McConnell continues to put small-minded partisanship ahead of solving the massive problems facing our country, then we should get rid of the filibuster.

I’ve watched Republicans abuse the rules when they’re out of power, then turn around and blow off the rules when they’re in power. We just saw it happen again this week when they unilaterally changed the same rules they abused to ram through President Trump's extreme nominees.

For generations the filibuster has been used to block progress, and in recent years, obstruction in the Senate has only gotten worse. We’re fighting for big, structural change—but we won't get anything done unless we face this head on.
Jail time. That’s what you should get if you negligently oversee a big corporation that defrauds hard working Americans. My ideas tackle corporate fraud head on.

Amazon used to promote its products above other vendors. Not anymore—they’re scared by my plan to #BreakUpBigTech. Now we need to make sure there are rules in place so it doesn’t happen again. You can be the umpire or you can own a team, but you can’t do both at the same time.
Happy birthday, NATO! America is strongest when we work together with our allies. #NATO70

51 years ago the life of Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was tragically taken away. They may kill the dreamer, but they can never kill the dream. Today and every day, we are the heirs of Dr. King’s dream & we are called to continue fighting for social, racial, & economic justice.

Under my new proposal, corporate executives who negligently oversee a giant company causing severe harm to American families would face jail time. Sign our petition to become an official citizen co-sponsor.
Great point, Jamie! How about we start with you giving back the $3.7 billion J.P. Morgan made this year off the #GOPTaxScam that you lobbied for?

At least 25 people in the Trump administration were denied security clearances, yet they insisted on ramming them through approval anyway. The man in the White House is putting our national security at risk.
I’m glad to hear that @JoyceCraigNH is running for re-election as mayor of Manchester. I know she’ll continue to fight for New Hampshire families. Go Joyce!

With so much on the line for our country, there’s no place I’d rather be than standing shoulder to shoulder with grassroots fighters and the @NationalAction Network. Read my remarks from the #NANCONV19 here.

It was an honor to be at #NANCONV19 today. For decades under the leadership of my friend @TheRevAL, the @NationalAction Network and the people in this room have been on the front lines of the fight for social, racial, and economic justice.

In just a few minutes, I’ll be speaking at the @NationalAction Network Convention about the big, structural change we’re fighting for, and the powerful forces—including the Senate filibuster—that will try to hold progress back. Tune in here.

We’re done with having two sets of rules. When Democrats have the White House again, if Mitch McConnell continues to put small-minded partisanship ahead of solving the massive problems facing our country, then we should get rid of the filibuster.

I’ve watched Republicans abuse the rules when they’re out of power, then turn around and blow off the rules when they’re in power. We just saw it happen again this week when they unilaterally changed the same rules they abused to ram through President Trump's extreme nominees.

For generations the filibuster has been used to block progress, and in recent years, obstruction in the Senate has only gotten worse. We’re fighting for big, structural change—but we won't get anything done unless we face this head on.
Jail time. That’s what you should get if you negligently oversee a big corporation that defrauds hard working Americans. My ideas tackle corporate fraud head on.

Amazon used to promote its products above other vendors. Not anymore—they’re scared by my plan to #BreakUpBigTech. Now we need to make sure there are rules in place so it doesn’t happen again. You can be the umpire or you can own a team, but you can’t do both at the same time.
Happy birthday, NATO! America is strongest when we work together with our allies. #NATO70

51 years ago the life of Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was tragically taken away. They may kill the dreamer, but they can never kill the dream. Today and every day, we are the heirs of Dr. King’s dream & we are called to continue fighting for social, racial, & economic justice.

Under my new proposal, corporate executives who negligently oversee a giant company causing severe harm to American families would face jail time. Sign our petition to become an official citizen co-sponsor.
Great point, Jamie! How about we start with you giving back the $3.7 billion J.P. Morgan made this year off the #GOPTaxScam that you lobbied for?

At least 25 people in the Trump administration were denied security clearances, yet they insisted on ramming them through approval anyway. The man in the White House is putting our national security at risk.
I’m glad to hear that @JoyceCraigNH is running for re-election as mayor of Manchester. I know she’ll continue to fight for New Hampshire families. Go Joyce!
I left a voicemail for Dan, a small-dollar donor from New York who just chipped into our campaign. It really matters and I’m grateful for people like him.
Great seeing you, @SymoneDSanders.
This grassroots movement starts with the people. I hope you’ll attend or host a #WinWithWarren house party in your community on April 13th. Are you in?
What a historic night for Chicago! Congratulations, Lori Lightfoot.

After the big banks crashed our economy 10 years ago, guess how many CEOs went to prison for their frauds? Zero. My new idea would hold executives at big companies criminally accountable—if you negligently oversee scams on the American people, you should go to jail.
People should be able to live without fear or discrimination—regardless of who they love.
I’m proud down to my toes that our team is growing across the country—and we’re not even done yet! You can check out our open positions here:
You know the system is rigged when the IRS targets working Americans while dedicating fewer and fewer resources to holding the ultra-wealthy taxpayers accountable.
No wealthy donors. No fancy closed door fundraisers. Just people who pitch in what they can to keep growing this grassroots movement.

Today, I’m proposing a new law that expands criminal liability to any corporate executive who negligently oversees a company that causes severe and widespread harm to families. Our justice system should ensure that if you cheat working Americans, you’ll go to jail.
But we need to go further. From Equifax to BP, top executives across the country have overseen corporate conduct that has done real harm to American families—and walked away without any jail time.
Congress should start by enacting the Ending Too Big To Jail Act I introduced last year. This bill would make it easier to hold executives at big banks criminally liable for scams.

It’s been 10 years since the financial crash cost millions of people their homes, jobs, and savings. But not one big bank CEO has gone to jail. It’s time to reform our laws to make sure that corporate executives face jail time for overseeing massive scams.

I’m grateful that people around the country have joined forces to host #WinWithWarren parties on April 13th and beyond. We’re going to do this together! Are you signed up to attend or host in your community?
Organizers are an essential part of this campaign. I’m glad that Juliana is leading our movement in Iowa.

If we want to tackle the opioid epidemic head on, then we have to hold Big Pharma executives accountable. Rep. Elijah Cummings and I have a plan that demands accountability and provides communities with the resources they need to beat this.
This is a disgrace. Our service-members deserve to be treated with respect.

The man in the White House is obsessed with holding up the funds to help Puerto Rico recover more than a year after Hurricane Maria. Three million US citizens live on the island and we need to show them some respect.

For decades, government policy has worked to keep us separate from each other while neglecting nearly every kind of housing—suburban, rural, and urban. My housing policy rejects this legacy of segregation and disdain to build better communities for everyone.
I’m keeping Ashanti and her loved ones in my prayers. At least 26 trans people were killed in 2018, and most of them were women of color. We need to call that out—and fight back.

One way we can fight for #EqualPay is to guarantee affordable child care and early education for every kid in America. And I've got a plan to do just that.   #EqualPayDay
Too many families don't have an Aunt Bee, or access to quality child care. And too often, it's women whose careers and paychecks take the hit when they don't have child care.

I was teaching at a law school in Houston when the kids were little and, suddenly, the babysitter quit. I tried all sorts of child care options, but none of them worked out. I thought I'd have to quit my job. But my Aunt Bee flew down to help out, and I kept my job.

The Trump administration rammed through security clearances that had been turned down. The administration is a walking, talking, living, breathing threat to national security, and we just have to call it out.
We don’t win if we don’t fight. I’m in this fight all the way for big ideas like #UniversalChildCare and the #UltraMillionaireTax that will move our country forward.
Giant corporations have figured out a way to cut out the competition and take more profits for themselves—squeezing the life out of family farms. My new idea would tackle this head on.

Voter suppression is real—and we need to put more federal muscle in the fight to end it. That's why we need a constitutional amendment that protects every American citizen's right to vote and to have that vote counted.
Looking forward to speaking at the #WeThePeople19 Summit this afternoon. Tune in at 3:30 PM ET!
No tricks, only treats. #AprilFoolsDay

Housing is already the biggest expense for most families—and it's just getting worse. Every American deserves a safe, decent, and affordable place to live, and my housing plan will reduce rents by 10%.
We've got to fight back against consolidation. It's time to reverse the Bayer-Monsanto merger.
I love getting pictures with everyone who comes out to our organizing events. No matter how long it takes, I’ll be there taking selfies till the end

The @Boeing crisis isn’t just about a technical issue: It’s systemic corruption. There’s a revolving door between industry and regulators—where the people lose and big corporations win. My plan to #EndCorruptionNow would close that door.

Last year, farmers got less than 15 cents of every dollar that Americans spent on food—the lowest amount since the Department of Agriculture began tracking that figure in 1993. My plan to break up agribusinesses like Monsanto would help family farmers get what they deserve.

I want Washington to work for family farmers, not just for the agribusiness executives pocketing multi-million dollar bonuses. I joined Family Farm Action today to say loud and clear: We need a Farmers Bill of Rights.

At the Heartland Forum, I talked about how Washington should work for family farmers across America—not just the agribusiness executives pocketing multi-million dollar bonuses or the Wall Street traders.
Those cookies have been a #TeamWarren favorite for years—mine, too. Thank you for everything you do, Barbara!

We proved the naysayers wrong. We won by 7.5 points.

“It’s just too hard”—that’s what people told abolitionists, suffragettes, early labor organizers, civil rights leaders, and the first LGBTQ rights activists. Yet every one of them stayed in the fight, and persisted. It’s our moment to change the direction of American history.

Giant agribusinesses like Monsanto have too much power to squeeze farmers. One of my new ideas to help farmers is to appoint trustbusters to review—and reverse—mergers, including the recent Bayer-Monsanto merger that should never have been approved.
Thanks for picking up my call, @jocelyn_roof. I’m so glad we got to talk!
Democrats have a chance to help end the influence of big money in politics in the 2020 primary. I’m walking the walk.

The man in the White House and Senate Republicans are failing to extend important SNAP benefits in Puerto Rico, potentially hurting thousands of people across the island. Our government needs to show the people of Puerto Rico some respect.
Big Pharma executives need to be held accountable when they break the law. My sweeping plan with Rep. Elijah Cummings does just that—and tackles our country’s opioid epidemic head on.
The people of Selma—and Americans across the country—deserve access to safe, affordable housing. That’s what my housing plan does.
I want Washington to work for family farmers—not just for the agribusiness executives pocketing multi-million dollar bonuses. That is how we build an economy that works for everyone.

Today a farmer can work hard, do everything right — even get great weather — and still not make it. My new idea would level the playing field for America’s farmers by standing up to Big Ag and un-rigging the rules that are hurting competition.
The Affordable Care Act is the law of the land. Without it, millions of American families would lose health care coverage. I’ll fight tooth and nail to protect it.
The American people deserve to see it. #ReleaseTheFullReport

The Republicans and the man in the White House have tried to repeal the Affordable Care Act at every turn. But the American people have come together time and time again to protect the ACA—and we’re not about to back down.
I’m so glad to have @janicero leading @IAforWarren. River to river, county by county, Janice is dreaming big and fighting hard.

I stood on the Senate floor while we hung onto health care for millions of Americans by a single vote. We won't back down. Health care is a basic human right, and we fight for basic human rights.

“It’s just too hard”—that’s what people told abolitionists, suffragettes, early labor organizers, civil rights leaders, and the first LGBTQ rights activists. Yet every one of them stayed in the fight, and persisted. It’s our moment to change the direction of American history.

Giant agribusinesses like Monsanto have too much power to squeeze farmers. One of my new ideas to help farmers is to appoint trustbusters to review—and reverse—mergers, including the recent Bayer-Monsanto merger that should never have been approved.
Thanks for picking up my call, @jocelyn_roof. I’m so glad we got to talk!
Democrats have a chance to help end the influence of big money in politics in the 2020 primary. I’m walking the walk.

The man in the White House and Senate Republicans are failing to extend important SNAP benefits in Puerto Rico, potentially hurting thousands of people across the island. Our government needs to show the people of Puerto Rico some respect.
Big Pharma executives need to be held accountable when they break the law. My sweeping plan with Rep. Elijah Cummings does just that—and tackles our country’s opioid epidemic head on.
The people of Selma—and Americans across the country—deserve access to safe, affordable housing. That’s what my housing plan does.
I want Washington to work for family farmers—not just for the agribusiness executives pocketing multi-million dollar bonuses. That is how we build an economy that works for everyone.

Today a farmer can work hard, do everything right — even get great weather — and still not make it. My new idea would level the playing field for America’s farmers by standing up to Big Ag and un-rigging the rules that are hurting competition.
The Affordable Care Act is the law of the land. Without it, millions of American families would lose health care coverage. I’ll fight tooth and nail to protect it.
The American people deserve to see it. #ReleaseTheFullReport

The Republicans and the man in the White House have tried to repeal the Affordable Care Act at every turn. But the American people have come together time and time again to protect the ACA—and we’re not about to back down.
I’m so glad to have @janicero leading @IAforWarren. River to river, county by county, Janice is dreaming big and fighting hard.

If we have an #UltraMillionaireTax on the richest 0.1% of people in this country, we can use the money for ideas that will help millions of Americans—like a #GreenNewDeal and #UniversalChildCare. @StephenAtHome is on board!

When I first ran for Senate in 2012, we were up against a Republican opponent who was bankrolled by special interests and the RNC. Then we out-raised him—one small-dollar donor at a time. I need you in the 2020 fight. Will you pitch in what you can?
See you again soon, Iowa!
Amazon has too much power. You can be an umpire or you can own a team, but you can't do both in the same game. #BreakUpBigTech
I stand with the @Palms workers who are fighting for strong wages, comprehensive benefits, and dignity on the job. It's time for management to come to the negotiating table.

Let’s call @Boeing’s ties to the US government what they are: Corruption, plain and simple. The American people should be able to trust that our government is working for us—not giant defense contractors.
I stood on the Senate floor while we hung onto health care for millions of Americans by a single vote. We won't back down. Health care is a basic human right, and we fight for basic human rights.
Try and keep up, @TMZ.
Thanks for having me, @StephenAtHome! Tune in to watch us on @colbertlateshow later tonight.
I agree. By getting rid of the electoral college and replacing it with a national popular vote, we can protect our democracy and make sure everyone’s vote counts.

Public financing of elections is the single best solution to reduce the undue influence of big money in our politics. And New York could be on the road to #FairElections this week! Hope this passes in the state budget.
Looking forward to talking with @StephenAtHome tonight. I hope you’ll tune in to @colbertlateshow!

We have failed the people of Sandy Hook, Parkland, and the communities that face these tragedies every day. We mourn for Mr. Richman’s family again—but Congress must act. No family should have to suffer this pain and hopelessness.
Monsanto has a moral obligation to tell the public what it knows about the health effects of its weedkiller, Roundup, before more people get sick.

Great news! You can join the fight for big, structural change in Iowa by following our team on Twitter, Instagram, and Snapchat at @IAForWarren. Then text IOWA to 24477 to be part of our grassroots movement on the ground.
When WhatsApp started growing, Facebook had to make a choice: They could either do better on their privacy policy or buy out the competition. Guess what they did? #BreakUpBigTech

After my daddy’s heart attack, my family almost lost our house. My mother got a minimum wage job at Sears, and it saved our family. Today, a minimum wage job can’t even support a mama and a baby. Time to rebuild the middle class. Will you join us?
Thank you, Earle, for listening to my speech in 2015—and for being a part of our fight for big, structural change like my housing plan. Black lives matter and Black families matter.
I’m humbled to have your support, Pastor Kathy. Let’s do this together!

Our government is failing Americans like Monica and Pete. No matter how hard they tried to play by the rules, they lost everything.

We need a government that works for everyone, not just those at the top. That’s why I’m running for president.

Donald Trump is not the cause of what's broken, he's just the latest symptom of what's gone wrong in America. He is a product of a rigged system that props up the rich and the powerful—and kicks dirt on everyone else.
Congress didn’t ask for a “summary,” Attorney General Barr. Members of the House voted 420-0 to release the report. The American people deserve to see the full report. #ReleaseTheFullReport.

A year ago today, people across the country organized and took a stand against gun violence at the @AMarch4OurLives. There’s a lot of pain in this country caused by gun violence—and we’re fighting our hearts out to end it. I’ll go where the Parkland students lead.

Bruce and I are heartsick for the victim and his loved ones. I’m keeping the Parkland community in my prayers throughout this difficult week. We need to end the cycle of pain caused by gun violence. We need gun reform—now.
Congress voted 420-0 to release the full Mueller report. Not a "summary" from his handpicked Attorney General. AG Barr, make the full report public. Immediately.

My housing idea would build 3.2 million new units across the country—including here in Conway. Thank you for the wonderful conversation about housing, supporting our unions, and the environment this afternoon. Glad my guys came too!

Fun fact: Bruce and I love maple syrup! We were glad to visit the Believe in Books Sugar Shack in Intervale to hear about their efforts to increase childhood literacy and learn how maple syrup is made.

We packed into city hall yesterday and talked about the big, structural changes we’re fighting for—like a Green New Deal and getting rid of the electoral college. Thank you, Berlin!

We need to make sure that Robert Mueller’s report is released to the American public. Remember: This investigation has already resulted in dozens of indictments, convictions, and guilty pleas. Sign our petition to make the Mueller report public.
Girls dream big, fight hard, and run for president.
Republicans are working hard to roll back a woman’s right to control our own bodies. But let’s be clear: We won’t go back—not now, not ever. We’ll fight this with everything we’ve got.

Nine years ago today, President Obama signed the Affordable Care Act into law. Health care is a basic human right, and we fight for basic human rights. I won’t stop fighting to make health care accessible and affordable for everyone. #MedicareForAll

This morning I was glad to visit Friendship House, an addiction treatment center in Bethlehem. Many of its patients have recovered from opioid addiction. My opioid plan with Rep. Elijah Cummings would invest in centers like Friendship House so we can tackle this epidemic head on.
I’m heartsick for Sydney Aiello, her loved ones, and the Parkland community. We need real, structural gun reform in this country to end the cycle of pain caused by gun violence.
Heading to New Hampshire!
For a lot of candidates, “call time” means spending hours on the phone every day with ultra-wealthy donors who write fat checks. This is my version of call time.
Robert Mueller’s finished his report. He’s delivered it to Attorney General William Barr. The American people deserve the full report. Sign our petition to make the Mueller report public—immediately.
Attorney General Barr—release the Mueller report to the American public. Now.

Mr. President: Chairman Kim is not your buddy, and the North Korean nuclear program is a national security threat to the United States. Reversing North Korea's sanctions hours after they were announced is chaos. Foreign policy by tweet does not make Americans safer.
This week I was in Tennessee, Mississippi, and Alabama. I had powerful conversations with people about how we can make big, structural change in this country. Here’s an update from the road.
Last night on @TheLastWord, I talked with @AliVelshi about my plan to #BreakUpBigTech. Giant tech companies like Google and Facebook have too much power—and we need to act.
Happy #NationalPuppyDay to my go-to guy.

What can we do to make a real difference in Cleveland, MS where families can’t afford the skyrocketing costs of living expenses? We put more money into housing so everyone can have a safe and affordable place to live.
I’m so glad to be back in New Hampshire this weekend! Will we see you there? Littleton, Berlin, and Conway—see you soon.

“Conversion therapy” is cruel. I’m glad to see the government of Puerto Rico taking real steps to end this immoral practice. People should be able to love who they love without fear or discrimination.
With fewer competitors in the market, big tech companies like Facebook don’t have to compete in key areas like protecting our privacy. That would change under my plan to #BreakUpBigTech.
Health care is a human right. And Medicaid is a commitment that says if your family gets sick, the rest of us will be there. I’m glad to see that Kansas is on its way to expanding this program.

Bigotry and hate have no place in the United States of America. Period.

Every voter matters. That includes voters in Mississippi. And whoever gets the most votes should win. I was honored to travel to @JacksonStateU and talk with a fired-up crowd about issues that matter—including getting rid of the electoral college.

All three of my brothers joined the military—Don Reed and John went into the Air Force, and David joined the Army. My mother would wait every day for a letter while they were deployed. I know how important it is to support our service members and our military families.

I don’t take PAC money or checks from federal lobbyists. This grassroots movement is by the people, for the people—and it’s going to take all of us fighting side by side to win in #2020. Let’s do this together.
I’m with @davidcicilline. Facebook has too much power—and we need answers.

We’re not going to solve our housing crisis by nibbling at the edges. We need to tackle it head on—with big, comprehensive solutions that match the size of the problems we have. That’s what my housing plan does.

Even Big Oil says we need stronger rules to limit methane and combat climate change. We have to tackle this problem head on—that’s why my climate bill would require these companies to publish their greenhouse gas emissions.

The American people should be able to trust that government officials are working for them—not big defense contractors like @Boeing. My #EndCorruptionNow bill would have banned Shanahan from serving as acting Defense Secretary in the first place.

What would it be like to have a school teacher in the White House? As a former special needs teacher, I think it would be fabulous. I won’t stop fighting for America’s public school teachers and our students.
There are up to four million people in Florida who can vote but aren’t registered. I’m so glad to see @AndrewGillum’s new initiative to help Floridians register to vote.
Unions are the backbone of our country. I stand with the Amazon workers who are organizing and fighting for better working conditions. #1u
Woo-hoo—congratulations, senator-elect @EricGiddens4IA!

I went to Brown’s Chapel and the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma, Alabama with Rep. Terri Sewell yesterday—places with powerful legacies of people coming together and fighting for civil rights and a better country. It gave me hope.
Let’s dream big, fight hard—and win! Thank you to everyone who came out to our grassroots organizing event in Birmingham.
This is exactly why we need to #BreakUpBigTech. Companies like Google have too much power—and fines alone won’t fix the problem.

This week in Mississippi, we had a powerful conversation with Greenville and Cleveland community leaders about the housing crisis in our country. Thanks to Mayor Simmons and Mable Starks for showing me around the Greater Greenville Housing Revitalization Association.
Millions of Americans like Amber are spending more than 30% of their income on rent. I say it’s time to address this problem head on.
We need to have policies on immigration that are consistent with our values—and we need answers from @CBP.
In today’s economy, a person working a minimum-wage job can't afford decent housing—and that's just immoral. It's time we tackle the housing crisis head on.
Access to quality, affordable housing unlocks opportunities for families across the country. I’m working hard to level the playing field for working parents like LaTonya.

For years, government regulators looked the other way as predatory financial institutions targeted minority communities and sucked billions of dollars in wealth out of them. Learn more.

16 years ago today, the US invaded Iraq. The costs of that mistake are staggering: 4,751 brave Americans killed, tens of thousands more wounded, untold civilian casualties. We owe it to our service members to do better. Time to bring our troops home and end these endless wars.
I’m glad the people of Iowa are starting to return to their homes. Always grateful for the first responders who helped families stay safe during the flood.
.@RepColeman gave one heck of an introduction. Birmingham is fired up!
Every vote should count equally, no matter where you live. It’s time to get rid of the Electoral College and elect our presidents with a national popular vote. Read more.

I’m not doing things the way traditional candidates for the presidency would do. I’m not holding fundraisers for wealthy donors. I’m spending my time with people all across the country who believe that our grassroots movement can make big, structural change. Thank you, Memphis!
Everyone deserves a safe and affordable place to live—in Mississippi and across the country.
I believe we are called on to act.
Our differences make us stronger. I will fight against all forms of bigotry and hate—including white nationalism.
Thank you, @AmirTalai! We’re in this fight together.
The way we make sure that every vote is counted is by getting rid of the Electoral College and making the national popular vote a central part of our democracy.
Every vote should count—and the way we can make that happen is getting rid of the Electoral College.
My favorite Bible verse includes two lessons that guide me every day: There is value in every single human being, and every one of us is called to action. #WarrenTownHall
I’m not taking PAC money or meeting with rich donors behind closed doors. I'm working to build this campaign face to face, person to person, neighborhood to neighborhood. Join our fight:

After my daddy’s heart attack, my family was this close to losing our house. My mother got a minimum wage job at Sears that saved our house & family. Today a minimum wage job can’t even support a mama and a baby. I’m in this fight because I believe that’s wrong. #WarrenTownHall
Our fight is about making big, structural change—and it starts with you. Chip in whatever you can and let’s grow this grassroots movement. If we dream big and fight hard, there’s nothing we can’t do.

Every vote matters. We need to get rid of the Electoral College so that presidential candidates have to ask every American in every part of the country for their vote, not just those in battleground states. #WarrenTownHall

Maternal mortality is a real problem in our country—and it disproportionately impacts Black and Brown women. We need more funding for the NIH and we need to fight for our mamas and babies. #WarrenTownHall

There is a sacred responsibility on our leadership to understand that we can’t use the military to solve non-military problems. We need to be using all the diplomatic and economic tools in the toolbox. No more endless wars. #WarrenTownHall

I want to say something very controversial: I believe in science. Climate change is real, it is man-made, and we are running out of time. We need all hands on deck to pass a #GreenNewDeal and invest in sustainable infrastructure. #WarrenTownHall

Our fight is about making big, structural change—and it starts with you. Chip in whatever you can and let’s grow this grassroots movement. If we dream big and fight hard, there’s nothing we can’t do.

Every vote matters. We need to get rid of the Electoral College so that presidential candidates have to ask every American in every part of the country for their vote, not just those in battleground states. #WarrenTownHall

Maternal mortality is a real problem in our country—and it disproportionately impacts Black and Brown women. We need more funding for the NIH and we need to fight for our mamas and babies. #WarrenTownHall

There is a sacred responsibility on our leadership to understand that we can’t use the military to solve non-military problems. We need to be using all the diplomatic and economic tools in the toolbox. No more endless wars. #WarrenTownHall

I want to say something very controversial: I believe in science. Climate change is real, it is man-made, and we are running out of time. We need all hands on deck to pass a #GreenNewDeal and invest in sustainable infrastructure. #WarrenTownHall

Here’s how we can level the playing field for working people and give everyone a fighting chance: an #UltraMillionaireTax on the richest of the rich. It could pay for #UniversalChildCare for millions of American families—and a whole lot more. #WarrenTownHall

On average, we lose seven children and teens every day to gun violence. But we do nothing. Why? Because the federal government is being held hostage by the NRA. Laws should reflect our morals—we need #GunReformNow. #WarrenTownHall

Voter disenfranchisement is real. I believe we need a constitutional amendment that protects the right to vote for every American citizen. We need to repeal every one of the voter suppression laws out there. And we need to make sure every vote gets counted. #WarrenTownHall
If America wants to be a place of opportunity, then that means every kid must have the right to get an education without getting crushed by student loan debt. #WarrenTownHall
The border wall isn’t about security, or making America safer. It’s a monument to hate and division, and I won’t support it. We are a better country than that. #WarrenTownHall

Having a decent and safe place to live should be a basic human right. My new housing bill would build or rehabilitate 3 million units, lower rents across the country by 10%, create over a million new jobs, and tackle our government’s history of racist redlining. #WarrenTownHall

Democrat, Republican, or Independent, Americans know a scam when they see one. And they can see that Washington is working great for the rich and the powerful. The American people are ready to fight for a country that works for everybody else. #WarrenTownHall
We need to make it easier to join a union and for workers to make their voices heard. Unions built America’s middle class, and unions will rebuild America’s middle class. #WarrenTownHall

We need to have policies on immigration that are consistent with our values. We are a country built on our differences. That is our strength not our weakness. When people come to our country fearing for their lives, then we have a moral responsibility to act. #WarrenTownHall

Health care is a basic human right, and we fight for basic human rights. That means we need to protect the Affordable Care Act, bring down the cost of prescription drugs, hold insurance companies accountable, and fight for 100% coverage with #MedicareForAll. #WarrenTownHall

Slavery is a stain on America & we need to address it head on. I believe it’s time to start a national, full-blown conversation about reparations. I support the bill in the House to support a congressional panel of experts so that our nation can do what’s right & begin to heal.

We have to recognize the threat of white nationalism. We’ve got to call it out. As President of the United States, my Justice Department would go after white nationalists with full prosecution. #WarrenTownHall

Washington is working great for the rich and the powerful—but it’s not working great for people living paycheck to paycheck. I want a Washington that works for the rest of America. That’s why I’m in this fight. #WarrenTownHall
I’m reading through all of your kind notes of encouragement ahead of tonight's @CNN town hall. I can only say: Thank you! We’re going to do this together. #WarrenTownHall
Tonight’s @CNN town hall is a powerful opportunity for our grassroots movement to talk about the big ideas we’re fighting for. Hope you tune in!

Saudi Arabia has brutally crushed dissent—kidnapping, detaining, torturing its own citizens—even murdering Jamal Khashoggi, a Washington Post journalist who dared to criticize the regime. The Trump administration has done nothing to hold them accountable.
My thoughts are with the victims and families affected by flooding across the Midwest. Grateful for the brave first responders who are helping people get to safety.
We’re just a couple of hours away from meeting at @JacksonStateU to talk about our grassroots movement with @jaketapper. Can’t wait to see you there!
Unions have always been the backbone of our country. When workers fight, workers win.
Tonight our grassroots movement has a chance to tell our story and talk about the big ideas we’re fighting for. Grab a friend to watch and let’s do this together.

Here’s how we can level the playing field for working people and give everyone a fighting chance: an #UltraMillionaireTax on the richest of the rich. It could pay for #UniversalChildCare for millions of American families—and a whole lot more. #WarrenTownHall

On average, we lose seven children and teens every day to gun violence. But we do nothing. Why? Because the federal government is being held hostage by the NRA. Laws should reflect our morals—we need #GunReformNow. #WarrenTownHall

Voter disenfranchisement is real. I believe we need a constitutional amendment that protects the right to vote for every American citizen. We need to repeal every one of the voter suppression laws out there. And we need to make sure every vote gets counted. #WarrenTownHall
If America wants to be a place of opportunity, then that means every kid must have the right to get an education without getting crushed by student loan debt. #WarrenTownHall
The border wall isn’t about security, or making America safer. It’s a monument to hate and division, and I won’t support it. We are a better country than that. #WarrenTownHall

Having a decent and safe place to live should be a basic human right. My new housing bill would build or rehabilitate 3 million units, lower rents across the country by 10%, create over a million new jobs, and tackle our government’s history of racist redlining. #WarrenTownHall

Democrat, Republican, or Independent, Americans know a scam when they see one. And they can see that Washington is working great for the rich and the powerful. The American people are ready to fight for a country that works for everybody else. #WarrenTownHall
We need to make it easier to join a union and for workers to make their voices heard. Unions built America’s middle class, and unions will rebuild America’s middle class. #WarrenTownHall

We need to have policies on immigration that are consistent with our values. We are a country built on our differences. That is our strength not our weakness. When people come to our country fearing for their lives, then we have a moral responsibility to act. #WarrenTownHall

Health care is a basic human right, and we fight for basic human rights. That means we need to protect the Affordable Care Act, bring down the cost of prescription drugs, hold insurance companies accountable, and fight for 100% coverage with #MedicareForAll. #WarrenTownHall

Slavery is a stain on America & we need to address it head on. I believe it’s time to start a national, full-blown conversation about reparations. I support the bill in the House to support a congressional panel of experts so that our nation can do what’s right & begin to heal.

We have to recognize the threat of white nationalism. We’ve got to call it out. As President of the United States, my Justice Department would go after white nationalists with full prosecution. #WarrenTownHall

Washington is working great for the rich and the powerful—but it’s not working great for people living paycheck to paycheck. I want a Washington that works for the rest of America. That’s why I’m in this fight. #WarrenTownHall

Decent housing shouldn’t be this hard to find. My housing bill would build or rehabilitate more than three million affordable units to address this exact problem.
"Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that." —Martin Luther King, Jr.
This is a perfect example of why I want to #BreakUpBigTech. You can be the umpire or you can own a team—but you can’t do both at the same time.
This grassroots movement is about fighting for big, structural change—like ensuring that every family has access to high-quality, affordable child care for their kids. Thank you, Memphis!
Can’t wait to answer your questions live at @JacksonStateU! RSVP here and we’ll send you a reminder when it’s time to tune in.

The man in the White House let @GM executives give billions of dollars in stock buybacks to their rich stakeholders while workers were left out in the cold. That’s why I’m fighting to level the playing field for working families across the country.
Excited to spend some quality time with our grassroots movement in Tennessee, Mississippi, and Alabama. We're going to do this together.
It’s always great to meet people on the road—even better when I get to do it with my guys by my side. Thank you for the wonderful conversation, Exeter!
Make sure you get out to vote, Black Hawk County!

Homeownership is out of reach for too many families—especially Black families. Decades of discrimination by the federal government denied families of color the same kinds of homeownership subsidies available to white families. We need to tackle this head on.
Add your name as a citizen co-sponsor of my American Housing and Economic Mobility Act. Let’s work together to ensure every American has a safe, decent, and affordable place to live.

Let's be clear: We’re not going to solve our housing crisis by nibbling at the edges. We need to tackle it head on—with big, comprehensive solutions that match the size of the problems we have. That’s what my housing plan for America does.
Government regulators looked the other way before the 2008 crisis as predatory financial institutions targeted minority communities and sucked billions of dollars in wealth out of them.
The gap between white homeownership rates and Black homeownership rates is 30%—more than it was when housing discrimination was legal in 1960.

Government at all levels hasn’t done enough to tackle our housing problems. The federal government has reduced investments in housing for middle-class and lower-income families even as rents have gone up.
I still think about these gut-wrenching stories because it’s a powerful reminder of what housing means in our country. That's why it's so important for government to get housing policy right.

During the 2008 housing crisis, I traveled to NV to hear the stories of those who'd lost their homes. I was part of the panel that oversaw how the Treasury Department was spending the bank bailout money, and I wanted to make sure we heard from the people being hit the hardest.

Housing is one of the biggest purchases most Americans will make in their lifetimes. My new Housing plan would address some of the most pressing issues that have kept homeownership out of reach for too many families. Here’s how we’re going to do it:

Charleston, Pittsburgh, and now Christchurch. Everyone should have the right to worship without fear, and an attack on a place of worship is terrorism perpetrated against all of us. My heart goes out to the people of New Zealand today.
I’m proud of how the Sandy Hook community organized and stood up to the gun lobbyists to secure this victory. We won’t stop fighting for #GunReformNow.
A fake crisis at the border is fear-mongering of the worst kind—and we’re not falling for it. I voted to terminate the president’s ridiculous “national emergency.”

Yesterday on @Morning_Joe, I explained how we’re going to break up Big 
Tech companies like Amazon. You can read more about that here:
Despicable.
If you want proof that Facebook has too much power, look no further than their ability to shut down a debate over whether their platform has too much power. #BreakUpBigTech
Under my #UniversalChildCare plan, high-quality child care would be free for millions of parents and affordable for all. Imagine what that would mean for families across the country.

I’m spending my time thanking grassroots donors at pop-up events like the ones we had in NY and TX last weekend—not at fancy fundraisers with mega donors. Chip in whatever you can, and let’s grow our grassroots movement together.
This policy to ban transgender people from openly serving in our military is shameful and should be reversed immediately. We’re going to fight this tooth-and-nail. #ProtectTransTroops
Today on @Morning_Joe, I talked with @WillieGeist and @morningmika about my new plan to #BreakUpBigTech. They asked me if I thought Google, Amazon, and Facebook are all monopolies. Here’s my answer.

About time. Now it's Congress's job to figure out what went wrong here, and why this decision took so long, to make sure it doesn't happen again. Nothing should come before the safety and security of the American people—especially not corporate profits or political favors.

Paul Manafort just got 43 more months for a new raft of crimes. Black men like Bernard Noble can get decades just for selling 2 joints. We need criminal justice reform so the well-connected play by the same rules as everyone else. Now.
Glad to see Boston will be hosting the @NAACP’s 111th national convention!
See you soon, @JacksonStateU! You too, @jaketapper.

First Donald Trump stacked the @EPA with corrupt climate change deniers—now he wants to slash the agency's budget by 31%. It's a disgrace. The effects of climate change are real and we have a moral obligation to protect the future for our kids.
Planned Parenthood provides health care for millions of women in Ohio and across the country. This decision is an attack on women’s reproductive rights. We won’t go back—not now, not ever.

A president who actually cares about the American people's safety does not decide whether to ground an airplane based on Boeing's profits, Boeing's political donations, the rich CEO's visit to Mar-a-Lago, or personal phone calls. The FAA needs to get this plane out of the sky.

The Trump administration wants to cut hundreds of billions of dollars from the #Medicare budget, all while giving billionaires and giant corporations huge tax breaks with the #GOPTaxScam. This is immoral.

The Boeing 737 MAX 8 is a major driver of profits. In the coming weeks and months, Congress must hold hearings on whether an administration that famously refused to stand up to Saudi Arabia to protect @Boeing arms sales has once again put lives at risk for the same reason.
The FAA itself has indicated that software updates are likely coming. Any necessary changes must be made before, not after, more flights occur and more lives are potentially endangered.

Charleston, Pittsburgh, and now Christchurch. Everyone should have the right to worship without fear, and an attack on a place of worship is terrorism perpetrated against all of us. My heart goes out to the people of New Zealand today.
I’m proud of how the Sandy Hook community organized and stood up to the gun lobbyists to secure this victory. We won’t stop fighting for #GunReformNow.

Dozens of these planes fly daily in the US. The UK, China, Australia and several other countries have already grounded the 737 MAX. The #FAA should follow their lead, reverse their decision, and immediately ground this plane in the US until its safety can be assured.

We witnessed the second tragic crash of @Boeing 737 MAX 8 planes in less than 6 months. We don’t know the cause of these crashes—but serious questions have been raised about whether these planes were pressed into service without additional pilot training.
When women fight, women win. #WomensHistoryMonth
Citizens United opened the floodgates of foreign money into US politics. This decision is a victory for our democracy.
We want to rein in the companies that think they get to roll over everyone—and that doesn’t start by talking to folks in Washington. It starts in rooms like this one.
You shouldn't have to contact Facebook's publicists in order for them to decide to "allow robust debate" about Facebook. They shouldn’t have that much power.

Curious why I think FB has too much power? Let's start with their ability to shut down a debate over whether FB has too much power. Thanks for restoring my posts. But I want a social media marketplace that isn't dominated by a single censor. #BreakUpBigTech

I’m the daughter of a janitor who managed to become a public school teacher, a law professor, a United States senator, and now, a candidate for president—all because Texas opened the door of opportunity. This state has a special place in my heart. Thank you, Dallas!
I’m so glad to have you on our team, Luis!
I love this explainer from @voxdotcom. By taxing the wealthiest 0.1% of Americans, we could pay for #UniversalChildCare and big, structural changes that will help everyone.
DC residents don’t have an equal voice in our government—despite paying federal taxes. It’s not right, and I’m fighting to change that.
There are a lot of reasons why I’m fighting for a #GreenNewDeal. It’s a strong response to climate change, and a chance to bring our country into the 21st century.
Facebook, Google, and Amazon have mastered a very powerful business model: Monopolize their platform and force other companies out of business. We’ve got to do something about it.
I was excited to meet you too, John!
Probably. But let’s be clear: I don’t work for the lobbyists—I work for the people. #EndCorruptionNow #BreakUpBigTech

.@AriMelber asked about my plan to #BreakUpBigTech, “Could she really do it?”

The answer is yes—and here’s how.
America has a long tradition of breaking up companies when they’ve become too dominant . Our country needs stronger antitrust enforcement, and we need it now. #BreakUpBigTech

I went to #SXSW2019 to talk with @AnandWrites about how I’m fighting for big, structural change in this country—and that includes breaking up some of the biggest tech companies so they don’t have so much power over everyone else.
In just a few minutes, I’ll be live with @AnandWrites at #SXSW2019. Tune in:

Yesterday, I talked with @AriMelber about how equal justice demands that everybody—no matter how wealthy or well-connected—is held accountable when they break the law. That includes political operatives like Paul Manafort.

Woo-hoo! Looking forward to talking with @AnandWrites about our presidential primary campaign and my plan to #BreakUpBigTech. Watch the interview live through this link at 2:00 PM CST today:   #SXSW2019
Wow—thank you, Long Island City! You showed everyone what’s possible when people fight back. We can #BreakUpBigTech to protect our democracy and our economy, and we must.

Today was my first pop-up event with grassroots donors—people who’ve chipped in $25 here, or $5 there—in East Harlem. Glad we got a chance to talk about how we’re running a campaign by the people, for the people. Watch your emails and texts for one near you!
Watch live as I discuss my new plan to #BreakUpBigTech.
I’m looking forward to talking at @SXSW about my plans for big, structural change to make our country work for working people. Can’t wait to see you all there. #SXSW2019

I want every little girl to grow up knowing that they can fight from the heart — and they can win. Today, and every day, I want to celebrate every woman who wakes up ready to fight to make life better for them. #InternationalWomensDay #WomensHistoryMonth

Today’s big tech companies have too much power over our economy, our society, and our democracy—and in the process, they have hurt small businesses and stifled innovation. That’s why my administration would make big, structural changes to the tech industry.
Glad to spend some quality time this morning with our grassroots movement. Thanks for having us, @HotBreadKitchen!

Good news: The House just passed the #ForThePeople Act, which includes key elements from my #EndCorruptionNow bill, to start cleaning up corruption in Washington.

I’m joining @StopBigMoney to demand that @senatemajldr give the bill a vote on the Senate floor. Are you with us?
Looking forward to talking more about my big new plan to #BreakUpBigTech. See you soon, @AriMelber!

Facebook, Amazon, and Google run the internet. In fact, Big Tech spent almost $50 million dollars in lobbying last year. They know they have a lot to lose if Washington starts putting the interests of consumers first. #BreakUpBigTech

We can get this done. We can make big, structural change. But it’s going to take a grassroots movement, and it starts right now. Sign our petition if you agree, and let's get ready to fight hard together.
This policy will ensure that tech entrepreneurs have a fighting chance to compete against the big companies. That’s how we get innovation.

Let's be clear: This policy won't limit your ability to go on Amazon and find 30 different coffee machines that you can get delivered to your house in two days. And you’ll still be able to go on Facebook and see how your old friend from school is doing.

What I’m proposing is in line with our country’s history of antitrust laws—and it’s a big part of what has allowed our economy to grow and new companies to thrive. You can read more about how our plan is going to work here:

We’ve got to call it out. And we’ve got to do something about it. So today, I’m proposing a new plan to #BreakUpBigTech companies, restore competition, and make sure these corporations don’t get so powerful that they undermine our democracy.

America’s biggest tech companies are controlling more and more of our digital lives. And they’re using their size and power to make it harder for the next tech entrepreneur with the next big idea to break through and compete with them—meaning less options for us.

Facebook, Amazon, and Google have vast power over our economy and democracy. They’ve bulldozed competition and tilted the playing field in their favor. Time to break up these companies so they don’t have so much power over everyone else. #BreakUpBigTech
Wonder if Bailey can tell us apart. I'm flattered—and the grandkids can't wait to see Captain Marvel!
You’re darn right I am.

Trump's campaign manager, Paul Manafort, commits bank and tax fraud and gets 47 months. A homeless man, Fate Winslow, helped sell $20 of pot and got life in prison. The words above the Supreme Court say "Equal Justice Under Law"—when will we start acting like it?
Go Katie!

Let’s be clear: Banning service-members based on gender identity is unconstitutional. We must keep fighting our hearts out until every trans American is free to be themselves and serve their country without discrimination. #TransMilitaryBan
.@GM executives shower wealthy shareholders with billions of dollars in stock buybacks, while working families in Ohio are left in the cold as the Lordstown factory closes. This is immoral.

We can’t let the man in the White House use the pardon power to let his buddies off scot-free. If I’m elected president, there will be no pardons for anyone implicated in the investigations into Donald Trump.
Instead of protecting consumers, @CFPBDirector Kathy Kraninger is gutting the agency’s rule that ensures payday lenders can’t trap borrowers in cycles of debt. We need answers.

Yesterday under oath, Sec. Nielsen said, “We don’t use cages for children.” That couldn’t be further from the truth.

I want to remind everyone of the little children I talked to at a processing center in McAllen, TX and the Port Isabel Detention Center.
I was happy to get to chat with Donna, a teacher from New Jersey who chipped in to our campaign, and talk about why we’re in this fight together.
Texas has a special place in my heart, and I’m excited to be heading to Dallas this Sunday. Hope to see you there! RSVP to our organizing event at the @granadatheater in the link below.
Threats of violence—like those made against Rep. @IlhanMN—are never acceptable.
If we put workers in corporate boardrooms where the real decisions are made, we can hold giant companies accountable for their actions, raise wages, and improve working conditions.

The families targeted by the Trump administration are fleeing violence in their communities and risking everything for a fighting chance in the US for their kids. But when they reach the border, they’re treated like criminals and animals. #FamiliesBelongTogether
.@SecNielsen is wrong. I saw children who had been locked up in cages in a processing center in McAllen, TX—separated from their parents and scared of what would happen next.
An entire generation is getting crushed by mountains of student loan debt. It’s time we address this head-on.
Can’t wait to see you all in Long Island City this Friday! RSVP to our organizing event, bring a friend, and let’s do this together.
Exploring outer space: That’s what girls do. #WomensHistoryMonth
Before we had Bailey, Bruce and I had Otis. There’s something about a dog that just grounds you in life.
I'm not afraid to fight—even with my friends sometimes—to hold Wall Street accountable, protect consumers, and create an economy that works for everyone.
Laissez les bons temps rouler! Hope the people of Louisiana are having a happy and safe #MardiGras.

The proposed merger between @TMobile and @sprint could strangle competition in the telecom industry. Small businesses, entrepreneurs, and working families get hurt when power is concentrated in a handful of giant companies.

Trump's campaign manager, Paul Manafort, commits bank and tax fraud and gets 47 months. A homeless man, Fate Winslow, helped sell $20 of pot and got life in prison. The words above the Supreme Court say "Equal Justice Under Law"—when will we start acting like it?

If you agree it’s time for:

✅#UniversalChildCare
✅A #GreenNewDeal
✅#MedicareForAll

✅#GunReformNow
✅An #UltraMillionaireTax on the richest 0.1% of Americans

Then join our grassroots fight.
The headline says it all. #GOPTaxScam

I talked with @davidaxelrod the other day about how I helped President Obama create the @CFPB—an agency that has forced big banks to return an estimated $12 billion to the people. That’s the type of big, structural change our country needs.
We need big, systemic change—in Iowa and across the country. If we do that, we start to shift what our economy looks like.
This fight isn’t about me. It’s about the big, structural changes we can make for our kids’ futures.
We’ve learned that nickels spent on early education for our little ones pay off many, many times over throughout the years. #UniversalChildCare
Iowans are huggers, and I’m glad I got a LOT of hugs this weekend. RSVP to one of our next organizing events and come say hello!

We can keep America safe without stretching the Constitution beyond recognition to justify endless wars. It’s time to review our military commitments overseas—and that includes bringing US troops home.
Thanks for contributing, @damonbethea1! We’re going to do this together.
My heart breaks for the victims of the Alabama tornado and their families. I’m thinking of their community today and thankful for the Lee County first responders for keeping people safe.

I’m running my campaign differently. I don’t take money from PACs, lobbyists, or billionaires who want to buy my time. This is an equal-access campaign and it starts with you. Chip in what you can afford and join our fight.
America’s trade policy should help small businesses and family farms—not giant corporations. Let’s turn that around.

My campaign finance rules for the Democratic primary:

❌No PAC money
❌No federal lobbyist money
❌No special access for wealthy donors
❌No asking billionaires to start a Super PAC

I challenge every other candidate to do the same thing.
Stay safe, Massachusetts.
#MedicareForAll is a big, structural change that I’m fighting to make a reality. An army of lobbyists and giant insurance companies might think they can stop us—but boy are they wrong.
The man in the White House always wants to be the center of attention. I say it's time to turn the spotlight off.
Our democracy is stronger when every voice is represented on the ballot. I support the @WorkingFamilies Party's fight to protect New York's fusion voting system.
